Summary Heading: Don’t stay in 2023 due to remodel & on going construction!
Summary: Don’t stay in 2023! Under construction and they won’t tell you. Major renovations going on right now and they won’t make it right if you get stuck on the floor below the remodel.  It’s an older property with thin concrete construction between floors. The Westin or Hilton are much better options for the physical structure of the building.  The front desk and management team were worthless in making my situation right — although the restaurant staff is 10/10 & amazing.
Manager Response: Hello Mwarmack,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We are very sorry we did not meet your expectations and that your stay was negatively impacted due to our ongoing renovations. We will share your comments appropriately, and we are very grateful for your patience. We would welcome another opportunity whenever you return to the area to experience our updated look.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Stayed here in October for a business conference.  Very convenient to nearby Convention Center.  Room was bare- like it got forgotten to be decorated- non specific- could have been anywhere, USA.  I arrived early for the conference- and even as a Marriott Loyalty member- I was given a room with a balcony facing the convention center roof-pic attached.   Luckily the noise from the HVAC system provided adequate white noise to help with sleeping. My co-worker was not so lucky with a room facing front of the hotel- where all the noises carried up early morning and late night from events below in the plaza.  Food at restaurant was average.   Honestly, left no memorable impression for the stay- and for the rate charged- no worth the trip.
Manager Response: Hello Suzq23,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are delighted that our convenient location served you well. However, we deeply regret that we did not exceed your expectations with your accommodations and our dining options. Everything we do is directed at curating an exceptional, memorable stay for every guest, and we apologize that this was not your experience. We appreciate your insightful feedback, and we will share your comments appropriately to help improve our guest experience. It would be an honor to host you again and provide you the superior hospitality and accommodations you should always expect from us.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Good experience for a business meeting - great staff at Marketplace
Summary: Stayed here for a sales meeting. Space was good - room was comfortable, lobby and bar/restaurants lively.  Most notable was every morning at the Marketplace for coffee and some sort of breakfast. It was fast, delicious and most importantly the entire staff was friendly and efficient. It’s what I will remember most. Thank you
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had an excellent customer service experience with Jennifer A. at this hotel. She was very friendly and accommodating, always going above and beyond to ensure that our stay was comfortable. She was very helpful with requests and questions that we had, and she made sure that we had everything we needed during our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great customer service and location The hotel was clean and the room was comfortable, overall it was a pleasant stay.
Manager Response: Dear D3364OSmichelles,  We are flattered by your very kind review of Anaheim Marriott and appreciate you recommending us to fellow travelers. Team members like Jennifer A are a perfect example of the passionate and dedicated spirit of service that we value, and we are delighted that our caring hospitality was the highlight of your stay. We are also glad you enjoyed the spotless accommodations and had an excellent time with us. It was a pleasure hosting your visit, and we hope to welcome you again soon.   Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Fabulous stay at the Anaheim Marriott
Summary: This was our second time staying at the Anaheim Marriott. We spent 8 nights over Christmas 2022 and it was a fabulous experience! The hotel is beautiful, clean and the staff are amazing! We ate at the restaurant, the lounge bar, ordered pizza from the custom order pizza kiosk and took advantage of the coffee shop in the mornings (essentially a Starbucks)! The location is perfect for Disneyland (10-15 minute walk), close to CVS for picking up water and snacks. We loved our stay and I highly recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was clean and modern, plus it’s a convenient location for those visiting Disney. Plus, a special shout-out for the kind security team member who helped me find and give me my passport when I forgot it and was already at the airport for my flight!  I forgot to ask the name of the gentleman but he was very kind and helpful! Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Above average Marriott.  I like all the amenities in the place.  Had a 2 day conference on site.  Nfuse restaurant was a great place to eat and drink.  Service was good with a clean and quiet room.  The elevators were the best I have used, totally automated.  A large Starbuck on the first level and a small pizza place too.  I met all my requirements and then some.
Manager Response: Dear 73BW,  We are delighted you chose to stay at Anaheim Marriott while attending an event at the beautiful Anaheim Convention Center, just steps from our hotel. It is always nice to hear that our service and amenities exceeded our guest's expectations, and we look forward to your next visit with us. Thank you for the compliments. Happy Holidays!  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: I have just arrived And had the worst experience. We are a big family that arrange a suite with two king bed and one bed sofa. When we enter the room, we realized that only have one bed and the sofa. The y answerd that they dont have disponibility to give us what we reserved. i dont recomend it!!! The worst!!!!
Manager Response: Hello Ginaf807,   Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Please accept our sincere apologies for not meeting your expectations regarding the room you requested. We do try to honor these requests; however, there are times when we do not have the room unoccupied and available. We understand your frustration, and we truly regret disappointing you and your family. We are committed to providing a comfortable stay with exceptional service, and we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience whenever your travels bring you back to the area.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Service,But the room is small.
Summary: We had a family trip to Disneyland so we decided to stay at this hotel because of how convenient the distance is from here to the theme park. Upon check-in, the staff was professional and friendly. We had a reservation 2 queens bed. When we arrived inside the room we noticed that it was small and crowded with barely any space to move around consider we have a toddler that likes to play. Our beds also felt like 2 full sized instead of 2 queen bed and I dont think the sheets had been changed because one of them had a stain on it. Aside from that, the lobby is really nice, they have a Starbucks inside. Also, the gym at this hotel was big and clean.
Manager Response: Hello 676jenjoyb,  Thank you for staying with us and posting a review. We are glad your stay with us was enjoyable on many levels. However, we are sorry your room did not meet your expectations. We have different configurations available, and in the future, based on availability, we are more than happy to find something more to your liking, that will better suit your needs. Thank you again for choosing us. It was a pleasure hosting your visit, and we hope to see you again soon.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Had a good room - nice bed and shower!  Close to where we needed to be.  Easy access to parks and convention center.  Hotel was modern.  I would use it again, assuming you do not mind walking places.  Parking was expensive but always is.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nicely updated and great staff. The staff is friendly and very attentive. The tower was just remodeled a year or so ago. The rooms are a bit small but comfortable and worth the cost. I would definitely stay again when I come back to go to Disneyland maybe next year
Manager Response: Dear travelnmatt,  Thank you for your wonderful comments about the outstanding service and hospitality you received from the Anaheim Marriott. Our main priority is your comfort and convenience, and we appreciate you taking the time to let others know we went over and above to meet your expectations with our exceptional service and updated property. We look forward to serving you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Great full service hotel within minutes to Disneyland
Summary: If you’re looking into your next stay in Anaheim within walking distance to Disneyland, stay at the Anaheim Marriott. We were upgraded to a very nice larger room with a balcony & loved every meal at nfuse restaurant. Each & every employee has a “can do” attitude & the hotel has everything you need. There is a pizza place open in the lobby each evening as well as a coffee shop serving Starbucks & a large gift shop. We opted to walk to the Hilton next door for our Starbucks & breakfast sandwiches because I wanted my pumpkin spiced latte & our lobby was extremely busy with a conference, so there is also that option. Disneyland decorated for Christmas is not to be missed. 🥰
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location.  Room was large and updated.  Bus stop onsite.  Received good service.  Easy check-in anbd check-out.  I would definitely stay here again if in the area or to go to Disney.  There was a good quick service pizza restaurant onsite.
Manager Response: Dear Michells S,  We are delighted you chose to stay at Anaheim Marriott while attending an event at the beautiful Anaheim Convention Center, just steps from our hotel. It is always nice to hear that our service and accommodations exceeded our guest's expectations, and we look forward to your next visit with us. Thank you for the wonderful feedback.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: This is NOT A TYPICAL Marriott Hotel. As a loyal member, we have never stayed anywhere other than a Marriott hotel when we travel all around the world but this one is VERY DISAPPOINTING. The room is super small, dirty and crappy. I can see there are trash under the sink. The supposed to be white color bed sheets and towels are not white anymore . They look dirty and need to be replaced or some extra bleach. The worst is the building wall is super thin which reminded us of some super cheap motels. You can hear very clearly about what your next door neighbor’ regular talking with their regular voices. You also need to put up with some undisciplined kids screaming and super mad (uneducated) parents yelling at late night if you decide to stay here. There is also a big potential

We have shared your comments with the appropriate individuals to help improve our guest experience and to ensure your concerns are improved upon. We appreciate your patience and we hope you will give us another opportunity to regain your trust the next time you are in the area.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: After a tiring Disneyland Day we opted to stay for a night at this hotel.  Hotel is ore for business travelers.  Room was large enough, although the bathroom was quite small and only had showers.  Front desk, housekeeping and room service was excellent except the valet service.  We had an infant in a stroller and at the time of arrival and departure, no one helped my daughter load the stroller and bags to her car.  Very disappointing.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel staff was great. First night there we arrived late and enjoyed an evening swim. Pool felt cold/cool, but refreshing. Their lobby bar was good. Good food and drinks. The blacked salmon was fantastic.
Manager Response: Dear mikeaU6677ZF,  Thank you for your wonderful comments about the outstanding service and hospitality you received from the Anaheim Marriott. We appreciate you taking the time to let others know we went over and above to meet your expectations and that you enjoyed our delicious food and drinks. We look forward to serving you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Marriott Titanium.   Was in Anaheim for a long weekend with the family, including a 2 year old.  Huge hotel with very good staff.   Pros: Rooms: Big and updated.  Executive Lounge: Great staff in the AM with good variety of food. While the lounge is closed on the weekends, if you have status the front desk gives you vouchers to eat breakfast in the restaurant.  Restaurant and Bar: Restaurant was great for breakfast.  Bar had good options.  Pool: While not heated, it was big - would like to see more kid friendly activities at the pool.  Location: Even if Disney is not your prime reason for being here you are within walking distance to a lot of things.  Walkable to Disney.   Cons: Size: Hotel is huge with lots of people.  You will be waiting in line for some things especially with
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for the final 3 nights of our honeymoon. This hotel really cares, I emailed them before we arrived and they asked what things we liked for them to leave as a gift in our room. When we arrived we were given early check in & an upgraded room which was really nice, they also left chocolate coated strawberries & a bottle of processo along with a personal signed card from the staff. The hotel is a great location to various restaurants & CVS / Walgreens for water / snack supplies. It's also a 20 minute walk to the disney Parks ( very easy straight road) they also offer shuttles but we preferred to walk. Most rooms have a balcony which is also nice, the hotel was massive & very busy as they have alot of conferences going on. The only downside was they don't offer showers
Manager Response: Dear Chatterbox2019,  Firstly, we want to congratulate you both on your recent marriage. Our associates are committed to ensuring our guests have an exceptional stay, and we are delighted we exceeded your expectations with our thoughtful hospitality, convenient location, and spacious accommodations. We appreciate you choosing Anaheim Marriott to celebrate this special time in your life,  and we hope you will revisit us the next time you are in the area. Thank you again for celebrating your honeymoon with us, and we send all the best for your future together. We are also grateful to you for recommending us to future guests.  Cory Ryan, Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Overall I was very happy with our choice of hotel for my friend’s bachelorette party weekend. There were 11 of us and they were able to accommodate us by keeping our group pretty much together and having our rooms all on the same floor. It’s a nice hotel with a good location to Disneyland and restaurants; half of our group made the walk to Disneyland in about 18 minutes. The hotel offers self parking and valet parking, for only $10 more. A few ladies in our group booked on a third party website and received a complimentary buffet breakfast, but the Marriott members did not (I would recommend changing that, seems like your members who book directly should definitely receive a complimentary breakfast). The restaurant in the hotel was pretty good for breakfast, lots of tasty
Manager Response: none

Summary: No free wifi, expensive and unimpressive food. Rooms are fine, unimpressive and LOUD. Get ready to hear the people above you walking around, or getting back from Disneyland at 1am. We could hear people outside and cars being loud all night. Get ready to pay and pay and get the minimum every time.
Manager Response: Hello AceDanger,  Thank you for the candid review. On behalf of our entire team, we offer our sincere apologies for not meeting your expectations. Summary: Huge posh hotel. Lovely rooms very comfortable great walk in shower. Close to Disney. Had dinner and drinks in the bar one night and it was very nice. Everything you needed in the room. Really enjoyed our stay would recommend. Staff friendly

Summary: We’re Marriott regulars, it’s our go-to brand when traveling, but I have to say… this stay was lackluster. We stayed for a convention at the nearby convention center.  Room was fine, clean and beds comfortable. Not much else you can ask for there, really. Only downside was how LOUD it was. The doors must be hollow, because we could hear ever word, every movement, every sneeze outside our room and halfway down the hall. Same with the bathroom door; if you’re sharing a room I hope you don’t mind hearing EVERYTHING your companion does in the bathroom.   The other really frustrating thing, is the day we checked in they had a massive wedding taking up the entire convention center, and they were trying to redirect everyone not attending away from the front of the hotel. It took me

Summary Heading: Nope and Nope - seriously disgusting  - RUN AWAY
Summary: Ok one thing we found a roach in our bathroom just hanging out. We killed it and had to handle it ourselves because no one came until an hour later to help us.  But on the ceiling smashed with a shoes print from a prior guest and stay   Beyond clogged sink in bathroom, my husband tryed figuring out why - rotted food from a prior guest staying here  Annoying stuff - queen fitted sheet on a king bed so that wasn’t staying in place at all  We ordered breakfast and there was mold on 1/3 of my husbands berry in his fruit bowl.   Get it together Marriott.

Summary Heading: Great choice for a stay while visiting Disney
Summary: We just returned from 4 nights staying at the Anaheim Marriott and really enjoyed our stay. Check-in was quick and smooth. We stayed on the 9th floor of the Ocean Tower and found it extremely quiet. Also, this hotel has the best and most efficient elevator system of any hotel I have ever stayed at. The rooms were small but updated, and the beds were comfortable. My only constructive criticism about the room is the pocket doors to the bathroom do not provide enough privacy. It didn't bother us to much as a family, but I can imagine it being awkward for some. Housekeeping did an excellent job cleaning our room. The hotel lobby and restaurant had a nice sophisticated vibe too it and we ate at the restaurant a number of times and found it to be good. We used the pool twice and my
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have just had 4 nights in Anaheim. We stayed at the Marriott Anaheim and I cannot recommend it enough.   The hotel has had a refurb and the rooms and public spaces are lovely! There is a nice pool which is part open part covered and the staff are all very helpful. The food at the hotel was good and fairly reasonably priced for the area!  There is a bus stop outside the hotel which goes to and from Disney every 15/20 mins and is $6 a day and kids are much cheaper (my 5yo sons pass for 5 days was about $4 total). We walked a couple of times and it was about 20 mins with my 5yo walking! It is probably a little quicker if your kids are in a pram or older.  We stayed in a junior suite which was spacious and modern. There was a fridge that we were able to use and it was a great
Manager Response: Dear Linzarella,  Thank you for your lovely review of Anaheim Marriott and for recommending us to future guests. It is gratifying to know you were impressed with our outstanding hospitality, spacious, well-appointed guestroom, swimming pool, and convenient location close to Disney, including delicious food served at our onsite dining options. We are glad we could provide you with an outstanding experience throughout your stay, and we love knowing you plan to return.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: We enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Marriott for our first family trip to Disneyland with the kids. Location wise, it's right across the street from the Convention Center, and a 15 minute walk (2 long blocks) to Disneyland. The ART line stop is located outside the hotel for those that don't want to walk the 0.9 miles.  ROOM: We opted for a balcony room with pool view. Newly modern and renovated. Small fridge available. The room felt smaller than most hotels, there's a chair instead of a couch in the room to lounge on.  PARKING: $35 for self parking and $39 for valet. We opted for valet, as the self park of lot was further away from the hotel.  WIFI: $15/night or free for Bonvoy members. You can easily sign up for their membership at no cost to have internet fees waived.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great way to go in disneyland. Pool is great for kids, our assign room was infront of it. Frontdesk made a mistake with my booking instead of 2 it was 1. Everything went well. Its just the self parking is very far.
Manager Response: Dear enelraaicrag,   Thank you for the nice review of your stay at Anaheim Marriott in the heart of Downtown Disney! We are thrilled that our location a couple of blocks from Disney was perfect for your family's vacation. We are glad your kids loved spending time at our beautiful pool and liked our accommodations. However, we regret your inconvenience due to miscommunication in reservation and for the parking. On your next visit, please know we will do our best to help you with this situation. On behalf of the entire team, we look forward to welcoming you back the next time you and your family are in town.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Check in was quick although we weren't told how to get to our room in the Oasis Tower. Room was standard corporate style with fridge and poor coffee maker. A convention was taking place during our stay and delegates took over the bar and pool areas making it difficult to get served at the bar and our our attempt at booking a meal failed unless we were prepared to wait for an hour. On the plus side it's in a great location for Disney although it doesn't come across as a family hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Jcyorksman,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are glad that you were pleased with our location. We are always looking for opportunities to improve our guest experience, so we are grateful for your feedback. Thank you for your patience. We value you as a guest and hope that we have the opportunity to welcome you again in the future.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for business not for pleasure
Summary: Our travel agent recommended this hotel because it was good neighbor hotel.  It was a nice hotel but it caters more to conventions.  We were there to go to Disneyland.  My 13 year old said it was too serious of a hotel.  There were several conventions at the hotel while we were there.  I traveled with my husband and 2 daughters (18  & 13).  The hotel was crowded due to the onsite conventions.  We arrived at 4:.00PM (check in time) and after waiting on line our room wasn't ready.  We didn't know how long in would be and waited in the lobby so that through off our night time plans a bit. They finally called to say room was ready and I had to wait in line again to check in for real.  This was our pool half day so we didn't get a chance to try that out.   In the morning the
Manager Response: Dear Kbuck1012,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your comments. We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to know you had a pleasant stay. However, we are sorry for the inconveniences you faced durimng your time with us, and we are taking steps to keep them from happening in the future. We enjoyed having you with us and hope you will choose us next time.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Stayed in this hotel for a week, the hotel and rooms seem to be recently remodeled.  The room was very nice and nicely sized.  The hotel was very busy, but generally the meals I had were very good quality and served quickly.  The only negative about the hotel is that the cleanliness of the room wasn't great.  On the surface it was fine, but when I dropped something under the headboard it was obvious that hadn't been touched in a year, just poor attention to detail.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is in great location for Disney. There is a bus stop outside of the hotel where a bus will pick you up and take you to Disney. The rooms are nice and clean. Housekeeping is hit or miss. I asked for housekeeping once during a 4 night stay and they didn't come. The pool is excellent for kids. The pool was probably our favorite part. Self parking is $29 a night. Check in line was long and took a very long time to check in, close to 25 mins

Summary: We had a family emergency at 6pm and had to leave the hotel and drive back home. I let Jared at the front desk know so they would know the room was vacant. He spoke to a manager and they decided to give us a break since we were not staying our final night. They did not have to do anything, but they went above and beyond.   In addition, we stayed on the concierge level and it was amazing. Great staff and food. The family loved it!
Manager Response: none

Then there was urine and tons of dog feces on the balcony below us.  We complained twice yet the excrement remained during our entire stay.  Worst hotel in the chain!  Would not even offer a refund!

Summary: I was back to the Anaheim area and tried a new property for my stay, as stated in previous reviews, aiming at finally finding that hotel that would make me feel in this century. Although I had my doubts, chose Marriott Anaheim for its convenient location -right at the convention center where my event was set to take place- rather than for its look.  Because, let’s be honest, the property does not exactly yell 21st century on the outside, so my expectations were low and hoped for the best. I have to say that I liked finding a more current property in terms of style, décor, comfort, and ambiance. Although the property obviously bears its years, I can say it’s one of the most agreeable hotels I’ve stayed at in the area.  The property is not perfect, lighting and ventilation have
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros- close to Disney Cons- pretty much everything else  Marriotts are normally very good- I stayed in 5 in the last two weeks and this was the one that absolutely failed to meet expectations, I even emailed the hotel manager to provide my feedback upfront and give them chance to discuss- two weeks later they haven’t responded which sums it up (although I expect I will get a reply below!)  I could give all the details of what let it down- but I can put it simply. If you don’t plan on being in the hotel at all, not using the facilities and spending all of your time in Disney and have a spare hour to check in, consider this hotel.  Otherwise there are so many other hotels in the vicinity that are better value, just as close and will look after you far better- book one of those

Summary: Tagged along with the hubs (work conference) for a few days. The hotel was quite nice - busy lobby, but people are always coming & going. Get the breakfast buffet - it's essentially the same price vs ordering a la carte, by the time you add on drinks (coffee, juice, tea). Plus you can get a custom made omelet if you select the buffet option.  After business/touristing around/Disney, the lounge are was nice to come back to and have a snack/drink. I ordered the chicken tortilla soup each day (clearly I liked it) and the service was very good.  Locaton is very convenient to Disney - you can walk if you're inclined. :)
Manager Response: Dear R2063NGanthonyv,   We are delighted you enjoyed your stay at the Anaheim Marriott. Thank you for letting us know we exceeded your expectations with our breakfast, location, friendly service, and all the amenities we offer; it was a pleasure being a part of your trip. We appreciate you choosing us for your visit to Orange County!  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: As with any hotel property in this day and age people make the difference. Over time hotels all start to look the same. Well played Marriott, well played. You still need to battle it out with Hilton so step it up a bit more please. You got the right staff now what can you do outside of them to bring you the top spot?  Pros of this Property:  Staff  Location   General appearance   Holes in sheets I actually applaud you for that because having had both over the years, holes and no holes, I slept the same. Summary Heading: A top notch property that seamlessly merges business events with tourism activity.
Summary: I attended a three day conference and was amazed at how smoothly and easily I was able to navigate the hotel during the high peak tourist season. The layout of this property makes it simple to figure out where to go depending on your interest or purpose for staying. The staff are extremely intuitive and helpful. And the rooms are some of the nicest I have ever stayed in. Beds are super comfortable and the bathroom shower is excellent. This is definitely one of the best places to stay whether you are at the Disneyland Resort for fun or work.
Manager Response: Dear John M,   Thank you for sharing your experience from your recent meeting at Anaheim Marriott. Summary Heading: Excellent Stay at the Anaheim Marriott
Summary: Came for a tradeshow for 3 nights. This is one of the better Marriott’s I have been to as a Titanium Lifetime member. Used my SNA’s and actually got upgraded to a junior suite. Most comfortable bed. Bathroom was a bit small for a big room. Room had a balcony. Club lounge was very nice with the usual food items. We were give PM coupons for appetizers which we used 2 days. Breakfast in their main restaurant was very good as this was given to us since the lounge was closed on weekends. Very nice fitness center with many working machines. Marketplace serves coffee and food items. Nice nice lobby. Lots of things going on while we were there but the hotel handled it well.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great breakfast, extremely slow room service
Summary: I am not sure why I ordered room service when I could have just stopped by on one of the places on the walk back from Disneyland and had food and drink within 10 minutes instead of over an hour. Other than that i liked it. Don’t bother with room service, you will fall asleep before it arrives.
Manager Response: Hello B11811,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the delay you experienced with our room service. Your observations will be shared with our food and beverage team for immediate improvement. It was our pleasure hosting you, and we hope to have the opportunity to make sure your next stay is outstanding in every respect.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Leaving today after a four night stay.  This is a business class hotel and within a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  The lobby and common areas are very nice and open.  The employees are all very accommodating and quick.  We had a deluxe king room on the 7th floor.  We did not find the room inviting.  It was functional, however it felt more like a hospital room.  There was a king bed, two straight back chairs (one at the desk, one with a little side table).  The desk was built in under the TV.  They provide a fridge but no microwave.  The floor is linoleum.  There is a single cup coffee maker but the quality of the coffee was underwhelming.  We had a small balcony but it overlooked a parking lot.  We were given access to the concierge lounge.  We had breakfast every morning and
Manager Response: Dear kiwi4532,  Thank you for choosing Anaheim Marriott and sharing your experience. We are glad that our location a couple of blocks from Disney was perfect for plans. It is also good to learn you liked our courteous service and the hot breakfast we offer. However, we regret not meeting all of your expectations on this visit. We are grateful for all of your comments, as we are always looking for ways to enhance our guest experience. It was our pleasure hosting you, and we hope you will choose us whenever you are in the area.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Nicest hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Great 4 night stay over the Memorial Day long weekend . The staff and management came through big time over a busy weekend . My Marriott Titanium Elite status was recognized with access to the Concierge Lounge which I used for breakfast and an afternoon snack. I desalt enjoyed the food service at the hotel including nfuse, Slice, and the Market Cafe ( great burritos). This is a better hotel than any of the properties across to Disneyland. We used Uber to drive us to Disneyland and then walked back to the hotel in the evening. It was a 20 minute walk . My adult kids loved the pool as well. We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Over the top customer service during a hectic convention.
Summary: The entire staff was fantastic during my stay. Everyone was pleasant, and I mean every employee I interacted with, from check-in, housekeeping,and concierge staff to the bar and restaurant.   Even having the bell staff manning and opening the doors was greatly appreciated. The hotel was sold out and very hectic, and the staff were grace under pressure.
Manager Response: Dear sporkster,  Thank you for your wonderful comments about the outstanding service and hospitality you received from the Anaheim Marriott. Our main priority is your comfort and convenience, and we appreciate you taking the time to let others know we went over and above to meet your expectations! We will surely share your compliments with all the associates you mentioned for a job well done. We look forward to serving you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: We chose this Hotel as it was about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland and worked out as a much less expensive option than staying at one the Disney Hotels. There is a Bus outside the Hotel which shuttles to Disneyland which i think was about $6 per person per day but we enjoyed the walk. Our room was made up of two Queens and was very clean and tidy and housekeeping will come every day if you wish. Internet is free as long as you are a Marriott Bonvoy Member (free to join). This Hotel is an excellent choice for your Disney Vacation
Manager Response: Dear Coggeshall,  Thank you for your loyalty to our brand and for being a guest at Anaheim Marriott and sharing your experience. We are delighted to know you were pleased with our convenient location, courteous associates, and refreshing accommodations. We also appreciate you mentioning our complimentary Internet. It was a pleasure to host you, and we look forward to your return visit.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Good hotel , balcony rooms have nice view
Summary: Great hotel great service, rooms are simple but really nice it was very clean also if you can get a room with balcony nice views and the balconies have lots of space it’s not like those stand balconies has two chairs. The only complain I would say is the bathroom door don’t lock but other then that good hotel Btw this hotel is next to convention center it didn’t seem so kid friendly stayed in room 1735 floor 17th and it was peaceful and quiet.
Manager Response: none

New the expenses of use of the swimming pool to be paid also separately, the service of cleaning of the rooms it is necessary to ask it specifically, if not the room is not made, the service to the rooms after 22 is not possible and finally the reception not sympathetic at all, one would have said that one disturbed and they do not know the thank you or please.

They will just tell you it is a convention center and so all of us titanium elite members get screwed out of an upgrade. We had an awful time being stuffed in their tiny room.  I called on Sunday halfway through our stay and asked for an upgrade, but no, they had already put the guests that HAD NOT arrived ahead of us when I k own for a fact there were several open suites that night. I will never stay here again, and I will stop using marriot hotels when I travel very frequently for work. Extremely disappointed in this hotel that show no regard for those of us that

Summary: This hotel has great service and great staff. It is very convinently located next to the convention center and right down the street from Disney. It is under a comfortable 25 minute walk to the parks itself.  Had a two beds room. The beds were very comfortable and there is a great desk for me to work from the hotel while my husband is at the convention center.   Great housekeeping staff and great pool area. Once again, a must location for conventions. It is completely worth the extra dollars for  a great experience.
Manager Response: Dear samanthao520,  Thank you for being a guest at Anaheim Marriott and the perfect rating. Summary: Great stay on the 14th floor. They have housekeeping if you request it at check in. The rooms are pretty standard.  Had a good stay. Very close to the convention center.  The lobby is busy because of the bar. There's also a pizza place and coffee shop that are convenient.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My partner & I stayed mid March to visit Disneyland & Knotts Berry Farm theme park. There is a ART shuttle stop right outside the hotel, it’s not really needed for the Disney parks as they have a few stops and you’re only a 20 min walk, however it’s definitely worth it for Knotts Berry. The location to Disney is amazing, so nice you can just walk right up to the park. There is also the Toy Story car park up the road if you do need a shuttle (much more often than the ART hotel service).  The pool is a good size, we spent a day there and it only started to get busy around 5pm. Nice enough bar with nice cocktails. The shop on site is very expensive, better off popping down to Walgreens.  Our room was a good size, with a generously sized balcony. The side we were on was a bit of a
Manager Response: Dear Fiona H,  Thank you for being our guest at Anaheim Marriott. We are thrilled that our location a couple of blocks from Disney was perfect for your vacation. An hour an a half later we were still waiting for our room.  After complaining multiple times they finally offered us a room below what we had booked.  But we took it because we were tired from traveling and needed to clean up for dinner.  Any management that cannot get its rooms ready by 5pm shouldn't be in the hotel business.   Many hotels, like Marriot, now take on less staff and don't clean rooms unless you requested it explicitly.  With this they save money and increase their profits. Summary: The staff here are WONDERFUL! Everyone is very friendly and responsive. From the minute you arrive and they open the doors, you feel like a total VIP!  I got to check in early, they made sure I had the room I wanted (view of the fireworks AWESOME), helped carry my bags, and the housekeeper even noticed I liked the camomile tea so they left me extra. What service.

Summary Heading: Nice and clean hotel near Disney

Location is incredible since you can go walking to Disney, they have several convention stores on a walking distance to. Valet parking is real good you can call from your room so they can have your car ready to go and don't need to wait for the car.  I was very satisfied with my stay here.

Manager Response: Hello Druiz788,  Thank you for being our guest and for sharing your experience. Summary: We enjoyed our stay at Anaheim Marriot. We stayed Dec 25 through Jan 1. They put us in the Oasis tower. We could see California Adventure from our room. I loved the elevators in this hotel. There’s a large keypad on the main floor where you type in your floor, then it tells you which elevator to get in. The elevator then immediately sends you straight to your floor (so no waiting for other guests to get off on other floors). The room was refurbished and clean. The only thing I didn’t like was the soap and shampoo they provided, had a musty smell.   A tip for transportation to Disneyland… we’ve used ART in the past and didn’t have any issues, however this time our experience was not the same. We went down to the stop early, so we were one of the first people to get on the bus,
Manager Response: Dear MsKay84,  Thank you for your detailed review. We are delighted you enjoyed your stay at the Anaheim Marriott. Summary Heading: The Most Successful Team in SoCal
Summary: If you have ever read one of my reviews, it has been a minute since I took the time to write a review, you know that I can write a million words when 10-20 are all that a perfect review needs. Evelyn Fagan was more than simply engaging. She was overwhelmingly intuitive and literally covered all of the bases to make sure my check in and initial entrance was a great experience. As my wife and I were about to head to Disneyland, we had the pleasure of meeting Elsie Carbajal, Director of Room Operations. We spoke for a couple of minutes about our room and our thoughts about it. I was very pleased to report that our room was clean, sanitary, safe and COMFORTABLE!!!!! There were others that made our stay exceptional. The valet, concierge and the housekeeping teams all did
Manager Response: none

Summary: I really wanted to get back from my trip and give this place a review. It was like 8am mind you we were ecstatic and this really made the difference for there rest of the trip. We took a nap, showered and were refreshed and ready for the parks. The Hotel and grounds are immaculate, the lobby is inviting and large, the courtyard and pool were really nice with a covered area one the pool itself.  There is a nice restaurant and lounge sadly we never got to hang out but were wanted to. It really ticks all the boxes, a wood fired pizza place,
Manager Response: Dear Shawn O,   We are delighted you enjoyed your stay at the Anaheim Marriott. Summary Heading: Loved my stay at the Marriott
Summary: Stayed 2-nights recently for a Disney vacation and loved my spacious room. All the staff I encountered were amazing and service was top notch. Had dinner one night in the lobby bar and both food & drinks were amazing. Highly recommend this hotel in Anaheim.

Summary: Staff was friendly, room was spacious and clean and updated. Restaurant food was really good, America and Gretchen are wonderful! 20 min walk for us to Disney or $10 uber was perfect. Lots of shops nearby. We had the king room with balcony by the pool and it was lovely!

Summary Heading: This hotel does not meet Marriott standards
Summary: I decided to stay at this hotel because I trust the reputation of the Marriot but I was totally disappointed. Although the room was newly remodeled, the carpet was very dirty and every day I was staying at the hotel it was never swept. The mattress was squeaky and uncomfortable. It is not possible that they cannot leave a complimentary bottle of water, the internet is charged additional at a very expensive rate and the $ 36USD for parking is too much. It was an abuse.
Manager Response: Hello GeorginaRZ,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your review. Summary: Stayed with my teenager son for Disneyland trip. Check in was very quick and the hotel was extremely clean. My room had a balcony. The room was very comfortable. My only issue was with the noise coming from other rooms. On one night, the people staying at the room next to us were having people over. We could hear everything, all the conversations, kids yelling and running around, etc. We couldn’t go to sleep until they left. I just wish the walls weren’t so thin. Overall, our stay was good. We’ll definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just OK. Location is main draw.
Summary: I think with this hotel the main draw is the location.  It is really close to Disneyland (easy walk) and the convention center.  The location and convention draw must be the reason they charge so much.  The hotel was clean.  Aside from that, the hotel is not very user-friendly.  Parking is in a large ramp and a long walk to the hotel.  If you plan to go in and out much from the hotel in your car, it's not very convenient.  There is only one laundry area and it was a very long walk from our room.  This hotel is HUGE so if you want to get from one part to another plan for a long walk.  As with many other very large hotels, the front desk can get swamped very easily and at times there were multiple people in line waiting for help.  It served our purpose but I probably wouldn't stay
Manager Response: Hello Kn56,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your comments. Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Excellent hotel with a huge lobby. rooms were spacious & well equipped, but we couldn't add an extra bed. check in & check out was very smooth & the staff are really helpful, Location is very nice near Disney world (15 min walk) & surrounded by many restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It was a pleasure to read your review of the Anaheim Marriott. We are thrilled that our location, a couple of blocks from Disney, was perfect for your visit. Summary: Hotel is clean, updated and in a good location in a cluster of hotels surrounding the convention center.  You can easily walk to Disneyland/California Adventure and Downtown Disney District.  There are also ART buses that run and pick up right by the hotel.  Hotel is also within walking to CVS/Walgreens in case you forgot something and don't want to pay hotel upcharge.  King corner room was a little weirdly laid out with only one small chair and small table for working/eating.  Feel like a small loveseat  could have fit in there to fill unused space.  No luggage rack but I'm sure I could have asked for one.  Overall, a good stay, great location and very friendly staff!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, thank you for your review of your stay at Anaheim Marriott in the heart of Downtown Disney! Please know our front desk is always available and happy to help make your stay as comfortable as possible. Thank you for choosing us, and we hope you will make the same choice when your travels bring you back to the area.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: The rooms in the old tower have really noisy air conditioner which prevents a good night sleep. Like sleeping with a jet engine going on and off all night.    There is now window - just a sliding glass door which opens to a shared balcony or a balcony with flimsy barriers between rooms. Unless you know the person in the room next to you, most will not sleep with the door open.  The bed is comfortable and the room is clean. Employees are very friendly. The location is good; a 15 min walk to Disneyland and right next to the convention center.   The hotel has a second tower with newer rooms. They may be more quiet.
Manager Response: Dear KBGA,  We regret that the condition of your room did not meet your expectations and that you had challenges controlling the temperature. Your feedback will be shared with the appropriate individual to address these concerns. We are also sorry for the other issues you had. However, we are glad you liked our location and friendly staff.  Cory Ryan Senior Rooms Operations Manager

Summary: Hotel was very nice and clean. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions. The bathroom in the Executive King room is pretty small with limited counter space. Only a 5 minute walk from the Disney Toy Story parking lot where free shuttles were provided to the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 2 nights. Room 625. Thought the hotel was fine until I got home and discovered I had been bitten all over my body by bed bugs. Contacting the hotel and Marriott in general yielded two cookie-cutter "we're sorry we didn't live up to your expectation" emails. Nothing else done. Disgusting sanitary conditions for such an expensive hotel. And abysmal customer service.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Maybe the Worst Marriott I've Ever Stayed At
Summary: This hotel needs serious updates. The room is old and dingy, the restroom outdated from 1985. The hard floors are very uncomfortable. The room AC didn't work well. It was very hot. The smoke detector went off in the middle of the night at 2am while we were sleeping and we had to call maintenance in to fix it as our kid on the autism spectrum was very disturbed by it.   There was  a huge spider in the bath tub soon as I pulled the curtain. Not enough electrical sockets in the room or conveniently located. The staff is great, but the hotel is plain awful.

Summary: My family and I stayed at this Marriott Hotel on June 28 to Aug 1. We occupied 2 connecting rooms on the 4 floor (rm 379 and 481). The rooms and bathrooms are updated and clean. The swimming pool is great the it had a shaded covered section. We ate every morning at Starbucks. Every employee we encountered was very polite, especially the valet attendants. Distance to Disneyland/Ca. Adventure is about 20 mins with young children in tow.
Manager Response: none

Walking distance to Disneyland as well.   They also have a pool with food and drink service and it has an awesome shaded part on half the pool.   Will stay here again when going to Disneyland.

Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is spacious and conveniently located but it is completely lacking service. Rooms are not maintain as the property is pretty empty. Our room was not serviced even though we asked for it. The heating system in our suite was so noisy that it was impossible to sleep. It was like a broken turbine. After the engineer looked at it, it was even noisier. Self-parking is $26. At this time, you stay here, if you need a bed and nothing else.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great service and Clean room, please try to stay here.
Summary: We have stayed here before when Disneyland was open. It is a great hotel. We stayed here while getting a late start up the coast for the weekend. Rooms are very reasonable right now and staff is very accommodating.  Help out Anaheim and book a room and go to eat, people are really suffering with the closure of Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Let’s start with the bad, which isn’t much. $26.00 a night for self parking, with Disneyland being closed at the very least there should be a discounted rate. Walls were pretty thin so you can hear quite a bit of noise. The staff is super friendly, location is awesome, about a 20min walk to Disney. Rooms are updated and aesthetically nice. I’ve stayed here before and I would stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: We originally booked this hotel to go to Disneyland. They were great with changing our accommodations due to our change in plans! We only ended up staying 2 nights here but it was a beautiful hotel! The staff was great! The only sad thing was the options for the pool reservations. We ended up not utilizing the pool which made me sad. That is covid for you though. The room was nice and spacious. If we ever get to go to Disney, we will be staying here!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I shouldn’t write this review while I am incensed....
Summary: I am staying at this hotel for one night for business. Self parking fees are $26 in the empty lot and the room is $136. The hotel is walking distance to a few restaurants.  I am writing this because of the insane inability to service guests property. ( I am the highest level of the rewards program with both Marriott and Hilton.)   First, the room has no coffee maker in the room. ( Hilton always does still.) I had to call for that because I was getting up early. The coffee I just made tasted like chemicals. I am sure they have sanitized the coffee maker and I probably ingested  some kind of antivirus concoction. . There is no room service.  I went downstairs to get coffee at 6 am and they told me they don’t open the Starbucks until 6:30. I noticed that many people who trekked
Manager Response: none

Summary: I expected more of this hotel being it was the Marriott. Once we walked in the waiting for check in was so long. When we finally got our room key and got to the room some of the floor was soggy, the room smelt bad, and some of the furniture were ready to fall apart. Was not able to check out the bar due to Covid and basically just slept there. Glad there were restaurants around the hotel to walk to and also target was across the street. Overall I don’t believe I would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The wife and I booked a Thursday night here just to get a rest from our busy time packing up our house to move.  Have to say coming down here during the covid problems it's just horrible seeing the economy that's just not happening at this time.  The jobs that are just not there,  the convention center, hotels, shops, restaurants just closed....the hotel was empty mostly,  some families enjoying the pool.  Our room was recently updated and nice and clean.  There is a store with Starbuck's coffee but that was about it.   We walked to the Garden Walk for dinner.  It was a nice rest.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Front desk was welcoming and helpful, but If you’re a light sleeper, do not stay at this hotel!  The ceiling and walls are very thin!  I was woken up at 6am by a crying baby and two men talking loudly upstairs.
Manager Response: Dear Kathy T,  We appreciate you taking the time to write about your experience at our hotel. We are glad you liked our friendly front desk team, but we are terribly sorry your sleep was interrupted by noise from your neighboring room. Should you stay with us again, please request a room in the quietest area of the building, and we will do our best to honor your request. In the meantime, we will work with our engineering team to find solutions to these issues. We value your feedback and hope you both will return for the perfect stay you deserve.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: I stayed here for a work conference in early March. I tried to cancel the trip due to the COVID situation that was developing at that time, and I was told they would not allow any refunds. While the conference spaced out the seating and had hand sanitizer available, I feel like the hotel was tone deaf to what was developing. I checked out early because, on my second day there, the governor restricted gatherings and the safer at home order followed. Even then, despite the government order, the hotel did not refund me for the unused portion of my stay.   The room was nice enough and my bed was comfortable, but the noise from outside was a bit much. Also, the food in the hotel is wildly overpriced and not very good. I think they take advantage of the fact that many of the guests
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your comments. We are committed to excellence in every respect, so it was disappointing to learn we did not provide what you have come to expect from our brand. Please accept our apology as well as our assurance that your concerns have been noted. We hope to serve you again when your travels bring you back to Anaheim so we can regain your confidence.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: I attended a national conference at this site.  The room was comfortable enough and site had a nice pool.  I always appreciate a smart TV so I can watch Netflix on it.  Site has a nice bar located in the lobby area was a nice meeting place.  Location is short Uber ride from Disneyland and other attractions and their are several restaurants conveniently located within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Rhino2525,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Anaheim Marriott while you were here for your conference. We are euphoric to know our convenient location, beautifully appointed accommodations, and bar helped to elevate your time with us. We appreciate your valuable feedback and look forward to your future visit.   Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Bed bugs and Marriott doesn't care
Summary: I stayed here from February 7-11 for a work conference. The night of February 10th, I noticed 10-15 bites on my hands and arms that I thought were from mosquitos, as I had walked from the hotel to the convention center in a sleeveless dress. After I checked out of the hotel, bites kept getting worse. I never suspected I would have gotten bed bugs from a Marriott hotel until I found a bed bug nymph on my bed on February 20th. Had to get my whole house fumigated and all in all, cost me hundreds of dollars. Pest control could not find evidence of bed bugs in my house when they came to address the issue on February 24th, indicating a new infestation. A majority of my bites appeared at the hotel, where I was truly eaten alive. After fumigation, we found one additional dead bed bug
Manager Response: Dear 246haleym,  We apologize for your disappointment in the results of the investigation.  We appreciate you bringing these concerns to our attention. We are grateful for your feedback on this matter and want to assure you that we will share your comments appropriately.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Marriott Does Not Care About You
Summary: I was supposed to stay at this Marriott on March 13 right as the pandemic was starting to grow and affect the masses. By March 19, six days later, California was put on a safer at home order, so as you can see, I believe I made the right choice to stay at home and not travel. I was going to be traveling with my 66 year old mother who is vulnerable, and I didn’t want to jeopardize her health and safety. In light of this, I requested that they cancel my reservation and provide a refund given the current state of the world. I called numerous times and emailed, and today, April 17, more than a month later, I finally got a reply of no from Marriott that they would not cancel, and no they would not refund me. I had made the reservation through Priceline and they would not provide a
Manager Response: Dear LbeforeE,  We appreciate you bringing these concerns to our attention. We are grateful for your feedback on this matter and also for your patience. You have our assurance that we will address your comments appropriately.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: I flew down to John Wayne for the historic, unprecedented closure of Disneyland. I did not book this room until about 11:00 pm. I watched the prices fall on Orbitz.com all day.   This 4 Star adjacent to the Anaheim Convention Center was amazing.  The room was well appointed. The bed was super comfy, with Pacific Coast bedding.  I have stayed at Disney’s Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel too many times to count, and I slept better here.  Once the world opens again, I will once again fly to John Wayne or Long Beach International to get back to the original Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear  Tofu-in-the-Desert,  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Marriott. We are sorry to read that due to this unexpected situation you were unable to visit Disneyland. That being said, we are thrilled you had an excellent time with us and that you had a restful night's sleep. We appreciate your business and hope you will choose us again on your next visit to our area.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: I have just completed my 2 night stay at the Marriott for a conference. When I checked in the front desk attendant was nice and accommodated my early check-in. I was put in a room with an adjoining door, next to a family who went to Disneyland that day, I am sure this was unknown but because of the connecting door it was so loud. Also, I believed I heard the fire alarm go off around 10pm that Sunday night. It rang for about 3 minutes, then went off so I decided not to say anything. Needless to say I did not get a great nights sleep and decided to change rooms. When asked to change rooms the front desk was very accommodating and gave me a new room. As I was packing up my stuff to go to the new room, I found underwear (not mine) in the bathroom which was pretty alarming but I just
Manager Response: Dear saramarie1234,  Thank you for staying with us and letting us know your concerns. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience of the fire alarm repeatedly going off in your room. We appreciate that this was brought to our attention, and ensure you that our engineering and maintenance department will be looking into it so that this doesn't happen again. Even though your stay was far from perfect this time, we hope you give us another chance to make things right. Please stop back anytime you are in the Anaheim area.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: I've been staying here each year for the last 20 years due to an annual convention for my industry. They recently completed a renovation of all the guest rooms and they are fantastic — wood floors, beautiful bathrooms, even new sliding doors on the balconies. Really well done. The front desk staff here is exceptional and knows how to manage hundreds of guests when the conventions are happening while making everyone feel special. A special shout out to the wonderful Flor in the concierge lounge, who ordered me special eggs when she found out I was allergic to butter!
Manager Response: Dear Ymx3,  We are delighted you continue to make the Anaheim Marriott your home away from home while attending an event at the beautiful Anaheim Convention Center, just steps from our hotel. Thank you for letting us know you loved our newly refreshed accommodations and that our devoted associates left a remarkable impression on you. Your compliments were a pleasure to read, and we will share it with our front desk as well as concierge staff. Your continued business is the best recommendation there is. Thank you again, and we look forward to your next stay!  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location at the Convention Center
Summary: This hotel is in a perfect location if you have business at the Convention Center. You can walk everywhere, and it is extremely convenient. The food in the restaurants is good, and you have several options, including a breakfast buffet that opens very early on the weekends. We have been twice in the last few months, and both times the rooms were recently renovated. One of the rooms (in the tower) sloped, so you walked down hill from the door to the other end of the room. Being in the bathroom felt a little like being on a ship, since it was also tilted. I found it a little annoying and disorienting with the door closed. The second room was in the main building. It wasn't sloping, but the floor we were on stunk of a heavy deodorizer from the minute you walked off of the elevator.
Manager Response: Dear Leslie R.,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your comments. We appreciate your feedback and are delighted knowing you had a pleasant stay and enjoyed our renovated rooms, as well as our convenient location to the Convention Center. However, we are sorry for problems that inconvenienced you, and we are taking steps to keep them from happening in the future. We enjoyed having you with us and hope you will choose us next time.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel, great room on 17th floor. Room is clean and updated. Main issue with this floor is you can hear chairs being moved in the Bonvoy lounge on the 18th floor if you happen to be underneath. Advice to management: modify the chairs so they aren't noisy on the hard floor. Self parking is a long walk, but overall this isn't a big deal.
Manager Response: Dear ricksanchez4080,   Thank you for staying at the Anaheim Marriott. We are glad you were pleased with our convenient location and well-appointed accommodations. We also appreciate your constructive feedback regarding the areas where we can improve. We enjoyed having you with us and hope you will choose us next time you are in our area.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: 1) Location - PRIME. Very close to all tourist attractions and eateries. 2) Room - Very spacious and neatly maintained. Has all the required amenities. WiFi quality was top-notch. 3) Food - Wide spread and tasty. Awesome food! 4) Business - Spacious, Greatly designed Ballrooms and Conference rooms.  A great business stay and I am totally satisfied. Strongly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear SenthilS,  Thank you for choosing Anaheim Marriott for your business visit. We are delighted to read that our hotel provided all the amenities you needed and that you particularly liked our comfortable rooms, well-appointed business accommodations that made for a relaxing experience. We appreciate you mentioning our convenient location and are glad you loved the quality food we serve. It was a pleasure having you as our guest, and we look forward to our next opportunity to serve you again soon.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Noisy rooms in renovated section of floor 10
Summary: Not acceptable. Noise comes in all four directions. One hears absolutely everything that happens everywhere. I will not stay here again. The staff offers earplugs. Really? And at almost $300 a night for this torture.
Manager Response: Dear 438cynthial,  We pride ourselves on delivering comfortable, accommodating hotel experiences for our guests, so please accept our apologies for falling short concerning the noise issues you mentioned. We emphasize the importance of quiet for our guests, but sometimes the energy of our city generates excited guests. We regret you had to endure this and invite you to request a room on the quieter side of the hotel should your travels return you to Anaheim. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers, and we hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: The staff could not have been nicer, or more accomodating.  BUT, the newer style, no dresser, cold floors (no carpet), and shower door that was very hard to open and close made my stay less than comfortable.The bed was great, though. Also, I can usually pay extra to use the concierge level and club room.  This was denied, as I didn't have the credit card.
Manager Response: Dear hkris3,  Thank you for joining us and sharing your feedback with fellow travelers. It was a pleasure to welcome you and to read your comments concerning our exceptional staff and comfortable guestroom mattress. However, we regret any inconvenience experienced by our new look and the changes to our concierge-level access. Your frustrations are understandable, and we apologize for how this negatively affected your stay. Your feedback helps us know where we are succeeding and where we can strengthen our customer service excellence, and is appreciated. Thank you again, and we wish you continued safe travels.    Thank you,  Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: Suitably located a short walking distance from the Anaheim Convention Centre and many excellent restaurants, this is a very luxurious hotel that you can enjoy while in that part of the world. Remember to relax at the bar by the pool.
Manager Response: Dear DrJKC,  It was a pleasure having you as our guest at Anaheim Marriott. We are delighted knowing you loved our ideal location close to Anaheim Convention Center and that you had an excellent experience at our on-site bar. We appreciate your kind recommendation to future travelers, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: I am here for a meeting for several nights and room 1934 has a great view but you really hear the elevators so if you are bothered by noise don’t take this room. Great lounge with nice breakfast. Service very nice here too
Manager Response: Dear ritatayenaka,  We are delighted you chose to stay at Anaheim Marriott while attending a meeting. We are happy to know our friendly service and the delectable breakfast we serve at our lounge met your expectations. However, we are sorry you were disturbed due to the noise from the elevators. We want you to have a pleasant stay, so please let us know at the front desk if there is anything we can do to make your stay better. Thank you for being our guest.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. I was here for a work conference and was so impressed. The hotel felt super luxurious and the rooms were modern (honestly nicer then my own home). The beds were incredibly comfortable. There is a Starbucks and quick service pizza restaurant onsite. The only downfall is the parking which is $26 a day!
Manager Response: Dear jonasfan18,  Thank you for your fantastic review and for all the wonderful things that you had to say about the Anaheim Marriott. We are thrilled you had an enjoyable stay while attending a conference in the area and that you were impressed with our luxurious accommodations with comfortable beds. We also appreciate your pointing out the on-site dining options we have, including Slice Pizzeria and Starbucks Coffee House. However, we regret your disappointment with our parking fees. We value the feedback and look forward to serving you again whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Marriott has upped their game with hotel
Summary: This hotel has 5 star service from the time you pull on to the lot. We were treated like royalty . They treated everyone like that. Every single employee greeted us with a hello and a big smile. We arrived late around 9pm. Joshua took car of us. He upgraded our room hospitality suite. The room was huge two balcony's no view but that was ok he let me ahead. It was the only one available  and I was happy to get it. The room was huge king size bed living room area kitchen kind of area 2 mini fridges.The hotel and rooms have just been newly renovated . The renovation was done very well. The hotel has Hertz and Fedx office. Their gym is one of the nicest I have seen. Their concierge room has a great breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Beverly K,  Thank you for being our guest at the Anaheim Marriott. We are thrilled you appreciated not only our newly remodeled accommodations and fitness center but also our delicious breakfast. It is also nice to know that you loved our tailored service. Your compliments were a pleasure to read, and we will be sure to share it with Joshua. We are grateful for your business and look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: Nice room. Convenient to convention center. Lots of small restaurants close by. 50$ Uber from airport. Nice pool. Big shower. Lots on big screen tv like Netflix, hbo, etc.  efficient check in. Several stations were manned.
Manager Response: Dear Flysalot99,  Thank you for your generous comments about your stay at the Anaheim Marriott. We are glad you loved our modern accommodations and convenient location. It is also nice to know that you liked our front desk service. We enjoyed hosting you and hope to welcome you back soon.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: Modern room. Very clean. Sleek design. No carpet, which felt odd, but seems much more sanitary. I think I'd like to see this as a trend in all hotels. Hall way noise is loud in the room. Super convenient to the conference center. Staff is very friendly and well trained in the art of customer service. There wasn't a microwave in the room. I called to the front desk and they delivered a complimentary one in under 30 min. Beds are comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear tcfpww,  Thank you for being our guest at the Anaheim Marriott. We are thrilled you loved our modern, comfortable rooms and that our associates were receptive to your needs. We appreciate you mentioning our convenient location and look forward to welcoming you again on your next visit to our area.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: It was the first time I have stayed at the Marriott during the NAMM show.  I wondered how overwhelmed the staff and systems would be, despite them knowing it happens every year.  They were on it!  My check in was swift and I was given a wonderful room on the 18th floor.  The exec lounge was very well prepared for breakfast every morning.  The food was delicious and fresh and a great start to every day.  The sweet lady with the radiant smile greeting at the door of the lounge every morning was delightful.  You chose wisely!  The bar and restaurant is simply chaotic during NAMM.  My wife, Rose, and I were able to meet Adrian on Wednesday night before the show kicked off.  Thursday night, amongst the sea of people, I hear, "Hey Mike!" and turn t see Adrian.  We looked for him each
Manager Response: Dear Z7925JLmichaelg,   We are delighted we could accommodate you and your wife at the Anaheim Marriott while you were here for the NAMM show. Thank you for letting us know you enjoyed the delicious food we serve at our lounge and that you were impressed with the excellent service provided by our team. We will be sure to share your compliments with them, especially Adrian. Thank you for allowing us to be of service. We look forward to having the pleasure of doing so again the next time you are in our area.   Thank you, Zuyen Urbina, Front Office Manager

Summary: Very happy with our stay at this hotel. I’ve stayed there four times in the past year. Each visit was great.  I enjoy the comfortable beds, the views are nice from either side of the hotel and the valet is very convenient and fast. I love the lobby and the look of this hotel.  We are Bonvoy Titanium Elite members so we get to enjoy the club level for breakfast and drinks and snacks. They do a great job on the breakfast.  I love the proximity to Disneyland and also to other attractions.  This is definitely one of my favorite and always dependable hotels in Orange County.  Also the rates are pretty decent.  The bellhop was also so nice  with getting my son a soft drink he wanted and ice for our room too.  I really love this hotel and highly recommend this for any Disneyland fans
Manager Response: Dear 929shellyo,   Thank you for being a Marriott Bonvoy Titanium Elite Member and for choosing to stay with us at once again at the Anaheim Marriott. There is nothing more significant than to hear from a guest who returns to our hotel because they love the staff, convenient location, excellent amenities, and everything else we offer our guests. We appreciate you recommending us and look forward to welcoming you again whenever your travels bring you back our way!  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: 1. This hotel charges $40 per package received  2. The housekeeping will com into your room even when you have the privacy sign hanging on the door 3. The girl at the market place “forces” you to “fill up” the credit card slip for tips before she starts to make your coffee!  After a few phone calls, they “were kind enough” to drop my $40 x2 = $80 “shipping charge” of my personal packages to $10. I refused to pay this because the reservation confirmation only indicated self and valet parking charges, but nothing about charges for package received. Ken at Bell Desk was nice enough to drop all charges on my statement. But I went to him and tipped him $10!  There are definitely many other choices in the neighborhood. This Marriott for sure would not be on of my future choices.  BTW,
Manager Response: Dear dk100641,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for taking the time to share your specific concerns. We regret that you were not informed of our package charges, especially as this is a wide practice with larger hotels. We are happy to read, though, that Ken was able to address this to your satisfaction. He is a great example of the service we strive to provide our guests. Additionally, we apologize for the service issues you encountered at the Market and with our housekeeping services. These are not normal complaints for our team members, so we will be sure to investigate your comments. Thank you once more for your feedback. We hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a more seamless travel experience.  Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Below Marriott standards - “extra fee land” but you don’t get for what you pay.
Summary: Hotel is remodeled with a beautiful clean design but you feel it’s age when it comes to the noises in the room made by the mini bar (had to unplug it or I could not sleep - it comes empty anyways) and Air Conditioner.   Noise is a real problem at this place. Before 7:30am I was being awaken daily by vacuum cleaning in the aisles, but apparently they just use that to wake you up.  Room was DIRTY. Full of hair from previous guests and corners either dusty or with spider webs.  They offer digital key via App but it never works.  BAD customer service. You don’t feel honest wish from the employees to help the guests. They are fully reactive and answers just what is asked.  A couple of times they knew I had half of the info I would need to accomplish what was being asked and had no
Manager Response: Dear rcperez,  Please accept our apologies for the service issues mentioned in your review. Although we are confident some of these instances are isolated, this in no way excuses the fact that we failed to provide you an outstanding experience. We value your loyalty to our brand and promise that immediate steps will occur to ensure we strengthen our customer experience moving forward. We hope you will consider a future visit so we can better demonstrate our commitment to excellence.  Thank you,  Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary: This hotel was very expensive but had great rooms. I was upgraded and had a corner room with a balcony (eastern exposure for sunrise). The room was large and the amenities were standard for a nicer Marriott. Wifi was fast, and the cafe/market on the ground level was efficient and had good beer. This was a fine conference hotel, and after visiting rooms in the Hilton across the street I would only recommend this property.
Manager Response: Dear Cameron W,   We are delighted you chose to stay at Anaheim Marriott just steps from the beautiful Anaheim Convention Center. It is great to read you could relax in our well-appointed accommodations and enjoy our amenities and the lovely view it provides. Thank you for recommending us, and we look forward to serving you soon.   Thank you, Zuyen Urbina Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Our favorite place to stay when visiting Disneyland/California Adventure!
Summary: We love the Anaheim Marriott! It is our "go to" hotel for our annual trip to Disneyland and California Adventure. We have stayed at the two fancy D-land hotels and Anaheim Marriott remains our absolute favorite for comfort, value and convenience.   The Anaheim Marriott has recently gone thru a complete renovation and is so modern and comfortable. The beds are fabulous, the thread count also awesome.
