Summary: Excellent experience.  While at Disney by son got sick, the hotel was GREAT and assisted us in finding a doctor to come to our hotel room.  Really saved the trip for us!  It was a busy week and the hotel was booked - everything ran smooth and the hotel staff was very accommodating.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and kind words regarding our hotel. Glad we could help you during your visit. Thanks for staying with us and we hope to have you back. Thanks, Dan

Summary: Stayed at the Marriott for two nights in May.  Business trip for me.  Disney trip for wife.  Very happy with my stay.  The onsite convention/banquet staff was superb.  The lobby lounge area is spacious and comfortable and great for side meetings.  The rooms are standard and meet expectations.  Shuttle system to park worked well.  Overall good experience.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We pride ourselves on customer service, I'm glad to hear you were well taken care of. We hope to see you at your next conference! Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Nice hotel close the Anaheim Angels Baseball Stadium
Summary: I stayed at this hotel with friends while traveling to see a baseball game at the Anaheim Angels Stadium. We did the self-park which was cheaper then the valet, but much more of a hassel. My room was on the concerge level of the hotel (18th floor) just a few doors down from the lounge. The room had a balcony that looked out over some neighborhoods. The hotel had a modern feel with a nice large lobby and bar area. We ate dinner and breakfast in the lounge which was very nice. The bed was comfortable. The room came with a bath robe too which I rarely see in a Marriott. The hotel was very quiet which was surprising because I was affraid there would be little kids everywhere going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We pride ourselves on customer service, I'm glad to hear you were well taken care of. We hope to see you again soon! Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great hotel and convenient to Disneyland
Summary: Beautiful room and the staff is super friendly. There are plenty of great restaurants near by. I went to race on tinkerbell weekend and there is a bus that picks you up in front of hotel or it is a nice warm up walk to the start line. I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We pride ourselves on customer service, I'm glad to hear you were well taken care of. We hope to see you at your next race! Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Amazing Service, Amazing Hotel, Makes Your Feel Valued
Summary: The Anaheim Marriott is my second home. I say this as there is not another hotel I stay at while in Orange County on business.  They make you feel valued and the service is second to none.  A special thanks to Kelly Hurley, Scott at the Bell Desk and Heather at the front desk.  It is the service that you and the Anaheim Marriott team  provide that make me book 60+ meetings a year at Marriott Properties and our National Convention.  When you are on the road as much as I am it is important to have a great partner like the Marriott during your travels.  Thank you Anaheim Marriott
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We pride ourselves on customer service, I'm glad to hear you were well taken care of. We hope to see you at your next conference! Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Location best for Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: Not even a block away, I stayed here for Star Wars Celebration Convention in April, 2015.  Room wasn't spectacular (had a special rate or I could not have afforded it) but the location was everything.  Not even a block away from the con center. Cool gathering area in the very large lobby plus a nice bar with cozy areas.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, we've completely renovated the hotel including our nFuse Bar & Kitchen where there's something for everyone! 24 craft beers on tap, and light and fresh California local sustainable fare on the menu! Thanks for staying with us, and would love to have you back!

Summary Heading: Good if you're going to the Convention Centre, not Disneyland
Summary: Had a reasonable stay here, I think the rooms are nicer than the Hilton opposite. Proximity to Anaheim Convention Centre is unparallel, down the street and you're on the promenade where the food trucks are for Wondercon.  PROS - Lovely renovated lobby, quick lifts (great lift system that appoints your floor prior to arrival), welcoming and polite reception and concierge service. - Balcony for each room - Comfy bed with lots of pillows - Plugs available on bedside lamp - handy for charging phones at night. - Lots of towels provided in the room - My room's bath was decent, with a good curtain that doesn't let much water leak over, and good drainage while showering. - Super close to Anaheim Convention Centre - Wifi included. - Starbucks and Pizza Hut in the lobby.  CONS - Toilet is
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, and for the suggestions. We appreciate the feedback. We've completely renovated the hotel including our nFuse Bar & Kitchen where there's something for everyone! 24 craft beers on tap, and light and fresh California local sustainable fare on the menu! Thanks for staying with us, and would love to have you back!

Summary: I stayed at the Anaheim Marriott for a business trip from April 29-May 2, 2015. My room was on the 14th floor, 2 beds and a balcony. My employer paid $212 a night (plus taxes) for the room using a third party to make the reservation. After a few phone calls, I was able to link this reservation with my Marriott Rewards account. I used mobile phone to check in early and low and behold there’s a separate check in line at the lobby for “Elite and Mobile Check In” guests.  The elevators are pretty high tech too. I posted some pics along with the review.  There’s a Starbucks and Pizza Hut in the hotel. You can use your Starbucks card in the Starbucks, but you cannot redeem freebie rewards though.  This hotel (along with the Hilton) is the closest, and I think, best hotel to stay if
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, and for the suggestion. We appreciate the feedback. Also, those pictures are great! We've completely renovated the hotel including our nFuse Bar & Kitchen where there's something for everyone! 24 craft beers on tap, and light and fresh California local sustainable fare on the menu! Thanks for staying with us, and would love to have you back!

Summary: I should mention right off that the Marriott is typically well out of my price range - we split the room with a friend. Overall, my feeling was that this hotel was very nice, with very helpful staff, but that they nickel-and-dimed you for everything. I mean, here I am staying in a upscale hotel, and even breakfast and Wi-Fi was another $13/day each. I thought at least some things should be complimentary, and not a thing was.  When I first went to check in, the clerk made it sound like they didn't accept debit cards, but then clarified that if I used my debit card for the room, it would be charged then, instead of at check-out. That was fine, so it didn't end up being a problem, but it was the start of several little hassles upon check-in. Arriving up at the room, we discovered
Manager Response: Thank you for your thorough review. It sounds like you visited when we were going through our 13million dollar hotel renovation, as the rooms are all renovated now, and the bathrooms are just getting finished. The pool has been remodeled, and as you stated the lobby, bar and restaurant are all also complete. Thank you for your patience while we were going through the renovation. We hope to have you back to enjoy all of the newness of the hotel!  Best, Dan

Summary: Close to convention center and Disney.  A bit on the pricy side, but specious, quiet rooms.  Great customer service.  Had a problem with my first room, they addressed it quickly,  then left me a fruit basket and cheese in the room with a very nice note (It was not necessary but it was very much appreciated).
Manager Response: Thanks your review. I'm glad to hear we were able to accommodate you and quickly. We always want to make sure you have a stellar experience when staying with us, so I'm glad to hear this. Hope to see you again.  Best, Dan

Summary: I stayed here for two nights earlier this week.  A rather large hotel with is own conference center and two separate buildings for rooms, I was very pleased with my accommodations.  Was in the Oasis Tower, which wasn't their main building (so it seemed), and got a king room that was actually handicapped-accessible.  Not a big deal for me, just meant it was more spacious.  However, loved that it was a corner room that had its own balcony - what a treat.  The staff al seemed very nice, and I would definitely stay here again.  The proximity to the Convention Center, which is why I was there, was great.  Easy to walk around and felt very safe.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We pride ourselves on customer service, I'm glad to hear you were well taken care of. We hope to see you at your next conference!  Best, Dan

Summary: We recently stayed at the Marriott in Anaheim,  this was a business trip/vacation.  Hotels rooms are very small, no king beds available.  But there some really big issues, first off the staff at the hotel is rude or simply nonexistent.  From the wait staff to the housekeepers.  At the outside dining area there was no one, you had to go inside and deal with the uninterested bartender.  To top it off we were charged $30 for a Manhatten.  We have stayed at many, many Marriott's and have never experienced such a disappointing experience.
Manager Response: Hi Marcy, Thank you for your feedback. I'm surprised to hear this, as we pride ourselves on customer service here at the hotel. Please private message me with the dates of your stay, room number, name it was under, and Marriott Rewards number (if any) so that I can look into this further.    Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: not for family, only business people
Summary: Good for convention due to the location next to convention center but long block to the entrance of Disneyland. There are many hotels closer to Disneyland.  The pool is not kids friendly - small and you go through a bar to get to it. On top of that, I felt like people in the bar were watching us through the glass windows and doors.  It won silver for green leaders but uses only paper cups in the hotel rooms. How many paper cups hotel uses per day? Very backwards. The place where they put coffee cups were darkly lit and I could hardly be able to see. The coffee itself comes with disposable plastic tray...there was no microwave.  Parking was $24 which was the most expensive around the aea. We parked Sheraton and Hilton hotel parking garage which was $16. WiFi $17+ depends on speed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We do have many families that come for a Disney vacation and enjoy the pool frequently. You might have stayed at a time when there was a big convention and was occupied by mostly business travelers.  We also offer shuttles to and from Disney to make getting to the fun easier.  Thanks for staying with us.

Summary: Let me begin this review by saying that I am a frequent visitor of disneyland, and when we decided to attend the final day of Star Wars Celebration, I had full intention of booking a room at the Hilton, simply because I had stayed there before and was familiar with the property. I ultimately chose Marriott because I was able to find a better rate (after parking, tax and room service breakfast, I my total bill didn't even add up to as much as the Hilton's pre-tax fees). I wanted to stay close enough that walking to the convention center would be easy.  This property absolutely exceeded my expectations. At check in, I had requested a room facing disneyland so we could watch the fireworks from our room. We were checking in on Saturday, and as the convention began on Thursday, the
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind and detailed review! I appreciate you answering some of the previous misconceptions about parking, and the elevator. -It's cool, isn't it? If staying for Disney, there are shuttles that can take you there. Thanks again for staying with us, and we hope to see you again.

Summary: Most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. Even the sheets were soft. Room was very clean and well decorated. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Food in the hotel restaurant never disappointed. Service was a little slow in the restaurant so if you are in a hurry, let them know ahead of time. For the price, could have included free wi-fi.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We're glad you had a great restful visit with us. Thank you for noting the service at the restaurant. We will look into that further. Thanks for staying with us and hope to see you again.  Best, Dan

Summary: Overall the hotel was nice.  The staff was accommodating a large business convention and a good job though a few members were not as professional and made comments that were derogatory in nature about the company.    Very short walk to Disneyland.    I'd stay again.
Manager Response: Hi Michael, Thank you for your review.  Were some of our staff not professional? If this is the case please private message me so that I can dive into this deeper.  I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: My wife and I recently stayed at the Marriott Anaheim for an entire week while attending Star Wars: Celebration Anaheim. I had extremely high expectations for this hotel and I can safely say that those expectations were exceeded.   The staff at the hotel are among the friendliest and most professional I have encountered. The recently remodeled room was large and very clean, the view was fantastic, and the service was first rate.   When I return to Anaheim, there is no doubt that I will be booking my room at the Marriott Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! This is the stuff we like to hear! We had a great time with our guests for the Star Wars Celebration, and got into the fun ourselves. Thanks for staying with us, and we look forward to seeing you next year!  Best, Dan

Summary: The Marriott Anaheim is an average hotel. Not super fancy, a bit on the worn side. The rooms are average...you can see a film of smog on the windows and sliding door to the small patio, which is to be expected I suppose but is not conducive to a clean feeling room.   The fitness center is nice, and quite large. It is more like a gym and is better than the average hotel fitness center.   Great location if going to an event at the convention center as it is mere steps away. Easy walking to the Garden Walk and Disney.
Manager Response: Hi Dana, Thanks for your review. Please private message us with your room number and the dates that you stayed with us, as I'd like to check into the state of the room further. We just went through a 15mm renovation on the entire hotel, so this information comes as a surprise. Thanks for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: I like how you punch in your destination floor and leads you to an elevator and get to your floor quickly. By the way what brand are your elevators anyway? I would really like to know. Thank You for making our stay easy and fun
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and kind words regarding our elevators. I think they are exclusive for Marriott Hotels. Thanks for staying with us and we hope to have you back.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Three Things, Great Anti Allergy Room, Clean Great Elevators, HORRID BILLING SYSTEM!!!
Summary: Went here for the recent Star Wars Convention called Celebration. There was good here, then one horrible item to my stay. 1) Rooms aren't large but many (if not all) have balconies, 2) the pool area and bar are very comfortable, 3) the elevators beat the Hilton next door by a HUGE amount. The elevators may not seem like a big deal but I always need to run up to grab a thing or two, VERY quick at the Marriott... At the Hilton, where many of our buddies stayed, and they complained about this issue, they had elevator buttons covered up. I personally waited six minutes waiting for one the only time I was in and that was at 11 PM. The person who took care of cleaning our room was great!  THE HORRIBLE: I gave the Marriott my Southwest Airlines, Chase VISA. The hotel placed two charges
Manager Response: Hi Jason, I'm sorry to hear about your pricing situation, can you please private message me on here with the exact dates, name room was number, room number, and if you have a Marriott Rewards number so I can research further in order to help solve this problem, that would be most helpful.   Thanks, Dan

Summary: This hotel was great! Lobby and rooms were very nice. The bathroom was average but better than most. The hotel has the new elevators and door locks, which make the experience a lot easier. The breakfast buffet was excellent!!  I loved this hotel and wish I would have stayed there last year when I was at Disneyland. I will be back!!
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We are proud of our 13mm renovation, and fully revamped menu at the nFuse Bar & Kitchen. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great Location and awesome for Disneyland
Summary: I have stayed at the Anaheim Marriott 3 years in a row now and it is amazing how much the place has changed in a year.  The hotel has had a complete revamp with a brand new bar/restaurant and seating area in the lobby.  I was amazed at how much was different, even the elevators had been updated.  The Marriott is in a great location if you are attending a Convention as the centre is on the doorstep of the hotel.  Disneyland is just a bus drive away and tickets for the bus can be purchased from the reception for $5pp.  However the there can be queues in the morning for the bus and you may end up fighting for a space as it stops at the Hilton first and everyone runs other there to catch it leaving the bus full before it even reaches the Marriott stop (this is more of a problem with
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your kind review. We are proud of our 13mm renovation and still put customer service as the number one priority.  We're glad you had a great stay, and hope to see you soon.  Best, Dan

Summary: Stayed here for 4 days during s business stay in Anaheim, the hotel was extremely comfortable and the staff was great! I had a blast watching everyone dress up for wondercon!! Will definitely stay here again! Walking distance to restaurants...not a small hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! We have a few food options in the hotel that include a Pizza Hut and Starbucks for on the go options, and a newly renovated nFuse Bar & Kitchen that serves of fresh Californian cuisine.  Some fan favorites are the Kale Salad, Brussel Sprouts, Siracha Shrimp and Lobster mac n cheese. A little something for everyone! Thanks for staying with us,  Best, Dan

Summary: We stayed at the Marriott Anaheim, which is not super close to Disneyland and may be a little too far to walk especially after a day of walking around Disneyland. The other couple that went with us decided it was too far away from Disneyland for them so they stayed somewhere closer.  In the end I was glad we decided to stay at the Marriott, the accommodations are much higher quality than any of the closer properties (with the exception of the Disney properties). Unfortunately they did not have a king suite when we arrived so we had 2 double beds, but Marriott gave us a credit to make up for the mistake. The room was clean and comfortable, and it had a mini fridge.   We utilized the valet parking which was only $4 more a day and well worth it. You have the ability to text the
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your informative review. This is the type of information we really appreciate ur guests sharing! Also thanks for the feedback about the lobby area. With conventions in town it does fill up quick!  The nFuse Bar & Kitchen menu has been completely revamped with local fresh California fare, so there's something for everyone! We hope to have you back again.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I stayed at this hotel many times in the past for conventions, and it has never disappointed me.  The rooms were clean and staff very helpful.  The location in relation to Anaheim Convention Center and distance to the Disneyland Resort (both walking and shuttles) always make it my first choice whenever I'm in town.    If there was anything that could be considered a "bad" experience, it was on the last day of the convention, with a vast majority of the attendees checking out before Noon.   I was staying over one more day, and I discovered my room was still not cleaned by 6 PM.  A couple phone calls, and half an hour later, the nice housekeeper arrived to clean up the room immediately.  One thing to remember is that a very large departure of hotel attendees on the same day is
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, and for the suggestion. We appreciate the feedback. Also, those pictures are great!  We've completely renovated the hotel including our nFuse Bar & Kitchen where there's something for everyone! 24 craft beers on tap, and light and fresh California local sustainable fare on the menu! Thanks for staying with us, and would love to have you back!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great stay, awesome view of the fireworks at Disney.
Summary: Stayed for a week right before the Fourth of July, enjoyed the stay quite a lot. Nice hotel, nice staff, special thanks to the man on the maintenance team who helped me out. Also a special thanks to the awesome housekeeper, Ms. E. Lopez who took great care of our needs. Wi-Fi cost $$, although it was reimbursed following the conference. Would stay here again. Stayed in June-July of 2013.
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review. I think you'll be pleased to know that we've completely renovated our hotel since your last stay, including the pool, fitness area, lobby, rooms and completely revamped our nFuse bar & kitchen with a local sustainable California fare cuisine and over 24 craft beers on tap! There's something for everyone! We hope to see you back again soon.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Nice hotel with clean rooms in a great location to Disneyland. However, parking costs $24/day ($16/day next door @ Hilton) and basic internet is $12/day. Staff is friendly. If you want a view of the nightly fireworks at Disneyland, stay next door at the Hilton. Wa'll ing distance to many great restaurants (Bubba Gumps, Cheesecake Factory, Roy's, Ihop, Morton's Steakhouse and many more). Very clean and nicely equipped workout room, althouh I did not use it. Finally, friendly staff at hotel bar.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We also have a newly renovated pool area, where you can eat and drink poolside from our also newly revamped nFuse bar & kitchen with a sustainable local California style menu with fresh fare that has something for everyone. Thanks for staying with us and we hope to see you again.  Best, Dan

Summary: My Famly and I stayed at the property in February as a mini vacation.  We arrived in the early morning around 3:15am, and after waiting 10 mins because no one was at the front desk, I called the hotel for assistance.  The hotel operator was rude when I asked if someone was available to check us in.  After waiting another five mins, the front desk agent arrived to help us.  The first room we were put in was  not clean, it's like housekeeping forgot to clean the bathroom, so we requested a room move.  Then next morning, Engneering was knocking on our door to see if we were in our room because they had some maintenance to complete.  Now why would we be checked into a room that needed repairs?  I requested that they not enter., which I was told they needed to enter to paint, which I
Manager Response: Hi Tiffany, I am sorry to hear of your less than stellar experience with our hotel. Please private message me with with the dates of stay, room number, and the name the room was under, and I will dig a little deeper to help resolve this. Also please provide your Marriott Rewards number if you are a member. That will help as well.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: this property is gorgeous in every way. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. I've been to many Marriott properties, but this one is one of the best. The price per room is reasonable given its proximity to Disneyland, and the convention center. The room was excellent, and ready upon my arrival. The ease of check in, and out was great as well. I'll visit this property again.
Manager Response: Hi Rick, Thank you for your great feedback. Customer service is very important to us, so it's great to hear that we're providing that on all levels. We just finished a 13mm full hotel renovation with many updates to the pool, fitness room, rooms and a revamped bar and restaurant area called nFuse with several different new menu options. I hope you were able to experience it all. Thanks for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great staff but Lousy beds - creaked all night - very run down
Summary: The hotel rooms are run down and my bed creaked the whole night - the staff is very good and friendly and refunded our money for one night.  As Concierge members the lounge was nice and the breakfast was very good. The staff in the concierge lounge was super friendly and gave my daughter a balloon on her birthday.   The lady at the Disney d so was most uninformed. Just expect to get your tickets from here - nothing else.   The hotel is full of people attending conventions and not really a family hotel for the Disneyland theme park.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. I'm glad you got things sorted out for your stay, and ended up enjoying your visit. We have an even mix of both families and business travelers that stay with us. We have a newly renovated pool, and a few dining options for the family including a newly renovated nFuse Bar & Kitchen that features local sustainable Californian cuisine. Thanks for staying with us, and we hope to have you back again.  Best, Dan

Summary: We are currently staying in this hotel. The staff have been great answering all our questions. We bought our Disneyland tickets here as well. There is a Target right across the street which was great for getting things for our kids. The rooms are good also. Very comfortable beds. The in room coffee is good but there is also a Starbucks in the lobby. We would definitely come back!
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We appreciate it. There is also a newly renovated pool for the kids to enjoy some sunny Southern California weather! Thanks for staying with us!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Upscale Hotel at reasonable price and great location when attending convention
Summary: Recently attended a convention at Anaheim Convention Center.  I enjoy staying at an upscale hotel and the Marriott Anaheim hits the mark with all of the amenities expected in a mainline hotel.  Staff is great and welcome your to the hotel.  The room was well furnished and comfortable.  I had a large balcony to enjoy the great weather.  Good pool area.  Located next to the Anaheim Convention Center it is very convenient. It was reasonably priced for the overall value.  Would stay there again when in the area.
Manager Response: Hi Don, Thanks for your review. We just went through a 13mm renovation and are proud of the results. Glad to see you appreciate it as well.  Thanks for staying with us, and hope to see you again soon!   Best, Dan

Summary: What an amazing Hotel! Staying away from home actually from Australia and coming to a foreign area to enjoy some family time when we arrived could not be happier with Marriott even the Bell Man Scott made us feel right at home from the time we walked in.  We did have a few concerns after I raised the issues with Cesar the manager he literally turned our whole vacation around and he made our stay even more comfortable than we had expected.  The food is fantastic.  A shout out to an Amazing Lady America who is way more than a waitress.  In fact there is a real family of staff behind the scenes some who have put over 30 years work into this hotel.  Only 15mins walk to Disney and other shops.  Short taxi ride to the Shopping Outlets or we did a long walk there nearly an hour & taxi
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review.  We love the location, and have just completed a 13mm renovation to the entire hotel. We've renovated the rooms, pool, fitness center and entire lobby area and NFuse Bar & Kitchen with a local sustainable menu and a 22 craft beer program. We would love to have you back any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I stayed here for a week while visiting my parents, the hotel is well located in the center of Anaheim and only a short walk to restaurants and Disney. The rooms are a good size and well maintained. The staff provide good friendly service. The pool area is a great place to relax. The team at the Starbucks provided a great fun experience also. I would recommend this hotel and would return here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great feedback. This is the stuff we like to hear. We also have a newly renovated nFuse Bar & Kitchen with 24 craft beers on tap and a large bourbon program. The menu is fresh Californian fare in a comfortably modern setting (you can even eat out by the pool.) So, we hope to have you back soon! Thanks for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: My wife and I spent a night at the full service Marriott Hotel while en route to the San Diego area.  The hotel is located adjacent to Disneyland and a short distance to a row of  restaurants, including The Cheesecake Factory, where we had a very nice and enjoyable dinner.  The hotel's rates are very reasonable for the type and location of such a nice facility.  The hotel's staff were friendly and helpful at all times.  We will definitely be staying  at this hotel on our next trip to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review! Happy to hear you had an enjoyable visit and that our staff was accommodating. We pride ourselves on customer service, so it's great to get that feedback. Hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary: Solid conference hotel with decent restaurant, catering, and meeting rooms. Room was well appointed and quiet. Nothing fancy, but clean and provides for your basic needs. The location is typical business / Disney:  lots of large chain restaurants at all price points within walking distance, and of course Disneyland. I took a jog around the large block and the surrounds are concrete and quasi-urban sprawl. Not a place I would visit for vacation but worked fine for a business trip.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We pride ourselves on our location across from the convention center, and 2 blocks from Disney...and a drive to the beach! We also have a newly renovated pool area and fitness room should you choose to exercise at the hotel. We like those options! Thanks for staying with us, and we hope to see you again.  Best, Dan

Summary: Stayed here for conference in Feb 2015.  This is one of 2 hotels immediately adjacent to the Anaheim Convention Center (the other being HIlton, right across the driveway).  This is the most convenient location, as you can walk less than 50 yards right into the convention center.    Pros:  - location  - full-featured Marriott, including conference rooms, onsite restaurants, bars, etc.  - clean, updated  - near Disneyland, if that's of interest   Cons:  - limited choice of restaurants in walking distance;  - no free parking - only daily fee of $24;
Manager Response: Hi Marion, Thanks for your feedback. We have 3 different choices on our property for food and beverage. There's a Starbucks, Pizza Hut, and our newly renovated nFuse Bar & Kitchen with local, sustainable and some gluten free options on the menu as well. It's fresh Californian fare in a comfortably modern setting. Hope that helps make the choice to stay with us again for another conference!   Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Not a Four Starr Marriott Hotel
Summary: We visited on the third week of March. Upon our arrival, the check-in was quite fast. Our request to provide us a room with two beds (double or queen, not sure) was granted. The tower and elevators to access our room were the furthest away from the lobby, but closer to the self-parking facility access elevator. The parking in this hotel is 50% more expensive than next door Hilton, and though it's the same price as Hyatt, they don't offer the same services (In Hyatt, you can have Park & Ride for the same price, which includes Valet Parking & Shuttle services to/from Disney) The staff - in general - were always helpful, smiling, welcoming and quick to respond no matter what time of the day or night. From the doorman and luggage services, to housekeeping, to reception. The Rooms
Manager Response: Thank you for your thorough review. It sounds like you visited when we were going through our 13million dollar hotel renovation, as the rooms are all renovated now, and the bathrooms are just getting finished. The pool has been remodeled, and as you stated the lobby, bar, restaurant and fitness facilities are all also complete. Thank you for your patience while we were going through the renovation. We hope to have you back to enjoy all of the newness of the hotel!  Best, Dan

Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Marriott during our Spring break visit to Disneyland. Upon check in we were upgraded to a room with a balcony and concierge amenities. This was wonderful as we could stock up on bottled water before we went to Disney. The room was average size and clean, except for the rip on the bottom of one of the comforters. The bathroom was very small and cramped. I get that most of the bathrooms are small but the layout of the bathroom was difficult to work around. My son banged his head on the bathroom door just trying to get out of the shower!  This hotel is about a 20-25 minute walk to Disneyland. They do offer the ART shuttle but we chose to walk since the shuttles were very crowded and we had a jogging stroller with us. On the 3rd night of our stay many young
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We also offer several dining options on premises, from a local sustainable restaurant called nFuse, to a Pizza Hut and a Starbucks. We hope to have you back soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Wow!  What a "yes we can" attitude!
Summary: We booked event space at the Anaheim Marriott as an aside to a large convention in the convention center.  The event staff, bell boys, and concierge were magic.  There was nothing they weren't willing to do and made our trip so much better.  They moved pallets, brought food, delivered things we ran out of, and checked in regularly.  They never looked like they were waiting for a tip.  They always had a smile and Can Do attitude.  We are a small business but felt very spoiled. I don't want to ever hold another event anywhere other then the Anaheim Marriott.  Seriously!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review! We pride ourselves on customer service to everyone who walks in the door from event space, to your family vacation! So thank you for the positive feedback. We would love to have you back again anytime.  Best, Dan

Summary: Been there for a conference which was in the hotel. From my room at the 6th floor to the conference in 2 minutes thanks to super fast elevators.... nice.  Room was clean and equiped with two kingsize beds, tv, coffee machine and bath. The view was hirrible because the only thing i could see was the roof of the conference center. For the rest no complaints.  Nice bar and restaurant. Nice pool and good staff. Starbucks and carrental were also present.  A good stay!
Manager Response: Hey thanks for your review. We've just been through a 13mm renovation, and paid close attention to what we thought our guests would like to make their stay easier. Nice to get some great feedback. Thanks for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: I stayed in anaheim marriott in october 2014 as a part of a large convention held by my company. The quality and efficiency that the staff demonstrated was not seen by me before. Handling the session spillovers by planning ahead of the events and even the sitting arrangement was done in a professional manner. The rooms were great . The food was something I did not like as I found it to be bland to my taste. Howver the overall experience was wonderful !!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and feedback about how we handle conventions. We aim to please there as well as for families on vacation! We have completed the renovation that was underway when you were here, and would love to have you back to see all of the redefined amenities including the revamp of nFuse Bar & Kitchen, with some great flavorful menu items like the Siracha Shrimp that is one of my favorites. We hope to see you again!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: The Hotel Front Desk Clerks should be dismissed.
Summary: When we told them twice the day we checked in that we could not get into our room; the lock was still broken when we got back at midnight.  We left all our luggages in a friend's room when they promised to have it all dealt with before we got back.  The manager was able to give us a small credit when we brought the matter to his attention.  It's too bad that he had to apologize to us over and over when it wasn't his fault.  The incompetent clerk gave us the dirtiest look for her and her colleague's mistake.   Maybe they haven't been on the other side of the desk.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear about your unfortunate situation, but are pleased that the manager on duty was able to apologize and provide a credit. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Beautiful hotel and grounds. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I asked for a room as high up as possible, and she delivered. The nature of the convention made the lobby very noisy, but that didn't travel to the room. The room service breakfast was a bit expensive, but very good.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We appreciate the kind words about our staff as we pride ourselves on exemplary customer service. Thanks for staying with us, and we hope to see you again!  Best, Dan

Summary: I have been staying at the Anaheim Marriott for  so long, it is embarrassing and have always like it. With this remodel, like it even more. The hotel lobby and rooms, bar and restaurant were remodeled late last year and what a big difference it makes. The lobby, bar and restaurants are not your dads red velvet any longer but more in line with streamline decor and a lot more room in the bar. The rooms but not the bathrooms were redone along with the halls. Overall, the hotel is very up to date. The only issue was the restaurant had miserable service as it just opened. Overall, the service as always was great and the hotel can't do enough to make you feel at home. Disneyland is only a short distance and can be walked in a pinch.  There is a shuttle that will take you there for $5
Manager Response: Hi Jeff, Thanks for your kind review. We really appreciate it. Thanks for your understanding about the service in the restaurant while we were working out the kinks. We have gotten it down much better and hope to continue to bring the level of customer service you would expect from a Marriott hotel. Thanks for being a loyal customer, and for staying with us.   Best, Dan

Summary: The elevators are Cool!  Loved this one...great location, service was spot on, and entire staff was very welcoming and attentive.    This hotel is what full service is about - lot's of additional amenities like Hertz on site, Starbucks, and numbers F&B outlets.
Manager Response: Thanks for the positive review. We also have a fitness center and a Fedex office for shipping! We hope to see you again!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I had an annual conference in Anaheim and most years I stay at the Marriott next to the convention center.  It makes for an easy walk and some activities are in the hotel as well.  The rooms are comfortable and spacious.  They have created a new elevator system that seems to manage the movement of clients much more effectively.  Members of our group all seemed to be able to rest well at the hotel.  Thanks for making it an easy week.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We recently completed a 13mm renovation on the entire hotel and are really proud of the results, so thank you for the feedback. Hope to see you back next year!  Best, Dan

Summary: Very clean and awesome pool that seems to only get used by the children who stay here (it seemed to only be mine + two other families).  A little to uptight for a relaxing vacation.  Expect to be charged for everything, including a $24/day parking fee.  I was a bit envious of the Clarion guests next door who had free par,king and a complimentary breakfast.  If I had to pick a Disneyland good neighbor hotel again, definitely not this one for my family.
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review. We have just gone through an amazing 13mm renovation so everything is basically new. Our comfortably modern approach is meant to be inviting, relaxing yet modern and sleek. Thank you for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: WOW.. this hotel and team knows how to support a major convention.  I have just stayed for 4 nights and the experience was excellent. Special thanks to the incredible Martha Arevalo and her manager who went above and beyond to make our stay and meeting perfect.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review and comments about Martha. I will make sure her direct supervisor hears of it. We pride ourselves on customer service here, whether that's for a family on vacation or a convention full of executives, so we appreciate the feedback! Thanks for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: Stayed at the Marriott for a business conference in Feb 2015. The location of the hotel is very good for both the convention centre and Disney. There are plenty of nearby restaurants to choose from and the hotel itself was fairly good. On the conference side the organisation was very good. There were several hundred of us (800 I think) and they managed to handle the meals and breaks very well. The people on the check in desks were brilliant giving me good recommendations for beaches and generally anything that I wanted advice on.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We pride ourselves on customer service so it's nice to get that feedback. There's lots to do in and around the hotel. We have a fitness center, beautiful remodeled swimming pool area with fire pits for the chilly SoCal nights, nearby beaches and that popular place called....Disneyland. Thanks for staying with us and we hope to have you back again.  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Hotel in vicinity of Disney Land
Summary: Nice, descent and neat hotel. What attracted us was a location which is very near to Disney. We were little adventurous and took a walk to park, to avoid all parking hassles and fees. It was worth it and we suggest you to do it as well.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. Yes, we are close enough to walk, and with our SoCal weather, it is usually a great idea! For those with small kids or physically impaired we do offer shuttle tickets at our Valet within the hotel to make it super easy as well. Thanks, and we hope you stay with us again!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great Choice Hotel for Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: The hotel has recently undergone a number of renovations.  The lobby and common areas are open, welcoming and perfect for the kind of business that permeates a trade show environment.  Contained within the property is a Starbucks, Hertz Rental and FedEx Business Center.  Current Elevator technology insures you never wait more than a minute for the next elevator.  This is all terrific of course, but what is really great, is the staff.  As many know the Marriott Brand owns Ritz Carlton which is renown for customer service and staff training, well this hotel surpasses every experience we've ever had with Ritz.  From the car valets to the front desk to house keeping just the best crew one could want at a business hotel.  The restaurants are large and welcoming.  Not a fancy dinner
Manager Response: Thanks for your review about our customer service! We hang our hat on providing only the best to ensure your stray is stellar. So, we appreciate the feedback. We hope to see you again soon.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I myself am a fellow Marriott employee, and LOVED your property. I stayed over this past weekend with a group of friends for a bachelorette party. Adrian made our stay! He provided the highest level of guest service! Well done Adrian! Thank you!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and kind words about Adrian! We love her too! I will make sure the praise gets back to her.   Thanks, Dan

Summary: Although I did not physically stay at this property I did use its drive up valet service and FedEx office to mail some packages home. There courtesy respect and attention to detail was simply outstanding. Just steps away from the convention center and Disneyland it is a wonderful property!
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. Customer service is our number one priority here at the hotel to ensure your experience is stellar.  If you are a Marriott Rewards member and book online with us, you can get free wifi in your room, and other perks! We hope that next time you come and stay with us! (Did you see the pool!)  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Comparatively pricey, but a solid experience
Summary: I traveled here on business for a conference at the convention center. At the time, it was slightly less expensive than the competing Hilton across the way. We drove down, arriving late at night. Check-in was fast and easy, and the counter person was super helpful and upgraded us to a great room with a balcony overlooking California Adventure Land. Hint: If you can get one of the handicapped accessible rooms, they are bigger and roomier and this one had the balcony! Room was spacious and clean, in-room coffee was good. We used the valet parking for only 4 dollars more per night and this was worth it. Parking fees even with the valet were under 30 dollars a night, 25 cheaper than when I stayed last in a Marriott in San Francisco. Dining options were preprinted on the map they
Manager Response: Thanks for your review.  We have many options and if you are a Marriott Reward member and book online you can get free wifi for the duration of your stay. A nice bonus when at a conference! We hope to see you again soon.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Marriott reward members beware. Staying for the weekend to visit Disneyland, we are appreciative to have been upgraded io have the additional space for our family their Hospitality Suites should not be used as a room especially for a family. The Murphy bed and sofa beds were terribly uncomfortable as were the pillows. The bathroom was too small for a family and needs upgrading.  This Marriott caters to the convention clientele and this is a suite used to entertain. There are better hotels close to Disneyland that would be better for families.  The pool area was nice but we did not use it. The exercise area was well equipped. Housekeeping did a great job even thou we hung out the "do not disturb" sign out so that we would not get housekeeping (which works well at every other
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am surprised to hear that our hospitality suite did not accommodate you in the manner you had hoped. We will take note of your feedback.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: The Anaheim Marriott is a nice average Marriott hotel within walking distance of a variety of restaurants and Disneyland.  The hotel is steps from the convention center and directly faces the Hilton hotel.  It is also within walking distance to several convenience stores so renting a car may not be absolutely necessary. Great location for both business and leisure/family travelers.  They also have 'Disneyland' ticket desks in the lobby and a shuttle that runs to and from the hotel to Disney.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! We also have some great amenities here at the hotel, including many dining options. Yes there's a Starbucks and Pizza Hut, but we also have a newly renovated bar + kitchen called nFuse that has seasonal, fresh, and sustainable menu items - something for everyone! We also have talented mixologists and 24 craft brews on tap, so adults can get that SoCal craft brew experience! We hope to have you back soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Best hotel teams turns business into pure pleasure
Summary: From the welcome to the accommodations and fabulous Foodservice this is the hotel to choose when attending a trade show - it is steps away from the convention center but it is the exceptional team that makes you feel very much and home. They care and you call tell!
Manager Response: Hi Sharon, Thanks for your review! Customer service is our #1 priority here at the Anaheim Marriott as we always want to make sure that everything is perfect about your stay with us. Thanks for letting us know, and we hope to see you soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We always choose the Anaheim Marriott when visiting Disneyland.  We've stayed there 4 times in the Spring( May) and loves each stay.  It is close enough to walk to the park (about 15 minutes) but also easily catch the resort transit in front of hotel.  The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are small but very clean and up to date.  The pool is usually quiet and close to empty because the hotel usually has business clients.  We appreciate the quiet atmosphere after the craziness of the Disneyland.  Starbucks in lobby is a blessing!
Manager Response: Hi Tiffany, Thanks for your review and being a loyal guest! We appreciate it and always want to make sure you are having a pleasant stay. We're looking forward to seeing you again on your next trip!  Best, Dan

Summary: I partecipated at one exibition and I stayed here. It is one minute walking from the exibition center, so for that the location is great if like me you have to participate to one show, people also are very kind, but fir the price you pay and the quality of the room is not worthy.
Manager Response: Hi Marco, Thanks for your review and compliment about our staff. We would like to hear more about what might have been less than stellar about your experience in efforts to always be better. Please private message me with the details.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Good for business and close to Disney
Summary: Stayed for business. Rooms nice, beds comfortable and location is very close/actually walking distance to Disney.  Ordered room service - Caesar salad with steak - it was very good but a little on the pricey side, $32.  The hotel also had nice bar and outside restaurant.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! We appreciate the kindness. Also if you're a Marriott Rewards member we give you perks like free in room wifi! We hope to see you on your next business trip.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We stayed here as a convention participant and registrant. About 3,000 people attended. We confirmed our reservations a head of time that we would have two adjoining/connected rooms.   Upon check in Thursday night, no such room available, so we had to take two rooms next to each other but not connected. On Thursday night, after a lot of searching, front desk staff found adjoining rooms to move into on Friday..but on the 1st floor. That was a non-starter. After pushing front desk to look at all the inventory, we were eventually able to check in Friday evening at 8 pm into two rooms on 8th flloor. [posted check in was 4 p.m.] Each "touch" I had with the front desk suggested that they didn't know what the previous staff person did or was going to do for us in finding the correct
Manager Response: Thanks for your detailed review. I'm glad we were able to accommodate your request for adjoining rooms, which is difficult to do when the hotel is completely booked. Our pool is being renovated, but should be open soon! We hope to have you back again!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Me and my kids arrived Thursday the 12th we pulled to Valet first because my car was fully loaded with kids and costumes.  There was one Bellman who was extremelt nice and very helpful when the rest left me standing.  I went in to check in, I requested early check in and I was there about 1:00pm  nothing ready.  The Front desk took my information and said they would call me when rooms ready.  I received a call 2 1/2 hours later to let me know one of the rooms were ready.  I had to go stand in line again to get my room key.  Not Happy :-( While I was getting my key they said other room would be ready soon I requested they bring up key to other room if possible and they did.  no more line  :-)  Happy again.  I did have a wonderful experience in their restaurant.  Great food and
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and feedback. We appreciate the kind words. We recently renovated the entire hotel and have some great new spaces including nFuse, our newly renovated bar + kitchen. It has something for everybody. Our state of the art elevators allow you to go right to your floor without having to stop on other guests floors as well! We hope to have you back.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: The was an amazing Marriott hotel! We stayed 4nights for a Disney vacation, the hotel its self isn't for family's (kids). Its on the same private street as the Anaheim Convention center, so most guest were there for business.  The front desk manger Cesar was great and made the process as smooth as possible.  I left my MacBook in the hotel and didn't realize it until I got to the airport, but Danielle from security found and mailed it out the same night.   The only complaint would be the parking garage! The tickets wouldn't work and a number of us would be trapped in side. It was extremely frustrating. I would gladly stay again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We actually do have a lot of families that come and stay with us year after year. We're walking distance from Disney and have a newly renovated restaurant with many kid friendly items to choose from. Our pool is also currently being renovated and has a nice fire-pit outside for the "chilly" SoCal nights. Something for everyone! We hope to have you back soon.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The facility is really big for a small conference,   The location is perfect, next to Disney and restaurants are with a short walk.   The staff was very friendly - she walked out of the counter to hand me the room keys.   The room is very nice and appears new.   The best part? I paid $139 per night.   The internet is complimentary if you are a member of Marriott Award.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We appreciate the feedback! Our newly renovated hotel also has a great Bar + Kitchen called nFuse that has sustainable seasonal menu items and 24 beers on tap. There's something for everyone! We hope to have you back soon.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Disappointed ~ Pool was closed and a/c did not work room 1718
Summary: I put a lot of thought into this reservation. It was warm so I wanted to make sure we had a hotel with a good pool for my son who is 6 since it has been cold and stormy at home. I took my little  one swimsuit shopping and to get some small pool toys so he could play while his sister sat outside next to the pool and worked on her mid-terms.  I wanted a clean comfortable room with room service and concierge. I am a Marriott Gold member and have stayed here before. I  arrived in the evening and was checked in by a very friendly man I noticed a note at the check in that the pool was closed for refurbishment. He said I could walk over to the Hilton and use the pool. If I wanted to use the Hilton pool I would have stayed there since it is too much of a hassle to take my little one who
Manager Response: Hi Tululaah, I'm sorry to hear you had a less than stellar experience at our hotel. Could you please private message me with your full name and dates you stayed so that we can do some research on our end? Also if you could provide your rewards number that might help too.   Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Close to Disney and Convention Center
Summary: We stayed at the Marriott for a work related event.  Majority of work events were located with in the Convention Center, which was a 5 minute or less walk.  The Marriott was also a 7-10 min walk to Disney.  Food restaurants like, Morton's are on the corner.  About 5 blocks away, or a 7-10 min walk in the garden walk, there are additional options like Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs and Bubba Gump.  Inside the Marriott is nFuse which has good and live bands in the evenings.  Great location and family friendly for less cost than on site Disney accommodations!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review!  yes, we have our newly renovated bar and kitchen called nFuse that has seasonal and sustainable offerings, and 24 craft beers on tap! We also have a Pizza Hut and a Starbucks in the building for more on the go options. Thanks for staying with us, and we hope to have you back soon!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Amazing staff at this hotel and good location for the parks
Summary: My family just spent a three day weekend at this hotel to celebrate my twins 3rd birthday! We arrived early friday morning after reserving the rooms on hotels.com.  We were able to check in early and our request for adjoining rooms was honored.  Everyone greeted my daugthers by name and wished them a happy birthday eveywhere we went.   We left the hotel to walk to downtown disney- this is a little far to walk with very young children.  We were told that it should be about a 15 minute walk but I think it took about 30 minutes with the girls. They have shuttles for $5.00 a day or you can walk across the street to the disney parking and take the Toy Story bus for free to the parks. Or even a taxi cost about $7-$9 to get to the parks. We ate at two restaurants at downtown Disney and
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review! I'm glad you enjoyed your stay with us and that your twins had a special birthday celebration! We pride ourselves on best in class customer service, so I'm happy to hear your appreciation. We also have a newly renovated nFuse restaurant with lots of options for the family, a Pizza Hut, and a Starbucks within the hotel. -Lots to choose from! We hope you come and stay with us again.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: This hotel was clean and the staff was very nice. Close to Disneyland / California Adventure and Downtown Disney. A great alternative if you need to save a little off of the local resorts. Stayed in a city view room (14th floor), view was just OK. The in room wi-fi fee was waved because I am a Marriott rewards member, other wise $13. Parking fees are $24 (self park) and $28 (valet) which is common for hotels these days although it doesn't make it right. The advertised rate of $159 turned into $215 overnight.
Manager Response: Hi Robert, Thanks for your review.  I'm glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you return to enjoy many of our newly renovated amenities such as our pool with fire pits, and nFuse Bar + Kitchen with 24 craft brews on tap! There's something for everyone!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We found the Anaheim Marriott to be a good location for Disney, The Pond for a Hockey game, access to freeway, and multiple restaurants that cater to everyones budget. We found the food to be excellent in the hotel and enjoyed our stay there.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! We appreciate the kind words. We just went through a huge renovation that included our bar/restaurant area called nFuse. There's a new menu with California cuisine sourced locally with a seasonal menu! Also there's 24 craft beers on tap in the bar!  Feel free to come back at any time. Thanks for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: Hotel looks like it was just renovated. We however had a horrible room with and old bathroom and an archaic safe. Staff were just ok! No one at the front door to greet us. There is a pool (outdoor)and starbucks which is good... as the in room coffee was terrible. sleep quality just average. im sure better options around for the price. Had a cold feel.  The breakfast was again just average. Had a buffet or a la carte. choose a la carte buffet isnt great.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We did just go through a 13mm renovation to the entire hotel and are still finishing up some odds and ends, like the points you mentioned. It's been a long process but we hope to be complete with all details soon. Thanks for staying with us!  Best, Dan

Summary: Beautiful property with a great look and feel. Excellent and very helpful staff. Has pre-programmed elevators that are very efficient but take a little getting used to. Fitness center is fantastic.  Free weights, multiple body part machines, cable machine, leg press, lots of cardio machines, etc.
Manager Response: Hi Rich, Thanks for your positive review. We appreciate the kind words. These elevators with the innovative technology are different, but are designed so guests don't have to stop on every floor. We think that's pretty cool! Hope you stay with us again!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Fantastic Stay, Compassionate and Caring Hotel Staff
Summary: Ok first off let me say the outside of this hotel is kinda of "meh", but the inside is very nice.  The rooms are very comfortable, updated, clean, and have great views.  I stayed in the Oasis Tower (recommended).  The first night was great and I slept fantastic.  The next morning I found a note that some creepy guest had slid under my door.  Later that morning I spoke with the front desk staff person and informed him of this situation.  He told me that he would get me a new room because that was unacceptable.  I told him that was great, but I really, really liked my room and it was hard to pass it up.  Aaron told me that he would find me something just as good.  Boy did he ever!  Aaron worked tirelessly to find me an equally fantastic room!  The rest of my stay was awesome and
Manager Response: Thanks for your ind review! I will let Aaron's manager know about how pleased you were with his service. It is important to us that everyone has an exceptional time here with us, and we're glad you did! Thanks for staying with us, and we hope to see you again. Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great stay for business and vacation, hotel is ongoing a complete make-over
Summary: The hotel is directly across the Anaheim conference center and a few minutes away from Disneyland / Downtown Disney. I had a room on the upper floor, with a balcony and facing the "Hilton" across street, but also (behind the Hilton) the Disneyland, so the fireworks display was wonderful to watch from the hotel room. The room was freshly renovated, very clean, comfort bed, fast internet connection, etc. and clean and updated bathroom. The service in the hotel was amazing, from the bellman to the receptionist. With the close distance to the parks and convention centers it is an excellent hotel to stay in the Anaheim area.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and notes about our newly renovated rooms! We are just finishing up a 13mm renovation to the whole hotel, that we put a lot of effort into. I'm glad you enjoyed it!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: it's just few step from Anaheim Convention Center and it's perfect for business travelers who will attend some events at Anaheim Convention Center, sleep quality is very good, room is very clean just as Marriott's standard, staff were friendly, vending machines are OK with reasonable retail prices. However hotel rate is a bit expensive, dinning options are very limited and disappointing, in-room TV is not very content rich but I could say it's family friendly but it's business traveler oriented hotel so TV content should have some updates, then they really should offer free internet as it's not a cheap hotel and business travelers really need internet. Overall, I do recommend this hotel for people who will attend events at Anaheim Convention Center, hunt for good deals before
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, and pointers. I will take that to the team. We are now offering free in room wifi to all Marriott Rewards members who book their stay online.  -Something to note for future stays with us should you decide to come back. We hope you do!  Best, Dan

Summary: I stayed at the Marriott during the NAMM show which is a trade event at the convention center next door. Despite being fully booked, one day before I was due to check in, I requested a King bed room, corner of the building with a balcony (not all rooms come with a balcony) and a high up floor. Upon checking in, fresh amuse-bouche pastries were placed at the reception which were delicious and I was pleasantly pleased to find out all my requests and needs would be met. The room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfy. There was a great selection of TV channels, a lovely working desk in the room and ample closet space. There is a ice machine on each floor (I believe) and there was an ice bucket in my room with 4 nice glasses (2 in bathroom and 2 near coffee machine). There
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review! Yes, NAMM was a full house, and we put in extra bar areas to accommodate the crowd. The pool is the last on the list of a huge 13mm renovation that we are really excited about! I'm glad you enjoyed all of our amenities. If you stay with us again I'm sure the pool will be finished!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We stayed at the Marriott Anaheim for a week in December. Hotel had a mix of family/tourists and business guests. The hotel was running smoothly and staff was helpful and professional. Our room was clean and well maintained throughout our stay. It is about 15 minutes walk from Disneyland and we walked there and back every day, even though shuttle bus was available. The walk is easy even if you spend all day walking around Disneyland. There are many restaurants near by, walking distance, so the lack of a hotel restaurant was not a problem. Free WiFi in the hotel lobby, but there is a charge if you want to use it in the rooms. The service over all in the hotel was great and we will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and for pointing out that it's an easy walk to Disneyland from the hotel. Something overlooked by many, but a huge convenience. I'm glad you liked your room as well. Thanks for staying with us!  Best, Dan

Summary: We stayed for a week over Thanksgiving because my daughter was in a character pageant.  We were really impressed that we were greeted so nicely by the front desk and given a way early check in with NO problem.  The wifi was complimentary with my rewards.  The lobby is huge and the bar area is newly renovated and really nice.  The pool area reminded me of a jungle, beautiful with glass all around the perimeter and a hot tub.  There are towels everywhere and plenty of seating.  Another nice feature was the outdoor couches and seating area with multiple gas log fire pits to lounge at.  Our room was spacious and beds comfy with a balcony.  I had read reviews saying the hotel was being renovated and how it would bother you but I saw none of that when we were there. The upgrades are
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review! We appreciate the kind words as we put a lot of thought and effort into our renovation. We pride ourselves on customer service too, so that pleases me to say that you encountered great employees and felt safe. Thanks for staying with us!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Disney Star Wars Run hotel stay
Summary: We stayed at the Marriott for 8 days whilst we visited Los Angeles and Disneyland area. The hotel is located in the convention area of Anaheim and a short (20 min walk) from Disneyland. Near to the hotel is Anaheim GardenWalk with various restaurants and a cinema.  From the moment we arrived at the hotel the service was excellent,we asked for a quiet room as we have several early (3am) starts while we completed the running events at Disneyland and Adrian who checked us in managed to accommodate our needs perfectly, even though he said he was new at this. The room was very clean and comfortable and the housekeeping staff were fantastic even cleaning our room in the evenings when we had left the "Privacy please" on the door.  The food in the restaurant was very good and well
Manager Response: Thank you so much for review. Yes, we are offering a lot of new deals for Marriott Rewards members, including parking and wifi! We would love to have you back at any time.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: What every Marriott should strive to be
Summary: We stayed at Marriott Anaheim to attend a wedding reception at the hotel.  We have stayed at other Marriott hotels before but this was one of the best.  The best part was the staff.  Without exception, everyone from the valet staff to the front desk to the housecleaning staff were great.  When we booked the hotel I booked the AAA rate not realizing that there was a special rate for people attending the wedding reception.  At the time I checked-in I asked if we could get the wedding party rate.  They did one better and gave me an even better deal they had for the weekend.  The house cleaning staff was prompt in attending to our needs.  I can't say enough about the staff.  The rooms were spacious and clean.  The beds were not too soft or too firm. The location is great.  There are
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. We pride ourselves on customer service, so it's nice to hear our efforts are appreciated. Good to know about the coffee in the room. Thanks for the heads up.  Best, Dan

Summary: This is a very nice hotel! Rooms are very clean and comfortable! It is very upscale! However, parking is $24.00 per day and Internet is $12.95 per day! None of this is included in the room rate! We enjoyed our stay here but would not stay here again because of the extra charges .
Manager Response: Hi Tammy, Thanks for your review. We are going to be rolling out some great perks for Marriott Rewards members this year including free wifi! If you aren't currently a member, it's really easy. Just go to www.marriott.com and fill out the form - it's free! Also, if you stay in touch with us on social we will be announcing the perks as they roll out. Thanks again for staying with us and hope this helps you come back!  Best, Dan

Summary: We went here for our Disneyland vacation.  We have stayed at the Hilton across the street before but wanted to try the marriott since they where both the same price. Front desk was nice. Got in our room. Nice and clean. That's all we care about when we stay places is clean. Every time we called for something they got it there right away. The only thing is wish they had a fridge and a digital safe and that parking wasn't so expensive. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We appreciate it! It's nice to hear about the good service as well, because we take that very seriously around here! Would love to have you back at any time.   Thanks, Dan

Summary: I only stayed here for one night and booked a room solely for the beds and easy access to the Disney parks. I arrived around 2:30pm to see if I could check in early - Adrian was at the front desk when I got there and was by far one of the best employees I've ever come across at any hotel. I was telling him about how I have an annual pass to Disneyland so it sucked to have to pay $24 just for parking when I only live about half an hour away... without even asking, he then gave me complimentary parking for the night and was very personable and easy to have a conversation with. That is exactly what good guest service is, thank you for your time and help!!  The room was average - nothing better than my room at the Courtyard down the street I had a couple of months ago. The sink
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and the compliment about Adrian! We will let her manager know. Thanks for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: There was a group of 8 of us attending a conference at the Hilton across the street.  So we pretty much just came to our rooms to sleep.  The hotel is beautiful as were our rooms.  The rooms were kept clean and are beautiful as well.  The bathrooms were clean, but a bit outdated... sink for us  5' gals was low so cant imagine how the men in our group felt as they are all much taller than us! hey have a fancy elevator, so make sure you don't accidentally type in the wrong floor as one of our group members did, we didn't realize it until we got off on the wrong floor :)  The person who booked our rooms had asked for early check in and we were told that it would not be a problem, however somehow our reservation got booked under someone else's name.  The front desk helped us get
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review! We pride ourselves on customer service so I really appreciate hearing about our great staff!  We are just finishing up a huge renovation, and the bathrooms are the last to get completed. Hopefully we can have you back again soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We did have some issues with our reservation which was fixed, however it was a bit inconvenient as it made me late for the opening session for the conference I was there to attend.  Was not impressed with the Starbucks in the hotel, long lines, slow service and horrible coffee.    The hotel itself is beautiful, my favorite place was the lobby.  The rooms are nice and clean and the bathrooms, although a bit dated and small are clean as well.  Biggest downfall for me was no free wifi.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are just about to complete our huge 11mm renovation to the hotel including the rooms. The bathrooms are the last to get done. We would love to have you back any time. Also, we will be rolling out new perks for Marriott Rewards members this year, including free wifi. If you aren't currently a member, please go to www.marriott.com and fill out the membership which is free!   Thanks, Dan

Summary: The lobby entrance and restaurant modern and chic. We stayed there for 3 day weekend for my 15 year old daughter who wants to spend her bday at Disneyland. We had 2 double beds. The room is clean but bathroom needs serious updating. Bathtub and bath fixture old and outdated. Has seen its time. Sliding door that leads to balcony gets stuck and hardware is old too. Otherwise, if these are updated, it would be much pleasing. However, wait staff at Nfuse restaurant was super nice and friendly . We told her that we were there for my daughters bday and she came back and gave her a Disney frozen backpack and gave her a complimentary breakfast, My daughter felt so special and so ecstatic  and for that we very impressed with the staff. Breakfast everyday was delish!!! Don't mind paying
Manager Response: Thanks for the review and the suggestions.  We are just finishing up a huge renovation on the whole hotel, including the rooms. There are a few touches here and there that we still have yet to complete including the bathrooms.  Next time you come back it will be complete!  Thanks for the kind words about our staff as well. We pride ourselves on our customer service.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: The Anaheim Marriott is a phenomenal hotel. It is located directly next to the convention center, and pretty close to Disneyland. Our room was fantastic. It was clean and comfortable with a great view. We got a good deal on Priceline that had us paying nearly the same for the surrounding 2 & 3 star hotels.   I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disneyland. Will most likely stay here again in August when we visit for the D23 convention.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We just completed an 11mm renovation which included the full lobby, restaurant and bar, pool area and the rooms! We would love to have you back again anytime!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We weren't  actually staying at Marriott Anaheim we were booked at Anaheim Marriott suites after a long flight from NZ with our kids and despite showing our shuttle driver the correct address he dropped us at the Marriott on convention way a mile from our hotel. Danielle on lobby duty  14/2/2015 at about 5pm was an absolute star she took one look at our hotel voucher ascertained we hadn't come by car apologised profusely for the mix up which was not her or her organisations fault and called a  complimentary cab to transfer us to our correct hotel. NOW THAT IS CUSTOMER SERVICE! I cannot thank her and her organisation enough she certainly deserves recognition by her organisation for her actions.We went on to have a great stay at Anaheim Marriott suites too.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and kind words about Danielle. Customer service is number 1 here at our hotel and we pride ourselves on making your travel as comfortable as possible. We hope next time you can stay with us!   Best, Dan

Summary: I stayed with my youngest daughter at this hotel to have easy access to disney land and adventure land.    It's nice to see a heated pull and this was enjoyable.   The rooms were very clean and comfortable beds.   Breakfast Bar was expensive in my opinion for light to medium eaters.   Nice having a good Starbucks and ample eating options in the hotel and close by.  The renovated restaurant and bar is new.  Love the modern elavator - very fast.   Overall, I would stay again and venture out to some of the local restaurants close by.
Manager Response: thanks for your kind review! We have many food options in the hotel including Starbucks, Pizza Hut, and our newly renovated nFuse bar and kitchen. We would love to have you back any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Wish I could give it 6 stars!!!
Summary: Really easy to get to from LAX with Disneyland Resort Express bus.  Such friendly, informative and awesome staff.  Easily walkable to Disneyland.  Short cab ride to some great outlet shopping.  Room big, bed comfy.  The restaurant - what can I say - the bar and restaurant far exceeded our expectations.  Usually steer clear of hotel restaurants but this one blew all my preconceptions out of the water.  Breakfast was top notch.  Cocktails out of this world.  Awesome selection of local craft beers.  Bar snacks and dinner brilliant.  Can't recommend it enough.
Manager Response: Thanks for the positive review!  We just relaunched our bar and kitchen area, and have 25 craft beers, and a bourbon program with hard to find choices. All our items on the menu are fresh and seasonal as well. We welcome you back any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Conveniently located for Disneyland visit, pretty good hotel too
Summary: About 15 minute away from Disneyland on foot and with Disney shuttle available at entrance too,  Marriott Anaheim can be dubbed as a Disneyland hotel! This hotel is located next to Anaheim Convention Center. Fairly old but well maintained hotel. The tower close to Convention Center has rennovated rooms. Rooms are adequate sized if not big. Asked for high floor and room had a part Disney view- my kid couldn't ask for more! Room and bathroom amenities standard, 2 comfy queen beds, linen fresh and clean, pillows okay.  Breakfast is little pricey (have options of buffet and couple of set though). Good thing they have a Starbucks and a Pizza Hut besides a proper restaurant (cum bar)!
