Many good eateries on Harbor boulevard within walking distance (Ihop, Tony Roma's and many more).
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind review!  Our restaurant is also open all day long, so you can come in after Disney and relax with one of our 24 craft beers (or a mocktail!) and some delicious appetizers. We welcome you back at any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: The moment you enter "You Know". Its like a bride picking their reception venue. A very warm welcome. Staff are incredibly  friendly.  Rooms were very clean , comfortable, and has plenty of space. The bar is situated at the entrance with many tables and relaxing chairs. This was always great for a gathering or talking business.The bar was accommodated with a  great snack menu. Overall - a relaxed comfortable feeling.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review! We put a lot of thought into our renovation. The design style we were going for is comfortably modern, trying to evoke pure southern California charm. It's great to hear that you like it and felt at home with us. Thanks for staying at the Anaheim Marriott, and we hope you return soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Great stay. We arrived, I think 2-3 hours early before check in, and didn't really have anywhere to go or anything to do so we stopped in to see if our room, or any rooms were ready. If not, it wouldn't be a big deal but just thought we'd check. So upon checking for room availability, they said they were able to get us into our room early at no extra charge. Not only that, but when I booked the room I requested three things; corner room, king bed, and highest floor possible. So when he told us we had a king room, I was very happy. Then as we went to our room, we discovered it was the highest floor in the building! Then when we got into our, we had a corner room with a balcony even, with a great view of Disney California Adventure, The Convention Center, Catalina Island, San
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, and I'm glad you enjoyed your stay with us. You're welcome back any time!  Best, Dan

Summary: When we arrived we were informed we had been upgraded to a suite due to the fact that my son in law is Military. The staff couldn't have been friendlier & the accommodations were first class. Highly recommended. We were in town for The Marine Corp All American Bowl & although the city was busy once you got on the hotel grounds you felt as if you were transformed to a tranquil resort
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. Customer service is our #1 priority! And thanks to your son in law for his service!  Sincerely, Dan

Summary: We stayed at Anaheim Marriott for a post-Christmas visit to Disneyland.  Hotel was very busy with lots of families visiting Disneyland and the hotel staff handled it very well.  I want to especially call out the staff working the concierge lounge.  First of all, they kept it open during holidays when many Marriott hotels close the lounge for holidays, they were very friendly and handled the crowd and kids extremely well.  The nightly “appetizers” were so good that we ended up skipping dinner for two of the nights.  Hotel room was standard Marriott, clean bathroom, comfy beds and reliable WIFI.  Hotel is 15 to 20 minute walk to Disneyland entrance so you don’t really need a car while staying there and visiting Disneyland.  I highly recommend this hotel for visiting Disneyland if
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We are excited about the many changes of our renovation including the innovative elevator system! It speeds up the process to get to your room so you aren't stopping on each floor! We hope to have you back again next time you visit Disney, or the Anaheim area. There's lots to do here! We change the menu with the seasons so there's always something different to try. Thanks for staying with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel before for another conference a few years ago. They say they're undergoing an upgrade and it's time. Everything in the room is in fine working order, but it feels dated from the low bathroom sink to the old shower fixture (again, they all work fine, but don't feel current). The elevators have been updated to a hi-tech system where you enter your room number in a keypad and it tells you which one to use. It works well, but feels a little weird that you can't enter a floor number once you're in (you do that before you get on).  The lobby is nice and the fitness center is also nice. One pet peeve in the fitness center, not just here but most hotels, is that there is no TV channel list in the room. You have to scroll endlessly until you find the channel you
Manager Response: Alan, Thank you for your detailed review. We are almost finished with our renovation, including the rooms in the hotel, which has been the last piece to get fully completed. Regarding the wifi, we are working to fix this and we will also be offering completely free wifi to all Marriott Reward members coming soon! Please stay connected with us on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to learn about the new perks coming for members this year. Thank you for staying with us, and we hope to have you back soon.  Best, Dan

Summary: The staff here goes out of their way to be helpful. We ordered a roll-away bed, which, by the way, is the best deal at the hotel (free), and it was delivered to our room within minutes. The beds are only doubles, but queens would be too much for the smaller room size. The room was very clean, but the sliding glass door leading out to the balcony was in disrepair as the handle was coming off and I had to force the door open and closed as it wanted to come off the track. I am certain the sliders in most if not all the rooms need updating or replacing.   Also, when I made my reservation, I was told it would be worth an extra $20.00 for a view facing towards the city and mountains--save your money, it is not worth it, and there was probably more traffic noise than facing toward the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are almost finished with our multi-million dollar renovation, including all the guestrooms. If something isn't working in your room please always contact us as we can work to fix things immediately for you. Customer service is our #1 priority! Thanks for staying with us. You're welcome back any time.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Stayed 2 nights and wanted to stay for more. Newly renovated rooms and lobby. Easy access to Disney and fine dining at night. Parking was waived because of a small misunderstanding. Sleep quality is high, what else can you ask for!
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. I'm glad you had a great stay with us, and to hear that we took care of any misunderstanding as customer service is our #1 priority. We welcome you back at anytime!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Decent location, better price than a room another block closer to Disney, larger beds would be nice.  Stayed here for a quick Disney trip over the break.  They allow 5 people in a room with an extra bed which is nice for the price we paid.  The rooms however have double beds which makes sleeping a bit tight.  Other than that, it's a clean, run of the mill hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. Yes, while we absolutely allow 5 to a room with extra bed, we don't encourage it for the maximum comfort level. But we understand and can accommodate your needs. We hope you choose us again for your next Disney trip!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel right next to Convention Center
Summary: Location, location, location... Perfect location right next to the Anaheim Convention Center.  Hotel is beautiful. It has a restaurant that has very good food but bit pricey as with any major hotel brand.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review! Yes, we just relaunched our restaurant and have revamped the menu a bit. We're focusing on local sustainable ingredients that are fresh and seasonal! There are additional options in the hotel such as the Starbucks and Pizza Hut for the family. We hope you come and stay with us again!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great service, but room smaller than expectations
Summary: In the hotels defense we on this occasion did not opt for a upgraded room. The standard room was nice, but much smaller than we expected from a Mariott.  The service was excellent though, and the location is great!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! Yes our upgraded rooms have more room to spread out. Definitely consider it if you like more space. Otherwise, I'm glad you enjoyed your visit with us. Thanks for the positive notes on our customer service as we pride ourselves on that!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Great location - close to Disneyland and the Anaheim convention center. There are lots of chain restaurants nearby. Having a Starbucks the building definitely deserves 1 star. The service is top notch. The restaurant there was pretty good with a modern menu. My only complaint is that the rooms are small and a bit worn out. You can see grime in the bathrooms. There are no towel bars or racks for hand towels or bath towels. It's an easy thing to install but convenient for the guest. The little things are what this hotel is missing that other high end chains offer.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review.  We're just completing a major renovation and the rooms still need to be completed. We hope to be finished by the end of January. Thanks for staying with us!  Best, Dan

Summary: easy walk with children to disneyland .Friendly and helpful staff. clean tidy rooms ,good beds & heating . lots to choose from to eat near by. older style hotel complex . parking on site if required . car hire on site and a block away option . washing drying option onsite. pizza hut out let on site .
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and for staying with us! We hope that you come back and visit us again!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: FANTASTIC STAY FOR A DISNEY VACATION
Summary: We took our trip during the Christmas/New Year time so everything around Disneyland was understandably BUSY!    My son timed the walk from Disneyland to the hotel.  From the security checkpoint at Disneyland to the Marriott Anaheim it was a 25 minute walk (down Harbor Blvd).  That was with 2 adults and a 14 and 10 year old.    Upon arrival I thought the hotel was very upscale, fancy.  Easy access from the main street to the hotel round about entrance.  Hotel staff member greets you upon arrival.  Check in was fast and easy.  Adrian at the front desk was very helpful.  I wanted to get a luggage cart, but was informed that only the bell hops use those so I could wait for them to load my luggage and deliver to my room or carry the luggage up ourselves, we opted to carry everything
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. I'm happy to hear you enjoyed your visit and that we provided the best service possible. While we currently charge for wi-fi in the rooms, it is free in the lobby. Also, we will be starting a new policy that wifi will be free in the rooms for Marriott Rewards members. If you aren't currently a member, you can get it free on our Marriott website. Our social media is a great way to stay in touch with all the new perks we will be announcing this year. We hope this will entice you to come back and stay with us again!  Best, Dan

Summary: All,  I just returned from my first Disneyland vacation with my very pregnant wife, very excited 7-year old and very active 4-year old.  Marriott made the stay perfect, and for our purposes, I'm so glad we chose this particular hotel (over hilton, doubletree, fairfield, sheraton) and even over the 'onsite' properties (none of which are really 'onsite' except for one of them).  We spent 4-nights and 5-days with the sole focus of getting Disney out of my kids system, and I think it worked.  The hotel lobby is beautiful and active--that starbucks is a LIFE SAVER (and a $$ saver over room service) and NFuse is high quality food at not SO expensive prices.  The only thing that is a bit dated are the rooms themselves--we stayed in the main tower, which was super convenient with the
Manager Response: Thanks for your detailed review. Yes, we are just completing an 11mm renovation of the entire hotel, and the rooms are the last part to get finished. We hope to be fully done by the end of this month. I'm also glad to hear about our customer service with your keys, as that focus #1 here at Anaheim Marriott. Thanks again for staying with us!  Happy New Year, Dan

Summary: Front desk superb, helpful.  Hotel lobby remodeled and looks really really good.  New high tech elevators I love.  No buttons inside the elevator.  They are quick and accurate.  Rooms partially remodeled.  New carpet and headboards show how outdated bathrooms were.  Rooms size ok, bathrooms way to small.  Bathtubs need to be removed.  Seriously old. Toilet pressure awful, backs up with a small piece of paper.  Rooms were remodeled with a small chair in the corner.  Sorta weird considering their is more room in that corner and nowhere else for guests to sit down.  Sofa would not fit but a extended layout chair would work better.  Decorators poor planning.  Lounge was really nice with good breakfast and evening food.  Great views.  Nice and attentive attendants.  Good bus service
Manager Response: Thanks for your review.  The rooms are still being renovated, and there are some makeshift furniture during the process, for example the chair.  It's been a long process, and we hope to be fully complete by the end of this month for the rooms. The lobby, pool area, and restaurant are all complete! I'm glad to hear we took care of the problem, as customer service comes first for us! Would love to have you back any time.  Happy New Year! Dan

Summary: If you don't mind paying $24 a day for self parking, this hotel is stunning. Sign up for a Marriott Rewards number and download the app. Mobile check-in is great. The room was spacious and clean. The beds were a little higher than I'm used to, but they were plush. I requested extra towels through the app, and they were there. They served hot chocolate and apple cider in the lobby, which was a hit with the kids. The elevators were fun. You type in your floor on the keypad, and you are pointed to an elevator. The kids loved that. Staff was so friendly. It's close to Disneyland and adjacent to the convention center. If I can find a deal again, I would definitely stay.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review, and I'm glad you had a great stay. Yes, we are now offering mobile check in, and in the upcoming months we will be offering additional perks like free wi-fi for Marriott Rewards members. Stay tuned on our social media for the announcements! Thanks again, and you're welcome back at any time.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: One of the nicer Marriott Hotels you will find
Summary: I have stayed at the Anaheim Marriott more than 15 times over the years.  It is conveniently located (about 15 minutes) from John Wayne airport (it is about 45 minutes from LAX depending on traffic).  There is also an attached ramp garage that offers ample parking.  The hotel is right across the street from the convention center and a very short walk to Disneyland.  There are also many restaurants near by.  Since my last visit, the hotel has done a major renovation (some of it still in progress as of 11/14), it is contemporary and very nice - perhaps the nicest Marriott property I have been to in quite a while).  In addition, the staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful - in many regards this would seem like a flagship property for a full-service Marriott property.   Since it
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review! Our lobby area renovation is complete and is open for service! We've changed some of the menu to keep with an artisanal seasonal fare, but have kept some of the favorites as well. We have 24 craft beers on tap in the social lounge and a great mixologist as well! There's plenty of places to watch the game, or connect with people, or even get some work done. We've almost completely renovated the rooms as well, and hope to be finished by January. It's been a major undertaking and we appreciate your patience during the process. Thanks for staying with us, and you're welcome back any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Adequate, but not a normal full service Marriott experience
Summary: Our stay at this hotel close to Disneyland, was just okay, but nowhere near my typical experience at Marriott hotels (where I am a platinum elite member and stay close to 100 nights per year).  Room - couldn't get an upgrade, but got a corner room on a high floor.  Room was very small with a tiny bathroom.  Not what you'd expect in a Marriott.  A/C vents were incredibly dirty - couldn't stand to look at them.  Security pin on balcony sliding door was broken. A/C was inconsistent in controlling room temp. Gap around door was so large, light from the hallway kept me awake.   Service - room cleaner did not replace some towels that she removed, did not replace some of the shower soaps, etc.  Room was still not made up when we returned to it at 4:00 PM.   Concierge Lounge - posting
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed honest review. I'd like to check into this more. Could you please private message me here with your name and nights you stayed?  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Heather at the front desk was fantastic!  My boyfriend and i had a very last minute trip to disneyland and we booked the hotel on the wrong dates by accident. Traveling from the bay area we were exhausted and just wanted a place to sleep. When we arrived (3am) we were welcomed by Heather. My boyfriend explained to her our situation and she was very accommodating with us being stressed and exhausted.  She definitely made our trip that much better.
Manager Response: I'm glad we were able to help. Customer service is priority #1 for us at Anaheim Marriott. We would love to have you back any time!  Best, Dan

Summary: first of all they charge 24.00 a day to self park as a hotel guest. then they charge 12.95 a day for Wi-Fi. you can go to mcdonalds and get free Wi-Fi. by the time we were done after 3 nights we had an additional 200.00 total extra miscellaneous charges. just not right. then our room overlooked the pool and the first night there was really loud music and festivities coming from the pool area that lasted pretty late.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are pleased to announce some changes with regard to that in the new year. There will be free wi-fi for all Marriott Rewards members in January, as well as some additional perks that we will begin to announce on our social media pages in the new year.   Have a Happy Holiday!  Dan

Summary Heading: Everything a Marriott should be only bigger!
Summary: The staff are good, hotel is great but so the building is so large it requires some time to familiarise your self to the property. No complaints from me. Perhaps a suggestion for more sitting areas outside so us northerners can enjoy the warm weather.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind review and recommendation, as we love hearing suggestions from our visitors. Although we just went through an 11mm renovation, we always want to hear your thoughts. We haven't completed the outdoor area yet, so your suggestion is in good timing. I would love to have you back at any time. There will be even more perks for Marriott Rewards members in 2015 as well!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: The hotel is large beautiful.  Clean and friendly staff. Having a Starbucks on property is a bonus for us coffee lovers.  My room was large and inviting.  Having a entertainment area in my room was great when family stopped my. Extra seating with a couch and chairs. The bathroom was a little small. OK for me. It had a Murphy bed. Not the best, Ok for a few nights. I would stay there again. Great location for Disney.
Manager Response: Joseph, Thanks for your positive review! We appreciate it and would love to have you back. As of January, our hotel will be finished with the renovation, and will have additional perks for Marriott Rewards members in 2015. We look forward to having you back at any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We stayed in this hotel for a night about a month ago.  The price was right for the services it provided.  The rooms were clean and there was a nice selection of breakfast items between the Starbucks within the Hotel and their own cafe. The lady at the service desk was outstanding.  She treated my kids to some balloons and coloring items upon check in.  She also found us a better room with views of the Disneyland Fireworks show.  I wouldn't rate the hotel a 4 star though.  It was definitely upper 3 star, but not enough elegance to get the 4th star from me.  The rooms were pretty standard business class.  There were only two negatives at this hotel.  The first, Parking is very expensive.  $24 to self park or $28 to Valet park. You don't even pay that much at a Disney Hotel for
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. We appreciate you staying with us! As of January our hotel will be completely finished with its renovation, including the rooms! There will also be more perks if you are a Marriott Rewards member in 2015. I am looking forward to having you back with us again.  Happy Holidays, Dan

Summary: I have stayed at this conference/resort hotel on several occasions.  Every time has been a delight with upgraded facilities, excellent restaurants and some of the very best elevators!  Staff is always friendly and accommodating to my room requests.  Top marks – thank you.
Manager Response: Thanks for the positive review! Our renovation is now complete, and there will be more perks coming in 2015, so we look forward to having you back to experience everything. If you follow us on our Facebook, Twitter or Instagram handles you will get all the updates as they happen!  Happy Holidays. Dan

Summary: We stayed here for my daughters pageant the week of Thanksgiving, and it was a nice hotel with breakfast and dinner buffet daily.  The rooms were bigger than I thought they would be. My kids are 11 and 13 and there were 4 of us in the room- it was plenty big enough for us.  We took the shuttle to Disneyland and there are many restaurants within walking distance.  The pool is not too deep, but it was still nice place to hang out.  The lobbies and conference rooms are all clean and beautiful.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and for staying with us during the pageant. We posted some pictures of it on social, so check them out!  We pride ourselves on being very accommodating for families and business travelers alike, and would love to have you and yours back any time.   Happy Holidays, Dan

Summary: We stayed here on the first stop of our honeymoon! What a lovely welcome we had and the reception staff so welcoming!  We were put in their renovated tower which had a balcony, lovely to take in the Disney fireworks when sipping a glass of bubbles!   The bed was really comfy and the room very tastefully decorated. When we visited the hotel was going through a renovation so the reception was in the gym area! However the staff were ever so friendly and the guy showed us to our room!   They made our honeymoon very special and added some special touches that really made us feel welcome.   You can walk to the Disney gates within 15 minutes which is a nice walk and to be honest there is no point paying for the local transit as everything is so close!   We didn't dine in the hotel so
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review and for staying with us on your honeymoon! Our renovation is finally complete and we've revamped our menu with lots of seasonal changes to stay local and sustainable. The whole area is revamped with plenty of areas to hang out and socialize, as is the workout room. We would love to have you back for your anniversary! Congratulations on your big day!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: One of the Best Beds Ever
Summary: My wife and I came for the weekend so she could enjoy a day at Disneyland and a weekend in SoCal.  After a stressful morning of driving in the rain to get to Anaheim, we arrived to great customer service and a front desk agent that was kind enough to comp our valet parking for the weekend since it was my wife's birthday.  Rooms are a bit small, but the bed was extremely comfortable. Only wish, is that the Wi-Fi would be free instead of $20/day. Can't compliment the staff enough though.  Everyone was helpful and friendly.  From the doorman to the housekeeper.  Everyone made us feel comfortable.  We will return in the future.  Great job.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review.  We are pleased to announce that we are starting free wi-fi in the new year! You are welcome back any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Excellent facilities for conferences, with superb quality refreshments through-out.  Good Bar, good cafe and a totally fabulous breakfast! Unfortunately, the pool area was being refurbished, but it looks like a nice little haven when operational...
Manager Response: Hi Robin, Thanks for the kind words!  We are pleased to announce that our pool refurbishment is complete as is the bar/social area and we now have many beers on tap. You're welcome back any time to stay with us. Happy Holidays!  Best, Dan

Summary: I was here for a convention, and the location cannot be beat.  The hotel has one restuarant, a little cafe that is open for lunch and breakfast, a Pizza Hut (only open for lunch), and a Starbucks.  The rooms were nice, especailly for a business traveler.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The beds were a little lumpy, though, and the comforters can make you very hot.  The carpet is a little worn, and the maids tended to leave bins by the elevators.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We do have a lot of food options in the hotel, including our newly renovated NFuse restaurant, bar, and social lounge! I welcome you back at any time to stay with us!  Best, Dan

Summary: My wife and I chose to stay at this hotel during our recent Disneyland trip and I couldn't have been more satisfied with the staff and facilities.   We are loyal Marriott guests and have stayed at this hotel many times in the past, both for work and pleasure.  The hotel was nice before, but was nothing compared to how it is now.  The service was impeccable from the time that we arrived at the front curb until we checked out four days later.  The staff never missed a beat, whether we were getting breakfast in the concierge lounge or just passing through the lobby.  The front desk and bell staff even went out of their way to address us by name as we would pass by, and would consistently ask us if there was anything that they could do to make our stay better! We were enjoying
Manager Response: Thank you for your thorough thoughtful review. We appreciate the kind words, as we have put a lot of passion behind this remodel. Customer satisfaction has always been and continues to be paramount.  We also appreciate your loyalty and welcome you back any time!  Thanks, John

Summary: I stayed here for a convention. This hotel is directly adjacent to the Anaheim Conv Center. Which makes it very convenient. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Rooms have been recently renovated as has the lobby, lobby bar and restaurant. All very well done. Room service was also very good. And delivered in less than 45 min the two times I placed orders. The Gym is very good. Plenty of cardio machines, some free weights etc.  This hotel can be very VERY busy during conventions. So - if you're looking to meet and greet people in "your" industry - this is for you. If you want a quiet lobby etc. - You may want to choose a hotel a mile or two away.. Again for conventions.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review. It's great feedback as we've put a lot of heart and soul into this remodel. Our menu is seasonal so there's a good possibility of new items coming if you find yourself back again. We appreciate your business, and welcome you back any time.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Disappointing, not that one would expect too much anyways....
Summary: I stayed at the hotel for one night only during a recent business trip to Anaheim. I have to admit that I did have an extremely hard time choosing the hotel in Anaheim. I don't love huge & identical chain hotels and everything in Anaheim is about Disneyland, with no boutique options...... So finally, I chose Marriott as it had the most convenient location.  Pros: - none  Cons: - the first room was away from the main entrance, but the nearby building had huge & LOUD AC units, so I decided to change it.... The second one was facing the valet parking & was even louder with buses, smoking, etc. - room were dark, not very clean, and rather depressing with extremely low ceilings - TA Certificate of Excellence seems to be a total mistake, the hotel has a nice lobby and that's just it -
Manager Response: We're sorry you had a less than stellar experience at our hotel. We have taken great pride in the 11mm renovation we've just completed, which includes our restaurant with a revamped menu. Most of our menu items are locally sourced, and if you request an all organic meal we would be happy to accommodate you! Customer satisfaction is paramount for us!   Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: A nice hotel for business travelers and families
Summary: This hotel is adjacent to the convention center and within walking distance to Disneyland.  The staff is nice and friendly.  The fitness center is well-above average, and provides earphones if you need them.  The hotel restaurant is recently redone and the kitchen did a good job.  The server and buspersons could use additional training in friendliness and promptness.  At one point an entree was left to sit on a lonely tray stand for 5 minutes after others were served.
Manager Response: Hey, thanks for the review, and for hanging with us while we work out the kinks of our new restaurant. I appreciate the information and will check into it. Would love to have you back!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I have stayed at this Marriot several times before. The space was big enough for the event I was attending (a national pageant). Few things, never go to starbuck hungry or thirsty. This is a small staff with very little sense of urgency. you are at their mercy. have patience. We stayed in a suite (room 320 to be exact). Overall i was impressed with the room, however the room had foul order that seemed to be has been there before Me. Might be from the sink in the kitchen. overall not the best and no the worst experience.
Manager Response: Hi Taccara, Thanks for your thoughtful review. We have many other options for food and beverage in the hotel as well including NFuse, our newly renovated restaurant and social lounge. Some things to consider for next time. We are surprised about the odor in your room. In the future, please feel free to give the front desk a call, and we hope to remedy that situation for you. Customer service is very important to us, as we want you to have the most enjoyable stay possible!  Thanks for staying with us. Best, Dan

Summary: Our family has stayed at this hotel on 2 different occasions for a last minute Disney trip. Great accomodations. Nice lobby restaurant for breakfast buffet. Easy access to Disney by shuttle. The parking garage is a quite a walk to the lobby but not bad. I would definitely recommend staying here. Very clean and very pleasant.
Manager Response: Hey, thanks for bringing your family down and for your positive feedback. We appreciate the support! You're welcome back any time. Have a Happy Holiday!   Thanks, Dan

Summary: I stayed at this hotel while on a conference and it was well suited for this purpose - only a two minute walk from the convention centre. It is a short drive or a long walk to Disney and some of the other theme parks as well, but bear in mind you might be sharing the hotel with hundreds of junior school cheerleaders, quantity surveyors, episcopal preachers, or whatever the conference is that week.  The area is pretty much exclusively devoted to conventions and theme parks, so there are lots of chain restaurants and a few stores around, but you are a long way from other attractions and from seeing the ‘real’ LA – whatever that is (Hollywood, Venice Beach, Santa Monica etc). The hotel itself is clean and comfortable. While I was there they opened a renovated bar area which had
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review. We are proud of our newly re-opened bar and social area. There's a new menu in the restaurant too! Plenty of places to relax, unwind, and be social. Please come back any time and join us again.  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Older property has just finished a major renovation
Summary: The property, while older, has just finished a very attractive upgrade in all public spaces and guest rooms.  The new linens are high class and very comfortable.  The only downside would be the fact that the guest rooms don't have a reading/easy chair, yet.  I was told they hadn't been delivered.  So, the Herman Miller-like desk chair must serve both purposes.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. Yes, those chairs are on order. We hope to get them in shortly. Thanks for the note about the green/conserving water, I will check into that.  thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Awesome craft beer selection in lobby bar
Summary: Stayed for 4 nights recently during a convention.  Remodeled in several ways including a sweet new lobby bar with 20+ craft beers on tap.  Rooms are like new except for the shower tile (?).  The weather was so good I shut off the AC and enjoyed a totally silent sleep.  The bed was fantastic.  The gym is decent but the weather is so good it's better to use all the sidewalks in the area outside.    As a Marriott gold member this is a no-brainer choice for convention stays.  I look forward to returning.  Tip:  Use the SNA orange county airport.  At 3pm it took only 10 minutes to reach by taxi.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive feedback. We are proud of our newly renovated space! Note that we are still finishing the rooms, so the tile might not have been replaced in yours just yet. The new restaurant and social lounge is complete with a new menu, and yes a selection of 24 beers on tap! Thanks again, and we hope to see you back soon.  Best, Dan

Summary: Outstanding service. Staff are stationed in strategic areas to service the guests. FedEx, Starbucks, Pizza Hut, Hertz are all located within the building for your convenience. Large pool and hot tub. The rooms are tiny but one wall is all glass windows and they come with a balcony.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! We pride ourselves on amazing customer service, so this is the kind of feedback I like to see! In addition to the amenities you mentioned, we just re-opened our restaurant with a new menu, and several craft beers on tap! We welcome you back any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We stayed at the Marriott between the 9th-16th of November. On arriving at the hotel, it looks very nice from the outside, into the lobby and straight over to check in. The staff member was very helpful, the room we had booked was free however he told us there was a big convention on the Thursday and our room would be with a load of teenagers on the same floor and asked if we wanted to move - A considerate touch. The room we requested wasn't available on other floors, so we were given two doubles on the 14th floor. The lifts work by simply punching in the floor number you require, it then tells you which lift to use. The view overlooked the Hilton opposite (High enough to see some of the fireworks from Disney), had a balcony and the room had very recently been refurbished. The
Manager Response: Hey thanks for your positive review! We appreciate your kind words! You are welcome back any time!  Best, Dan

Summary: I stayed here while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center next door.  The hotel maintained the high Marriott standards, thank you!  The front desk staff very extremely friendly.  Upon check-out, I needed the parking (which was billed to my room) separate from the room charges due to employer reimbursement.  They were more than willing to assist.  The only negative was the wifi was not free, but I believe Marriott offers this free of charge to their rewards members.  I had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant and was very pleased!  Thank you for a good stay!
Manager Response: Hey Chris, Thanks for the positive review! We appreciate your feedback and your business. You're welcome back any time!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Well like I said.. it all about location. I went for Blizzcon event at the convention center, & this Marriott was right beside it. It kinda has its own street shared with the neighboring hotel. in the center of this loop is a wounderful walkway with a couple fountains, & pleanty of places to sit. I spent each morning here eating breakfest. The staff is very friendly, and room service is a great value. Again the location was perfect!. We did not even rent a car since so much was in walking distance.(no more than 2 blocks)
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback. We appreciate hearing what you liked about your experience.   Best, Dan

Summary: I wanted to be sure Karla gets credit for her flawless care of me while I was having troubles.  I arrived to check in to the Marriotts Anaheim to attend a three day conference being held by Forrester Research in your hotel.  Karla could not find my reservation and when I showed her the confirmation, it turns out I had inadvertently reserved a room at the Anaheim Marriotts Suites. (Who knew there are at least four Marriotts in Anaheim!)   While I can laugh about it now, at the time it was very upsetting as I had four other teammates attending the conference and now I was going to have to stay miles away….not have access to my room during the day etc.  Of course there was no room at the Anaheim Marriotts (next to convention center), but without missing a beat, Karla •	found a room
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great review! We will make sure to thank Karla, and the rest of the team who helped you solve the problem. We pride ourselves on stellar customer service and I personally welcome you back at any time to come and stay with us.   Thanks, Dan

Summary: I recently stayed at the Marriott Anaheim for a conference and really enjoyed the experience.  The front desk staff was friendly (thank you Theresa) and helpful.  I was given a corner room on the seventh floor with a balcony (very nice) and since I am an Elite Member, I was given access to the Concierge Room on the 18th floor (great view and service).  While I was there, it appears that the hotel was being upgraded with new paint and wall paper being installed in the lobby.  My room also appeared to have been updated with new carpet and furniture.  For those who wish to head off to Disneyland, the hotel is located next to the park, though if you wanted to walk to the main gate, it is a bit of a hike (approximately 15-20 minutes).   They do offer a shuttle for a fee.  I would
Manager Response: Thanks for the positive feedback! We are almost finished with our massive 11mm renovation that also includes the rooms. It is quite possible that you had an old bed, as we are phasing things out. The rooms should be complete by the end of the year, so I welcome you back after that to experience our newly renovated hotel.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: This is a refreshed old Marriott.  Based on that fact, the rooms are small, and the bathrooms smaller.  Once you accept these facts, you'll find a great, clean, and convenient place from which to visit Disneyland.  As Platinum members, we enjoyed access to the concierge lounge which was well-staffed and well-stocked with a wide-array of food and drink.  We did not have any of the crowd problems complained of by previous reviewers.  As referenced by others, the ART shuttle is awesome.  While the walk to the parks is doable, it's a pretty good walk given that you'll be walking around the parks ALL DAY.  I would definitely recommend the shuttle.    We did not eat at the hotel restaurants, but got some snacks at the gift shop (it was well-stocked) and ordered in from the local Pizza
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! The newly renovated restaurant is almost complete and will have a new menu with lots of options as well. We welcome you back any time to check us out again.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Excellent stay after a rough start
Summary: I have to commend the staff and management of the front desk. During a recent October stay, we encountered a snag when checking in to the hotel. A corporate client had booked the room for us related to a Conference in Anaheim. The client had unintentionally not completed the payment by providing the proper authorization. It took us a few hours to final get checked in during this time because the corporate client was East coast based and it was beyond normal business hours. The hotel staff was very accommodating and we dined at the wonderful hotel Italian restaurant.  The front desk even sent up a smores kit for our family to enjoy at the hotel fire pit.  I would highly recommend staying here at an Anaheim visit.
Manager Response: Thanks for much for the great feedback! We appreciate your business and would love to have you back.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I visited and stayed at the Marriott Anaheim for a conference held at the same hotel. My one night stay started with a fast and friendly check in. My room, 339, is in the corner not far from the elevators with a king size bed next to the building stairwell - no issues with noise. The shared balcony overlooks the parking lot. The room is large with a refrigerator. This is an older hotel but still very well decorated and tastefully appointed. The room was clean. The tub in the bathroom didn't drain quickly. The WiFi service was fast and included with my Marriott rewards status. I had breakfast in the lobby restaurant which was a prompt experience. I would return to this hotel again for a conference or a potential visit to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We appreciate it. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas are almost finished and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. We hope to have you back again to see the finished product!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Given the lack of options in Anaheim (either cheap and nasty... or extremely overpriced) this is a very good upper end hotel.  Located opposite the Hilton and within walking distance to disneyland, we loved staying here.  The beds are SO comfortable.... and the nachos... well, we lived on them!! I loved that the hotel had in house facilities, a good gym, great bar, starbucks and a mail centre.  The hotel is a little dated, but i couldn't find anything modern in anaheim, so this was very good in comparison.  The pool area was being renovated when we were there, so it was a bit of a workzone, but still clean and relaxing.   The hotel is also linked with the convention centre, so be prepared to see lots of business guests at all times.   The hotel also offers a shuttle to
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are in the middle of an 11mm renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas are almost finished and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. I think you will find families returning again in the new year, and we hope to have you back for both business and vacation!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Ugh! The rooms are sad. Mismatched and sometimes broken furniture with swarms of convention groups moving in and out.  The terrace is gross and ours had wasps hovering outside. May be good for smokers? To make your stay as pleasant as possible, get as big a room as you can afford or beg for and be sure to get one in a corner for quiet.  The trade off is that with a corner room, you're near a staircase which is creepy so use all the locks on your door.  With just one look, we knew we had to try and get out of the room. When we called down to check in, we were told that there was only one other room with an extra 50 feet. They really did not want to move us, but We took the bigger room and it made a huge difference. We had enough room to open our suitcases and move in the room. By
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas are almost finished and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  Hopefully this will alleviate any concerns about our rooms in the future.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I stayed in  this hotel for four nights while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. I checked in at the busiest time when it was apparent that many attendees of the conference were all coming in. The staff at the reception desk was very professional, patient and processed the check-in effortlessly. I had a special situation in the sense that my son was joining me on the last night of my stay and he wanted to pay for that night stay.  Both of us are Marriott awards members so it was important that I earn my awards for three nights and my son earns his for the last night. I also wanted to make sure that since the last night of my stay was under my son's reservation that I can remain in the same room and not have to check-out and move to a different room.   The
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and I'm glad your stay went well. We are on the tail end of our hotel renovation, and while the rooms are being changed we have removed the chairs from the rooms, but will bring one in upon request. It's just part of this long process that will be over in the new year. I'm glad to hear we were accommodating to your request, and that you had a great stay. I hope to see you back in the new year!  Best, Dan

Summary: Every time I attend a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center I stay at the Anaheim Marriott Hotel.  The service is great, the staff friendly and professional and the rooms are very roomy and clean.  My room was ready beforehand and the staff very eager to assist with whatever needs I had.  Within walking distance to many restaurants and Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hi Theresa, Thanks for your kind words. Our new restaurant is almost ready to re-open, and there will be a lot of new dishes on the menu, along with 24 beers on draft and specialty cocktails in the bar! The social lounge will have lots of places to relax as well. We hope to have you back and to hear your thoughts on the new features.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Recently attended a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center which is adjacent to the Marriott.  The hotel staff at the front desk and concierge were very friendly and attentive.  The only issue we had was that our room was not cleaned one day during our stay.  Room was good and reasonable size.  Walking distance to several good restaurants and even to Disneyland although that is a little longer walk.  Shuttle bus to Disney is available or short cab ride for around 10 dollars.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words. Our restaurant and social lounge are almost complete with 24 beers on tap and several new dishes on the menu. There will be a huge tv for watching the games, and a lot of areas to relax as well. We hope to see you again soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Stayed here last week as part of a conference.  As others have said, it is used often as a convention property, as they can accommodate large groups in house, or one block away at the Anaheim Convention Center.  I checked in really early, about 6:30am, and I was completely accommodated with a room being available.  I did use mobile check-in, but the earliest time that would allow was 8am, so I was pleasantly surprised.  I am a Gold Elite member with Marriott, and I was thanked for my loyalty on several occasions.  I was provided a concierge level room, and had breakfast upon arrival.  Everyone, literally every staff member I encountered in the hotel, was pleasant...in a sincere way.  It was very refreshing.  For full disclosure, I am a Starwood elite and loyalist, and would not
Manager Response: Hey Adam, Thanks for your feedback. We appreciate the kind words. We are almost finished with our renovation, and will have a new bar and restaurant with 24 beers on tap and a huge TV lounge. There's also some great new dishes on the menu, and there will be a relaxing social lounge area. Thank you for staying with us, and we hope to have you back again!  Best, Dan

Summary: This is a nice place to hotel.  Room was fine, nice balcony, small bathroom.  The restaurant area is ok- there was quite a bit more going on at the hotel across as far as restaurant/bar.  Location was great, close to Disney & restaurants.  My room was directly next to the elevator so would hear the hum of the elevator, otherwise it was a pleasant stay & the staff was helpful.
Manager Response: Hi Heidi, Thanks for the kind words! We're almost done with our new bar and restaurant! N-Fuse, our new restaurant has some amazing new dishes, and our bar will have 24 beers on tap plus specialty cocktails. We hope you come back and visit!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: The better of the convention hotels
Summary: I stay each year in Anaheim for a convention and try my best to book the Marriott. It's certainly the classier hotel to stay at! That's why the rooms book up so darn quickly!  There are many good restaurants and things to do within walking distance and Disney is a short cab ride or 20 min walk away. If you're going to th Anaheim convention center this is by far the way to go.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review! We are also about to re-open our renovated restaurant N-Fuse that will features a whole new menu. So there are many reasons to come back!   Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Good Convention Hotel - Staff has "Disney-Quality" Attitude
Summary: Just spent a few nights at the Anaheim Marriott for a convention - best part is the Convention Center is just steps away.   PROS: Staff:  could NOT be more accommodating - you walk in and everyone asks if they can help you. Location/Conv Ctr:  fabulous if you're going to the Convention Center. Location/Restaurants:  is good for walking (5-15 minutes) to multiple restaurants. Balconies:  every room has a balcony and two chairs - a real plus for those of us who love our (kind of private) outdoor space.  You can have a city view (upper floors) some see nightly fireworks at Disney - or a pool view (lower floors) Room Service:  (Breakfast) was right on time - delicious - enormous and with extremely pleasant servers - especially for that early in the morning  CONS - Facility: is a bit
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am happy that you found some positive notes about your stay. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by mid-November and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. We hope to address all of your concerns through this renovation, and welcome you back to check out the finished product!  Best, Dan

Summary: Here for a convention. Very close proximity to convention center. This hotel is still undergoing a major remodel as others have mentioned. For the most part not terribly intrusive with the exception of a relaxing trip to the pool that was interrupted by very loud and continous sounds of a jack hammer and saws.  Most of the food options mentioned on their site no longer exist..perhaps due to the construction. A pizza place never opened once while we were there but still had food in a cooler. We were told they no longer serve a breakfast buffet. Not to worry..many choices nearby including a small food court across the way at the Hilton..all at ridiculously high convention/resort style prices.   They have new elevators where you punch your exact floor in before getting  on. Very
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Our hotel is finishing up a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. The restaurant is almost complete and we will be featuring some of the menu items and announcements on our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, so please feel free to Like us to keep up with all the latest news!   Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Nestled nicely by the Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: Mid October is a great time for a conference, especially if it takes place at the Marriott Anaheim. This is a terrific conference hotel, as there are great meeting facilities, break out rooms of every shape and size, huge corridors and lobby meeting spaces(with Starbucks in the midst) as well as several ball rooms. It features an impressive gym, located in the lobby level of the Oasis Tower and there is also a somewhat small indoor/outdoor pool on the opposite tower lobby level, so try to select which would be the most important to you before you arrive and request a room in that tower. Tip: Oasis Tower is the most convenient to the Conference Area, but the Club level lounge is in the opposite tower. We used several outdoor paths from the hotel, and you will likely enjoy them,
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed response! We do host a number of conferences throughout the year, and are equipped to hold many attendees as well as the ability to book meetings in several of our hall areas. We look forward to seeing you again!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay near Disneyland.
Summary: We were mesmerized by our view from the 17th Floor. The staff was very polite and helpful.Very close to the resort and there are shuttles available for Disneyland.I would recommend to do valet parking at the hotel and take the shuttle or just walk down to Disneyland. That way you save yourself from parking hassles. I would love to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your feedback! That's the type if info we like to hear!  Best, Dan

Summary: Choosing a place to stay while visiting Disneyland is a hustle for everyone!. You have to consider a lot of things like; the distance, reputation, price, surrounding area, other attractions, vicinity to restaurants and more. The Marriott Anaheim is what I choose for the better part of a good thing amongst the points mentioned above. It's not that pricey that some think of. And what counts the most is the honest welcoming traits of all staffers; from the Bell Desk staff, Front Desk staff, concierges to the Housekeepers. They all constantly check on your needs and if you're expectations were met. What a place for traveler like me. Upon approach to the Front Desk, I was immediately greeted by this gentlemen who is in an "Elite Member' line only but didn't hesitate to help. This
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! We are happy to help make your stay as delightful as possible! I would like to personally welcome you back after December, when the hotel renovation is complete. Thank you for staying with us.  Sincerely, Dan

Summary: The front lobby was being renovated during our stay but it didn't cause a huge upset like I've seen in other hotels. The valet/bell staff was amazing; attentive, prompt, and would do anything I help out, even in supreme pandemonium they operated like a well greased machine. Check in staff seemed annoyed we were there and that we had questions about the room and facilities. Good thing valet already had us buttered up.   The facilities are decent but a little older, the service good, and the price reasonable.
Manager Response: Thanks for your response. Our major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms is almost finished! The public space areas will be finished by the end of this month and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. I will check into the front desk staff on that, and am happy to hear our valet team was providing excellent service!  Sincerely, Dan

Summary: I stayed here for 3 business nights. It is a mega hotel which is gorgeous and spacious. The staff is super friendly and helpful. It seems like they are trained like Disney staff as they took care of any request I had.   The gym is terrific with two rooms of cardio and weight lifting equipment including barbells. They always have a bowl of fruit so you can grab and after workout healthy bite too.   I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review! We appreciate the kind words. Our hotel renovation is almost complete and we would love to have you back to check out the rest of the newly designed amenities, including a great new restaurant!   Thanks, Dan

Summary: In town on business, I expected, if nothing else, a quiet stay.  I have a busy travel and work schedule and need to sleep for a time in the afternoon.  This is not possible.  The sound of drilling and general construction noise (banging and scraping) is so loud it sounds like it coming from all sides.  It feels like the room is vibrating.  The customer service representative I spoke with explained that the hotel is undergoing construction on the 4th floor (I am on the 7th).  Why in the world didn't they tell me about the construction when I made the reservation - or even when I checked in??  They just offered to move me to another tower where they say there is no construction (so why put people in the tower where there IS construction?!) That will entail packing up my entire
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.   We have been a completely full house during this process and extremely busy this week. The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  I personally welcome you back once the renovation is complete to check out the new amenities.  Sincerely, Dan

Summary: I love the new elevators here, great location to the park, wonderful food court selection and amazing pool. There are a lot of added on charges like internet, resort fee, parking ($28!) etc. Keep that in mind when comparing rates. There is no free shuttle to Disneyland which I thought was interesting ($5 each per way) Overall a great place to stay with the kids
Manager Response: Thank for your response! The elevators are a part of our new renovation that should be completely finished by the end of December. You are welcome to come back and check it out anytime!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: The room was the newest to be remodeled so I had higher expectations than what I received.  Still small bathroom and closet space wouldn't work for the two beds that were in the room but most people had trouble getting used to the new elevator system.  Punch in the floor you want and it will tell you which elevator to get on.  That got old in a large crowd.
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review. I'm sorry to hear you had a less than stellar experience at our hotel. We did just go through a 13mm renovation to the entire hotel and are still finishing up some odds and ends, like the points you mentioned. We're working hard to make sure we provide the best experience for our guests. Thank you for choosing Anaheim Marriott for your stay.   Thanks, Dan

Summary: While there are closer hotels to disneyland this is only about a 10 to 15 minute walk.  Before arrival I was worried about the walk back during dark,  but it was completely safe and well lit. Although most of the foot travel sites out before getting to this distance.  The room was nice but nothing particular about it stood out.  There is a full bar in the lobby which came in handy upon return.  I was able to catch them when after the park closed,  and right before last call (which was about midnight or shortly after), and get some beers to take back to the room.  Parking is an extra fee. Valet is only 5 extra,  with self serve parking being 25 and valet being 30. The walk for self parking seemed much further and worth spending the 5.  They did bring up an extra cot free of
Manager Response: Hi Carol, Thanks for your thorough review. We are almost finished with our renovation which will include the guest rooms. The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. I hope that you come back once everything is complete to check out the new rooms and restaurant!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I stayed here on business for a short conference. The staff was very friendly and professional, check in was a breeze. The room was ready earlier than check in and I was able to check in to my room at noon, which was very nice. My room was clean and well appointed, but the wifi in the room was spotty and slow, I could not get any work done up there but they were kind enough to not charge me for the wifi. The from was a bit dated but nothing to complain about, it was comfortable and had a fridge, always a bonus. The hotel is under renovation, but you would never know it. Parking was easy and signage made it easy to navigate to the room. Love the elevators. Banquet food was actually pretty good for hotel banquet food. Our lunches and breaks were very good. Great coffee. I would
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive response. Our renovation is almost finished! We have been working on a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  I personally welcome you back to stay at one of our newly renovated guest rooms.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel but Room Not Up to Marriott Expectations
Summary: I stayed at this property for two nights this past weekend because it was available last minute and close to Disneyland. When we arrived at the property the valet man was very nice and pointed us to the (Temporary) check-in desk.   Check-in was smooth and the agent was extremely friendly. She even walked us to show where the elevator was for our room, showed us the Disney desk, and then walked us out to point where to go for the parking garage.   On parking... $24 a night?!?!?!?! That's robbery. I'm a travel agent and for Anaheim that's absurd. Disneyland itself doesn't charge that much. And the parking garage isn't convenient, it's automated with a pass that you put into the machine, and you have to walk through the convention center to get from the garage to the hotel room
Manager Response: Thanks for your thorough response. As you know, our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  I personally invite you to come back when our rooms will be complete! We hope to wow you!  Best, Dan

Summary: Stayed at Marriott Anaheim early October 2014. Temporary check in desks due renovations, check in staff not over friendly or helpful. Difficulty finding elevators due lack of signage and areas curtained off for renovation work. Accommodation was roomy and bed very comfortable as we have come to expect at Marriott. Bathroom small and dated. Room safe very small and operated with a key which gives a clue to the age of the place. Paper cups for making tea or coffee seemed a bit cheap for a hotel of Marriott status. Overall disappointing and not good value for price paid.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. The issues you have had will no longer exist once the renovation is complete. I personally invite you back upon completion to check out all of the modern and innovative amenities that our hotel will have, including an all new menu at our restaurant!  Best, Dan

Summary: We stayed here on a family trip to Disneyland.  Previously we've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel (massively overpriced for nothing), and a couple 2 star hotels/motels (disgusting but cheap) on Harbor Blvd across from the entrance to the Park, so we thought we would try the Marriott since we're big fans of Marriott and Gold members.  The staff was outstanding both at check-in and check-out, couldn't have asked for more.  The hotel lobby was undergoing a huge renovation while we were there but, even though it was inaccessible, there was never any true inconvenience or noise.  The room itself was a little smaller, and the bathroom much smaller, than I'm used to at a Marriott property but clean as usual.  My one big complaint was it was literally the hardest and most uncomfortable
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest response. I appreciate the feedback as we are always trying to make changes to enhance the stay for our guests. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  I would like to welcome you back then!  Best, Dan

Summary: One of the best hotels we have stayed at during our 14 day road,trip.girls on front desk very friendly,check in speedy,rooms typical Marriott clean roomy plenty of bathroom essentials.beds huge and the best yet,2 t.v.s.minor criticism parking 12 dollars a day.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! We appreciate the positive comments.  Best, Dan

Summary: I was here for business from Oct 2 - Oct 5.  This does seem like a popular location for families, close to Disney.  My room, 6050, was decent size and clean.  No view, was looking at Hilton.  I ordered room service a few times, food was good and they were pretty fast at getting it to me.  Staff was very nice and helpful.  One afternoon I went to the outlets at Orange, just a few minute drive from hotel and there was tons of stores and restaurants.  I of course had to go to an In-N-Out burger, that was about a 15 minute drive but well worth it :) The one thing I was disappointed in was the wi-fi.  I think when you spend a couple hundred a night this would be included, they charge $13 a day for this or $17 if you want "enhanced internet".  I was attending an all day conference on
Manager Response: Hi Heather, We will put through a credit for your Wi-fi since we previously promised it and it mistakenly showed up on your bill. Thanks for staying with us, and we hope you return again!  Best, Dan

Summary: Had we known that this property has 1,041 rooms was a convention type hotel and was under construction in some areas we would have stayed in a smaller scale hotel like the nearby Courtyard.  The front desk staff could not have been more friendly and accompanying and helpful.  There are two towers and our room was located in the older side where the top floors had been recently updated.  The other newer tower is in my opinion better since it was smaller, did not have balconies and seemed quieter. There was a charge for parking with the parking deck somewhat far from the hotel.  Overall an average stay however this large property was a bit overwhelming. The individual at the Marriott Disney Desk sold us tickets to the park which was convenient. However, we asked about dining at a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. That said, we always go out of our way to provide the best hospitality  to make sure your stay is suburb. I will check into the BBQ recommendation to make sure we are providing the most correct information.  Sincerely, Dan

Summary: I have been traveling for several weeks and needed to do invoicing so I could get paid.  Mike at the front desk was so very helpful as I could not get the invoices to print.  He gave me his e-mail at the hotel and printed the invoices and copied the receipts I needed.  Then, after all of this help as I was leaving for dinner he asked me...with a smile...if I needed any other help.  As a non-stop traveler for a month, Mike was just amazingly helpful.  Excellent customer service!   The hotel is close to Disneyland and as a business traveler, it was such fun to get on the elevator with a little girl dressed as a princess, daddy was a pirate and grandmother, Snow White!  Nice change from just fellow business travelers.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review! Also, thanks for calling out our stellar employee Mike at our front desk. We always try to go above and beyond to make sure your stay is stellar, and I personally would like to welcome you back any time.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I have stayed here several times and this was the only time I have been disappointed. They are remodeling the lobby and have moved the front desk to another area. Unfortunately my room was on the 4th floor above the relocated lobby and it was very noisy. They have also a new computerized elevator system and I don't like it at all. Twice the elevator doors shut before any passengers could enter due to passengers being slow to get off.  Love the location!
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear your experience was less than stellar with us. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. The new elevators are state of the art technology, which eliminates stopping on floors other than yours!  We hope you come back and stay with us once the renovation is complete. Thank you again for your feedback.  Best, Dan

Summary: Why don't these hotels tell you when they are remodeling?  I chose this based on reviews and was disappointed.  This hotel is under remodel and the lobby is shrouded in black fabric.  The restaurant is in a ballroom.  The rooms are clean but very 1990s.  Expect today for everything: parking, breakfast, Internet, etc.   At least they have power plugs on the lamp bases.
Manager Response: Thanks for your honest review. Yes, our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. We have included images of what the new design will look like on this page, and are doing our best to get the word out there.  I welcome you back once everything is complete to check out the amazing amenities we offer.  Sincerely, Dan

Summary: We stayed five days in this hotel as our base for visiting LA.  Couldn't fault the hotel or the staff.  Hotel was spotlessly clean as were the rooms.  Also the staff were very friendly whenever needed.  This hotel is an excellent base if you are visiting Disney.  Good links to all the highways. Couldn't complain about anything. They also upgraded our room as it we were celebrating a birthday...nice touch.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review! We are always striving to provide the best service possible. It's nice to hear about your great experience. I hope we contributed to an excellent Birthday celebration!   Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great hotel for business trips and meetings
Summary: I've stayed here several times for business trips. The staff is always courteous and helpful. Even though they're renovating right now, I got checked-in quickly. My room was facing west which means it was hot when I got up there. I turned on the A/C and it kicked in right away. I enjoyed the large balcony. The proximity to the convention center is unmatchable. They have a great variety of meeting spaces and their chef prepares delicious meals that go above and beyond what most imagine "meeting food" to be. I'm sure I'll be back again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! Yes, our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. We hope to see you again when the restaurant is complete. There will be a lot of new items on the menu!   Sincerely, Dan

Summary: I arrived at the hotel to drop my luggage off and I did not return until 10:00 pm.  They were out of the king sized beds that I had reserved so I got put into a different room "in the newly renovated part of the hotel with 2 full sized beds"   I noticed that they were doing a lot of construction which is never good.  When I arrived back to my hotel at 10:00pm it was VERY warm in my room so I turned the temp down so the ac would kick in.  I wanted to watch tv but I could not find a remote so I called the front desk and they sent one up quickly.  Then I tried that remote and it did not work so I had to call once again for another remote.  By now the room was really hot and the ac was not working so when the guy brought up the remote I mentioned the ac so he said he would send the
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review. I'll make sure to take all the points you made to our team. Could you please private message me with your full name and dates you stayed so that we can do some research on our end? Also if you could provide your rewards number that might help too.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Great stay for a convention and trip to Disney!
Summary: Our company had a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center, which is right between this Marriott and the Hilton across the street. Of the two hotels, this one seem to be preferred among the convention guests! Although they are still remodeling the lobby area, the guest rooms have already been finished and were nicely updated! The elevators were fast and efficient, and the beds were comfortable. Our room was clean, and it was nice to have a small balcony! We did find that the pool was rather small for a hotel of this size. There were not any lounge chairs available when visited. I was a bit disappointed that the concierge lounge did not stay open a little later for breakfast. They closed at 9am, and we were told at check-in that it lasted until 9:30am. When we showed up at
Manager Response: Thanks for for review and feedback. As you mentioned, our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and all of the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. So thank you for pointing out the positives, and bearing with us as we iron out some changes. I would personally like to invite you back once the renovation is complete to check out the hotel!  Best, Dan

Summary: We stayed here whilst in LA, we weren't sure where to stay and was told Anahiem was a good tourist place to go. There was lots around including trips and food and Disney is on the same street and a 5 minute walk. Staff were very helpful with our queries about places to go.  We caught a lot of buses as they have reasonable day prices and very friendly drivers.
Manager Response: Thanks for your positive review! We appreciate it and would love to have you back next time you're in the area!  Best, Dan

Summary: I stayed here for a conference over the weekend. They were doing construction on the main lobby so the guest registration was near the gym, maybe not the best spot but it'll do.   The staff I encountered throughout the weekend were great, helpful and all very pleasant and great to speak with. Each one had good knowledge of the hotel as well as local area.   The room itself wasn't bad. My only gripe was the square pillows which were a bit too soft for my liking but that's more personal preference. The room was clean and well kept. I had more than enough towels for one person. There was a fridge in the room which I wasn't aware of and found out when I went to pull a drawer in dresser and it ended being a door in camo.   I enjoyed a meal on the patio, wasn't bad, the selection was
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback.  I personally invite you to come back and check out the hotel once we have completed our major renovation around Mid-December. We hope you will find even more niceties to review.  Sincerely, Dan

Summary Heading: Excellent short stay for Disney visit!
Summary: We loved the convenience of staying at the Anaheim Marriott. It's a stone's throw away from Disneyland entrances and there is a shuttle bus that take you and bring you back to the hotel. The room was bright and spacious with all the conveniences - the hotel was great, the staff was very helpful. We chose to stay at the Marriott instead of one of the Disney resorts because it gave us flexibility - we could eat out either at the hotel or any of the restaurants on the main strip which is all walking distance and yet experience Disney without any travel time associated with it. If we visit Disney again, we would stay there again!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great feedback! This is the stuff we like to hear back from our guests. I'm happy to hear that your stay here was everything you hoped it would be. We look forward to serving you again.   All my best, Dan

Summary: Have one night remaining of 4 night stay and will be glad to leave.  Where to start; they hit a number of my negative buttons 1) the hotel has major renovation work going on on the ground floor with significant impact on all of the services (breakfast, availability of hot water, amenity of the entrance foyer).  It would have been nice to make an informed decision at booking of what we were buying.  Room rates are on the high side @$179/night, clearly the guest is paying for the inconvenience, not the hotel; 2) charging for internet access - very poor service, requiring repeated sign-on, no doubt driven by the default cost upgrade at each signon 3) "have a nice day" delivered with zero sincerity.  You really are a revenue opportunity at this hotel, not an experience I care to
Manager Response: Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $18M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.
