The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  I'm sorry to hear that you didn't have a great experiance. We'll review with the internal team to assure this can be used as a teaching moment. We appreciatte your comments.  Best Regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: They're currently undergoing a renovation/remodel of the lobby area, but despite the issues that brings, the staff was courteous and efficient.  Took just a few minutes to check in, the room was ready before noon (which you can't always count on), and the room with two queen beds was excellent.  On two different occasions I needed to go to the concierge for information regarding dining in the area, and their suggestions and directions were always spot on.  This was a business trip, but I would definitely go for pleasure if I were in the area.  The only reason they didn't get a top score was due to the areas blocked off for construction.  I would really like to see what this hotel will look like when the construction in completed.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind note about our service and staff.  Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. We would love to have you back to check it out!  Best, Dan

Summary: Upon going to bed my first night I discovered that I could hear every suitcase rolling up to the hotel. I was on the 2nd floor facing the street. When i went downstairs the next morning the desk staff was wonderful about moving me, and offered me a free coffee. The front desk staff is a great example of the excellent service you come to expect from the Marriott Hotels.  My room was a double with twin beds, the beds were comfortable and the room was a perfect size for 1 or 2 guests. I wouldn't suggest any more then that.  The bathroom was small but the water pressure was excellent. The room was clean and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job in making sure I had plenty of clean towels.  The hotel is under construction at the moment, so I can't say much about the restaurant
Manager Response: Thank you for your note about our service.  We are currently undergoing a major $11 renovation that will be complete this year. The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  We would love to have you back to check it out!  Sincerely, Dan

Summary Heading: A good hotel for visiting Disneyland.
Summary: The only complaints I have are that the Palms tower rooms are ugly.  The decor is new, but the design of the carpets looks like they are worn and threadbare.  These rooms are also relatively small.  I also did not get the pool view I requested.  The upside is that the Anaheim Resort Transport shuttle route 5 bus goes straight to the Disneyland Main gate and back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes the guest rooms and main areas.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. I would like to invite you back once the renovation is complete to check out the brand new guest room decor as well as a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, and pool deck.   Best Regards, Dan

Summary: Full service Marriotts are getting to be very disappointing. We stayed here for the holiday weekend. Right from the start we had trouble. There are two lobbies and the staff directed our cab to the wrong one. So we had to haul all our luggage down to the other lobby only to haul it all back to get to our room.   After all that room was not as we expected. Cracks in the ceiling, hair in the tub, and a safety lock installed backwards allowing an intruder easy access to the room. The did change us the next day to a better room but we were expecting more from a full service hotel.   The"restaurant" in the lobby is whee we ate the first night. Service was very substandard. The waitress was very pleasing but must have been assigned too many tables. Our order was not right and they
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us an honest review. I'm pleased to hear that management has already provided you with room credits and points. I will take all the points you've mention above to our team. Once again, we apologize that you experience was not exceptional. We hope to see you soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Pay for parking, pay for wifi, average, also been renovated so a bit noisy, close to disneyland.we walked there, or you can get a bus outside the hotel. Parking 24 for 24 hours  and wi if is 15 .good luck
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  I would like to personally invite you back to check out the state of the art main areas, and new decor in the guest rooms at that time.  Best Regards, Dan

Summary: I stayed here for 1 night with my wife for a short trip to California Adventures.  We picked this hotel because it is nearby Disneyland, it had availability and I am a Marriott Rewards member, so I try to stay at Marriott properties when I can.  HOTEL  The hotel itself is situated within walking distance from Disneyland, but there is also a shuttlebus to take you to and from the park.  It is not a new building, but there appears to have been some remodeling in the recent past. That being said, the decoration is more family focused and sits somewhere around middle-to-upper-middle tier in terms of substance. In other words, it is apparent that we are in a Marriott and not a JW Marriott or a Ritz Carlton.  That is fine for a hotel nearby Disney.  The valet service is friendly and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms. The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  I appreciate your feedback, and welcome you back when the renovation is complete to check out the new rooms and main areas.  Sincerely, Dan

Summary: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Close to Disneyland but far enough away to not be too busy and loud. Great for business traveller for access to the convention center next door. Easy commute to LA.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review! We pride ourselves on customer service, so it's great to get that feedback. Hope to see you again soon!   All my best, Dan

Summary Heading: Elevators are wierd, but hotel is Fantastic
Summary: This hotel is Convenient to Disneyland and/or Conventions, the rooms are comfortable and spacious. The Staff was over the Top and very friendly from check in to check out. only issue I had was the jets in the Spa were not working properly. once you get used to the elevators, the place is awesome! you have to pick your floor BEFORE you get on the elevator.  no buttons inside the elevators.  weird, but it works and  there was always an elevator there for me when I needed one. ate Dinner a the Bar with again Very friendly staff and great food.  prices are a bit expensive but I guess in line with rest of California.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. The elevators are the state of the art technology, providing access to your floor much quicker than technology of the past. We are excited about this part of the renovation among many other details to come. I would like to invite you back once the renovation is complete to check everything out. The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. Hope to see you then!  Best Regards, Dan

Summary: We were here for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center and had been anticipating a lack of sleep due to the possible noise that was bound to be kickin' around. We managed to get a corner room  on the 6th floor and heard NOTHING from anyone the entire time! The beds and pillows were SO comfortable it was nearly impossible not to just drop off the moment your head hit the pillow. Everything was super clean, and the hotel staff was nothing but accommodating. They were also quite happy to allow con-goers time and a place to convene & chat after that days events were drawing to a close. Price is AMAZING for the location and time of year. We will stay at this Marriott EVERY time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I appreciate the positive response and welcome you back any time.  Best Regards, Dan

Summary Heading: Disneyland is just a short walk away!
Summary: Ok, it's been awhile, but I stayed at this hotel for three days back in November 2010.  I had my younger brother with me for the Thanksgiving weekend, and I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland.    After arriving in Anaheim on the train, this hotel was perfect for us.  We didn't even bother taking the hotel shuttle to Disneyland because you can leave the hotel, walk down the street, and easily access the Disneyland parking lot and catch their shuttle into the park.    When we arrived at the hotel, it was very busy due to a beauty pageant being held in the hotel along with the holiday weekend.  Check-in was smooth.  We got a room with two double beds, which were quite comfortable.  My brother enjoyed some Pizza Hut and we shared a pint of ice cream from the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a positive review. We appreciate the kind words about our staff as we pride ourselves on exemplary customer service. Thanks for staying with us, and we hope to see you again.  Best, Dan

Summary: This hotel is undergoing fairly extensive remodeling.  This information was not made clear to us at the time the reservation was made.  However, the staff made every effort to make our stay comfortable and pleasant.  The restaurants are now considerably smaller and have been moved into the lobby area of the hotel.  They moved the front desk into a small area adjacent to the entry and seemed to manage fairly well with a minimum of waiting.  From what we could see of the new carpeting and some new fixtures in the hallways upstairs, the new fixes will be very nice.  We are planning to at this hotel again this March and can't wait to see the finished project!  As always, the staff was great!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  I am glad you like some of the details already, and we can't wait to unveil the rest! The main areas should be done by October and the guest rooms by mid-December, so it looks like we will be ready to go when you come back! We look forward to your visit.  Best, Dan

Summary: Room was very clean, beds and pillows were extremely comfortable! Location is great, just a short walk to Disneyland. Only gripe would be that the walk from hotel rooms to parking garage is pretty long.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review! We're pleased that your stay with us was everything you hoped it would be. We look forward to seeing you soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We asked for quiet room but it was in the middle of everythinhg and work started in the building at 6AM. We were moved to a higher floor and everything was fine.  Best: The front desk manager on duty called our cell phone a few hours later when we were not in the room to make sure everything was OK!
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December.  I welcome you back once complete to check out the new features!  Sincerely, Dan

Summary: We experienced a wonderful Take Shape For Life convention for coaches and clients in July 2014.  We were housed at the Anaheim Marriott and found this to be a delightful hotel.  It is an older one, but has nice amenities.  It's a short walk to Disneyland so it great for that.  It is next to the Anaheim convention center where we had our convention, so convenient for our stay.  Would recommend this for the vacation or work traveler.
Manager Response: Thanks for your kind review. We are proud of our recent 13mm renovation, and fully revamped menu at the nFuse Bar & Kitchen. We hope to see you again soon!   Best, Dan

Summary: Stayed for the 1/2 marathon.  They have a shuttle that picks up out front and takes you to he race or you can walk about 1.25 miles.  Rooms were typical Marriot.  Only complaint is thin wall.  We heard kids all night long every night screaming off the balcony. The staff here was very helpful again typical of Marriott.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write a review. We apologize for the inconvience of the other loud guests. We're happy to hear that you were satisfied with our staff. We hope to see you soon!  Best, Dan

Summary: Commendation to this gentleman at the front/check-in desk for excellent customer service.  Very friendly, accommodating and kind-hearted.  This is the kind of personnel needed in this kind of establishment.  See you next year.  Thank you Latiff Leo and Tina Poulain Kellyjo Farnum
Manager Response: Thank you for your note about our staff and Latiff in particular. We pride ourselves on amazing customer service and welcome you back to the hotel any time!  Best Regards, Dan

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet and close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for a conference at the end of August and were more than satisfied with our stay.  DL a 15 minute walk, numerous restaurants within walking distance, conference center next door. Rooms, lobby and halls very clean.  Pool area in need of updating, but the 1/2 in sun and 1/2 in shade was helpful when it got hot. Restaurants in hotel under construction, but we went elsewhere anyway. Minimart within 2 blocks.  Fridges in room, but no microwave.  Bathrooms small but updated. We were in the garden room section and our view was only of the roof and the tower.  Beds extremely comfortable, but pillows leave a lot to be desired.  Others have posted about noise levels but we didn't find this. Very quiet and no problems.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review! We pride ourselves in customer service, so despite the few construction compliants we're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to see you in the near future.  Best, Dan

Summary: Good location for theme parks but due to very bad LA traffic - at all times of day - it was a lot further away from downtown, airport & beaches than had anticipated. Started our Californian trip here and had two very comfortable nights offering a good sleep. Two interconnecting rooms were quiet, very clean and comfortable. Front desk staff were friendly and welcoming as were the servers in the bar and restaurant who went out of their way to chat and make you feel valued. Great breakfast! Would recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a positive review. We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, and would recommend our services. We hope to see you soon.  Best, Dan

Summary: The hotel is under construction right now so the normal bar and restaurant set ups were modified. The staff did a good job in the transition and provided scaled down versions of both bar and eatery.  I went across the street to the Hilton and it was also under construction. It appeared to be impacted to even a higher degree then the Marriott.  My one complaint is that the companion chair in the rooms was gone. Each room had a desk chair but that was it. So, when four people came up to my buddies room for a drink 3 sat on the two beds and one in the desk chair. I guess that chair costs money. Maybe you can order one up like a roll away?
Manager Response: Hi Robert, Thank you for your feedback. We have made some temporary changes during our major renovation and changing out the chairs in the guest rooms is one of them. We will have all new chairs in the rooms post remodel. Please note that the public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. I would like to invite you back to check out the new rooms and come to the lounge with your friends as well! Thanks for staying with us.  Best Regards, Dan S.

Summary: We chose to stay at the Marriott as we were coming to DL for the first time without children.  We thought that being a little farther away from the park it would be a bit more peaceful and this was totally the case.  There was also no convention taking place at the time of our stay, so there were no huge crowds (one started the day we were leaving).  The Marriott is about 20 minutes walk from DL.  This was completely doable for us.  For those with small children who might find that a bit far, especially at the end of the day, the ART shuttles have a stop right outside the hotel.    We were in the Oasis Tower - the one closest to the Convention Centre.  The soundproofing between rooms is GREAT!  This has been an issue for me in other hotels in a variety of cities, but here we
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to give us a review. We'll be sure to take the points mentions to our staff. We hope to see you again in the near future!  Best, Dan

Summary: We stayed here and really liked the room, the service, the concierge breakfast, and the convenient location.  The only problem was the cost of parking but that is to be expected, around $30/day. Other than that, the only negative are the different towers.  I was in one that I had to walk around to the back and that wasn't very convenient.  I actually had a hard time finding the elevators!  That was the tower on the West side of the hotel. And to go to the pool you had to walk WAY around to the other side of the hotel.   Other than that, very nice!  My teenagers enjoyed it as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for the inconvenience of not being able to locate our elevators. We're happy to hear that besides some points made, your stay with us was still satisfying. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary: I always have a good experience at this hotel, obviously due to the size of this hotel, I don't get the same attention as I would compared to some of the smaller marriotts, however,  the staff and manager are always polite and professional. My company always uses marriott as we are reward members and so far everyone has been happy!  This hotel is a few minutes away from the convention center and several other hotels. Aside from parking charges, which seem to be the same at most hotels, it is a great value for the experience.  The front desk staff were professional and attentive and fortunately I was upgraded to a city view room with a balcony. The bell staff were helpful and the rooms were clean. I love their elevators and overall updated features of the hotel!   EVerything I
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and staying with us. I appreciate your comments about the updated features. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms.  The public space areas will be finished by the end of October and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. We would love to see you again and appreciate your feedback after the renovation as well.  Best Regards, Dan S.

Summary: I was here for a very large conference at the convention center and the Marriot was the "headquarters hotel" since it is connected to the convention center. I was pleased and surprised at how the staff managed to maintain a "personal touch" with so many people there. Well over 5000 people for the conference, plus Disney traffic. It was nice to be able to go back and forth between the hotel and the convention center throughout the day. My wife was with me also.  She was able to enjoy the room and the other hotel facilities while I was out conferencing.  The staff was always attentive, courteous and friendly. I "lost" my wife when I went to join her for dinner, and the hostess personally walked me around the different restaurants until we found her.  With so many people there, the
Manager Response: Thank you for your complimentary review and for staying with us. I appreciate your comments.  Best Regards, Dan S.

Summary: I had to move to the Marriott Anaheim from Anaheim Marriott Suites because the Suites were not so clean and too many kids running around for me as a business traveler.  The Marriott Anaheim was a good choice for me because it was more business travelers versus Disney Visitors.  It also connected to the convention center.  It was a decent hotel that is clean.  They refurbished the lobby and elevators.  So the lobby is all dining area.  The elevators were really high tech, so that was kinda cool.  Get a room near the elevators.  Will make life a lot easier.  Parking is not included.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We're pleased to hear that The Marriott Anaheim was a better choice for you. We hope to serve you again in the near future.  Best, Dan

Summary: We traveled here for a 3 day convention, but actually stayed two days beforehand so we could go to Disneyland.  We took a shuttle for $8 a person from the airport (John Wayne).  There are many shuttles available that go here for $8-$15 dollars.  If you fly into LAX, the shuttle price was $30ish a person as it's further away.  The hotel is very clean, the staff is extremely friendly and the room was spacious and clean.  We were in the Oasis Tower on the 16th floor.  The room had a small, walk-out balcony and we could see Disneyland from our room.  This was great as you could watch the nightly fireworks from there.    The hotel is next to the Convention Center and the Hilton.  The grounds are immaculate and you could walk to Disneyland or Downtown Disney.  This walk was a good
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review. We're pleased to hear that you had a satisfying experience with us. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary: I have very few positive things to say about this hotel. The lobby and restaurant were under construction during our trip. Unfortunately there were no indications of this on their website. They had a make-shift dining area in the common areas of the lobby and it certainly felt like it. Access to the pool was a joke as you had to go clear out of the way to enter thru the rear hotel corridor. Once in the pool it felt old and dirty. I took the 15 minute roundtrip walk to the bar for a glass of wine for my wife and I where I had hoped I could walk up to a bar outside for this amenity. It didn't matter as the $8 bottle of wine in the store cost me $12 per glass so I would recommend a quick trip to the store to stock up instead of patron the bar. Regarding the rooms, they were very

Summary: First off, we are local disney passholders with a newborn not willing to shell out the $500 a night for the grand california like the rest of the family visiting the park. We stayed 4 nights in august and were pleased with the rack rate of around $120 a night. There are closer hotels, this one just had the right price which I am sure depends on if there is a conference in town.  Things to know about the hotel - It is a 20 minute walk from the park. If going to california adventure park, you can cut through the convention center, west down Katella and cut through Grand California hotel. It is a little shorter and shaded with less crowds. -There is a shuttle that leaves the hotel area for $5 a day. Quick way to get to the park, but can be crowded leaving the park. Not good for
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write all the pros and cons of staying with us. We pride ourselves in customer service, and we work hard to ensure that all of our guest are pleased with their stay. We hope to see you again soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I stayed here for a conference.  They did a great job with our large conference.  Rooms were nice and clean.  It was surprisingly quiet for the amount of people and children at the hotel.  I have stayed at hotels where you knew there would be a lot of children before and just felt over run by kids, but not here.  The food for the conference was excellent, but the restaurant was just average.  Location is awesome and close to so much including Disneyland and Downtown Disney.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review! We're pleased to hear that your stay with us was everything you hoped it would be. We hope to see you again soon.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: We stayed at this hotel after a long day at Disneyland. It is close to the attraction. The bar was packed when we got there so it must be a good spot to hang out. We got upgraded to a 'suite (probably because we checked in after 11 pm)', which was just a bigger room with an extra couch and table, and a bed that came down out of a cabinet! Yes, it was a smaller pull down bed, but still pretty comfortable. As we walked to our room we could hear people partying in the rooms, which was a concern, but the rooms by ours were quiet. The place was pretty clean, but you could tell it was an older hotel. Small bathroom, older furniture, but flat screen TV. THe bar that was so busy at night turns into a busy restaurant in the morning, so there really isnt a place to sit in the lobby as you
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write a review. Our main goal is to strive for excellent customer service, so we will take your points into consideration. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Not the best place to stay.
Summary: An interesting stay. I had great service from all the front desk staff but average to poor service from the dinning staff. The room was clean but small. I asked to move across to the other side of the corridor due to the massive HVAC unit on the roof of the building below me. It sounded like a low hum to whole time. After the move my room was nice and quiet - even though I looked over the front side of the hotel. Breakfast were a crap shoot I was seated across the lobby on all 3 days. Not sure why since there were open tables much closer. On one occasion between the 3 different servers I never got a drink, never got the bill so left, went back to my room, got my stuff ready for my meeting and then came back down to pay the bill. I had one meeting in the concierge lounge and felt

Summary Heading: reliable Marriott, good location for Disney
Summary: There was no way we were paying for a Disney hotel given the inflated rates, so we went with the Marriott Anaheim because we've yet to be disappointed by Marriott service.    Some stray observations:  Staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay.  We arrived five hours early and our room was ready.  They safely held our bags for us for seven hours after check-out on our last day.  Everything went very smoothly.  Our room was spotless and our bed mattress was firm and very comfortable (these are the two things most important to me in a hotel room, so I always take keen notice).  The walk to Disneyland was only about fifteen minutes (granted it was just two adults, no children...might take longer with kiddos in tow).  Although we never used it, we saw a frequent Disney
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to give us a review. We strive to have excellent customer service, so we will definitely take the points mentioned into consideration. We're pleased to hear that you had a satisfying experience.   Thanks, Dan

Summary: Stayed here one night for business.  I was a little put off that the Concierge lounge was under construction and that wasn't noted on the website.  Also my tub was plugged up and I took a shower with water over my ankles.  Went to the bar to eat, pulled in my stool and found a big wad of gum under the stool.  The bartender didn't act surprised at this at all and offered me a paper napkin.  The Ahi Tuna salad was maybe marginal to poor.  It was like the whole thing came out of a bag.  I stay in a ton of Marriott properties and really expect more from a full service Marriott.

Summary: Looking forward to the largest convention of my craft for a full year and dedicated a year to reward points to achieve Platinum.  When I check in, K tells me that "here since we're a convention hotel, upgrades to suites are hard to come by because our rooms are regular."  What a disappointment to have a weeklong stay in a regular room in the center of a long hall with noisy adjoining doors and the highest elite status of Marriott that, quite frankly, means nothing.  I'm going to change to another hotel for next year's rewards.  I have 7am classes to teach and we got a room facing the parking lot with the hotel (and next door hotel's) car horn alarms going off incessantly.  #Ridiculous

Summary Heading: OK, but very poor value for money.
Summary: We spent 5 nights here to visit disneyland, with the location very good for the parks. The hotel lobby is well appointed and luxurious, with friendly staff. However, we were situated in the 'Garden Block', and the quality of the rooms was very average; dated bathroom and terrible pillows ahoy. What's more, the sound insulation was poor, and we could hear noise from the rooms above. Our balcony faced the valet car park, so we were frequently disturbed by car horns going off at all hours. I used the well appointed gym facilities, but sadly they were situated in a different tower, meaning I had to walk through the lobby after my workout (this would have been easily avoided if there were shower facilities). The pool is entirely geared towards kids, with shallow covered areas (a
Manager Response: Hi, Rob,  We appreciate you taking the time to write a review. We strive daily to have excellent customer service. With that said, I will make sure to take the points mentioned above to our team. We hope to serve you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Great stay at a reasonable price point
Summary: Very good hotel at a reasonable price point.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and the staff is very attentive.  Brent at the Elite check in provided outstanding check in service taking the time to make sure that we got the room we desired.  This is a sure bet when visiting Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review! We're pleased to hear that you had a satisfying experience while staying with us. We hope to see you back soon.  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Decent for a family visit, but it would be better if updated
Summary: I travel a LOT for work, and I decided that I'd use my points at this location for a family vacation to the area.  This was the same number of points as another Marriott property that is closer to the Disneyland Resort area, but since this was a standalone Marriott versus a Fairfield Inn, I thought I'd made the better choice.  It was about a 1.5 mile walk to/from Disneyland, Downtown Disney, and California Adventure - which might be a bit much for most families, especially in the summer heat.  However, there's a bus stop for a service that will take you to/from the front gates for a reasonable rate.  It was disappointing that the hotel didn't offer a shuttle to the resorts in the area, or the airport.  With regards to the room, we were in a two-bed setup, and it was the "old"
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We strive to have excellent customer service every day. With that said, I will ensure to take all your points mentioned to our team. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: In the heart of Disneyland - but not too close
Summary: I stay at this hotel at least once a year, and I have for years. It's a full service hotel, so it offers many amenities. I recommend staying on the concierge level if you're not a Gold Elite or Platinum member.  As a regular traveler I use the benefits of the concierge level to obtain complimentary hot breakfast, fruit and snacks - if you make the time this can save you money by avoiding paying for breakfast in the park.  Additionally, free sodas, water, juice and fruit throughout the day are nice, especially if you're just grabbing something on the way out to the park.  Of all the Marriott properties I've stayed and enjoyed the concierge service, I've never seen it abused like it is at this hotel.  It's original international intent is a perk to attract business travelers, that
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write us a review. We will take all the points you've mentioned into consideration. We hope to see you soon again!  Best, Dan

Summary: I stayed at the mar riot from 23 July 2014 for 5 nights.  My room wasn't ready so i had to wait for 2 hours after a long flight from UK.  I thought the hotel was busy so i didn't say anything.  The rooms need to be updated and the rooms were not that clean.  Next morning i went for breakfast and got charged for it even though it was included in the booking. I had to go back to my room to get the booking to confirm it was included. There was no apology and the service wasn't good at all.  This  happened throughout my stay and i was advised that it would be taken care off when i get the final invoice. I got the final Invoice and had to wait in a line of 20 people to get my point across.  The bill was sorted out but all the hassle and tie wasting for something that wasn't my fault.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear of your less than stellar experience with our hotel. Summary: My wife and I spent a week here for a convention.  It was very convenient for the local attractions and the business facilities were more than adequate.  Starbucks in the lobby is a plus, and the food in the lobby bar was good as well.  Rooms were clean, a little tight on space but it wasn't bad.  We were on a low floor with no view so I can't speak to that.  If we return to this area I would consider this a good option.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write us a review. We're pleased to hear that you had a satisfying experience while staying with us. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary: Our room had 2 double beds and was roomy enough. However the bathroom and toilet were really really small. You could here people next door and also above us when they moved chairs across the floor. The rooms were clean and serviced daily. The staff were very nice and helpful. We didn't lie the menu at the restaurant. It was very limited so we holy snacked there once and ate out for the rest of the week. There is a Pizza Hut, Starbucks and a cafe inside the hotel which is very convenient. Most shuttles t attractions stop out front or about 5 minute walk away so it is conveniently located. Disneyland is only a few minutes up the road via a shuttle which cost $5 for a day ticket.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We're working hard every day to ensure that all of our guest experience an enjoyable stay with us. We'll take your feedback into consideration.  Best, Dan

Summary: Brilliant hotel very close to Disneyland.  I think it's very good value for money.  We had 2 rooms on the 16th floor of the Oasis tower - and one of the rooms had views over Disneyland and we were able to see both the fireworks and water shows.  The rooms were very clean with ample space. The beds were extremely comfortable.   The only downside was that one of the rooms did not have a safe.  The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly.  They were also very accommodating on the final day when I wanted to keep one of the rooms until we left for the airport.  This allowed us to use the pool and visit Disneyland for one last time - and have a nice shower and change before leaving for a late flight back home.  There is a Starbucks at the hotel - but it is very pricey.  One
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive review! We're so pleased to hear that you had a satisfying experience with us. We look forward to serving again in the future.  All my best, Dan

Summary: Recently had to spend a week in this hotel.  Rooms are very small twenty years out of date and quite stained and maintenance challenged.  Hotel is under some restoration but at this point is a very poor deal.  If you need to be nearby the Hilton across the street is a far better place.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write us a review. We've recently undergone some construction and we're working hard to fix all the odds and ends. If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable please feel free to send me a private message.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here as a family of 5 so had a double queen room plus rollaway. Our first room overlooked the Carpark and was dark but they moved us to a bigger room on the 16th floor after the first night with a view over towards Disneyland so that we could see the fireworks and gave us free bags of popcorn and a free movie voucher. There's a pool here which is quite dated but perfectly ok, a gym, Starbucks and a bar. You can walk to Disney in 15-20 minutes and there are lots of restaurants all around. Half the price of a Hotel in Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review! We're pleased to hear that your experience with us was satisfying. We hope to serve you again soon.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: I recently stayed here with my family on a trip to Disneyland. At first glance the hotel is very impressive, and being next to the convention center you can tell it's geared for business people. The lobby is very clean and welcoming, and the dining area stayed busy well into the night. We had just a slight trouble with their elevator system (the buttons call the elevators from the outside rather than inside the elevator), but nothing major. The staff was friendly and catered to our every need. Definitely will try to stay here again on our next trip!
Manager Response: We truly appeciate you taking the time to write us a positive review. We're pleased to hear that you had a satifying experience with us. We look forward to serving you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary: Took my daughter to Disneyland and stayed at the Anaheim Marriott. The hotel was great. The people were very nice. Hotel was beautiful and the beds were very comfortable.  After a day running around Disneyland it was great coming back to a great hotel with a bed you could call asleep in fast.  They had public transportation to Disneyland right from the front of the hotel. If you were like us and don't feel like driving this is the perfect hotel.
Manager Response: Hi, Kim,  Thank you for the positive review! We're happy to hear that you and your daughter had a pleasant experience with us. We hope that you choose The Marriott Anaheim again when you're in the area.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: The staff is very friendly and helpful.   The beds and pillows are comfortable.  Come here for visiting Disney, but don't plan too spend much time at the hotel.  The pool is uninspiring, the restaurants are all closed for renovation, and just 1main outlet in the middle if lobby open.  If your expecting more than smiling people and a comfortable bed, then stay in Newport or Laguna.
Manager Response: We appreciate the honest review. We work hard daily to have excellent customer service, so we will definitely take your feedback into consideration. We hope that choose to stay with us again in the near future!  Best, Dan

Summary: Our stay at this was just an overnight before heading to the airport. First off, the advanced elevator system was both entertaining and efficient. The bathroom very small and needed substantial renovations. The room was very clean but was missing a chair and luggage stand. Finally the air conditioner was not very effective so we were pretty warm all night. but we managed.
Manager Response: Hi, Kristopher,  We appreciate your honest feedback. We pride ourselves in customer service, and we will work hard to ensure that all your points are taken into consideration. We hope to serve you again in the near future.  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, great location, awesome service!
Summary: My husband and I stayed here when he was in town for a conference. The location is fantastic if you want to squeeze in a trip to Disneyland or California Adventure. It's only about an hour drive to LA if you wan to do the tourist thing there. There are a ton of restaurants, some within walking distance. We also ate in the hotel restaurant a couple of times and were pleasantly surprised that we loved the food. The servers were great. We would definitely stay in this hotel again if we were in the area.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate all the positive feedback. We're pleased to hear that you had an enjoyable experience staying with us. We hope to see you again soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Not bad, but not the best Marriott experience I've had.
Summary: I've done a lot of traveling this year for business and have stayed at several Marriott properties.  At the end of July, I stayed at the Marriott Anaheim for a five day/four night stay.  The primary purpose of my trip was to attend a Conference that was being held at this location.  This property seemed older with smaller guest rooms, or at least the room I stayed in (Room 1446) seemed smaller than the rooms I have stayed in at other Marriott properties.  My room was clean, although I did have to ask for extra toiletries.  In my past 2-3 stays at various Marriott properties, including this one, for some reason they only leave one bar of soap in the bathroom, so I have to ask for a second bar, so I can keep one at the sink and put one in the shower.  The Marriott staff that I

Summary: We recently stayed three nights at this property. From the minute we arrived until we checked out it was an excellent experience. The Staff was very pleasant and the entire property was very clean. We will stay here again and I recommend this to anyone thinking about a trip to Disneyland. However If you have more than two young children you will want a larger room.  This room was adequate for just the two of us. The only real down side for us was the beds as they would slide on the box spring---it was a little strange. They do have a restaurant, bar and Starbucks on the property and they were very nice--we used all three. They do charge for the WiFi which I found different as we just stayed at two other Marriott Properties and the internet service was free. But again overall it
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review. We're happy to hear that you had an exceptional experience staying with us. We hope to see you soon!  Best, Dan

Summary: we arrived here for family stay, no wifi access in the room, room too small for 3 of us.  Hotel is outdated needs a upgrade.  Had to call a couple of times for toiletries etc… but they responded right away and also gave us a free courtesy nuts and water treats.  Okay stay could have been better   We stayed for a week.  Location was good.  As close to the orange county mall, restaurants so not bad location
Manager Response: We appreciate the time you took to write us an honest review. We pride ourselves in excellent customer service, so we'll be sure to take your feedback into consideration. We hope you choose to stay with us again when you're in the area.  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Old and in need of an update
Summary: Booked to stay here for 3 nights to do Disney etc. Arrived and first impression was old and outdated. Inside the reception areas were ok and bar was quite nice but when we arrived in the room this was very small for the four of us and did need updating! We stayed here for one night and then transferred to the Hilton across the road - much nicer!
Manager Response: Thank you for the honest review. We've recently undergone construction and are working hard daily to fix all the odds and ends. We will definitely take all of your feedback into consideration.  Best, Dan

Summary: Stayed here for a conference recently.  Received a good room rate and asked for an upgrade when I arrived.  Being a Marriott Rewards member was hoping for a free upgrade (no such luck), they wanted to charge an extra $20 per night for a slightly larger room.  Didn't realize until later that I should have asked for a room that faces the Disney fireworks each night.  Instead, had a beautiful view of a dirty roof.  The hotel in general seemed clean and was more of a city with Starbucks, Pizza hut, fedex store, etc.. Seemed very business like with not many amenities.  Bathrooms need to be upgraded, but found the bed and pillows to be comfortable.  A/C wasn't very good - just kept running and never got completely cold.  With proximity to Disney, there were a lot of kids with very
Manager Response: Hi, Nate,  We appreciate the honest review. We pride ourselves in excellent customer service, and we'll definitely take all of your feedback into consideration. We hope you choose The Marriott Anaheim again soon.  Thanks, Dan

Summary: Prime location at convention center.   easy safe walk to Disneyland resort and downtown Disney.  Rooms well maintained, clean and spacious.  Concierge lounge worth the upgrade for free water, snacks sodas, breakfast, desserts and early evening appetizers.
Manager Response: We appreciate your postive review. We're pleased to hear that you had an exceptional stay with us. We hope you book another stay with us soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Very close to Disney and good for families
Summary: We stayed here on our way to San Diego for a couple of nights.  Hotel is always busy because of its location.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Room was large and we had a perfect view over Anaheim. If your planning to visit Disney or have a convention this is your hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review. We're happy to hear that you and your family had a satisfying experience with us. We hope you book another stay with us soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: An Old Marriott with some great new features
Summary: We were lucky with our time of arrival. We had great front desk service from Therese and were well taken care of. We noticed over the next several days, long lines at the front desk often.  This Marriott has a new elevator system that takes a little to figure out at first but is very efficient and effective for moving lots of people and not having long waits.    The rooms are clean and the beds are super comfy for a good nights sleep. They are old looking and the bathrooms are really small, but the shower heads are great with super water pressure.  The hotel is so close to so much and a $5 bus ride to Disney or a nice long walk to Disney. The hotel itself only has one restaurant that is pretty much just open to the lobby.  It's great for a convention hotel, maybe not so much for
Manager Response: Hi, Sue,  Thank you for taking the time to write us a review. We've recently undergone some construction, and are working hard to fix any odds and ends. We will definitely take your feedback into consideration.  Best, Dan

Summary: Attended a conference at hotel.  Fortunately we arrived at off time for such a large conference as check in line was always long when we walked by, front desk seemed under staffed all weekend.  Nice, spacious, clean room.  Courteous, polite staff.  Bit of a walk to parks but not bad.  All in all nice business stay.
Manager Response: Hi, Denise,  Thank you for the feedback. We pride ourseleves in excellent customer service, so I'm pleased to hear that you were satisfied with our staff and services. We hope you book another stay with us in the near future.  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: OK Marriott Property - Beware of the Fees
Summary: This was my second stay at this Anaheim Marriott (for a convention).   Check-in: Traveling with a group, we always call ahead and make sure our keys are ready before arrival (which we did on this trip, about 2 hours prior to arriving at the Anaheim Marriott). However, the front desk didn't know where our keys were, leading to about 15 minutes of confusion and security threatening to tow our motorcoach (with ~50 people on board) unless we moved.  Once the keys were provided, we easily made our way to the rooms (LOVE the new elevator system).  The rooms are very well appointed - we had a Luxury Suite for our group and it was one of the nicer hospitality suites we've had at a Marriott property.  The one thing that erks me about this property is the number of fees charged for every
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review. Could you please private message me with your full name and dates you stayed so that we can do some research on our end? Also if you could provide your rewards number that might help too.  Best, Dan

Summary: We had a great convention experience at the Marriott Anaheim and the convention center. Location was so convenient to not only the surrounding hotels but restaurants outside the hotel/convention center as well as getting to Disney was a breeze! Walking distance!! The hotel took great care of us. My only negative is the lack of restaurants on site but I think they are under construction.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Our hotel is currently undergoing a major $11M renovation that includes a complete re-design of the lobby, guest registration, restaurant, bar, pool deck and guest rooms. The public space areas are almost finished and the guest rooms will be completed by mid-December. Hopefully this will alleviate any concerns about our rooms in the future.  Best, Dan

Summary: I stayed for 4 nights while in town for business. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is very large and has a Starbuck's and sandwich shop in the lobby for snacks. The room was nice and roomy and very clean. Plenty of restaurants in the area even within walking distance.  They were performing some upgrades to the elevators so elevator travel was very slow but it has to be done sometime.  The only issue I encountered was the self parking, the card that they gave me never allowed me out of the parking lot so I had to always call for assistance which usually consisted of a 10 minute wait.  Other than that no complaints the ground were beautiful spacious felt safe and conveniently located.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback. We'll be sure to take all the points mentioned into consideration.   Best, Dan

Summary: We had a huge convention at the convention center and they hosted a lot of people. The convention brought over 80,000 people to Anaheim and they did it well. I cant believe how smoothly it went. They had extra staff on hand and made it run well. Good job!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write us a positive review. We're pleased to hear that your experience with us was satisfying. We hope you book another stay with us soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary: All I have to say is that I had an excellent stay at this hotel. The staff is super friendly and the location is very convinient. The rooms are clean and of a good size. The bathroom was also very clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review! We strive every day to provide excellent customer service to our guests. We hope you book another stay with us soon.  Best,  Dan

Summary Heading: Sub-par service is not the Marriott way...
Summary: "How Rude!" in my best Stephanie Tanner voice from Full House.   I do not normally write bad reviews and more often than not I'd like to give folks the benefit of the doubt; however, this is my third night in the establishment and it has been disappointing at best. This review will focus mostly on the service from the staff at this hotel...but before I get down to the dirty deets...let me just say that the food and service down at the restaurant (while still under renovation) has been the best part of this trip (and that's not saying much)...we have been eating in a hotel lobby! (so strange eating in a lobby...)  Ok...let's just get down to it... the service has been sub-par for what I know of Marriott, and it seems like my fellow yelpers have experienced this for
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed honest review. I'd like to check into this more. Could you please private message me here with your name and nights you stayed?  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Good location for Disneyland, Great for the Convention center
Summary: We have stayed here many times. The last time we stayed was a little disappointing. Our room wasn't clean and the furnishings were tired and worn. The staff is friendly and took care of the items that needed attention. We unfortunately stayed in a room over very loud machines that were even heard when the doors and windows were shut. The hotel was full so we couldn't move to another room. The tower we stayed was older and needs to be updated. The building was certainly showing it's age and the elevators were having equipment problems.  We have stayed here before in a better room and didn't have the problems, so ask for a newer location away from machines. We would try to stay here again if there was a great offer through the trip advisors site, and make the above mentioned

We have included images of what the new design will look like on this page, and are doing our best to get the word out there. I welcome you back once everything is complete to check out the amazing amenities we offer.  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay for conference attended
Summary: My colleague and I attended a conference and stayed a week at the Marriott Anaheim. Initially we were across the hall from each other but decided on reflection we wanted to have adjoining rooms, we were shifted without any fuss. The staff were thoroughly professional,helpful and courteous throughout our stay and really went the extra mile if we had more complicated query.  We ate at the hotel on several occasions (including room service) and found the food to be excellent. Again, service without fault. The standard of the rooms was excellent and cleaning without fault. The gym was good. We didn't use the pool.  My only gripe would be that I couldn't listen to music in my room (even just by way of playing a radio station through the tv) without paying an expensive fee. I am not a
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review. We're pleased to hear that you had an enjoyable experience with us. We hope to see you soon!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: That guy name Alex (Anaheim Marriot Suites in Garden Grove)
Summary: Chilling on vacation with the family at a very nice hotel. Had a server this morning name Alex and he was the bomb! He was on his "A" game. Glasses stayed filled and he really appears to enjoy what he does! Sometimes with servers you can tell when they are not in the best of moods. Being sat in Alex's area was a great way to start our day.   Way to go my man!!!!!!  D. Lanes

Summary: My family stayed at the Anahiem marriott over Memorial Day visiting Disneyland. Check-in was easy although it was disappointing that a conference group at the hotel prevented me from being upgraded for the stay (I'm a longtime Platinum member), but our standard room turned out to be more than adequate.   The room was quiet and faced away to disneyland - actual overlooking the pool. But in reality, the view was nothing to write home about.   Breakfast at the concierge lounge was great with all that you'd need. Eggs, bacon, breads, cereals, etc. One nice thing - they had children's cups with lids and straws which were great. We even took one to Disney to allow my daughter to have a protected cup!  And finally the location. With a 3 year old, I wouldn't call it walkable, but it's
Manager Response: Thank your for your honest review. We're pleased to hear that The Marriott met all of your needs. We do apologize for any inconvenience you may have dealt with while staying with us. We'll be sure to take all of your points into consideration.   Best, Dan

Summary: Two thumbs up for Lindsey and Jennifer! Me and Norma were chaperons of 19 kids attending the Key Club Convention. Lindsey and Jennifer made sure that all our trips were well taken care of! Also two thumbs up for Orlando Jones, who made sure that the kids were in good hands at all times! Mind you, we came all the way from Aruba and stayed over for 8 days! Thanks to everybody for their patience and support!!! Hope to see back soon! Regards Edbert Schwengle & Norma Brinkenberg.
Manager Response: Hi, Edbert,  We truly appreciate your honest and positive review. We're pleased to hear that you had a satisfying experience with us. We hope you book another stay with us in the near future!  Best, Dan

When we checked in, it was if we were dropped into an episode of "Dance Moms." Pixies everywhere with their hair pulled so tightly into buns they'll never need botox. Their intense mothers buzzing around them sipping their fifth Starbucks of the day. Crazy crowds. Lobby always packed with people and suitcases. My check-in belied the proximity to the Happiest Place on Earth. In room wifi overpriced considering it was slower than lines for Radiator Springs Racers.   What went right? The rooms are
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm sorry to hear that you didn't have a great experience. We'll review with the internal team to assure this can be used as learning.

Summary: Very nice hotel with great convention facilities on site, even though it's right next to the Anaheim Convention Center.  Public areas are well maintained, rooms are nice, towels are soft, staff are very friendly and helpful.  Great location, walking distance to many restaurants and Disneyland.   Food at the restaurant was very good. I had salmon one night and sea bass another night, both were excellent, though the seafood was a bit pricy. A friend had the lobster grilled cheese sandwich and said it was very good as well.
Manager Response: We appreciate the positive review. We're happy to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us. We hope to see you again soon!  Thanks, Dan

Clean rooms, nice view, coffee in room, room service, staff to bring is extra towels and shampoo. Thank you for making it easy for my family to focus on Disney activities

Should have researched it myself as it was a 10 to 15 minute walk away but right at the gate of the convention centre  The Super Shuttle took 40 minutes to get us from the Airport to the hotel and I was a bit worried when I saw the queue at reception and though that our check in would take forever but my fears were unfounded... in barely 10 minutes we were in our rooms.   The rooms had two beds, which I moved together and had a nice balcony overlooking the pool.   The beds were very high and a bit too uncomfortable. The management should look into making them more comfortable

Summary Heading: Great for a Disney Vacation or Visit to the Anaheim Area
Summary: This was my second stay at the Marriott Anaheim. My first was for a respiratory therapy convention. My first experience was great, which helped my family make the decision to return here for our vacation to Disneyland. I must say that this hotel really is centered on making their guests comfortable, relaxed and happy. The front desk attendant, Monica was the first to greet us. She did an outstanding job. She went above and beyond to find us a room with a view of the Disney fireworks. She even took the time to chat with my 6 year old son and brought him a few fun items to keep him occupied and entertained. Once Monica found our room, she realized that it needed to be serviced by housekeeping. Therefore, we weren't going to be able to take our luggage up to our room at that time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a detailed positve review. We pride ourselves in having excellent customer service, so we're happy to hear that you had a satisfying experience with us.  Best, Dan

Summary: My family is full of Marriott fans and we are rewards members.  With that said,  this one needs some work.  I'm not too crazy uptight about hotels,  but I do like a semi decent shower.  Water temp was fine.  Pressure was awful, shower head was a joke.  I normally wouldn't even notice a shower head,  but this was so bad it was crazy.  It is so loose that you couldn't really get it to spray in any particular direction and you'd find yourself standing in the back right corner of the tub, almost leaning out, to stay under the head (we were in #468 of the garden wing).  The internet connection blows.  It's definitely not worth paying for the wifi if you're out here.  There is no connection that works and you'll be mad you spent the money.  Maybe it's less of a problem of the hotel is
Manager Response: Hi, Nicole,  Thank you for the detailed and honest review. We apologize for any inconvenience that you experienced while staying with us. If there's anything I could do for you, please feel free to send me a private message. We'll be sure to take all of your feedback into consideration.  Best, Dan

Summary: Stayed in this property for nearly a week while on business in Los Angeles area. If you have business in the Orange Co. area, this property is ideal. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are quiet and clean. The hotel is located close to the freeway and Disney and Angels Stadium are both within walking distances. Lots of non-fast food chain restaurants are within walking distance as well. The staff was courteous and helpful.
Manager Response: We appreciate the positive review. We're pleased to hear that your stay with us was exceptional. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Lots of noise from the outside bar area.
Summary: Nice hotel overall. The food was nice in the bar and service was great. Two things that we had issues with were the parking system and the noise coming from the outside restaurant bar area. No one explained at check in that once we left the parking structure we had to reinsert our parking ticket each time we returned. After having the machine tell us we owed $48 we had to return to the desk and find out what had happened. No one could figure out what went wrong so we just got another ticket. So it happened again, had to truck all the way back to the front desk again. Finally someone called someone and they told us we had to insert this ticket in the machine when we returned to the parking structure so it could keep track of the exits. All made sense once someone told us.
Manager Response: Thank you for the detailed and honest review. Summary: Following a bad start to our visit - our confirmed rooms with concierge access were re-allocated to other guests - the reception staff were extremely apologetic and went out of their way to try and set us up with 2 'similar' rooms.  Although we were extremely annoyed, our 'new' rooms were great and during our 3 night stay we were well looked after, and received some complimentary items and services.  It is a nice hotel and the location to Disneyland makes it an ideal venue for short leisure breaks.  Most of the on site amenities are pretty good but if there is one thing that could be improved is the internet access.  The Premium service - when it feels like connecting - is slow and doesn't live up to it's advertised billing.  Overall, we ended up having an enjoyable stay and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're pleased to hear that you had an enjoyable stay with us. We hope to see you again soon.  Best, Dan

Summary: Myself, my boyfriend, and his 9 year old son stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. We did two days at the park. The first day we walked and it took a little over 15 minutes. The second day we purchased the shuttle tickets ($12 for the 3 of us) and that was worth it. We were just tired from walking by then! We spent one day relaxing by the pool. It was very nice! We also made use of Cafe Del Sol, Degrees, and Starbucks. All were nice dinning options to have on site. There is a nice shopping complex (Garden Walk) about a 10 minutes walk away. It has a PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza, Etc. In terms of the room, the balcony was a plus and it was fairly quiet. However, the bathroom was tiny! Only one person at a time getting ready. Also, the new
Manager Response: We truly appreciate you taking the time to write an honest and positive review. We strive to have excellent customer service daily, so I'm pleased to hear that you had an enjoyable experience with us. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Dan

Summary Heading: Good for leisure, not for business
Summary: As an Elite Marriott member, I have to say that this property confuses me.  The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the variation for mood lightning is a really nice touch.  The staff was friendly (albeit somewhat aloof) and the food in the restaurants was really good for "hotel food."  Obviously, it's a great location if you have a conference at the convention center and there is a nice variety of restaurants within walking distance.  So why the 3 stars?  WiFi is horrific.  They charge $12.95 a day for 4MBS wifi - to put that in layman's terms, it's terrible.  The upgrade of $17 a day brings you to 12 MBS which is ok for email, but don't plan on streaming any media or Netlix.  The signal was spotty as well - it made for an EXTREMELY difficult time to get any work done.  I
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm sorry to hear that your accomodations did not meet your expectations. We'll review with the internal team to verify the highlighted opportunities. I appreciate your comments and we hope you'd give us another chance if your travels ever bring you back to the city of Anaheim.  Best regards, ~ Dan S.

Summary: Marriott is our preferred hotel. The front desk is very nice and helpful. We were upgraded to a suite. Dare I say it was too big? No complaints here at all!  There wasn't a robe in my room so my husband notified them and it was in my room before I finished dinner.  To get to Dinsneyland, we took the shuttle. It's only $5 a day and right out front. Unfortunatley, the restaurant was closed since it was slow the night we ate in. We ate in the bar area. The atmosphere was great. The food is good.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate you taking the time to write us a positive and honest review. We're pleased to hear that you didn't have any complaints while staying with us. We hope to serve you again in the near future.  Best, Dan

Summary: I seriously have a problem every time I visit Anaheim to go to Disneyland trying to choose a place to stay that is decent, not too far from the parks and not going to break the bank. The options are so poor, and while I love staying at the Disney properties I cannot always afford to. Finding this place was a gem! This hotel is professional, clean, comfortable and close enough to Disney for my taste. You will NOT be disappointed. The staff was super friendly and professional. The room was very clean and a nice size.   A little tip, if you walk down the street to the parking lot for Disneyland, you can take the bus into the parks, very close walk!
Manager Response: We truly appreciate you taking the time to share you positive experience with us. We're pleased to hear that our hotel met all of your standards. We hope you book another stay with us very soon!  Thanks, Dan

Summary Heading: Great location to Disney and convention center
Summary: We stayed here for eight days and if there for a convention or Disney it's a great location  The room was a corner room and we saw fireworks every evening from Disneyland . It was clean and modern but not the best we have stayed in.  It was directly across from the Hilton and the convention center. We were there for both a convention and to go to Disneyland .The hotel provides a shutter to Disney which cost 5 dollars a person which is an excellent deal. It ran so frequently that both coming and going we didn't have to wait more than 5 or 10 minutes. You pay at the hotel not on the shuttle. There's a Starbucks, Pizza Hut, deli, two restaurants and room service. We ordered room service a few time but had most of our meals outside the hotel. Sadly I was disappointed each time. My
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad to hear that you will return next time you're in Anaheim. Best regards, ~ Dan S.

Summary: I arrived at the Marriott for a day-long conference.  I did not anticipate staying at the hotel, but when I explained to the staff that I was a nursing mother with a newborn and inquired where I would be able to pump for the day, they offered me full-day complimentary use of one of their rooms.  Pros:  Rooms are clean and well appointed.    Staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful.  Good restaurant and cafe inside hotel.  Excellent location.  Cons:  None  My husband and I will be back to stay the weekend at this hotel - very impressed!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying with us, I really appreciate your comments. Best regards, ~ Dan S.

Summary: I stayed for two nights on business and had a pleasant stay. Check in was quick and the customer service was very good. The room was cozy with a nice firm bed and pillows that had some form to them and supported my neck. The fitness center was very nice with lots of treadmills, free weights, and machines. Fruit and water were included as well for a nice post workout snack. There are many restaurants within a short car ride. Disneyland is right across the street. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: It's nice to hear that you'd stay with us again, I'm glad you had a pleasant stay. Thank you, ~ Dan S.

Summary Heading: Very convenient to convention center and Hilton
Summary: This is a nice, clean and relatively new property that is very convenient to the Anaheim convention center. I had an event at the Hilton and it was convenient to that as well. It's about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland Park.  There wasn't anything about this hotel that set it apart in my mind, but it was a good stay. They don't have a spa, but they do have a Starbucks :-)
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying with us, I hope you'll return. Best regards, ~ Dan S.

Check in: I asked the front desk gentleman for a room with a king bed and no ajoining doors, as we travel a lot and in these old hotels I am aware sound travels through the perimeter of the door. He stated he normally didn't work there and would have to ask another clerk for assistance. A woman approached and said the room she was giving me was a non ajoining room. The Bellman took me to the room and not only was it an ajoining room it was also a disabled room. I went back to the front desk and explained what had happened to another clerk who apologized and said he was now giving me a really good room. I get to that room and open the curtains to find I'm on the same level as the air conditioners, which are pretty loud. My husband goes down
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm sorry to hear that you didn't have a great experience.  We'll review with the internal team to assure this can be used as a teaching moment.  I appreciate your comments.   Best regards, ~ Dan S.

Summary Heading: Very disrespectful and definitely not a four star hotel.
Summary: I have never been more disrespected by a hotel in my life. They not only treated my badly because I booked through a third party, which I usually do, but I had one girl straight out tell me they don't consider third party guest actual guests when it comes to accommodating us. I was so upset. On top of all the disrespectful I had to deal with, half the stuff in the hotel was closed and nutting was very clean. But the disrespect really did it for me. Especially after how much money I spent at there hotel to know that I wasn't even considered a guest to then.

Summary Heading: Service is not good.. We asked for towel never got called later the PM manger was rude ...
Summary: I would never stay here again , very disappointed with Marriott all together. I also this for as offended I was there should have been more than sorry. Next time back to the Grand where you receive more than expected service from all .

Summary: Lobby & common areas updated & sleek. Room was comfortable but show some signs of wesr.pleasant pool which was often busy Ate at casual restaurant decent selection . Best point is proximity to convention center
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad to hear you had a nice stay. Best regards, ~ Dan S.

Summary: The staff at this hotel are absolutely amazing. Very upbeat, energetic and clearly take their jobs seriously. From my check-in until my check-out 5 days later, I could not find a thing wrong. In addition to the staff, the hotel was clean and the food absolutely delicious. If I had to make a suggestion, it would simply be get more umbrellas for pool time. I made sure to find time even during work to spend time sitting out by the pool. Poolside service was great, lots of towels and food service awesome. Thank you Marriott for making another stay awesome.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, I really appreciate hearing of your stay with us.  We pride ourselves on our service and I'm glad you noticed.   Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Great hotel but the rooms aren't a bit small
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a conference this month and it was very accommodating. The lobby is large and open with fruit infused water for a refreshment!  The concierge desk workers were very friendly and there are computer/printers in the lobby to print your boarding pass.  The conference center was great and was definitely easy to get around.  The hotel had a $5 shuttle to Downtown Disney but it wouldn't be a bad walk either.    The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was a fridge too, which was nice to keep water cold, in addition to a coffee maker.  The only down side was the toilet paper was hard to find (it's under the sink counter) and this was likely due to the tiny bathroom.  I felt a bit claustrophobic in there. The room was a bit small too and
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience, It's so nice to hear that you had a nice stay and will return to stay with us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: The hotel needs a facelift. It looks old and tired. Pool view room on 9th floor very noisy at night. Prople can stay out by the pool til midnight and the voices carry up. I could hear everything and got no sleep 2 of the 4 nights I stayed there. No gift shop to buy a magazine, bannanas green at coffee shop. Prices at the bar rediculous. Went to the Hilton for drinks and snacks. Would stay at Hilton next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your stay.  We do have a gift shop on property, I'm surprised that you didn't see it.  Next time, ask the front desk and they'll be happy to help you find what you need. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: This hotel is awesome.  I stay here all the time for work and it's always nice.  I called ahead and asked for an upgrade this time as a Platinum member since I was traveling with my family.  They gave us a great suite.  Everyone is always very nice and helpful at this hotel.  I will continue to start here every time I am in the area for work or if I return for a pleasure trip.  I would recommend this to anyone traveling for work or vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being a loyal guest, I'm so glad to hear that you'll return. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: My stay at the Marriott Anaheim was part of an auction package I won at my children's school gala. I had no expectations other than a clean room in a safe & reliable hotel chain located near-ish to Disneyland.  Even so, the ambience, decor and staff at the Marriott Anaheim blew us away! We are well travelled, and have stayed at many of the true luxury brand hotels, including Ritz Carlton, Mandarin, Four Seasons, L'Auberge and One & Only.  From the moment I contacted the hotel to redeem our certificate, Anne Maselli went above and beyond any expectation I could have had. Upon learning we were a family of five, she noted the hotel's low occupancy and moved us from the single room specified on our gift certificate to two adjoining rooms. At check-in we found that we'd been further
Manager Response: Congratulations on winning your auction package.  I'm so glad to hear that Anne took such great care of you and will share your comments with the management team.  Thank you for sharing your experience with other travelers, I hope you'll stay with us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a convention this week.  This was one great hotel!    I am a frequent Marriott traveler (Gold Status)!  And have been to hotels across the country!  I checked into the hotel and found the front desk staff to be extremely polite, courteous and helpful!    I decided to grab a bit to eat prior to going to my room... found the pool area/eating to be a little outdated and I was not impressed.  Needs more color and "umphf" to this area.  Immediately, I was not impressed (as this tends to be one of more updated areas in hotels).    I then went over to the lobby and then to my room and was immediately impressed.  I got a corner room on the 15th floor!  Very, very impressive!  The room was large and very well decorated!    I also used the concierge lounge and
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal Gold Member, we really appreciate it.  Thank you for the compliments, we pride ourselves on our friendly staff and glad you had an impressive time.  I hope you'll return and stay with us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Larger property shows signs of age but still nice
Summary: I had a great room at this hotel, a larger corner room on a high floor and it was great.  It was big, plenty of room, with two (count 'em two) balconies.  The room was quiet, slept great.  They are talking about renovating the restaurant and that'll help -- the one dining room labyrinthine, and in general the service was off bost in the restaurant and in the bar.  I was there as part of a big convention, which may have impacted the quality of the service, but as a convention hotel I would have expected them to take it in stride.  All in all though it was a good stay, and I loved the location.  The front desk staff was awesome.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, it's great to hear that you had a good stay.  I hope you'll be back. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay close to the Park
Summary: I love staying at this hotel! It's in a great location that's close to Disneyland, but not so close you get the noise and crowds. We stayed here during Memorial Day weekend and it was incredible.
