Always great service, the rooms are spacious and clean, the only downside is that the Starbucks line is out of control in the mornings, something which isn't the hotel's fault but still a bummer. Great location, incredibly clean and friendly, attentive staff. I will always stay here first, if possible!
Manager Response: I'm delighted to hear of your excellent and incredible stay.  Thank you. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Big hotel atmosphere and no free wifi in the rooms
Summary: If you want to stay at a big hotel chain then this is perfect for you. I personally prefer the Sheraton around the corner as it has more of a personalized feel and the staff are more relaxed and not on guard like at this hotel. Replace the fake smiles with genuine ones please!
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your stay with us.  We genuinely like to smile at our guests to it's disappointing to hear that you didn't feel warmly greeted. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Close enough to walk to eat, shop, and Disney.  Drinks were expensive. The convenience of accessibility to the convention center was amazing and the night view was gorgeous. Only down fall was no free wifi and once we paid for it there was still network issues that interfered with the connection.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad to hear it was well worth it for you and hope you'll come stay with us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here on our trip, 21-27th may we chose this hotel mainly as I had read it was within a good distance to disney and not too expensive. Check in was great we arrived at about 9:30 at night so it wasn't busy at all, we didn't have to wait in line and the woman on the desk was really helpful. As stated in a previous review the front desk is a bit of a walk from the self parking car park, which is fine usually but with heavy cases it wasn't so great, and would probably use the valet service next time.   We ordered room service one night, the food was pretty good and it came much quicker than expected. We also used the Pizza Hut in the hotel once for a quick late lunch, this wasn't open all the time though and seemed to be open mainly on the weekend.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.  Other travelers will benefit from you detailed review. Best regards,. ~Apryl

Summary: It was a very nice hotel, very helpful staff and friendly...  Room are nice and comfortable too. There are shuttle busses for you to travel from the hotel to Disneyland... You can actually walk to disneyland. If you drive, there's plenty of parking space available at the hotel...
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us I really appreciate your comments.  I hope you'll visit us again.  Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: We stayed here two nights a few weeks ago before staying four nights next door at the Courtyard.   We thought the room was very nice and comfortable. Our room had a deck which was great! We were on the 5th floor facing the Hilton but I suspect that the rooms on the upper floors may have a view of the Disneyland fireworks. The only negative about our room for us was that as other reviewers have mentioned - the walls are thin! On both mornings, I could hear our neighbors radio loud and clear. The first morning  I actually thought it was ours.   We walked from the hotel to Disneyland entering on the Downtown Disney side. Walking briskly, it took us I believe 18 minutes to get to the entrance of the Grand Californian Hotel, which you can walk through to enter the middle of Downtown
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind remarks and for staying with us.  I really appreciate it and hope you will be back again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: The hotel staff was excellent on accommodating an over booking of the hotel upon our arrival.  They placed us in a room with a great balcony over looking the Disneyland fireworks at night.  The hotel itself was a great location able to walk to many restaurants, stores or Disneyland itself.  Hotel staff was more than willing to answer and help with any and all questions.  The banquet rooms were nice the food was ok.   Our room was very clean and nicely comfortable, even with double beds in place of a king size we opted to remain in our room the entire trip.  One nice feature is the elevators were not slow paced as in many other locations for our conferences.  I would highly suggest this as a place to stay for family or business.
Manager Response: I'm glad you enjoyed your stay for your convention.  Thank you and I hope you return again.  Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: Maybe I don't get out enough, because I was surprised by the technological improvements. The room was very much Internet ready. I saw what looked like a video cable for displaying one's laptop screen on the TV. There were also multiple electrical outlets and a connections to the TV, including HDMI. The elevators are being converted to floor pre-selection. That means that you select your floor before you even enter the elevator. That helps if it's crowded because you don't have to reach over someone or yell out your floor. The room door had a proximity sensor and the key cards were plain white (no one knows what hotel you are staying at by just looking at your key card). A proximity sensor means that you just hold the card near the sensor (no swiping).  I forgot to leave a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying with us.  I really appreciate your detailed account of your stay and other guest will appreciate your information.  I hope you'll return and visit us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Great conference facilities, but otherwise stay elsewhere
Summary: I was at a five-day conference at the Marriot Anaheim. On the positive side, the conference facilities are terrific, with lots of meeting rooms and public spaces. However, the hotel has little else to distinguish it, other than being close to Disneyland. Check-in was understaffed, with a long wait line. We were offered bottled water by the friendly staff as we waited and waited. Rooms are typical Marriot, a bit overpriced, but fine. My biggest problem was meals other than the conference meals. The hotel's restaurants, other than the bar, close if they don't have adequate occupancy. There are no sandwich/lunch type restaurants for snacks. The pizza shop off the lobby was closed throughout our stay. The Starbucks was fine for breakfast, but little else. Fortunately, there were
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I appreciate hearing about your experience.  There are other restaurants nearby, next time you're with us just ask the concierge and they'll be happy to direct you to other places to eat. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: This is a fantastic location for a convention. Guest services working  the conventions are extremely attentive.  Restaurants and Disneyland are nearby for after convention hours entertainment.  Parking is not the best, use valet or If you have handicap plates,  there is free parking by the front entrance.  Ask the valet and he'll direct you.    Rooms are clean and adequate, nothing special.
Manager Response: Thank you for your fantastic review and for staying with us.  I hope you'll return and visit us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: We booked a room here last minute for a quick overnight stay during Memorial Day weekend.  We had a room with two double beds and we are a family of four with an 8 and 5 year old.  Room was nice and clean and beds were comfortable but a little small.  Nothing special overall about the room, really just the basic room.   We had a long day so we ordered room service for dinner, and the food was OK, but the service delivery was very good.  We walked over to Downtown Disney for dessert and had a very pleasant and easy walk through the convention center walkways and Disneyland grounds.    We self parked, which is $24/day, and is a bit of a walk to the rooms.  Had we known or asked about the price we would have probably done valet for the extra little bit and just unloaded at the
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that you probably won't be back to stay with us.  Please let me know if there is anything I can assist you with in the future.  Thank you for staying with us. Best regards,  ~Dan S.

Summary: This is Marriott through and through.  Arrived on a Monday evening for a three day conference.  Hotel was very busy and while I had just joined the que to check in the staff was scrambling to check every one in quickly.  The concierge desks were checking in folks, the premium check in desk was opened, and even the Disney ticket sellers were checking in guests.  What looked like it might be 20 minutes or so was 5.  You have to know that by that response this hotel gets it.  Can't think of a major issue in the 3 days I was there.  Only negative is the size of the hotel.  Several wings and a tower.  Took me the three days to find my way around.  But I'm sure if I had asked they would have shown me around.  Great bedding, lovely and quite room, upscale shampoo ect, plush towels, got
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I appreciate your nice comments.  I hope you'll stay with us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: Your standard convention center hotel, which wouldn't have been so bad if we hadn't been put in a room overlooking the air handlers, which had a tendency to squeal loudly at 3am. The insult to injury here was that (a) I am a marriott member, (b) although I was out for a conference and paying a slightly lower rate, I came a day early and paid a higher rate the first night, and (c) several of my colleagues got a government rate ($100 less per night than my rate) and they had MUCH nicer rooms overlooking the pool. Really? Would it have hurt the receptionist to put us in a nicer room? This kind of thing has never happened to me at Starwood hotels so my loyalty points will go there next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal guest, I'm sorry to hear of your experience and will be sending you a private message. Best, ~ Dan S.

Summary Heading: When away from home they make you feel at home
Summary: I travel 4 days a week for work. I have been staying now at the Anaheim Marriott suits for the last couple of months. The staff is exceptional. I am ALWAYS greeted and welcomed with great warmth. The rooms are clean, large and very quiet. The breakfast is amazing, fresh fruit and made to order omelets. The staff in the dining room are very good. There is one staff member Leo who is the best. He anticipates my needs, very attentive with out being intrusive. I will be continuing my stay there till July/August. If I need to be away from home, its great being in a place that makes me feel at home.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal guest, I really appreciate your comments.  I'll be sure to share them with the management team.   Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: I stayed here for one night. I arrived and was greeted immediately by staff. Check in was a breeze, front desk agent said I was upgraded to an executive king which was a larger room. I had room 1400. Hotel has upgraded to a new elevator system which was very cool. You type in the level floor and it gives you an elevator in a specific queue that is quickest. Room had large balcony, working desk, chair, coffee maker, and robe. Bed, pillows and shower were great. I've stayed here several times and the staff is top notch, friendly and customer based. The Starbucks is conveniently located in the hotel and food in the cafe was very good. The conference facilities and staff were outstanding. The only downfall is the parking fee. It's within walking distance to downtown Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for the great compliment, I really appreciate it.  I'm glad that we made your stay exceptional. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: great service you can tell that the manager and personal are in
Summary: we arrive 3 days after our reservation and anaheim was quite full, well we search in the whole hotels around trying to stay for those 3 nights noone could help us sheraton try but they do not had the whole nights anyway we decide to make a try in here and for our surprise they get us a room that night the room wasnt pleasure but the next day I visited the front desk and for my great surprise all was just pleasure they give me a room in the 11 floor with a great view the service was great from all at all time the managers front desk office, ballet parking and bell boys were favoluous, and we stay for 2 weeks so let me say was great
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great review, I really appreciate your comments.  I hope you will stay with us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay. Good location for Disneyland
Summary: Well located to Disneyland either by walking or shuttle bus which costs $5 all day.  Rooms comfortable and well maintained. Disappointed a hotel of this size and name only had key lock safes.  Also disappointed dining room was closed although food was available in lounge and bar area.  Seating area around lovely pool very pleasant.  Dining expensive for what you got. Would recommend dining elsewhere.  Staff great.  Overall a pleasant stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I really appreciate your comments.  I'm glad you had a pleasant stay and enjoyed your Disney vacation. Best, ~Dan S.

Summary: First, let me say that we booked at the last second for a last second get away without our kids. The hotel was first class..... However we are not so fancy. I checked in, wearing my Mickey pj's and the girls at the reception desk checked me in with the same great service as they did with the business travelers. Loved that!!!!! The beds are so comfortable. The room was spotless and good size. The only down size was the beds. We had two doubles. I am not complaining, we booked with PL and got the room for 100 a night. This nice of a hotel should up grade to two queens. The room is big enough.   As big Disney fans we usually stay at a hotel that offers free breakfast and parking. As to save our dollars for Disney stuff :)  Marriott charges 24 dollars a night to park again for what
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad you were able to get  your parking charges corrected.  I hope you'll stay with us again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Great hotel to stay at when attending a conference
Summary: The location of this hotel can not be beat when attending a conference at the conference center,  Everyone was very helpful and very pleasant.  We received a lot of great information from William and Arthur and good places to eat.  Walking to Disneyland is about 10 t 15 minutes and it is a very pleasant walk.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying with us.  I appreciate your kind remarks. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Good Value If You Are Headed to Disneyland
Summary: Having stayed at the Grand Californian a number of times, we were after something  convenient, but substantially cheaper for this trip.  We hit on the Marriott based upon reviews on Tripadvisor and other sources.  Overall, we were quite happy with the decision.  The staff was very helpful and cheerful, front desk and bell staff took good care of us and of our stuff.   The rooms were small, but well appointed for the price and the bathrooms were more than passable.  Only the towels could use an upgrade, even at this price point they were less than ideal.  The beds were comfortable, quiet, mainly, and the maid service did a good job--nothing fancy, but well done.  Note that travel to Disneyland is either a 15 minute walk, or, a 5 dollar per day fair on the shuttles.  Once we got
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us for your Disney vacation.  I hope you enjoyed the parks. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Great location, sizeable and quiet rooms
Summary: Went there for a convention, stayed for about 4 days. I was impressed with the friendly efficient staff - both at check-in, valets, and bar staff. Only made use of the bar and breakfast so can't comment on the restaurant: breakfast and bar were good, but felt that the bar could have been bigger (nip over the road to the Hilton for a larger space). Fitness center looked good, the pool looked fun rather than a great location for fitness swimming. Personally I ran round the block - which was a good run. There is a starbucks and a pizza hut on site but plenty of alternative choice within walking distance. Its a way from LAX so would recommend getting the shuttle. Very close to Disneyland.  Thought the bed and room were excellent. My room overlooked the convention center plaza and
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad to hear that you had a nice stay.   Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: If you're visiting Anaheim, odds are you are likely heading to the Disneyland Resort, which means you likely are looking for a hotel that is above average but not a place you're going to be in much, except for sleeping. The Marriott was just that and more.  Located very close to the resort and right next to the Anaheim Convention Center, this is a fantastic location for guests planning on utilizing either the Center or visiting the parks. For a small fee, the Anaheim Resort Transit service is available just outside the lobby and provides frequent shuttles to the Disneyland main gate. Although this hotel is a bit farther from the gate than some more affordable options, it's quality is much higher. You are getting a legitimate hotel room up to Marriott standards, as opposed to a
Manager Response: Thank you for the detailed review, others will certainly benefit from your account of your stay.  Thank you for staying with us. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Great customer service and great place to stay
Summary: Went there for a convention with my wife.  From check-in to check-out it was a great experience.  Room service, restaurants, fitness center, Starbucks, swimming pool, all top notch.  If you want the shuttle it is only $5 per person for as many times you need it per day.  Very close to Disneyland.  The beds are very comfortable and room is very quiet.  We stayed on the 9th floor and did not hear anything.  The only thing is you have to pay for wireless if you are in the room but the lobby WiFi is no cost.  I just drank my Starbucks and kicked back in the lobby.  We will definitely stay there in the future.
Manager Response: I can't thank you enough for the great review.  I hope you'll stay with us again. Best regards,  ~Dan S.

Summary: My wife, son and I stayed for three days two nights at this hotel.  This hotel was one of the best that we have stayed at.  The staff from the beginning to the end of our stay were friendly and helpful.  The proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center was awesome.
Manager Response: Thank you for the compliments!  I hope you will stay with us again.  Best regards,  ~Dan S.

Summary: Stayed here while attend the Citrix Synergy event at Anaheim Convention Center.   This hotel is very close to the Convention Center.   It was nice to be so close.   The rooms are quiet and bed was very comfortable.   I had dinner in the bar - the Cobb salad was fabulous.   Best I have had in a long time.   There is a Starbucks on the lobby level that was great.   I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you, I am so glad to hear that you had a nice stay.  I really appreciate the recommendation.  Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: I've stayed at this Marriott twice now and it never fails to please. The location is very good - about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland (ART shuttle service is available for a fee if you don't want to walk) and close to several good restaurants and the convention center. There is a pool which is partially covered for shade, as well as a hot tub. The bar and restaurant both serve delicious food - our breakfast at the Cafe del Sol (I think that is what it was called) was delicious and our waitress, Nicole, was very sweet and nice. In fact, all the hotel staff was friendly, professional and helpful. The beds are super comfy with pillow tops, clean white linens and fluffy pillows. Definitely a great place to come back to rest at after a busy day at Disney!! NOTE: Also, if you are
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I will pass along your compliments to the team. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: Had to be at the Anaheim Convention Center for business. The hotel is located maybe 100 meters from the entrance which is very convenient. The staff was friendly and the rooms are nice and clean. Enough restaurants and shops nearby for after working hours. A shopping tip are the Outlets at Orange. Located only a few blocks away and open until 9 pm.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your review. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Good location for convention center but...
Summary: Stayed here 3 nights for a conference.  LIKES: Professional staff, clean property, good food in restaurant, good convention center location. Room with 2 beds was large, with computer desk and TV. Bathroom had above average lighting.  DISLIKES: HVAC unit blows air directly at the computer desk, which makes it very drafty. It's also noisy.   Bathroom is very, very, very tiny. Barely OK for one person, impossible for 2. (Example: there is 16 inches between sink counter and toilet, and 16 more between toilet and shower tub.)  There was also a dripping noise in the bath room. Called engineers who came 30 minutes later and concluded it was the light fixture.  While I admit there were a lot of people in the hotel, the walls are exceptionally thin. From my bed, I could hear complete
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We regret that you discovered our accommodations to be less than satisfactory. Please know that our first priority is to provide first class accommodations and make sure our guests are as comfortable as can be. We hope you give us another opportunity in the near future if your travels bring you back to the city of Anaheim. In the mean time we will review your comment and celebrate our hosts for thier service. We will also review the structural opportunities in order to consider future enhancements. Thank you once again

Summary: I admit I did not stay at this property but I had friends I was visiting with who were staying here over the weekend of Wondercon.  The hotel was extremely busy that weekend but all of the staff were professional and friendly.  One person in particular stuck out to my friends and me and it was at the lobby Pizza Hut of all places in the hotel.  We had just snuck in before they closed for the afternoon and you could tell the place had been hit hard with the convention attendees.  Gustavo was finishing ringing us up and started a very friendly conversation with my friends and I about the convention we were attending.  He didn't need to do this and I was surprised he had the energy to even want to talk with us because you could just tell that his day must have been nonstop but he
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience.  I'll be sure to pass on your comments. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but package handling is outrageous
Summary: The Mariott is located next to the convention center, a short walk from Disney and Disney Downtown if you dont want to pay to see the Mouse but want some of the restaurants.   There is a pool and a pleasant outdoor area, and some businesses in the ground floor like Pizza Hut and Starbucks.  The rooms are nicely kitted out and of a decent size, mine had a balcony with a view which is nice as, as a solo male business traveller, you are often given a view of a wall as they assume you wont care about aesthetics.   Its very, very busy but the staff do alright helping the million or so  guests they must check in and out every day. I dont like the Elite check in desk idea much but I suppose thats a corporate decision. It didnt really inspire me to become an Elite member, it just
Manager Response: Your response means a great deal to us and we regret that you found our storage and handling fee's excessive. I am glad that one of our guest representatives were able to reduce the cost. We hope you will allow us to provide you with an exceptional guest experience when your travels bring you back to the city of Anaheim.

Summary: Really enjoyed this hotel.  Close to everything and very convenient - Disney is within walking distance.  I attended a conference there for work and the accommodations met our needs.  Staff were friendly and accommodating.  Overall good experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for always banking on Marriott.   Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: First visit last year was much more enjoyable
Summary: When I checked in I was booked into the older tower. Although the room was nice, Everyone could see into my room & I asked to change. I got moved into the Oasis tower (which is very nice) but the room I got not only had a view over a roof but the bathroom was slanted in such a way that I lost my balance several times. Being that I recently lost my hearing on one side my equilibrium is a bit off so even the slightest slant effects me significantly. The view was horrid, it was the third floor and all I could see was a roof. I decided not to ask for another room since I had just asked to switch so I dealt with it. One of the nights I was there, my room was cleaned but all of the litlte extras like the coffee and sugar was not replaced. I called down and someone came and refilled
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We regret to hear that your stay was less than satisfactory. Please know that our first priority is to provide first class accommodations and make sure our guests are as comfortable as can be. We hope you give us another opportunity in the near future if your travels bring you back to the city of Anaheim. In the mea time we will review our comment with our teams in order to prevent future instances of this nature. Thank you once again.

Summary Heading: Convenient, but needs updating in the older tower.
Summary: I stayed here for a local convention, and the hotel was very convenient to the convention center. This was not my first stay at this Marriott.  Pros: -They've improved their elevator system since our stay a year ago, and it's much speedier. -The front desk staff was accommodating and friendly, as was the bell staff. -The Marketplace Grill in the convention space is reasonably priced and the food is very good. -The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean.  Cons -The rooms were small, and the bathrooms even smaller! -The sliding glass doors on the balconies do not seal very well...there is noise leakage from outside which can be distracting. -The bathrooms need serious modernizing. It's very Motel 6 in there. Seriously, towel rack inside the shower?
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We regret that you discovered our accommodations to be  less than satisfactory. Please know that our first priority is to provide first class accommodations and make sure our guests are as comfortable as can be. We hope you give us another opportunity in the near future if your travels bring you back to the city of Anaheim. In the mean time we will review our comment with our team in order to consider future enhancements. Thank you once again

Summary: Was booked into this hotel by the organizers of the conference I was talking at. At check-in the guy at the desk told me I was in an upgraded room. If the room was up-graded I would hate to see the regular room! Yes the room was large (hard to see the TV from the bed) and it did have a balcony - but it was the standard Marriott with nothing special or new. Same old carpet, same old bathroom with sink area separated by a wall, plain desk and one arm chair. They are working on the elevators so not all were in service. And they closed the shop yesterday so no where to get water or candy other than Starbucks or something called the Market Garden that has limited hours. While I am not that interested in anything Disney, anyone who wants to feel like they are here to see Mickey and Co
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: The hotel is average for my standards - clean, somewhat small, bathroom needed updating. My room did have an empty refrigerator to store my beverages.  Close to Disneyland and convention center.  Good wifi reception in my room.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: We loved our stay at the Marriott , our suite was large enough for us and our young child, the rooms were clean and very comfortable. The location was great, with easy access to Disneyland via the bus service that dropped us off door to door. The pool at the hotel got some good use also :)
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your review.  I'm glad you had a brilliant stay! Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: The staff was friendly and helpful.  I was there as part of a large group. The staff did a very good job of managing the high volume of arrivals with minimal wait times. While not very large, the room was clean and well appointed with additional outlets accommodate the variety of electronic devices we all seem to carry now.    The only downside to my visit was a lack of places to get a snack or drink within the hotel. Starbucks and a gift shop were the only places that I saw open during my stay.
Manager Response: I'm very glad to hear that you had a pleasant visit.  Thank you. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: I stayed at the Anaheim Marriott for 7 nights in April for a Conference.   Conference was located at the Convention center so it made it a great location.   Easy to get to Downtown Disney on the ALT for $5 for the day.   Lots of Cabs available.   Concierge were very helpful with booking my supershuttle back to LAX.   Room was comfortable.  Loved the balcony.   My room was facing the Hilton although I was too low to see all the fire works at Disney every night I could still see the really high ones.  :)    Great for the business traveler.   It has a Fridge in the room but no other equipment that may be needed for a family.  Starbucks located in the hotel which I used and a few other restaurants which I never got a chance to try.   Pool is located in the lobby.    I never used it
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad to hear you had a nice stay.  Other travelers will benefit from your details.  I hope you'll come again. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: I enjoyed my stay at the Marriott Anaheim.  Room was comfortable and clean.  Check in & check out was as usual and anything I asked for was quickly addressed.  I can't say I was "blown away" by the hotel or service or anything astonishing like that.  I can just say...nothing went wrong, I was very comfortable and I enjoyed staying there.  I love to be "wowed" but never expect to be.  I do expect to not have a poor experience, and this place did fulfill that.  I quite enjoyed my stay overall.
Manager Response: I'm so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  Thank you. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: i have high respects for marriott hotels, but this one really is a downer. stayed at this hotel for the wondercon convention. they pretty much charge for everything. 12.95 bucks for 24 hour internet service that doesn't even connect well, considering it is right beside the convention center where a lot of business conventions occur, you would think wi-fi would be free of service. parking is 19 dollars, shuttle is $5 per head. what else won't they charge? service at cafe del sol was horrible. the receptionist was rude and does not care about her job. will not stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear of your experience, we pride ourselves on our service and consistently assure all of our team members treat all of our guests as though they are the only ones in the hotel.  I'll send you a private message now because I want to get to the bottom of things for you.  Thank you for bringing this to my attention. Best,  ~ Dan S.

Summary: We just got back from Disneyland and I must say that our stay at this hotel was absolutely wonderful!   When we first arrived, a young woman with a great smile (I never remember anyone's name, I'm sorry!) checked us in.  I told her I wasn't concerned with the view as long as our room was nice and quiet.  We stayed on the third floor and the room was VERY quiet at night.  It was so nice to have the door shut and not hear anything but the heater or air conditioner kick on.  The room was very small but the beds were very comfortable and everything was clean.  There were also no funky smells.  I have a very sensitive nose and an entire stay can be ruined by a stinky room.  It was nice to only smell the bleach on the bedding when I laid down and no weird air fresheners trying to mask
Manager Response: I really enjoyed reading your detailed review, thank you so much.  Other guests will benefit from your account of your stay and I'll be sure to share your comments with the staff.  Thank you for staying with us and I hope you'll return. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights. Basic hotel with no service, dirty and beds most likely are not clean as we were itchy and had rashes. One soap in bathroom, Really??  Normally only stay at a Hyatt or Intercontinental and live these places. The Hyatt was booked out had to stay here. Will not recommend this place to anyone. Apart from convenience to Disneyland there is not one positive thing I could say.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your stay with us.  We definitely clean all of the bedding and rooms.  Also, we're happy to provide more soap should you need it.  We like to keep waste to a minimum (and we're recognized for our green efforts).   Thank you, ~ Dan S.

Summary: The staff at this hotel were just amazing and made our stay here even more special.  It is large and very busy hotel, and during our stay there was a large Cheer convention together with a very large youth convention, however none of this impacted detrimentally on our stay, in fact the staff we encountered made us feel like we were their only guests.  From check-in, to the guys at the front door, to the concierge staff all were great.  The hotel itself is well located in Anaheim, we could walk easily to Disneyland, to places to eat etc.  The hotel is spotlessly clean and has a swimming pool, nice for first thing in the morning or at the end of a busy day out.  The room was well fitted out and had a good sized fridge and had a nice small day.  Would definitely stay here again, if
Manager Response: It's so nice to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  We pride ourselves in our service and I'm glad you felt like the only ones in the hotel.  Thank you! Best, ~ Dan S.

Summary: Best Marriott I have ever stayed at, rooms are very clean, restaurant very good, beautiful pool, lovely outside eating area, café was very good.  All employees were exceptionally friendly and helpful.  Gerald checked us in.....room wasn't ready yet, he made sure we were taken care of during that time with a nice credit in the café. I had several gift cards for the stay....he was more than happy to do this!  Some of the cards were different and I needed to get them credited the next morning.  Jore was more than glad to help me.  So a great Big Shout Out to Gerald and Jore.....exceptional employees I recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disney..bus picks you up and only a short distance to Disney.  Thanks Marriott for a great, pleasant stay.
Manager Response: I'm delighted to hear that our location is the best Marriott you've stayed with.  Thank you for the wonderful compliment.  I'll be sure to tell the staff about your comments. Best regards, ~ Dan S.

Summary: My fiance and I spent a wonderful week at the Marroit Anaheim! Despite a large conference going on (CABE) the staff went out of their way to ensure we had a great trip. The room rates were exceptional we were both pleasantly surprised with the room we received. The pool was empty most day but it was clean and their was a staff member replacing towels regularly. The bar staff was excellent we purchased a few over-priced drinks but they were all made well. The staff was knowlegable and friendly at all times. I would highly reccommend this hotel to everyone.
Manager Response: I'm delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay, thank you for spending your Disney vacation with us.  I hope you'll return. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Perfect for Convention Center Event- LOUDEST ELEVATORS EVER in ROOM!
Summary: Arrived to check in to our room and were told we had a balcony room with a fridge, etc.  Wonderful friendly customer service representative at the front desk and off we went up to our room.  It was a room situated in what had to be the furtherest corner of the hotel, and it definitely had no balcony. So we went back down to the front desk and inquired if we could get the room with the balcony we had originally booked.  That was not a problem and a nice gentleman helped straighten it out and we were given a different room in a different tower, Room 1636 I believe.    Let me just tell you, the room was noisy.  You don't notice this during the day but it is two doors down from the elevator shaft where there are 6 different elevators going up and down ALL DAY AND ALL NIGHT LONG.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry to hear that your room was too loud for you.  We definitely want our guests to get a good night's sleep.  Thank you for staying with us and I hope your cheer competition went well. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: My stay during the CABE conference
Summary: I stayed for 4 days and 3 nights!  My stay was very comfortable.  Overall service was excellent! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  Even the attendant at the parking was friendly and wished us well as we left. I only have one complaint: I needed to change the name on the parking receipt after check out, and I was told I could not change anything once I checked out.  It just seems like that wouldn't be a problem.
Manager Response: I'm glad you had a nice stay during your conference, thank you for staying with us. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: A PROBLEM WITH THIEF AND NOT RESPONDING TO GUEST IN A TIMELY MATTER
Summary: I am here for a conference and had to change rooms in the early morning hours (4:30) because my hot water did work.  In the move I forgot my watch (Fossil w/tan leather band) in the night stand drawer.  I came back to the hotel as soon as I realized I had for got to get it and it was gone, the room had been clean (two hours laps time).  I have talked to about 4 front desk people since this happen and the keep telling me they would get back to me with the lasts being 3 hours ago and no one has called me back.  I keep checking in and they would say oh sorry so and so didn't call you.  To me this means they have a problem with thief and they do not want to own up to their problem.  At this point because I keep inquiring about the watch, it seems as though the manager would have
Manager Response: none

Summary: My stay at the Anaheim Marriott was amazing.  It started off terrible because an employee at the front desk refused to change my room minutes after checking in. I was uncomfortable in the area but she told me I had to wait until all the guest checked in.    However, the next morning I spoke with Karla Velasco and told her about my experience and she apologized and right away told me that she would change my room no problem.  Karla changed my room and I could relax and feel comfortable each evening after a long work day.  That same day Kosta Xilikakis apologized to me for the experience I had and told me that the the customer is a high priority and that they take our complaints experiences very seriously.  I would be remiss if I did not mention William Bryant who exhibited the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I am so glad that we were able to accommodate your needs.  We pride ourselves in our customer service and it's disappointing to hear that you didn't get that service the moment you stepped in the hotel.  I'm very glad it all worked out and hope you'll be back to stay with us.  Again, thank you! ~Dan S.

Summary: We have been staying at the Anaheim Marriott since 1987! The property has been kept up to date and is great. I use the service at this hotel to judge other hotels and it is outstanding.  The restaurants are great and the lounge in the lobby is excellant also. There is the Anaheim Shuttle that will take you 3 times per hour to and from Disneyland, so just park your car and leave it.  NOTE: If you stay across the street  at that big barn of a hotel chain, you will find dismal service and an attitude that they are doing a favor just giving you a room card. I know, I stayed there once.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal guest, we really appreciate it!  I'm glad that you had a nice stay. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Couldn't have asked for better hospitality!
Summary: We couldn't have asked for a better stay at the Anaheim Marriott. Upon checking in Monica at the front desk was great. She asked about what we were doing while in the area and made sure we had everything we needed before we went to our room.  Paul and Mark at the bell desk were helpful when we checked in and out. They helped us unload our luggage upon checking in and they helped us load it back in the car when we were leaving.  Barbara in the parking garage literally made our whole day as we left for Disneyland each day. Always a smile on her face...and she left us with treats, so how could we not love that? AYS was a great help the couple times we needed something. The staff in Cafe Del Sol were fantastic and helpful and the food was so delicious.  Overall we had an incredible
Manager Response: I'm so glad to hear that you had such a nice stay.  I'll be sure to tell the staff your thoughts.  Thank you for staying with us and for your detailed review. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Brilliant hotel, well situated, clean, lovely staff!
Summary: This hotel was the first of our honeymoon. It was brilliant and the concierge manager was great before we even entered the country! As we had never visited Anaheim before we were very curious and inquisitive, Jennifer answered all questions and gave brilliant advice via email before our stay! During our stay she was extremely helpful, as were the other concierge staff.  Aside from that, when we arrived we were at the top level and our room had been connected to a large lounge room, with champagne and chocolate strawberries waiting from us with a handwritten welcome note from Jennifer! It was brilliant! The beds are comfortable as well as large!  The complex the hotel sits in is beautiful, maintained daily. The surrounding area feels very safe to walk around even at night, with
Manager Response: Congratulations and we all wish you many happy years!  I'm so glad that you had a nice stay with us.  We definitely try to go the extra mile for our guest.  Thank you for spending this memorable time in your life with us. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: I regularly stay at Marriott properties for business and pleasure so am used to the level of service they provide but the Marriott Anaheim staff outdid themselves. We arrived in Anaheim after a typical drive in traffic from Las Vegas and drove directly to what we thought was a new SpringHill Suites where we were booked (after dropping off my 7 year old grandson and two of my daughters at Disneyland). Unfortunately it was a construction site! It seems we were given the wrong address through a website computer glitch. My daughter suggested we drive over to the nearby Anaheim Marriott to see what could be done. The Elite desk staff were very helpful and assured me (I was in tears by this point) they would be able to accommodate us even though it was spring break (and during a cheer
Manager Response: I'm so delighted to hear that we were able to accommodate you in your time of need.  Thank you for the great complements, I'll make sure the staff is aware.  Thank you for staying with us. Best regards, Dan S.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay but not during High School Cheer Comp.
Summary: We just got home from an 8 night stay for a cheer competition and Disneyland. The hotel was very nice. The restaurant was pricey but the food was very good. The first part of the week was great but the second half of the week the High School cheerleaders rolled in. Completely ridiculous. These girls were up until 2am each morning running the halls, banging on doors, and looking into peoples rooms from the pool area. I realize its business but this is the only reason I will not stay at the Marriott near the convention center again. I have to say the staff were exceptional. I was checked in by Jore. She was very helpful with anything I needed throughout my stay. For this reason I will be staying at the same hotel next time just not during cheer competitions. My family of 4
Manager Response: I really appreciate your comments and will pass them along to the staff.  Thank you for staying with us.  I'm glad your kids enjoyed themselves. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: I was very pleased with this Marriott. I called ahead with a few requests for my room and staff accommodated me on all. Room was VERY spacious and the beds and pillows were absolutely heavenly. Housekeeping staff did a good job and every part of the hotel was clean. Valet was incredibly efficient and quick. If you're there for work it might be a good idea to call ahead and make sure your trip doesn't coincide with a convention. Millions of kids on every floor can make for sleepless nights. Good thing the AC fan is rather loud when on high (and doesn't automatically shut off as so many hotel ACs do) and drowns out the noise.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for staying with us and for your review.  I really appreciate your comments. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary: We were here the end of March for a cheer competition.  The location in regards to the convention center is outstanding - very easy to just walk across the street and be at your event.  There are many restaurants in the area, however, it is a walk.  A solid mile to eating either at the River Walk or Downtown Disney.  The rooms were very nice and clean.  They were on the small side and the bathroom was very tiny but again, clean and nice.  Definitely try and get a room in the main building with a balcony.  We were in the Oasis Tower and there are no balconies - I really enjoy being able to get fresh air in my room.  The staff was extremely helpful at check in and made sure we had all we needed.  The bar and outdoor sitting area/pool was also nice - the hotel was completely booked
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed your visit and will remind the restaurant staff to remain friendly.  Thank you for staying with us and for your review. Best regards, ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Steer clear of the restaurant, excessive internet charges, otherwise good hotel
Summary: This is our second stay at this hotel.  We tried to dine at the restaurant.  Soon after we ordered our meals, we overheard another guest complaining how long it had taken her meal to arrive.  We had to leave shortly for an event at Disney, so we questioned the approximate wait time with our server.  We were assured by our server that our meals would only be a further 10-15 mins wait.  After another 30-40 minutes, we still had not received our meals.  Our server had made himself scarce.  We had to leave, and never received our meals.  Wifi internet access in your room costs $12.95US/day.  Wifi in the lobby and bar is free.  The staff of the hotel and hotel bar cannot be faulted.  Bernadette in the bar was fantastic.  The hotel is close to Disney and in generally good condition
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear of your experience in the restaurant.  This is not a normal occurrence and I'll be sure to address this with the team.  Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your overall experience and will let Bernadette know you appreciated her service. Thank you, ~Dan S.

Summary: I love staying at this hotel when I am in town. We stayed here recently on vacation. I am a Platinum member so they treated me as so. It would have been nice to have been upgraded to the higher floor room that I requested, but other than that, wonderful stay. There was a conference in town, some 15,000 people in attendance. Even with the conference in town and the amount of people in and around the hotel, it still felt as it was not packed out house. The concierge level lounge is one of the best. The food quality is second to none and this is saying a lot for a concierge lounge.  Our room faced Disney. That was great. We used the shuttle service which was $5.00 per person a day I believe. It was totally worth it. We went to Disney so it was nice to be able to come back in the
Manager Response: We love it when you stay with us when you're in town!  I regret that we couldn't accommodate your request for a higher room floor and glad that didn't put a damper on your trip.  I'm glad to hear you had a wonderful stay and look forward to having you stay with us again. Thank you, ~Dan S.

Summary: Stayed here for activity at Convention Center. We were assigned an Accessible room (not requested) which was very spacious with a balcony. The pool restaurant and lounge was great for meeting friends and socializing. The staff was a bit slow, but it was a busy weekend at the hotel (spring break). Walked to Disney. Would return.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting us from Colorado, we definitely appreciate it.  I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your spacious room and enjoyed your stay.   Again, thank you ~Dan S.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for business or vacation
Summary: Spent 3 nights here for a work conference.  Treat their Platinum Premiers great here and went out of the way to be accommodating. Also they have a full service Starbucks that is great, the other restaurant/cafe next to Starbucks leaves a little be be desired, the menu is boring.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, I'm glad you found our service to be more than accommodating.  We strive to provide exceptional service.  I'm sorry you found the restaurant next to Starbuck's to be boring, we do have other dining options in the hotel next time you stay with us.  Again, thank you! ~Dan S.

Summary: A family of three stayed here for a couple nights for Disneyland. Everything went smoothly. The price was reasonable at around $130 before taxes. The staff seem rather flexible regarding the pricing of extras so it never hurts to ask. It was a bit annoying that they want to charge for parking and Internet access.  The location was good but at more than a mile away from Disneyland makes it a bit too far to walk after a long day at the park. One purchases bus tickets for $5/adult to go this mile (the tickets were good all day). We did not check out the pricing for taxis.  The staff was really great and the facilities well maintained. Breakfast was satisfactory and everything was clean. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and hope your family had a great time at Disneyland.  Some people do like to walk, but it can be tiring after walking all day in the park so the $5 shuttle is a great deal that we recommend.  I hope you'll come stay with us again. Thank you, Dan S.

Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights while attending the Los Angeles Catholic Religious Education Congress.  Our check in process was ok as we had originally booked two 2 rooms (one for each person in our party of two).  I called the hotel earlier in the day and checked our reservation stressing the need for a king bed in one of the rooms because of my recent rotator cuff surgery.  Desk attendant told me that there were only rooms with 2 double beds in each of the rooms left. Big disappointment.  Otherwise the hotel was rather nice.  Room service prompt and good. Cleaning was good. Toiletries provided were not up to usual high quality Marriott or Hilton standards.  The linens on the bed were fine.  The bed was very comfortable despite my trouble getting my arm that had been operated
Manager Response: I'm glad we were able to offer you a nice concession that you appreciated, thank you for staying with us.  Best of luck with healing from your surgery.  I hope you'll come stay with us again. Thank you, Dan S.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, great location to Disney
Summary: We are never disappointed with Marriott hotels, this location is about half a mile to Disney Land. There is a wonderful pool area, lounge and restaurant! And also a Starbucks and Pizza Hut in the hotel! There is a concierge desk from Disney to purchase tickets. We stayed on the 18th floor facing Disney and could see the fireworks from here. Also when checking in they will mention you can buy bus tickets to Disney and they come by every 20 minutes it however is only $8 for a taxi that's always available when ever you are so it was cheaper and faster for our family of four to take the taxi! The entire staff here were absolutely wonderful and always helpful. This is the hotel we will always be suggesting to anyone coming to Disney and where we will also be returning to!
Manager Response: I'm so glad to hear that we never disappoint, thank you for staying with us.  It's great to hear that you had a wonderful Disney vacation.  Great tip about the cab, especially for larger families.  I hope you'll be back to visit us again. Very best, ~Dan S.

Summary: stayed here for business.  It was good.  Liked the balconies in the room.  Liked having a refrigerator in the room.  That's about the best I can say.  Having also stayed at the Hilton across the street - I would choose there over here assuming the price is close when visiting.  It's not that the Marriott is bad - just I think the Hilton is better.  While there is an inroom safe at the Marriott - it requires you to use a key (as opposed to a code) and also is 'vertical' as opposed to 'horizontal' which requires you to tip up your computer - it just didn't seem as convenient to me.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your thoughts.

Summary: Really near the Disney parks.  Good bus service to the parks.  Clean and friendly.  Very helpful. Checked in for flight at the hotel which saved a great deal of time once that was done. Comfy bed.  Good restaurant, good value. It's nice that there is a pizza hut in the hotel for a quick meal once back from the parks.  It's good for a park trip when you need just somewhere to crash.
Manager Response: I'm so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for choosing us and I hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: I tagged along with my husband who was attending a conference back in October (just getting around to this review...lol). This hotel is very nice and inviting. All the staff we encountered, from valet to restaurant servers, were all very professional and courteous. Our room was sufficient, nothing fancy, but enough and very clean. Our one complaint, if any, was that we booked a king suite, but got double beds. They were very busy due to several conferences taking place, so there were no king suites available. But we made do, it was actually nice and cozy. The location was perfect. While he was "working", I was able to sightsee and shop and it was also convenient to have the shuttle service, for a nominal fee, all day. Although the hotel was at capacity or almost, the staff was
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay. I'm so glad you found our staff to be accommodating and pleasant. I hope you and your husband will come back and stay with us again.

Summary: I stayed at the Marriott Anaheim for a conference.  I checked in extremely late, so much so that I was only charged 3 nights rather than 4.  My room was sufficient albeit a little cold.  I had to use the extra blanket in the closet.    The elevators were very fast and the front desk staff was friendly.  We used valet parking and they were speedy.  I did feel that things were pricey but I was expecting that for a conference hotel.  Luckily my work paid for this trip.  The hotel does have a Starbucks.  I also ate at the food court in the Hilton right across the street.  I'd stay here again if I was in town.
Manager Response: I'm delighted to hear that you had a great experience at our hotel. Thank you for you review. I look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: This was a great hotel with excellent staff.... From check in to check out, nothing was too much effort for them to make my stay better. They even sent nice messages to my room about meeting me. The room was high up and facing Disney, I could lay in bed and watch the fireworks show. It was also close to a 7/11 for cheap snacks to fill the fridge provided with.   The concierge were very helpful. I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel!
Manager Response: I'm delighted to hear that our staff was able to make your stay so enjoyable. It's great that you had a room where you could see the fireworks, it's quite a show! Thank you.

Summary: Room was nice and large.  The balcony is nice to have for sitting outside and watching the passing crowds.  They have restaurants and bars downstairs in case you do not want to leave the hotel.  Being a short walk to the convention center is key as driving and parking for trade shows is tedious and $20+ a day!
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us and for sharing your thoughts. Im glad we were able to provide you with  a comfortable stay and hope to see you again.

Summary: Just want to say THANK YOU to Kosta at reservations, Kevin at Valet Parking and Cesar at the front desk for such a wonderful service from the minute we book our reservations to the minute we left, also the ladies that clean our rooms in the 7th floor were outstanding. This hotel personnel sure made our stay a very pleasant one. Thank you
Manager Response: I am very happy to hear about your pleasant stay at our hotel. Thank you for staying with us and for your compliments to all the staff. I'm glad they were able to provide you with excellent service. I hope to have you stay with us again in the future

Summary: I had to work a conference, early in the morning of 3/2/14. After finding out my truck was 2" too tall for the parking structure, I drove up to the front and parked hoping to find a place to park. Nathan, in  Valet Services, informed me I couldn't park there. I quickly informed him of my situation and was expecting the usual, "sorry, but you'll just have to find another place to park" run-around. To my surprise, he kindly offered me a spot in the Valet area without having to get out of my truck. It may have been a little gesture on his part but having to report in on time for my shift, it was very important to me. A++++ for Customer Service for Nathan!!!! Thanks again!
Manager Response: I'm so glad that we were able to help you out and make your day a little easier. I appreciate your compliments and will be sure to pass them along.

Summary: Clean hotel next to the convention center. Pool was a little loud at night but it is to be expected when your room is off of the pool. Not much of a dining selection in this hotel but right across the street is the Hilton which had a few fast food places. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. I look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel close to Disney and Convention Center
Summary: The Marriott Anaheim is a great hotel if you are visiting Anaheim for the Convention Center or Disneyland.  Both are a short walk out the front door.  The Marriott is a very well run hotel.  The service from the Bellman, to the Front Desk staff, to their Convention Services people, couldn't be nicer.  The rooms are standard, well taken care of and clean.  There is a nice pool in the center courtyard for the kids or a relaxing dip.  It is close to a bustling scene of restaurants and shops just down the block.  The Marriott Anaheim is definitely worth a look.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our hotel. I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay and appreciate your review. Thanks again.

Summary: I recently stayed here for a conference. I had a wonderful experience at the hotel. The front desk is so friendly, each one I came in contact with. Monica checked me in. Super nice. Got to my room in the Oasis tower and didn't want to leave. Great views and balcony! I faced the Hilton but was high enough to see Angel stadium, California Adventure and got glimpses of World of Color and Friday`s fireworks at Disneyland.  Only negatives: elevator button on ground floor looked questionable, parking is ridiculous at $24 per day, and drinks way overpriced at bar especially when bartender couldn't make a good lemondrop.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your compliments to the staff. It's great that you were able to enjoy a room with a view. I'm so glad you had a wonderful experience and hope you stay with us again.

Summary: We got to the hotel around 12:30am after a very long flight from Hawaii. We were exhausted and the kids were hungry. The hotel manager assisted us personally with check in, which was fast and efficient, cause we told him that we needed to get some food. Room service was opened till 1:00am, so we did make it on time to order some food. The hotel was very comfortable, with spacious rooms that were very clean. We did not have adjoining rooms, but it was still a perfect stay. There is a shop opened till late at the hotel which met our basic needs of beer, cold drinks and snacks, which helped with my husband and teenage kids. We bought our shuttle and entry tickets to Disneyland from the ladies at the hotel lobby. They were very helpful indeed. The shuttle picked up and dropped off
Manager Response: I'm delighted to hear how well you were taken care of by our staff. I'm so glad you had a lovely vacation and appreciate you choosing to stay with us. Thank you.

Summary: They charged my card additional fees without ever disclosing it and then said there was nothing they could do about it. They were rude. I called the 800 number and there the manager told me he couldn't do anything. I told him we have a corporate account and that I did not want to continue business with a company who treated their guest this way. He said " oh well I am not really concerned because we have accounts with Microsoft and other such companies, so do what you need to do". I am floored that management would treat guest this way. On top of that they offer no breakfast, we had four guest they only gave us three towels, I asked if there was anything to do in the area the receptionist said not really. Just terrible experience and I have no use for this hotel in the future.
Manager Response: I am very disappointed to hear about your experience and am sending you a private message.

Summary: We took our son to Disneyland for lhis 3rd birthday and stayed at the Anaheim Marriott. The room was very comfortable and restaurant and bar was a great place to have a drink.   The front desk agent "Jore" was very patient, friendly and accommodating with our needs. She even slipped a birthday card under our door for my son. I believe she was also responsible for sending cookies and milk to our room. First class to her!!  Brandon and Bernadette were our servers in the restaurant/bar. They were prompt, friendly and were on top of it. Brandon even sent out a birthday ice cream for our son. Also, Kaliko (bar supervisor) took really good care of us when were seated on the patio. She took it upon herself to serve us when the servers were busy. She knew when her team needed an extra
Manager Response: Happy belated Birthday to your son! I'm absolutely delighted that you chose to spend such a special occasion at our hotel and it's great to hear that you had such a great stay. I appreciate your compliments to the staff and will be sure to pass them along.

Summary: We have always been skeptical about positive traveler reviews, but I assure you we were actually guests at the Marriott. This hotel is fantastic! It was so clean, staff were so friendly and helpful and Ms Alvarez at the concierge was beyond helpful. We were there for the holidays and the staff managed the busy front desk very well and even bumped us to a higher floor upon asking. Although the commute to Disneyland was about a $20 round trip via cab, the Disney parking lot was across the street and probably a 15min walk to the park. When we needed a cab the gentlemen at the front were able to get us one ASAP! Would definitely return to this hotel.
Manager Response: I'm so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at our hotel and that our staff was able to give you a pleasant experience. Thanks for staying with us during the holidays and I look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: i wish they had 7 stars ratings +
Summary: excellent...on everything ...from the arrival bell man Freddy to the check out time to Sandy and Jore ...we stayed 4 days and 4 nights...they did everything to accommodate us and the stay was beyond every expectation ....i will never stay any where alse if we are in Disneyland,....  it remind me what hotel service is all about 7 stars across bravo to all of you and your company....
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. I am so happy to hear that our staff went above and beyond your expectations. Thanks for staying with us and I can't wait to welcome you back!

Summary: I just returned from a 2 day stay with my children and nanny. It was very convenient for going to Disneyland, but what set it apart was how helpful the staff were. Being a busy holiday weekend with a dance event taking place, the hotel was very full. But when I requested a different room that would work better for us, they went out of their way to help me and found one that worked out great! Cesar and Monica at the front desk were so helpful-everything they did was with a smile, and Hank at the bell desk was a gem. We travel quite a bit and are Starwood Platinum and Marriott elite, so I've stayed at many very nice properties, but this little, close to home trip to Disneyland stood out because of the great customer service at the Anaheim Marriott!! I will definitely return on our
Manager Response: Thank you for being one of our elite members and for this great review. I am delighted to hear that our staff was able to make your stay a memorable one, and will certainly pass along your compliments.

Summary: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Marriott Anaheim with the intentions of having a place to stay while visiting Disneyland. We came to find that the accommodations were greater than we expected and well worth the price as opposed to staying at a less expensive hotel. The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are spacey and fresh. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. I hope you enjoyed your trip to Disneyland. I look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary: I attend a convention at the convention center about every year. I make it a point to make sure that I get a room in the Marriott  because their service is outstanding every time.   Getting to the hotel is easy, and the style and decor is great. The grounds are always clean as is the lobby. There is always a friendly, smiling face ready to greet you at check in. The staff is friendly and happy.   The rooms are comfortable and clean and the beds are cozy. I especially enjoy the small balcony where I can sit out in the warm cali air and enjoy a morning snack while I take in the scenery.   The food options are great as well. From pizza to good food its convenient though a little pricy sometimes. I still love grabbing a bite from downstairs every time I am there.   If you are in
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal guest at our hotel. I am delighted to hear that you consistently have a pleasant experience and appreciate your recommendation. I look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.  This hotel is your standard Marriott hotel - clean, comfortable, quiet rooms, nice gift shop, Starbucks in lobby, big workout room, etc, etc,.  What really sets this hotel apart is 2 things:  1) Hotel is literally steps away from the Convention Center. Great for those traveling on business.  2)  the customer service at this hotel is outstanding!  All the associates I encountered at this hotel were friendly, attentive, had a smile on their face and were eager to help.  Really, ALL of the associates.  This made my stay memorable and very enjoyable.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for sharing your thoughts. I appreciate your comments about the staff and am glad they were able to give you a memorable experience. Thanks for the recommendation, I hope you stay with us again in the future.

Summary: Have you ever gotten off a hotel elevator and realized you were on a service floor with big maintenance trunks, storage rooms and construction barriers?  Checked in yesterday, desk staff gushed over about how they were giving me a great room.  Then I realized that I wasn't in a service floor but a floor where they actually put guests.  Other complaints related to the fact it's an old beat up hotel that's been here forever.  Rooms have been renovated but old style tiny bathrooms and insecure safes with steel key for your valuables make this hotel a 1975 time warp.  I've stayed at the Hilton next door a few tines and will do so in the future.
Manager Response: I am disappointed that you were not completely satisfied with your stay. I am sending you a private message.

Summary: I stayed here three nights for a conference last month.  This place is HUGE - which makes sense since it is right next door to the convention center.  Check in was a bit confusing  - they have a large reception desk that has several lines, but there's no indication of where the lines actually begin.  The pillar in the middle makes it even more confusing.  However, once we checked in, it was smooth sailing.   My room was large, clean, comfortable and QUIET.   The bed was awesome!  Bathroom was a bit tight, but more than adequate counter space made up for it.  My room had a balcony that overlooked the pool and it was nice to sit out there midday to "get away" if needed.  Two nitpicks regarding the room.  I wish there had been more than one trash can in the room - it was a pain to
Manager Response: I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. I appreciate your feedback and am glad our staff were able make your stay fantastic. I hope you choose to stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel at a great price
Summary: We chose to stay at the Marriott Anaheim for our week-before-Christmas family trip to Disneyland.  We have stayed here a number of times and we keep on coming back because it is great value for the money.  We thought of staying at the Grand Californian, but could not justify the $600/per room/night price tag when we found the Marriott at $119/night.  To give you a bit of perspective, when we first stayed here in the early 90s for approximately the same price.  Given inflation, it is amazing they can keep the prices at a similar rate 20 years later!  When we first arrived, it was warm and welcoming as always, but with the added treat of a hot cocoa or hot apple cider trolley in the lobby.  In addition, there was an adorable table set up with new crayons and cute sheets of paper
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us for your family trip. I am delighted to hear about your experience and am glad the staff gave you such great service. Hope you had a wonderful holiday.

Summary: Stayed here for a conference at the convention center.  Even though the conference hotel was the Hilton across the street i am a loyal Marriott person plus the Marriott was $25 less per night. I was given a corner room on the concierge level -1803.  I was a little worried by what I thought was mixed reviews on TA.  Well there was no need to worry.   The room was very large, clean, quiet and well furnished.  The bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff is well trained.  You will never pass an employee with out being greeted with a good morning or hello.  Because I was so tired the first night i ordered room service and the person on the other end was very helpful in helping me make selections that were not on the menu in my room.  The food arrived hot and tasty.  Try the chicken
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for being a loyal guest of Marriott hotels. I appreciate your feedback as it helps us provide the best experience possible. I hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Ideal for Disney or the Exhibition Centre
Summary: Good hotel and priced far better than the Marriot in Frankfurt close to one third of the cost per night.the hotel is clean and smart a good four star rating. If you intend to visit Disney it is only a four minute taxi and you could leave your car at the hotel. I visited a show at the exhibition and it took a good two minute walk......  The breakfast has lots of choice or a Starbucks is also available in the lobby for a quick caffeine fix. Lots of good restraunts are close by so no problem for choice, the area is safe to walk most places nearby with lots of taxis always available. The nightly rate was around $150 per night so not bad value. The room was good, with a very comfortable bed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I'm glad that you had a comfortable stay and hope to welcome you back in the future.

Summary: Location was excellent to get to and from Disneyland, you need to buy the bus pass for the Anaheim bus unlimited rides to and from Disney for 5 dollar a day. No need to deal with parking at the park. Older property, but definitely upgraded, I loved that it had balconies in every room.  We went the weekend before christmas and they had Santa Claus in the lobby, and activities for my 3 yr old nephew, he loved it. So worth it.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. I'm delighted to hear your nephew loved meeting Santa. I hope you stay with us again.

Summary: We just returned from 6 days at this facility for a convention. Walked into the room and the sliding glass door handle was hanging by a thread, so as I tried to open the door, it fell off. Told the housekeeper in the morning and a staffer came to replace and drilled-in a new one. The bathroom door was 6 inches from the elongated toilet; why input such a toilet shape in such a tiny room.  The floor tiles were lovely and you step into the shower/tub and the towel bar is old 1970ish aluminum with old screws. The coffee set up was 10" wide x 20" deep. Yes, difficult to manage in such a teensy space, and after making coffee, I trundled all the trash back to the bathroom to the nearest trash can... good grief, yes, I keep bringing the can out to the coffee maker area. I asked the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your feedback. I am disappointed to hear about your stay and am sending you a private message.

Summary: We stayed in 3 rooms over the Disney Tinkerbell weekend and it far exceeded our expectations. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were clean, comfortable and well maintained.  When visiting the Anaheim area in the future we will use this hotel again! I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a family friendly hotel in the area.
Manager Response: I am delighted to hear about your great stay. Thank you for your recommendation. I look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 days while attending a work conference last year. Large room, comfortable bed. Location is excellent. Very close to Disneyland. Felt very safe walking in the neighbourhood even late at night. Overall enjoyed my stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about out hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: I stay here because there is a corporate rate--that I must show for my client. Generally when I go on the website and try and get the rate--there are days/weekends that it's not available. My client won't want the change in price. I tried to break the 3-week stay at the corporate rate into a 2-week and a 1-week through the Marriott line--and I couldn't. Then I talked to Kevin, the general manager. He had Lauren W. call me and they got it done. So, I don't have to stay weeks at a time to get the corporate rate. I've been travelling for 5 years, and this is the first time someone has worked with me to get what I needed when I needed. I really appreciate this--since I've been going to the hotel for a year--and have another half-year to go. I do like to get home occasionally.  In
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your thoughts. I am so glad that you consider us your home away from home. I appreciate your compliments to the staff and will be sure to pass along your kind words. Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Best hotel in the Disneyland area
Summary: First time staying at the Anaheim Marriott was the best experience i have had the staff was very helpful and did anything they could to accommodate the guest they really make you feel welcome especially would like to thank  (Dennis Tyler) for proving great guest service. Its in a great location overlooking the city and can see disneyland from balcony especially great at night to watch the fire works its a  short walk or bus ride to disneyland had a great bar,restaurant  and pool area. Will be staying here agin thank you Anaheim Marriott and its staff for providing a great service making this  trip unforgettable for my self and my family.
Manager Response: I'm delighted that your first experience with us was a great one. Thank you for staying with and for sharing your thoughts.

Summary: My husband and I stay at the Anaheim Marriott a couple of times a year and we have been doing this for about 7 years.  The location is great, but more importantly its the caring staff that has always made our trips memorable.  They do everything they can to make your stay fun and comfortable.  From the time you drive up, Nathan our one of the other incredible valets takes your car.  Jack or one of the other terrific bellman helps you to your room. Ivan, one of the managers jumps right in to help you get settled and get a great room.  As far as dining goes, everyone goes out of their way to help you and get you want you want-even if its not on the menu! From Brandon, Chris,Sharon,Kitty and the amazing Vanessa we were pampered appreciated and spoiled our entire trip.  No matter
Manager Response: I appreciate you being regular guests of our hotel. I'm so glad our staff goes above and beyond to make your trips memorable, and I will be sure to pass along your compliments. Thank you very much staying with us and I certainly look forward to welcoming you again.
