Morning coffee is available in your room and nice lil refrigerator for sodas or leftover dinners.   On another note It is located within waking distance of Disneyland and many prime resturaunts.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review, and thanks for your patience with the AC! We're glad that we could fix it immediately so you could enjoy the rest of your stay with us. We hope you will come back on your next business trip to Anaheim!

Summary: I stayed at the Marriott for a couple of nights.  My partner was there on business and I was planning to see Los Angeles as I had never visited California before.  I had booked a full day bus trip before leaving the UK.  Unfortunately, the bus failed to pick me up and I was left extremely disappointed and upset to miss my only opportunity to see the city.    The Marriott concierges were just fabulous and organised an alternative day for me - they arranged transport to and from Hollywood and a tour of Beverley Hills.  I cannot thank them enough.  Most hotels would have done nothing as the tour had not been organised by them but the Marriott staff went completely out of their way to sort things out for me.  Thank you Marriott - you were amazing and I had a wonderful time!
Manager Response: We're so happy that we could swoop in and save the day! Thank you for the wonderful review. We're glad that you enjoyed your tour of Los Angeles, and we hope to see you again on your next business trip to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Another great stay and fabulous staff at the Marriott Anaheim
Summary: We had a great stay at the Marriott Anaheim. All the staff were very attentive. My husband had communicated with Anne prior to our arrival to set up a couple of surprises for us on Mother's day. I guess there was a slight mix up with our reservation and the memo wasn't made when we arrived however the staff corrected this immediately - thank you for the fast and efficient service.  We were in a concierge suite in a connecting room to our friends that we travelled with (again thank you Marriott for making this happen!). The concierge is worth the money - they have a lounge that serves breakfast in the morning and a business centre. The food was very good and changed daily for variety. They also have snacks and desert in the evenings.  There is wifi in the lobby so I just used the
Manager Response: Thank you for the great recommendation and review! We're so happy that we could make your Mother's Day vacation special despite the hiccups, and we're glad that our staff could immediately solve the problems. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: we checked in late at night around 12pm.check in staff was preoccupied talking and did not seem to be in the mood to check us in. (She made some mistakes which  was corrected by staff at check out.) Room was big with two twin beds, balcony was big too with a view of the residential side.Bathroom was very tiny, for the size of he room.The room was clean except for hairs in the bathroom which I went around and cleaned.Lobby area very nice and has acess to free wireless internet in the main areas. In room you will need to purchase wireless for $12.95 per day .A strange stapler was found in the sheets which poked and scrached me.We complained to the manager and they apologised and offered us free movies and snacks as complimentary.this was very nice .We got ART bus to Disney land
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at the Anaheim Marriott and for bringing your concerns to our attention.  Your comments have been shared with the management team and corrective action will be taken.  A stapler?  That is strange!  We're glad that we could set that straight for you!  Again, thank you for staying with us.  We hope to see you again!  Let us know next time you're coming in.

Summary: We stayed here because it was pretty close to disneyland and we got a good rate! The hotel was really clean and the staff was so nice! Only thing is, and I already expect this from Marriott, is that the parking is overpriced ($24/day). I wish there was a refrigerator in the hotel but besides that it was a great stay! Definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and recommendation! We're bummed that you didn't ask about a refrigerator while you were staying with us because all our rooms have refrigerators behind one of the floor cabinets. Nevertheless, we're delighted that you had a wonderful stay with us, and we hope to see you again on your next Disneyland vacation!

Summary: Our company had it's convention in the close by Anaheim Convention Center last week. I wound up staying at the Marriott for 4 days.   Perfect hotel for anyone attending an event as the convention center is a 2 minute walk from the property. Very comfortable beds and amenities. Nice lobby and lounge with large screen TV's. This hotel doubles as not only a convention hotel, but since it is less than a mile from disneyland, there are many families that stay there as well. Quite a contrast between the business traveler and the kids walking around with their Mickey ears.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. I asked the Concierge for a good Mexican restaurant and he pointed me to a hole in the wall joint about 1 mile from the hotel. It was great! I was very thankful for this.
Manager Response: We're glad that you had a great stay with us, and we're happy that we could help you eat like a local! Thank you for the wonderful review, and we look forward to seeing you again next year!

Summary Heading: Great hospitality, good location, average rooms
Summary: If you're rating this hotel on locationa and staff it gets very high marks but room was basic.  Lobby: B.  Clean, and compact. Not small and by European standards very spacious and well appointed.  By American standards average.    Hosptiality: A.  Great staff at this hotel.  Checked my bag at the bell desk before checking in (had to run to the convention center for business), when I returned the bell men grabbed my bad AND checked me in.  Very friendly service.  When I checked out same kind of service at the main desk - everyone ready to help with directions.  Most of all was the friendly attitude.  Was it the proximity to Disneyland?   Speaking of which...  Location: A.  Walking distance to Disneyland, multiple restaurants, and adjacent to the Convention Center.  Can't really
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderfully-thorough review! We love to hear feedback on every aspect of your stay, and we're glad that you had a very positive experience with us overall. We hope your business travels will bring you back to stay with us again in the future!

Summary: To me, one of the most important intangibles is service.  From when I first walked in until I left, I received nothing but top notch hospitality and service. I was given a room near the concierge lounge.  You can't understate how nice it is (especially when traveling with family) to be near the lounge for a quick snack, beverage, and breakfast, of course.  A huge win for our stay. The room is on the small side, but the balcony is a nice touch.  In room fridge is also of high value when traveling with family. Location is very convenient to Disneyland and the convention center. Only minor issues were 1) the pool gets crowded, and in general folks not taking care of their kids at the pool (NOT the hotel's fault) 2) had an issue with a meal, but it was immediately and respectfully
Manager Response: Customer service has always been a priority for us, and we're delighted that we could meet your highest expectations! Thank you for the wonderful review. If we helped make your family vacation to Disneyland relaxing and convenient, then we couldn't be happier. We hope to see you again on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary: Stayed with my family at the Marriott during a visit to Disneyland and experienced a wonderfull time staying at the Marriott. All the staff were extremely kind and helpfull, especially Scott the Bellman who gave us all extremely good attention. All the Valet staff were also extremely pleasant and always prepared to assist.  The actual Hotel is a comfortable stroll from the entrance to Disneyland and close to many shps and restuarants. The Rooms are aslo well kept and the beds extremely comfortable. The Pool and Spa area were always clean and well presented, our kids loved the Pool area.  I would certainly stay there again and recommend the Hotel to anyone travelling to Disney.
Manager Response: Scott says, "You are more than welcome!" Thank you so much for your wonderful recommendation and compliments of our staff and facilities. We're delighted that we could make your Disneyland vacation comfortable and convenient, and we hope you don't wait too long until your next one!

Summary: I booked myself into this hotel using clever-hotels.com as part of my "Discover USA tour" It was the last week of my tour. I went to check-in and was told that my room had been given away and the hotel was fully booked. I asked them at the front desk what am I meant to do as I am half way across the world on my own and can't afford to pay again for another hotel. I was told "There is nothing we can do, have a nice day". So I had to go back to the Airport and plead with the airlines to get me back to England  From a big international brand Hotel I was not expecting this  When I got home it took me 3 weeks of fighting to get a refund back from clever-hotels.com
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear about your experience!  Would you please send us a private message and give us your name and when you were to stay so that we may look into this matter?  Our policy is to not give away rooms and if you have a reservation and we are somehow unable to keep you then we walk you over to another location and assure you are taken care of!  To avoid any confusion in the future may we suggest you book directly with the marriott.com website.

Summary: We just returned from an 8night stay as part of our honeymoon. The room was ok bathroom was tiny our agent put a request on that it was our honeymoon but this wasn't acknowledged or mentioned.all over hotels we stayed at offered an upgrade!!!  There was some sort of cartoon convention going on and staff were more interested in the guests attending this. Won't be returning to this hotel will use Hilton next time
Manager Response: Congratulations on your honeymoon!  We appreciate that you stayed with us.  Please send us a private message with your name and the dates that you stayed, we'd like to see why there was an oversight.  Thank you!

Summary: Stayed at the Marriott Anaheim with my family for 6 nights and had a great experience. The Staff at the Hotel are brilliant and very accommodating. nothing was too difficult for them and they always made my family feel welcome and at home. I can highly recommend this Hotel if you planning a visit to Disney Land as it it only o short walk to the Park.
Manager Response: We're delighted that we could welcome you to Anaheim! Thank you for the fantastic review and recommendation. We really appreciate your compliments for our staff, and we hope you will come back for another visit to Disneyland some day!

Summary: After six days of being on business, I'm generally ready to run away screaming and crying . . . Luckily, though, this wasn't one of those trips.  The Marriott is a beautiful hotel with amazing conference facilities.  The location is fantastic as you're just a skip and hop away from Disney Land and all of its amenities.  Room service, though pricey like all other room service(s), was very good and the staff very friendly.  The front desk staff was also friendly, spending quite a bit of time with me getting some billing issues ironed out (that were on my end).  The beds were very comfortable with great linens and nice pillows.  The room was very spacious and inviting.  The most amazing thing is that I heard very little noise outside of my room, even though multiple conferences
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review! If you enjoyed yourself on your business trip instead of pulling your hair out, then we accept that as a wonderful compliment. We're very happy that you had a quiet and comfortable stay with us, and we hope that you will come see us again for a vacation next time!

Summary: The rooms are dated. The carpet is old and run down. The hotel always has conventions and is too busy to enjoy the property. There is nothing really wrong with the hotel but knowing the HYATT is right down the street and is gorgeous in comparison makes it impossible to ever stay here again. Hyatt here I come.
Manager Response: We're sorry you feel that way.  Thanks for your feedback.

Summary: Stayed here for four nights.good location to walk to disneyland .we had a disabled child in wheelchair and was no problem getting from room to disneyland. Room was good and tidy.only thing was we had to wait hour and half past normal check in time to check in as room wasnt ready.if they sort that out id give them five stars.
Manager Response: Thanks for bringing that to our attention, let us know the date you were here and what your reservation was under so that we can get to the bottom of that.  We appreciate that you stayed with us and hope to see you again!

Summary: I stayed here on vacation for four nights.  Staff were super nice.  Upon request I was able to get a concierge level hotel room (floor 17) facing north.  This let me see the fireworks at Disneyland from the comfort of the hotel room balcony. I made reservations through a credit-card reward program and the hotel was on top of it - no problems checking in or honoring the reservation.  Onsite car rental is convenient. Even though I did not keep the car overnight parking at the hotel is complimentary for guests according to the desk clerk. The walk to Disneyland is not as far as it may look on a map. And the hotel is nice and quiet after a long day of crowds.  The pool was clean and temperature comfortable.  I stayed during a big convention at the adjacent Anaheim Convention Center
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! We love fulfilling requests whenever we can, so we're very happy that you enjoyed your balcony seats for the firework show. We really appreciate your staff compliments and room tips, and we hope that you will stay with us again soon!

Summary: I recently stayed here for a conference for 6 days.  The service was great!  Every staff member was friendly and attentive.  The valet's were excellent!  Kenny and the valet team left a birthday surprise for one of our children!  The pool was lots of fun.  Great place to decompress after Disney!  Thanks to the staff for making the stay wonderful!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that our staff could help you in every way (and celebrate your child's birthday too!). We'll be sure to pass your compliments on to Kenny and the rest of the team. Thank you for the great review, and we hope to see you again during your next conference in Anaheim!

Summary: Upon arrival, the valet service men were friendly and directed me appropriately, as I did not want to valet my car, just check in. Got to the counter and the staff was extremely courteous. Arrived in the room and immediately noticed I was upgraded to a corner room with balconies (yes 2 balconies). Room was spacious, bed was beyond comfortable, bathroom a little on the small side, but the room more than made up for it. Would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: We love those corner rooms too, so we're happy you could get one! Thanks for the great review and recommendation. We really appreciate your comments, and we look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: Stayed here for 3 days with my family we had 2 rooms I must say having stayed at hotels all over it has the best staff by far.  I never once had a grumpy or not smiling staff member.  Everyone was always willing to help and  give you anything you needed.  Our rooms were upgraded thank you so much to Anne.  This hotel went way above what any hotel had to do for my family.  Again thanks Anne.  I highly recommend this hotel for business or for staying with the family its a short walk to Disneyland parking lots for a free shuttle.
Manager Response: We're honored to have the best staff in your opinion, and we'll be sure to let Anne know about your appreciation! Thank you for the wonderful review. We're always happy to help, and we hope to see you and/or your family again soon!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while breaking up our stay in Vegas, We arrived late at 8.30 pm and were greated by the receptionist called Kelly. She was very nice and polite and helped us with the map to get familiar with the area and Disneyland itself. Although the internet was $12.95 per 24 hours (which should be free tbh) we had no qualms with the room. We were given a free upgrade overlooking the pool. We were not there most of the day, but if you want early nights then forget it as this pool is very, very loud up until 11ish. The shower in the room was great although by american standards the bathroom was smaller than a typical European one. The balcony door handle was broken and I needed to use a bit of force to open and close it, and the most bizarre thing of all
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for writing about your experience.  Next time be sure to let us know if something is amiss in your room and we'll be happy to get right on it.  We hope to see you again!

Summary: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at this Marriott during our vacation to Disneyland. As expected at a Marriott, the guest service was perfect. The room itself was spacious and had a nice balcony which overlooked the city. We purchased our park hopper passes at the concierge desk (it took all of 30 seconds) and parked our car at the guest parking lot (be prepared to pay $24 a day). We walked to/from Disneyland and it was not bad at all, though the walk did seem further at the end of the day.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful feedback! We love it when the word "perfect" is used in our reviews. We're delighted that you had a great trip to Disneyland, and we hope to see you again on your next trip to Southern California!

Summary: Very nice hotel, good location, easy shuttle to Disney and nice pool for the kids.    Good: Staff was very helpful (with the exception of my one bad comment) Execellent service for Disney and shuttle service.  Not exactly a short walk to Disney Starbuck and other shops/food in the hotel in case you need something Shallow pool, so not as conerned with my kids safety when swimming  Bad: Our toilet broke on the last night we were there and would not flush without reaching in the back to flush the toilet.  The front desk staff didn't seem to overly concerned about it nor did they offer to send someone up right away or ask us to change rooms.  A toilet is generally a needed item in a hotel room.  I didn't complain to management as it was the last night stay and we were leaving the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and telling us about your visit.  Would you be so kind as to message us with your room number so that we may address your concerns?  We'd really appreciate it and hope you come visit us again!

Summary: Excellent location.  $40 for cab fare from Orange County airport.  Many choices within walking distance.  Poor service when ate at hotel restaurant. Saw another couple leave because no server. Got a free dessert for inconvience..
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us!  It would be great if you could message us and let us know what day/time you ate in the restaurant if you could please.  We'd like to address your service concern.  We hope to see you again!

Summary: Everyone who I had contact with during my 5 day stay was polite, helpful and energetic. The hotel was so close to the convention center which was so convenient. It was also in walking distance to Disneyland and good restaurants.
Manager Response: We love it when our staff impresses our guests! Thank you for the wonderful review. We're glad that you had a comfortable and convenient stay with us, and we hope to see you again next time you're in town!

Summary: As foreign tourists traveling on holiday with kids, i decided that the best way to maximize our Disneyland experience was to check-in at a nearby hotel and the Marriott Anaheim was an excellent choice.  We got a Concierge Level room located on the 18th floor and had two double beds and room size was just right.  No complaints here and had all the amenities stated in their website.  The hotel has several elevators and were quite fast.  Lounge was open Mon-Thurs from 6:30am-10pm; Fri from 6:30am-12noon; Saturday-closed; Sunday from 5:00pm-10:00pm.  Since we checked-in on a Sunday, we were able to maximize our lounge access which was good as we were able to have breakfast just in time for our trips to Disneyland and California Adventure before they opened at 8:00am.  Food from
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and Disneyland tips! We're happy that we could make your vacation comfortable and convenient, and we hope that you will come back and stay with us again on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary: This was our first time ever visiting California and our first trip to Disneyland. I was very pleased with our stay. We were able to check-in early as our flight got in at 10 am. We were greeted in parking lot by staff who instructed us where to park and where to go check in. The check-in process was quick and easy. We had a room on the 9th floor. We had a balcony and view of the pool. The bed was quite comfy and had tons of pillows. The room is kinda small but it was more than enough space for me, hubby and 5 yr old son. We never heard any noise except for the fridge inside the room other than that it felt like we were the only ones on the floor. It was easy to get on and off the elevator despite the many groups staying there. You can either walk to Disney or catch the bus
Manager Response: We're delighted that we could welcome you to the Golden State! We're happy that you were able to experience Disneyland AND the beautiful beaches of Southern California, but we're sorry that you didn't know to take advantage of our free WiFi in the Lobby. Thank you for the great review, and we hope you won't wait too long before your next trip back!

Summary: Marriott hotels are typically predictable, good value and with good amenities. The same was true with this hotel.  Unfortunately though, this hotel was just average. Nothing outstanding, nothing exemplary. Usually I come across someone or some experience at a hotel that is great and memorable. Not so here.. all that said onto the details.  Our room was fairly standard pleasant enough, but the colors were a tad dated.  An alarming thing we noticed that the lock to the sliding patio door was gone and in its place was a bolt attached to a piece of wire, that I guess you were meant to stick in the hole...we did that, and it did nothing to stop the door from opening. A bit of a bummer. Its little things like this that can leave a bad impression. Although we didnt expect anyone to
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us.  We appreciate your visit and your thoughts.

Summary: This hotel was chosen by our main supplier for a convention at the nearby convention centre.  It is literally a two minute walk from door to door.  The staff were very helpful and pleasant and did everything they could to make our stay pleasant. A ten minute walk to Disney with several places to eat on the way. Nice pool in the centre of the hotel but business did not allow time to experience it. If travelling in from LAX a shuttle is the most cost effective, with five or more in the party a cab is as economical. Would recommend this hotel and would gladly stay again.
Manager Response: ...And we would gladly have you back! Thank you for the wonderful review and room tips. We hope you can enjoy some poolside relaxation on your next visit!

Summary: We stayed here in April for family vacation.  This hotel is only two blocks from Disneyland and California Adventure.  There is also the ART bus service that will bring you to the main gate for a small fair. Having been to Disneyworld in Orlando, it was quite a treat to be so close to the park and pay an excellent price. In addition, there were so many restaurants within walking distance.  The rooms were nice and clean, but generally no frills.  We spent most of the day out of the room.  They had a nice family friendly pool area as well.  The check in was a bid slow, mostly due to the friendly staff giving Concierge type guidance to each of their guests.  I didn't mind the wait, as they were very accomodating when we needed a room change.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, and thank you for your patience during check in! We're delighted to hear that we could make your Disneyland experience a more convenient one. We hope to see you again on your next family vacation to California!

Summary: My sister and I stayed here two nights for our Disneyland trip. It was really nice! The hotel is very clean and the room was comfortable - my sister thought the bed was too hard but she is use to sleeping on a fairy bed of pillows, so I don't know. I thought it was great. When we checked in, I had booked 2 double beds (I do not want to share a bed with my sister, thanks), and it seemed like they didn't have any left, but without pressuring us to take a king the front desk woman just spent a little time typing away and then got us the room we wanted. My only complaint about that room is that it was right next to the elevators, and this is a really busy hotel, so there was a WHOOSHH sound every 15 seconds or so. It was a little tough for sleeping, luckily I had earplugs but my
Manager Response: We're happy that you enjoyed smelling fresh at Disneyland with our Bath & Body Works lotion! Thank you for the great review. We can't wait to have you back on your next trip to OC!

Summary: This hotel is located right next to the Convention Center.  We were first welcomed at an outside stand on the palm-lined drive to the hotel.  Apparently, a message was sent to other staff of our arrival, because everyone thanked us for being a Platinum Elite member.  We were upgraded to Executive Platinum Room 339 with a balcony overlooking a parking lot.  It was a nice large room, typical Marriott décor.  The older-style bathroom has a low sink, which is great for kids & petite folks like me who usually find hotel sinks uncomfortably high.  Surprisingly, the bed was not the typical comfortable Marriott mattress that we love.  In fact, it was the worst I’ve experienced in a Marriott – very soft, springy, uncomfortable & squeaky.  You sink into it.  I’m petite and still sank into
Manager Response: Thank you for being a Platinum Elite Member, we appreciate your loyalty!  We appreciate your feedback about your stay and will share it with the management team.  Let us know when something isn't working for you in your room right away next time and we'll be happy to assure your needs are tended to.  Again, thank you and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The Rooms Were Ok, Check In On The Slow Side. But We Felt Like We Got What We Paid For. We Were In Town Strictly For A Volleyball Tournament. There Just Happened To Be A Cheer Comp. In Town Also, So Needless To Say It Was Really Busy. But That's To Be Expected At The Convention Center. Over All It Was nice To Be Realy Close.
Manager Response: We're sorry that you caught us during a busy period, but we're happy to hear that you still had a comfortable and convenient stay with us. Thank you for your feedback, and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: And here's why:  This has got to be the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in. Issue one-the yapping dog a few doors down from us. We moved rooms. Issue two-there were roaches in our second room. We moved rooms AGAIN. Issue three-there were more roaches in our third room. We gave up at that point. Had we not booked this room as part of a Disneyland package, we would have demanded our money back. I will NEVER stay here again. Travelers beware!
Manager Response: We are very sorry about all the inconveniences during your stay.  We are also concerned that the challenges you experienced were not immediately handled by our guest service team.  Our hotel has a no pet policy, except for service animals.  Regular dogs are not allowed, especially a yapping dog that would disturb other guests.  We also have a pest control service that is on call 24/7.  If a guest were to ever notify us about a roach problem, it would be handled immediately.  We looked through our manager reports for the past few weeks and did not see a report about a yapping dog or roaches.  Can you please confirm that you stayed at the Anaheim Marriott on 700 Convention Way?  Also, please let us know how we can contact you directly to rectify the situation.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Not terrible for a conference, but I expected better...
Summary: The hotel looks pretty enough, but rooms are in need of updates. It was crowded but I was there for a Natl conference.  The service from the maid staff, valets, and concierge was great!  The Guests Guide (that it is in every hotel room ever) was very outdated and included services that they no longer offer, such as free breakfasts, free afternoon snacks, etc. The pool was freezing, but the hot tub was nice.  The restaurants were expensive for what they offered and the deli/Starbucks was ridiculously expensive.  On the technology front, there was some confusion over wifi ; was it offered to guests, was it free (not according to the Guest Guide), and the only access to computers (other than for printing boarding passes) was through paid services by the onsite FedEx/Kinkos.   The
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us and sharing your thoughts.  Wifi is actually free in the common areas.  Thanks for pointing out the Guest Guide, we'll be sure to take a look at those.  We hope to see you again!

Summary: Check in took too long, I was the only one in line.  Rooms are starting to look dated.  What can you do, it is close to the convention center and it is a Marriott.  The JW restaurant was not open regular hours which was challenging, it has been reliable in the past.  Love the Starbucks/food market in the hotel.  Requested extra towels, had to ask several times.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your thoughts with us.  We appreciate the feedback and will be sure to address the issue with getting extra towels.  JWs is now only open for specific occasions but Cafe del Sol is open regularly.  We hope that you'll come see us again.

Summary: We stayed for three days and the service was excellent. The staff was friendly and the breakfast buffet was great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! The Pool was in the shade by 2:30. It is very close to everything disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words! We really appreciate your recommendation, and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Obviously with it being next to the Conference Centre it's full of people with Lanyards trying to look important, milling around drinking Starbucks, never the less its ideally placed for a trip to Disney which was the purpose of our visit. well appointed rooms with a fridge and good selection of TV channels and most appear to have a balcony, it's just a pity people use them for smoking on......and think it doesn't effect anyone else by doing this @#%!...anyway the Room Service is excellent as is the Maid Service but wall are thin and you can clearly hear the next doors room alarm go off on a morning, oh be aware of no free wifi in your room (which is sad) and unreasonable parking charges. It's a 15min safe walk to Disney or you can get the ART outside the Hotel, the Hilton
Manager Response: Thank you for the great (and humorous) review! We're glad that you had a convenient stay with us during your Disneyland vacation, and we hope you were able to stay connected with the free WiFi in the Lobby. We hope to see you again if you're back in the area!

Summary Heading: Good location for the Anaheim Conference Center
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights while attending a conference at the convention center. This hotel is ideally located for attending the conference center which is less than a 5 minute walk away.  It's located directly across the road from the Hilton Hotel.  I was in the Oasis Tower of the hotel.  The rooms were clean, but a little dated.  There is a hotel restaurant - Cafe Del Sol on the ground floor that serves breakfast, I think it might also do lunch and dinner.  There is also a Starbucks and another cafe for cheaper alternatives.   The hotel bar also offers good quick and easy meals.  The staff were generally friendly and helpful.  I have no major complaints about my stay here.  Most guests are either conference goers or families visiting Disneyland.  I would probably stay
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your thoughts.  We hope you visit us again!

Summary Heading: great location, quiet, on ART bus line
Summary: We had a lovely room - very quiet, loved that the ART bus line stopped right out front - bell boy and front desk people were excellent, room was clean and amenities were perfect - loved having a reasonably priced option for meals right in the hotel as well as a bar etc. nice childrens area with wii entertainment.   On the last day, we found that the room staff had gone into a closed cupboard and taken a bag of supplies that we needed - the meds for the last day, my energy bars and crystal light mix for the next 15 days of our trip, cough candies etc. - I was VERY annoyed that they would "snoop" into one of the cupboards that we were using and that they would take our stuff -   the front desk went out of their way to resolve the problem, providing us with a taxi coupon to go to
Manager Response: We apologize of the inconvenience are are so glad we could make thinks up to you.  We've assured that our staff is fully aware of the situation so it doesn't happen to other.  Thank you for staying with us, we hope you come again!

Summary Heading: Great for Fun, Great for Business
Summary: The hotel is nicely located for Disney and the convention centre. The staff are very helpful and polite. The swimming pool is ideal for relaxing and not for laps swimming.   The hotel rooms are clean and tidy.   If you are going to Disneyland or for convention, this is a good place.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for telling others about your stay.  We're glad you found the pool relaxing.  Please come see us again soon!

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel - would definitely stay again
Summary: It's a lovely hotel. As soon as we checked in the upgraded us to the hospitality suite which was huge and very spacious as we have 3 kids under 10. The lady at the reception desk was very polite and helpful and said if we didn't like the room then she would change it. The beds are big and very comfy. We had to ask for a rollaway bed for my son. The lady who bought it to our room was not very polite or helpful as she complained that she was not meant to move furniture but we had to move a table for the bed to fit. She also didnt put the bed the right way round, my husband had to do it, was not impressed.  The hotel is near the convention centre and its quite a pain when there is something going on there. There is tons of traffic and some roads which you need to turn to are closed
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback, we really appreciate it.  We're glad you got things worked out with the bed and will be sure to instruct our staff about these situations in the future.  Come see us again soon!

Summary: My husband and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary while visiting Disneyland with our 2 children.  First of all, the servers in the restaurant as well as room service are superb! They were extremely polite, friendly, professional and accomodating. There is no spa at this location and it's more of a business/convention hotel than a resort hotel. The front desk staff was a little undertrained in my opinion and the new employee that checked us in was having several issues. We're willing to overlook it though because we're very loyal to Marriott and could see the other front desk employees were friendly and capable of checking in the other guests quickly with a pleasant welcome. The other issue we had was eventually addressed by a manager after we returned home, and
Manager Response: Thank for for staying with us for your Disney getaway.  We apologize for the uncomfortable sleep, next time please let us know while you're here.  We're so glad that you'll give us another try, let us know when you come back.

Summary: The hotel is located within the convention area. 10 Minute walk to DisneyLand. Hotel has a modern lobby, but the guest room bathrooms need updating. I stayed 2 nights in a King room on the 14th floor. The room was comfy and spacious. I enjoyed the hotel staff as they were always friendly and greeted all guests. The bathroom could use a bit more room and updated floor tiles as the ones my room were all broken.Note: there is a fee to self park. There is a fee to park anywhere in the convention center area. Plenty of restaurants around the block from the hotel. Happy they had a Starbucks on site.
Manager Response: We're so glad you had a relaxing time and enjoyed our staff.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We are local residents but had plans in Downtown Disney and did not want to drive home, so we bought a room for one night through Priceline. Valet was simple, expensive but convenient. Check in was easy, front desk was pleasant and we were placed on the second floor, which is not great but I figured Priceline rooms are going to be bottom floors, so no big deal. The room itself was nice, and had a balcony that overlooked the parking lot. The main problem I had was the fact that staff members were taking their break outside our room. Since we were on the second floor, we were kept up throughout the night by their conversations. It would have been nice to leave the slider door open and get a little fresh air, but cigarette smoke from the employees on break and loud conversations
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  Even though you are local, we were so glad to have you.  We also appreciate your feedback on our associates and their break area.  We have shared your comments with hotel management to ensure that future guests will not have a similar experience.  Let us know the next time you’re in the area and need a nice place to sleep over so you don’t have to drive home after a day at the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: I was at the Marriott Anaheim for a business conference.  I stayed 3 nights.  The room was very clean and the bed comfortable.  What makes this hotel nice is the staff.  Every person I interacted with went out of their way to be pleasant and helpful. The on site restaurants were good and there is a Starbucks in the lobby. Although I was not their for the tourist attractions, it appeared to be in a very good location for Disneyland.  If you are attending an event at the conference center, you are right next door. All in a nice place to stay with an excellent staff.
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with us!  Thank you for the compliments, we definitely strive to have friendly staff so we're glad that you noticed!  We hope you can come see us again (maybe for fun next time)!

Summary: Nice, well kept. Good location for convention/conference. great location. Walk to Disneyland or Adventure, shopping & restaurants. nice little shop inside for forgotten items. Right next door to a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse.
Manager Response: Hi, thanks for staying with us and sharing your thoughts.  Your review has some great tips for others that they''ll surely appreciate.  We hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: Price was right, except for miniscule bathroom
Summary: Stayed one night for business. Room was spacious and comfortable, though not well designed for business, and the internet was an additional fee (boo, hiss!!!). The desk arrangement was too high for the chair even when the chair was raised to highest level. The bathroom gave new meaning to the term compact, and it was not comfortable at all. Ordered room service which was overpriced and mediocre, at best, and not hot when it arrived. Definitely would find dining alternatives elsewhere if I return to the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review.  We are glad you liked the size of your room and appreciate your feedback on our room layout and work desks.  We will take your feedback into consideration on our next rooms renovation.  Sorry about your in-room dining experience.  Cold and mediocre food is not acceptable.  If you stay with us again, please let our management team know and we would be happy to compensate you accordingly.  We look forward to having you back with us again in the future and improving on your guest experience.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for a Disney trip
Summary: To begin, the hotel offers great packages for families.  My favorite is the Discover Disneyland package: $100 Disney gift card, free self parking (the hotel allows you to upgrade to valet, only paying the difference between self and valet) and Anaheim Resort Transit passes for 2 adults and 2children.  Even with the road construction between the Marriott and the Hilton, the hotel is easy to get to.   Since we use the bus while there, the only times we are driving is upon arrival and when we leave to return home. Every member of the staff is extremely friendly and welcoming.  Although this hotel seems to be primarily a business travel hotel, they are very good to families.  The last time we stayed, checked out just before Christmas, the hotel was full swing into Christmas.  Kids
Manager Response: Thank you for the detailed review and the room tips! We're very happy that you and your family stayed with us during the Christmas season and could appreciate the holiday cheer. We apologize for the slow bar service and the issues with your bill, but we're glad that it all worked out. We hope to see you again on your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Nicest people and very fast service.
Summary: Everybody is extremely nice and attentive. Really close to Disneyland.  Clean hotel. GREAT PIZZAHUT DEAL FOR THE FAMILY! A little outdated, but is say better than the paradise pier.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We can't wait to have you back! Thank you for the great review, and we'll be sure to pass your compliments on to our staff.

Summary Heading: Attending a conference at the Marriott
Summary: I attended a conference at this hotel and also stayed here for 3 nights. The conference rooms are kept too cold and even when the staff was asked to turn down the air conditioner, it didn't help. The lower floor rooms need to be updated, especially the bathrooms. For the price the Marriott charges, the accommodations should be updated in the rooms. Also the guest services binder in the room restaurant and room service prices are different than what they charge. The binder needs to be updated to reflect the price increases. Overall the staff is awesome. They get 5 stars from me.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and the 5 stars for our staff.  We think they are awesome too!  Sorry about the temperature being too cold in our meeting rooms.  It is always challenging to get the temperature right for all conference attendees.  Some like it cold, some like it hot, and we usually error on the side of cold since people can add a layer versus the other way around.  The good news on our lower floor rooms and bathrooms is that they will be completely renovated this year.  We are just waiting on the final designs and renovation schedule.  We look forward to welcoming you back for another meeting or conference once they are all completed.  And thanks for the heads up on the binder in your room.  We will get that updated ASAP.

Summary: We spent 4 nights at this property (April 3-6) at a professional convention. Staff was very helpful, property was very clean AND it is within walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center. We ate at the outdoor restaurant twice for lunch and indoors for breakfast (too windy to be outside). Expect hotel prices for breakfast and lunch however the food was quite good! There's a Starbucks off the main lobby - usual Starbucks fare. Gift shop had a nice assortment of items including Brighton sandals! The room was clean and everything worked fine. We had a lower floor near the promenade so it got a bit loud outside but by 9pm it was quiet. A very good stay. The hotel is close to Disneyland but we did not go there for Mickey and Co.
Manager Response: We're glad to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us during your convention. Thank you for your feedback, and we hope you stay with us again if you decide to visit the happiest place on earth!

Summary: Room was fine. Had a small balcony which was nice to sit on but it overlooked an industrial-looking roof.   Bathrooms were clean but not overly large..  Staff was nice.   Great location for access to convention center.   Nice area to walk around and grab lunch at the outdoor trucks near the fountains.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review! Let us know that you would like a room with a view next time and we'll try to give you one that faces the Disneyland fireworks!

Summary: Rooms are kind of small but we did have a balcony so that was great!.  We were told we would have a view of the Disneyland Fireworks this was not true.   It was very quiet and peaceful stay.  The bathroom was very small.  The bus for Disneyland stops right in front of this hotel.  And there are tons of places to order food in from since the Hotel has very expensive food.    There is also a Starbucks and Pizza hut in this property as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a great review! We're glad that you had a nice quiet stay with us, but we're sorry that we couldn't give you a room with a fireworks view. Please mention this if you book with us again, and we'll do our best to make it happen!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel because someone in our group was attending a convention and the rest of us went to Disneyland. The hotel is clean and nice and I had no problems with the rooms. As for the location it is VERY convenient if you are attending a convention. If you are going to Disneyland it is a VERY long walk with kids. We walked to Disneyland upon arrival and decided not to walk again. You can take advantage of the toy story lot shuttle buses which are just across the street from convention way. That was how we got back and forth and it worked out just fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, and thanks for the Disneyland travel tips! We agree that the shuttle is the best way to get there, and we're glad that you took advantage of it. We hope to see you again on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: What you'd expect from Marriott - Nice!
Summary: Staying here 3 nights for a conference. The meeting rooms are set up well and are clean. There are many nice seating areas around the hotel for meetings. The staff are all very professional. My room on the 9th floor is clean. I love a hotel were I can be barefoot in my room and not be grossed out by dirty carpet. Nice flat screen TV, desk and furnishings. The bed is fantastic too! The only negatives are the parking and internet fees. $24 a day parking and $12.95 for internet per 24 hours. The parking fee was lowered to $12 for our conference, but still I wouldn't want to pay $24. The internet has been a problem for 2 days now. The front desk has waived the fee for 2 days which I appreciate. If I were booking a conference in Anaheim I would consider this Marriott.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We're very happy that you could enjoy a "barefoot-friendly" stay with us, and we apologize again for the issues with the internet. We hope you will choose to stay with us again on your next conference in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at Marriott near Disney
Summary: Stayed here for 5 night over Spring Break. Great hotel. We stayed in a larger size King room (1501) with a roll out they brought up for us. The bathroom was decent size, not sure about the complaints regarding the bathroom being small. Maybe in another wing of the hotel?  Parking/the downside of staying here: My only real beef is the parking. It is steep at $24 a day for SELF PARK. We were probably the farthest room away from the self park garage. Found out the last day the charge for self park was only $4 less per day than valet ($28). Should have used valet. It was a long walk to the parking garage from our room. Had to allow an extra 10-15 minutes of travel time when we used the car, by the time we waited for elevators and walked to the other end of the property to car.
Manager Response: Thanks for the detailed review, your comments will surely be appreciated by others.  We appreciate being called an excellent property and hope you come back to see us again soon!

Summary Heading: This beautiful hotel has it all!
Summary: I needed a hotel close to Disney and chose this location.  Our room was ready when we got there at 11am.  This was a plus as we had just gotten off a 16 day cruise.  We took the $5 a day shuttle, right in front of the hotel, then headed for Disney a short ride away!  There is a Pizza Hut and Starbucks right in this hotel, as well as other dining options.  Our room was spacious and clean.  It was the perfect place for two senior women!
Manager Response: We're very happy that we could welcome you on land after 2+ weeks on the high seas! It's great to hear that you had a wonderful time staying with us, and we hope to see you again on your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable hotel and very helpful Staff.
Summary: Just returned from spending five nights at this location. The location is close to the Disney resorts and the garden walk. the room we were given was very large very clean and the the beds and pillows were so comfortable after a long day at the parks. The room had a nice view of Disney which was great! The staff was very helpful. The front desk provided suggestions and assistance that made the whole stay quite enjoyable. As others have noted the parking fee is 24 a day. shuttles run right to the Parks and other attractions for $5 per adult and $3 dollars per child for unlimited rides per day. this is something to keep in mind if you don't plan on doing a lot of driving. Overall a very pleasant experience.
Manager Response: Sounds like you had a nice spring break at Disneyland! Thank you for writing a great review, and thanks for including the vacation tips for potential guests. We hope to see you and your family again on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary: False charges , lied to by front desk, charged visa without permission and said going to give credit for 2 nights stay on two rooms with uncontrollable room bar and pool noise but then lied and gave small credit that didn't cover even 20 %
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments - we're sending you a private message to get to the bottom of this.

Summary Heading: A stay at Marriott Anaheim for Wondercon 2013
Summary: I just finished a stay at the Marriott Anaheim for business as I was working at Wondercon 2013. This will be a simple and to the point review.   The good: The Marriott assisted us with a fast and easy check in. The room was excellent and comfortable. I required assistance one day with my business needs and the staff did more than was expected to help with my needs. The Cafe Del Sol was reasonably priced and had very good food. Lastly even though the Hotel was very busy due to the convention I never felt I was put in on any back burners for my requests.  The bad: The Marriott did an excellent job of having no bads on this trip. I would advise anyone who wishes to attend the convention to stay at the Marriott and make your business trip an easy one.
Manager Response: WonderCon was so much fun, and we're glad you stayed with us! If nothing met your "bad" criteria, then we couldn't be happier. Thanks for writing a great review, and we hope to see you again next year!

Summary: Even before arriving, I planned on giving the Marriott Anaheim a negative review, based solely on their $24/day parking fee. It just seemed ridiculoulsy high. And it still does. But there were so many other things to like about our stay that I changed course and wrote an entirely different review.   We were in town to visit Disneyland, and the location is perfect if you're parking at the Toy Story lot (which is just across the street). You can also walk directly to the park in less than 15 minutes. The rooms aren't huge, but the entire property is remarkably clean and the beds were incredibly comfortable.   There's a Starbucks on the main level, along with free WiFi on the Lobby floor. Not sure why they feel the need to charge for WiFi in your room (besides extra revenue, of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write an articulate and wonderfully-honest review! We understand your concerns about parking, but we're so happy that we could provide you with a comfortable and convenient experience to change your mind. We hope to see you again on your next trip to Disneyland!

Summary: We stayed here for one night. The decor is what you would expect from a business-type hotel. Sophisticated and clean. The standard room is very small compared to what I'm used to. Good thing my husband and I didn't bring our three kids. Though we only utilized the room to sleep in, it would have been nice to have a spacious room. Nevertheless, the room was clean and the location to the convention center is nearby. I brought my laptop but didn't want to spend money for internet, especially when self-parking already cost $20. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant is pricey. Not going to do that again. The room has a mini refrigerator. I suggest you utilize it by bringing your own milk, drinks, fruit and snacks. I would return to this hotel if I can get a good deal.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, and we hope you can find a good deal to stay with us again! We now have free wifi for all our guests in the Lobby area, so don't forget your laptop next time. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I came to Marriott hotel after having the worst service at Ménage and the atmosphere was so much more professional. Everyone there was so much more productive and helpful. It was a great stay in a perfect hotel. Not too loud and very intimate for me and my family.
Manager Response: We're very happy that we could provide a clean, quiet, and comfortable stay for you and your family. We hope to see you again!

Summary: After 10 hrs drive via highway 1 we were completely exhausted and wanted early check in, being very polite they accommodated our request and upgraded our room for no extra charge. The rooms were fabulous, although we had no interaction with staffs we were pleased with the standard, cleanliness and respect provided us with every means. The beds were comfortable and we had a good night sleep both the nights. We weren't able to go through all the amenities but all we had all we needed.Next time I m in Anaheim, I am definately coming back.
Manager Response: After a 10 hour drive, you deserve early check in with an upgraded room! We're very happy that you could get some much-needed rest to start your Disneyland vacation. Thanks for writing a great review, and we look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to the happiest place on earth!

Summary Heading: Great selection near the convention venter
Summary: Location is just near the convention center (2 minutes walk) Rooms are very good - spacious, clean, fast WiFi, enough storage space, comfortable bed, plenty of outlet socket for convenient charging. Restaurant/cafe is spacious, but hard to get a table in the morning, and they do not take reservations. Starbucks in-house
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a great review! We're very pleased that everything met your expectations, and we hope to see you again on your next business trip to Anaheim!

Summary: There is a roller bed already in the room when we check-in so we have option to spread out the family.  The room is very nice and comfortable.  The heated pool still have water at a lower temperature than what should be but you can get use to it.  The pool is half cover so you have options.  We did get into the pool in March when is 70s during the day and feel comfortable.  The nice machine is very noisy so try to ask for a room far away from it.  Our room is away so don't know how the noisy it is for the next room or the room across from the ice machine.  Parking is pricy at $24 self and $28 for valet.  We chose valet and it is worth the extra since the self park is way back of the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, and thanks for taking the time to write us a review! We're very pleased that we could comfortably accomodate you and your family with a roller bed. Thanks for sharing the room tip, and we hope to see you again on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary: Stayed in the Marriott Anaheim on business.  The hotel is next to the Convention Center, so if you're working there, the location couldn't be better.  The rooms were well-appointed, with good views to south.  Hotel staff were friendly & efficient.  There was a Starbucks on site for a quick breakfast, and the fitness center was very good for a hotel.  It is a short walk to a number of restaurants, although in this part of California they're all "corporate".
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a great review! We're very happy that you enjoyed your stay and were able to take advantage of our fitness center. We hope to see you again on your next business trip to Anaheim!

Summary: I decided to take a chance with Priceline and bid again on a hotel.  This time we won the Marriott.  Given the rate was $70/night, the additional charges ($28/day for valet and $12.95/day for internet) for our 2 night stay basically made up the difference for any loss on their part, in my humble opinion.  The service was impeccable, from the notes from housekeeping to their room service, which is open until 1 am.  The food from room service was delicious and prompt.  The room itself was nice, but the bed's springs were a bit worn on our mattress.  There was a hair on our bed upon entry and inspection, as well as a hair on a shower towel. The TV stand that had all those extra plugs did not work, unfortunately, so that feature was lost on us. However, the overall stay was good.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review, and thanks for sharing your pictures! It's great to hear that you had a nice stay with us, and we're glad that you were able to enjoy a relaxing meal in your room as well. We hope you will stay with us again someday!

Summary: My Wife and I stayed here while we visited Disneyland a couple of weeks ago. The resort is very close to Disneyland although if you plan to walk, it is a bit of a hike that takes around 20-30 minutes depending on how fast you walk. They also offer a shuttle bus to the park for $5 per person per day but it is good for the entire day and is completely worth it. It's not actually run by the hotel but  by the transportation authority. The hotel has an incredible convention space and is very nice, but if you want a good view make sure you ask for it. It was very comfortable and a lot nicer than some of the other options in the Disney area.
Manager Response: Thanks for writing a great review, and thanks for including guest tips! We're very pleased that you had a comfortable stay with us, and we hope your next trip to Disneyland will start with us.

Summary: OK, it's convenient if you're attending a show at the Anaheim Convention Center next door. The property management jacks up rates during large shows to exhorbitant rates. I paid $467 with tax per night for a standard double room. Non-show rate would be more like $129. The high rate increases expectations, and the hotel falls short. It's certainly not a luxury property. Decent food in restaurants, but nothing you would go for if not staying in the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review.  We are glad you liked the convenience of our property to the convention center and the food in our restaurants, but we are sorry to hear that we fell short in meeting your expectations.  You are correct that increased demand during large citywide conventions and special events raises our pricing, similar to airlines and other industries that establish rates based on demand.  Sometimes booking earlier during large conventions can help with that.  Hopefully, we can welcome you back in the future during a time of lower demand so the price/value of our hotel is more in line with your expectations.

Summary Heading: Good value for family trip to Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed at a variety of hotels in Anaheim for family trips to Disneyland but have returned to the Marriott twice now.  It is a 10 minute bus ride away, but the prices are much more reasonable that staying at the Disneyland Hotel or Grand California.  It is true to the Marriott brand image of clean spacious rooms with good customer service.  The valet service was always prompt and helpful, check in was quick, the bell desk was prompt and the room service people sent a very nice complimentary "treat" to our room on my daughter's 10th birthday of candy bars, a free movie  and icecream.  They take the time to go the extra mile in a city that has plenty of options.  We were upgraded to the concierge level due to Gold status and the breakfast spread was hearty.  The ladies
Manager Response: Thank you for writing such a great review, and thanks for the room tip! We're delighted that we could contribute to your daughter's birthday celebrations, and even happier that you enjoyed a hearty breakfast with us before a long day at Disneyland. We look forward to hosting you again on your next family vacation in Anaheim!

Summary: No complaints.  We loved the room.  The staff was excellent.  Location was ok, it was within walking distance to attractions.  A nice hotel to be at for a conference.  I think it may be a bit pricey for a family vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing such a great review! If you loved the room and you loved our staff, then we couldn't be happier. We hope to see you again the next time you're in town!

Summary Heading: Location and comfort a great combination
Summary: Every year I go to a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. This is the first time I have stayed at the Marriott and can only say the location (literally next door to the convention center) and comfort of the hotel made this year's four days of meetings and work much easier than any previous year.  I will stay here every year from now on, the bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, service was excellent, and everything was spotless.  I recently stayed at another hotel and found even on the 26th floor the street noise was a problem.  At the Marriott I was on the 9th floor, there was loud music in the lobby and in the plaza in front of the hotel and I could not hear a thing.  WHen I was done for the day with work, I could really relax and get a good nights sleep.
Manager Response: Music to our ears! We're so happy that our staff could provide you with impeccable service, and even happier that you slept soundly after a full day of work. Thank you for taking the time to write a great review, and we look forward to having you again next time!

Summary: I stay here at least once a year. I pick this over the Hilton next door (for me and the 30+ guests I bring) because of the wonderful staff. In addition, I find the services and amenities I need are great. It is true, the rooms are a bit smaller than some, but my King room had a lovely sitting area and desk - I felt it was laid out quite nicely, and that I had all the room I needed.
Manager Response: We can't thank you enough for your continued patronage! We're so happy that our staff can provide you with the services to make your stay a relaxing one. Thanks for the great review, and we look forward to having you again next year!

Summary: Compared to the Hilton across the street, the king room I got was tiny, but it was clean and the bed comfortable.  Right next to convention center.  Windows of the room could open but just a few inches.  Hotel looks newer than the Hilton but is about the same in quality.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review! We're pleased that you had a comfortable stay,  and we hope to host you the next time you're in town!

Summary: This hotel was amazing. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was as nice as possible. Great location. Walkable to Disney if you really want to but the shuttle is probably a better option for $5/person/day. My only regret is we didn't stay another day or 2!
Manager Response: Thanks for the amazing review, and thanks for the Disneyland tip! We really appreciate it, and we hope you can stay longer with us next time!

Summary Heading: If you attend a convention this is great.
Summary: Service is better here than the Hilton or other hotels in walking distance to the Anaheim convention center. The staff is amiable, well trained and eager. The rooms are older and the beds need to be updated. But it's clean enough. It is better than the other choices nearby which is the best praise I can offer - but not a place for the family or pleasure.
Manager Response: We're so glad that you enjoyed our service, thank you!  We hope you'll come see us again!

Summary Heading: run down, loud and over priced!
Summary: I rarely write bad reveiws, but this one needs to be written.  I'm sitting in my hotel room at the Marriott Anaheim, just checked in.  I'm an Elite status member and I'ver never had a bad stay at a Marriott properety.  I don't ask for upgrades, I'm not picky, I just would like to stay in a nice standard Marriott hotel room.  The gentleman at the Elite check in desk was very nice, offering us a room on the top floror, but also advising my husband and I that there will be a lot of partying on that floor.  We decided to take a lower floor opting out of our king sized bed for a room with two double beds based on his advice.  When we got to our room, the light in the bathroom did not work,and the fan was rattling.  When you opened the door to the balcony, we have a nice view of the
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention - we've sent you a private message to address your concerns.

Summary Heading: Solid but starting to show its age
Summary: We stayed in a standard room on the concierge level with access to the conciergle lounge.  The room was very clean and bed very comfortable.  TV had HD channels and good complement of channels.  The bathroom and vanity are little cramped.  We were in town for a couple trip to Disneyland so we did not stay in the room that long.   The Marriott Anaheim is a popular place to stay because of its proximity to Disneyland and being right next to the Convention Center.  This place is place is busy all the time!  Staff does a wonderful job managing the crowd.  Valet was quick.  You can use a text messaging system to request your vehicle.  That was nice.  Front desk check in was fast.  But because this place gets a lot business, its starting to show some wear.  The hotel is very clean but
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review, we appreciate your thoughts about Platinum Membership.  We hope you enjoyed yourself at Disneyland and come back to see us again!

Summary: Loved this place!! From the second we got there everyone was so helpful and so nice. We stayed for 5 nights. Had a nice room. With a balcony with a nice view. The shuttle for Disneyland was right outside the front doors. Never has to wait long for it. The valet was so awesome and always help with directions they were always fast.  The maids were awsome everyday we got back from Disneyland our room was always so clean and she would always set up my kids toys so cute on his bed he loved that!! It was such a nice relaxing stay and we will for sure be staying here again!! Never got a chance to use the pool but it looked like a nice area. All around we just really like this one!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us such a fantastic review! We're delighted that our staff could help make your Disneyland vacation a memorable one, and we look forward to having you back. Maybe next time you will be able to enjoy the pool as well!

Summary Heading: Concierge room great base for Disneyland exploration
Summary: The Anaheim Marriott’s concierge room came with the extras that made our Disneyland touring days easy.  The concierge lounge came with a buffet breakfast that included a variety of items – some hearty, others healthy.  The lounge also had beverages available when the kids were thirsty, hors d'oeuvres (although we were at Disneyland and missed these each evening), as well as evening desserts.    Our room had a balcony, two queen beds plus we squeezed in a rollaway to create the right bed configuration for our family.  Normally we purchase two hotel rooms, but knew with a Disneyland destination we would only use our room as a place to sleep.  The Concierge lounge, with its food and drinks, provided us with extra space for those few waking hours when we weren’t in Mickey’s Magic
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! We're so happy we could help make your Disneyland vacation as smooth and painless as possible. We'd love to see you and your family again on your next vacation to the happiest place on earth!

Summary Heading: Marriott Suites for a family is way better!
Summary: Do yourself a favor, book at the Marriott Suites further away from disneyland and the convention center and avoid a lot of hassle. the rooms are small and old, ghe service is poor. This Marriott nickel and dimes you for everything. Wifi is crap (15/day), self parking is expensive ($24/day) and a mile away. You feel like the workers are walking around waiting for someone to tip them.  Not making this mistake twice. Worth the longer shuttle ride to stay at a much nicer, roomier, better hotel at Marriott Suites!
Manager Response: What a bummer that your stay with us was such a hassle and that you felt our service was poor.  If there were specific experiences you had with certain department or associates we would appreciate the feedback so we can continue to improve.  WiFi is free in our lobby space, but if you want to use it in your guest room there is a charge of $12.95 per day that accommodates up to six devices.  For only $4 more than self-parking there is valet parking available which is much more convenient and provides daily in and out privileges.  We're sorry to hear you won't return, but are glad to know you will be staying in the Marriott family.

Summary: We booked this hotel as part of a package and it ended up being a great deal.  They were doing a lot of construction infront of the hotel which was only bothersome due to the noise.  We were on one of the upper floors in the main tower and the noise from the construction workers and the shuttle buses were the first things we heard each day.  On a better note, the hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful.  I would stay here again, but I would request a room that faces south.
Manager Response: You'll be happy to know that the construction of the Grand Plaza has been completed!  We hope to see you again soon, thanks for staying with us!

Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel. The check-in was painless and they brought us a rollaway bed for no charge. The parking though, is ridiculous, a total ripoff at $24 a night. And that's just for parking and doesn't include Internet or other services typically included in "resort" fees. But the hotel was nice and the room and bed were good.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, we're glad we could help you with the rollaway bed.  We hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service through and through
Summary: We actually checked in unexpectedly for 4 nights after being completely disenchanted with the hotel we had a reservation with.   While the hotel was unable to meet our request for a King bed, the staff went out of their way to make us feel very welcomed and accommodated as many of our requests as they could when the property was clearly near capacity.   Consistently solid service all around from front desk, loung and valet staff.   Beds very comfortable, but rooms are ready for some fresh paint.   Thank you. We will be back!
Manager Response: Thank you!  We're so glad we could make your stay pleasant.  We can't wait to see you again!

Summary: I checked in at 11:15 pm from a 7 hour drive to only meet a crabby check in person. I did not want my credit card on file for "incidentals" so she snapped I need to pay cash for parking.I felt like I was at a 1 star hotel where I was not worth the time or effort. The parking at $24 a night is a rip off but not the hotels structure but the cities. You have to pay $5 per adult and $2 per child 3-9 for a bus pass to take you to Disneyland. It was easy to take and never waited more than 2 minutes to leave. If you plan to go 3 days I recommend buying the 3 day bus pass to save $$ and you can purchase that at the gift shop. 1 day passes can be purchased from the front desk. I liked having a Starbucks down stairs and the dinning. The room was clean, but a little small. Not what I would
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us and write a review.  We are glad that you enjoyed the comfort of your bed, the cleanliness of your room, the Starbucks and the convenience of the Disney shuttle.  We are sorry for the bad attitude you experienced at check-in.  The service we provide at check-in is extremely important to us since it is one of the first impressions when you arrive at our hotel.  Clearly, one of your first impressions was not a good one.  If you do not remember the associate's name, please let us know the date you checked in so we can review our schedules and follow up accordingly.  We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel on your next visit.

Summary: Just returned from a 4 night stay on the "Discover Disney" Package. We usually stay at a Disney hotel, but this package was too good to pass up.  The hotel seems to be an older property. The common areas in the lobby and the convention center are very nice. We caught the tail end of one convention on the weekend and the start of another one during the week. The hotel can get busy.  Upon arrival, we were greeted and asked if we wanted self/valet parking and/or help with our luggage. I said we would self park, but did need help with our luggage. Bellman helped us and gave me a claim ticket. No issues. I asked if I needed to park first or if i could check in first. They said either way, but they only ask i leave the key just in case they need to move it while i was checking in. At
Manager Response: Thanks for that very thorough review!  We're so glad that we could provide you with top notch service!  We're glad that Cafe del Sol made things work for your cranky little one (they get that way, it happens!)  We hope that you guys had a great time at Disney and can't wait to have you come again!

Summary: The Anaheim Marriott is advertised in the "Superior" category of Disneyland's Good Neighbor Hotels. Compared to other Superior or 4 star hotels I've stayed at, this is definitely more of an average or 3-star hotel.   There is nothing particularly "Disney" or family friendly about this hotel, even though it is considered a Disney Good Neighbor hotel. This hotel caters much more towards the business/convention center traveler (which given its proximity to the convention center makes sense), but I was disappointed by the lack of "Disney" in the hotel.   Outside of the lobby, the rest of the hotel feels dated, including the pool area and the rooms. The rooms were adequately appointed, but were very small. When booking the hotel (2 adults and 3 children), I assumed the rooms would
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to post a review.  The dedicated Disney Desk in our lobby where guests can buy park tickets, annual passports and shuttle passes is the main reason we are part of the Disney Good Neighbor hotel program.  Sorry to hear that our hotel facilities and location did not meet your expectations, but we do appreciate the positive score you gave us for our staff service.  We are also glad you liked our Starbucks and Marketplace for easy grab and go items.  If you return to Anaheim, we hope you give us another try to exceed your expectations.  Let us know and we will do our best.

Summary: I ended up at this hotel for a trade show and I was happy. My boss checked me in under his Marriott rewards account so I had access to the concierge lounge which made the stay nice with free breakfast.  Room I ended up with an accessible room so it was huge. Equipped just fine with the bed was good. My only problem was the TV was halfway across the room so it had to be a little loud to hear it.  Bathroom Again with an accessible bathroom it was different than others but no problems. I actually thought it was kind of cool the light was a motion light so it turned on when I walked in. I had no problem with hot water.  TV Good selection of channels for the stay. Maybe 30 or so channels.   Overall I was happy. I did ask a question at the front desk and they were very helpful. The
Manager Response: It sounds like you had a great stay - that was really cool of your boss to hook you up with his Rewards number so you could enjoy even more.  Thanks for staying with us, we hope to see you again!

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel that last few times I've gone to Disney and I always love it. The staff is great, you couldn't ask for a better location and the rooms are very comfortable. It also has 4 restaurants out front, and one inside the hotel, so it gives you a lot of options for eating.  Parking is reasonable, $8 for self parking and $12 for valet. They also have a shuttle that takes you to Disney, which works out to be cheaper than parking at the park.   Timmy at the front desk went above and beyond at this visit and made our stay extra special. Service like this takes your stay from good to great!  I recommend this hotel to my fellow travelers. Don't forget to check out the french toast in the restaurant, it is my favorite!
Manager Response: Thank you for having a great time with us!  We really appreciate that you're a repeat visitor and can't wait to see you again!

Summary Heading: Convention center and Disney hotel location
Summary: Great location if you are attending a convention or visiting Disney Land. All the Marriott attributes but if you are in town on Bussiness find another location. Had to wait in line to access the elevator. Very busy with convention people.
