Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us - we hope you'll come again!  We really appreciate your review.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here in February 2013 for a quick trip to Disneyland.  This hotel is beautiful!  I found the staff to be very friendly, especially the parking staff.  The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to the park gates, or you can get an ART pass and it sounds like the ART comes every 20 minutes or so.  A cab ride for two people to the parks is about $10. We tried all three modes of transportation.  They have cabs parked at the hotel 24 hours a day, which was very convenient because we had a 7am flight on the way home.  We had a large room on the corner (1501) and it was very quiet and had a nice view.  The hotel also had lots of amenities, such as a pool and hot tub, restaurants, and a large gift shop.  In my opinion, nothing beats the Disney hotels, but the Marriott is
Manager Response: We love it when a review is titled, "A great stay!"  Surely others will definitely appreciate your tips for getting to/from Disney.  Thanks for staying with us and we hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: Okay - The rooms don't feel 4 star
Summary: I've stayed at several hotels around Anaheim when visiting Disneyland.  I stayed at the Hilton accross the street from this Marriott a few times, but really hated the lack of service, and the rooms (although I loved their pool and room service).  This time I stayed at the Marriott and I've got to admit that the rooms are really outdated. This hotel is stuck in 1985 and needs a serious remodel.  The actual set up and proximity to the Convention Center and Disneyland should make this a prime hotel, but it isn't because it's so outdated.  The windows in the rooms were thin (let in a lot of sound) and drafty, the bathroom was extremely small, and the tub had stains in it. The beds were not comfortable at all, the pool is right outside the check in desk (no privacy), the room service
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us - we definitely pride ourselves on our service.  We do hope you come stay with us again when visiting Disneyland.

Summary: I've had a good experience both times I stayed here. Once was back in high school when my choir performed in Disney's California Adventure. The other was last year when my uncle had some business at the convention center. I went to Disneyland while he was working! Hahaha. The staff are very helpful and they got us free wi-fi since my uncle was there on business. I think wi-fi was like 10 dollars a day or something like that. But the price could have changed since early last year. The pool was nice and warm too. It was a great stay.
Manager Response: We loved your story!  How fun it must have been to perform at California Adventure!  Were you nervous?    Thanks for staying with us again, we hope you keep coming back!  :)

Summary: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the staff at this hotel performed above and beyond what was expected.  Each staff member at this hotel is always ready to help.  At check in the clerk made sure we were in a room that suited out needs, and even offered us water since it looked like we were tired and thirsty.  She took the time to make sure we had a room close to the elevator and that the down pillows and comforters were removed from our room.  The rooms were comfortable, the bathrooms a little small.   It was great to have a balcony and to be able to open the sliding door to get some fresh air.  The access to Disneyland was fantastic.  The shuttles arrived with no more than a 10 or 15 minute wait and the ride to the park was very quick.  The food in the bar and
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing us for your Disney home base, we're so glad you enjoyed your stay!  Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: I Have Found My Ultimate Disney Hotel!
Summary: This hotel has a great package deal for $239 a night, which includes: free parking (or $4 for valet), free shuttle service to Disneyland for a family of four, deluxe room with balcony, and $100 Disney gift card for each night you stay. We received the gift cards during check-in. You can use them to buy your park passes at the Disney desk, which is next to the concierge desk. Or you can use them in the park, which I did so I didn't have to lug around my purse. The concierge was helpful by making reservations for us at Steakhouse 55. Our room was right across from the ice machine, but it was not noisy at all. Two double beds, which were a tad small but not a deal breaker. The room was quite large and roomy and the kids loved the balcony. The staff is AMAZING! Not one person stood
Manager Response: Thanks for making us your Disney hotel!  We take pride in making your stay an awesome one!  Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I stayed here for the second time in 3 years for a business conference. The rooms are the average marriott (but nice) style, definitely clean. The proximity to Disneyland really makes this a good choice. You can purchase a transit ticket that will easily drop you off at the park or the shopping district.   The onsite Starbucks was nice, however it can get busy. The restaurant wasn't anything out of the ordinary but it was nice as well.   All and all I'd recommend this location for business or family trips. If you're looking for ambiance and romance I'd probably select a smaller boutique hotel in the Orange County area.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us, we hope you'll come again!

Summary: Average experience in this marriott close to disneyland and very close to the convention centre. Large hotel. Great gym but crowded at times. Rooms are okay. Interior is dated at least 10 years back.  swimming pool has no privacy. Environment offers restaurants but not a lot more.
Manager Response: We're glad you stayed with us, thank you!  Let us know when you're in town next time.  We hope to see you again!

Summary: Pretty average Marriott hotel.  The good:  room was clean, good water pressure, onsite Starbucks, convenient parking, close to Disneyland.  The bad: beds are small, hall noise easily heard in room, expensive parking ($24/day).
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us - we hope to see you again!

Summary: I stayed here to run the half marathon sponsored by Disney, with my 2 small children to avoid the mark-ups of Disney property hotels.  This hotel is the place to be if you want to save money, have a clean room, but go without a "view", and a microwave.  The staff is professional and friendly, the rooms are clean, but we were promised a "microwave on arrival" that never came to our room.  We paid extra for "high city view of Disney" and our window stared right out at the Hyatt that blocks the "view".  There is a walk area that is lit at night and is nice but save the money and stay here if you want to save on Disney.  There is a shuttle service, especially for the marathoners that drops you right at the door.  The walls are thin, we heard our neighboring room enter/exit on their
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us while you participated in the marathon, we're glad you think we're the place to be!  We hope to see you again.

Summary: This place has the best staff of any chain hotel I have ever stayed at. All of the staff did a great job. The place was spotless inside and out. Very friendly. I just wish they had a coffee pot in the lobby. I was on central time and was wakeing up two hours early. Starbucks did not open until 6 am and I didn't want to wake my wife by my early hours making coffee in the room.
Manager Response: We're looking forward to having you for your next Disney adventure as well!  Thank you for making us a part of it!

Summary: You think it is Marriot, the quality is high.     The bed is smaller than to average American size bed.  The hotel is visibly old, but maintained.  This hotel is nothing more than just to sleep at after a day of fun and magic at Disneyland.  Value for money?   You definitely paying for the name.     To travel to the hotel, make sure you listen carefully to your navigator.  It's location is confusing.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us for your Disney trip!  We hope you'll come again!

Summary Heading: Beautiful home base for our Disney adventure!
Summary: We stayed at the Marriott Anaheim for 6 nights in early Jan. 2013. This was a family vacation, and we had two rooms.  The rooms were clean and spacious - perfect for our young child to run around in!  The exterior and lobby are immaculate. Very well kept and welcoming. The hotel cleaning staff were super friendly and hard working. The cleaning woman on our floor was amazing, and brightened our day by her friendly greetings and smiles for our daughter. Room was always spotless! We used the Starbucks every day for breakfast before heading to DL. So convenient! Also loved the lobby water dispensers. Nice touch. On previous trips we had always walked to Disney, but now that we have kids, we opted to buy a multi day ART pass (available in the hotel gift shop). Buses stop regularly in
Manager Response: Thanks for telling us about your fantastic stay!  We can't wait for you to come back for your next Disneyland adventure!

Summary: We stayed at the Marriott Anaheim for 4 night at the start of December.  We booked the room through Qantas travel (online) at a special rate with a free night and didn’t realise that the rate included parking which saved us nearly $100.  We arrived early and were able to get in to our room.  The room was clean and comfortable – just what we needed after a 14 hour flight! Unfortunately the room backed on to the elevator and we could hear it going up and down, but it didn’t keep us from sleeping.   The feather pillows were small and uncomfortable.  It would be great to have a pillow menu available...!  The hotel was very busy with conferences and it make finding parking a little harder, or we had to walk further away but again no major drama.  Also a couple of our showers were
Manager Response: Thanks for spending your trip with us!  We're glad that you enjoyed your stay and were able to walk easily to Disney!  We hope to see you again!

Summary: we stayed here for 4 nights in january and it was an absolute treat after being in freezing parts of the USA for the previous 4 weeks.  we walked to DL, the outlets at orange were a short cab drive away.  staff were very friendly and went out of their way to assist on all occasions!  very convenient. we were there for business and leisure and all bases were covered, i would definitely recommend for families and will certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: We're so glad you could come enjoy our fantastic weather!  Thanks for staying with us and we hope you'll come again!

Summary: I stayed between Christmas and New Year's while attending a large convention. Overall, the hotel was quite nice for the venue. Every staff member I passed while walking through the hotel greeted me. The meeting facilities were good, as was the food served during a banquet. Only issues with staff was housekeeping staff did not offer greetings in the halls and the server during the banquet seemed confused when our table asked about ingredients in the dessert because of a nut allergy. They initially said it did not have nuts but then brought out a plate of fruit to replace it.  Rooms were comfortable, but the bathroom felt cramped. Only some of the rooms had balconies, depending on which of the three areas (Palms tower, Oasis tower, Garden Wing) it was located in. The suites
Manager Response: Thanks for the thorough and positive review of your experience!  We really appreciate that you stayed with us and hope you come see us again!

Summary Heading: Despite being Sick....Marriott made up for it!!
Summary: So this is the second time I have stayed at the Anaheim Marriott and I am completely satisfied and impressed. Upon arrival, my daughter noticed that the lobby did not have the wii set up anymore (as it did at Xmas time), so she asked a bellman. The bellman Don explained that it is just a holiday thing but he would gladly set it up in our room for the weekend. So he and Ray (other bellman) did just that. The next morning our 9 year old was sick with the flu, so instead of heading to Disney, we stayed in our room for her recovery. Later that night, we tried to venture out to dinner, we saw Don again and he asked how we were. I explained that our daughter was sick! He offered us a free movie certificate and some popcorn (since we were cooped up in the room). My husband went to tip
Manager Response: Hooray!  Thanks for the feedback, we're so glad we could make your trip a good one.  We hope your daughter is over being sick and can come back and enjoy Disney soon!

Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights as part of a large meeting. I was very impressed with the service and overall feel of the hotel. There was a second large meeting in the hotel also, but the staff did an excellent job keeping things moving and it never felt overwhelming. Food was very good at both the small restaurant and large functions. The service staff were all very pleasant and helpful. I unfortunately never had a chance to leave the hotel but seemed to be very close to shopping and Disney.  I travelled alone for this trip but saw a number of families in the hotel.  I've stayed at a lot of large impersonal hotels for business and this one really managed to keep a personal and friendly feel in spite of all the people coming and going.   Room was quiet and comfortable (ask for a
Manager Response: Thanks for the note and for noticing our attention to detail to make you feel welcome and not overwhelmed.  We're indeed very close to Disney and hope you can come stay with us again so that you can see just how close!

Summary: I come to Anaheim twice a year and always stay at this hotel for a total of roughly 15 nights a year. There are many upsides to this hotel; 500 ft. walk to the convention center, proximity to Disney, and don't laugh but the best part of this hotel is the Chicken Spring Rolls on the room service appetizer menu. If the hotel ever takes these off of the menu I will find another hotel. The hotel also features a lot of dining options as well as a couple of bars on the lobby level. You also have a Starbucks in the hotel conveniently located on your way to the convention center. The downsides are the noise from Disneyland fireworks, the pillows are very small, the patio doors are not as airtight as they should be . It has been in the 30's this whole week and I can't seem to keep my
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review.  We really appreciate your loyalty and are happy to know that you continue to stay with us year after year.  The chicken spring rolls are definitely one of my favorites too.  If you like Ahi, try the Ahi Nachos which are also one of our signature items.  Dee-lish!  We will definitely pass your comments along to our Engineering department about the room temperature and seals on the patio doors.  Thanks again!  We look forward to welcoming you back for your next stay with us in the future.

Summary: We were relieved to get to the hotel after travelling for nearly 24 hours. The check-in was quick and efficient. We were giving two keys to our room #1747 situated on the 17th floor.  We were rather pleased with the room, which by our european standards was very spacious. We had a big bed which was very comfortable. Decent sized bathroom with a tub + shower head. We appreciated the beautifully scented bathroom amenities.   A few things did bother us, such as the expensive wifi. It was $12.50 a day if I remember correctly. Perhaps are we too accustomed to hotels with free wifi. The walls in our room were thin. It didn't interfere with our first night's sleep because we were exhausted and slept through the noise. But on the second night, we found it hard to fall asleep.The hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for the very thorough review and feedback, we really appreciate it!  We're glad you found our value and amenities to your liking and hope you come stay with us again soon!

Summary: The rooms are clean, very comfortable beds, staff are excellent  and very friendly. The hotel is about 2 blocks from Disneyland, we walked back it was about 20 -30mins. There is the convention centre and Hilton next door. There is a bar and several eating areas, the food at the bar area was very good as was breakfast at Cafe Del Sol, service was excellent. We were there New Years eve and the security was very good, there was no noise on our floor at all.
Manager Response: Thanks for recommending us as a great hotel for Disneyland visits!  We're so glad you also enjoyed our service and your stay.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We were attending a convention at this hotel, so the decision of where to stay wasn't up to us, which is why we were so pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel and service.  We usually get a small suite, since we are there for 6 nights, but apparently the hotel does not have an abundance of suites and they were all booked. The room was nice and comfortable and since we were on the concierge level, they lounge provided the extra space we needed.  We highly recommend requesting the concierge level, which includes a free breakfast buffet and water and soft drinks throughout the day and appetizers during happy hour.  The amenities of the Starbucks and Pizza Hut were a big hit with our conference attendees.  We ate several meals in the Cafe del Sol or the bar.  The food was
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your great feedback, we definitely appreciate it!  We're so happy that you were able to enjoy your conference and hope to see you again!

Summary: I stayed here on business.  This hotel was immaculately clean and the service was impeccable.  We had packages delivered to the hotel and the bell hop even carted them to the doors of the convention center for us which was completely above and beyond the call of duty.  Every staff member we encountered was just as considerate, patient, and helpful.  Attitude counts when you're running on fumes during an exhausting business trip.  Really enjoyed the pool and hot tub too!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful service and cleanliness compliments - we definitely pride ourselves on these attributes.  We're so glad that you enjoyed your trip and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I do not generally start a review with a negative comment, but the housekeeping staff at this property is inconsistent and needs better training. I hold mgmt. accountable for that. Since the GM reads these, I am being very purposeful in this comment. When we checked in (great front desk people, valet, bell desk), the room had 2 bottles of body lotion, 1 shampoo, and no conditioner. On the second day, the amenities were correctly serviced by the housekeeper, but they left no bath mat. Whether it is a lack of English comprehension mixed with the fact that the body lotion and conditioner bottles look the same, it is really very simple to fix. Conditioner is 1 word while Body Lotion is 2 words. How hard is that to teach? In general, the housekeeping staff was also very reserved in
Manager Response: Indeed - we do read these comments and thank you very much for your feedback, we will definitely pass it on. Thank you for letting us know your thoughts.  We love the tips that you gave as well and know that others will be grateful for your insight.  We hope that you will be back!  Thank you!

Summary: We moved to the Marriott from another hotel after a bad experience during a recent trip to Disneyland with our son. Boy were we impressed! Let me tell you about a number of great things: 1. Lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas. 2. Starbucks and Pizza Hut in the hotel--great for families. 3. Extremely well stocked gift shop with lots of snacks, drinks, etc. at reasonable prices. 4. The pool and hot tub were great. 5. Staff were extremely helpful and knowledgable. 6. The shuttle to the parks was easy to navigate and very convenient. 7. The room was spacious with comfortable king size bed and lots of room for a cot for our son. 8. Our son loved the Wii in the lobby where he could meet other kids and play. 9. Walking distance to other shops and restaurants. Can't say enough
Manager Response: Thank YOU for all of the fantastic compliments!  We really appreciate it and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We traveled for 7 days thru CA.  This hotel definitely wins the hospitality award!  We are Marriott gold members and the hotel definitely treated us like GOLD.  (Didn't get this treatment at the JW Marriott in Santa Monica).  The property is pretty standard for Marriott.  We booked it due to the proximity to the Disney parks.  The shuttle bus was available for rides to and from the parks.  To elaborate on why I said the hotel wins the hospitality award: We were able to check in at 9 am and get to Disney. A roll away bed was brought immediately to our room so our children didn't have to share a bed. The Concierge Suite was fabulous for breakfast and snacks and drinks.  We didn't eat dinner there even though heavy appetizers (beef tips/salmon/potatoes etc) were available. Milk and
Manager Response: We're so thankful for your feedback and glad that you enjoyed your stay!  We're all certainly happy to be here near the "Happiest Place on Earth", how could we not?  Thanks again and we hope to see you back again soon!

Summary Heading: Great staff, Clean hotel! Please have more payment options for Internet access.
Summary: I stayed at the Marriott for VidCon 2012 after my reservation with the Hilton was poorly handled. The staff who took my reservation went the extra step after hearing about my disappointing experience with their competitor, and tried to find a way for me to stay at the hotel AND match the pricing of the Hilton, which would've otherwise been higher as the cutoff date for group bookings passed only 24 hours prior.  The room was modest and simple for my needs. I stayed there over Canada Day weekend, and was pleased with the family-oriented vibe I experienced in the lobby, compared to the Hilton. When I had an emergency to deal with, the staff were empathetic and prompt in helping to the best of their ability.  I was so pleased with my stay that I decided to sign up as a member of
Manager Response: Thanks for the candid feedback, we really appreciate it.  We definitely use guest comments to improve our service and amenities.  Also, thank you for booking another stay with us!  We can't wait to see you again!

Summary: I stayed here to take my son to Disneyland and was surprised to see that the rooms were not newly renovated. The outside of the hotel looks good. I was there last weekend when they also had a huge convention there.The hotel did a great job. It is a very large sized hotel with ample rooms for meeting space and a huge lobby. There rstaurants are great and extremely kid friendly. They have a great breakfast for the Platinum members and a huge concierge lounge.The hotel is very clean, just needs an update. There is a shuttle for Disneyland and it is only a few dollard per person , which covers a whole days travel. If you choose to walk, you can because it is only a 15minute walk or about 3 blocks away from the hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review and for staying with us.  We hope you come stay with us for your next Disneyland trip!

Summary: I decided to take my husband to Disneyland for Christmas. As nice as it would have been to stay at The California Grand which is at Disney, the rates were astronomical so we decided to stay at the Marriott. Its only a few blocks from Downtown Disney or a $5 cab ride. The staff was great. Valet very kind and polite as well as front desk. They make you feel welcome and excited about your stay. We got an executive king room which was clean and roomy and a lot like all the Marriotts but could use some updating especially in the bathroom. I'd recommend asking for a room that's not near the parking areas as it's noisy and the lights are bright. Maybe ask for something facing the convention area. We went to the restaurant and bar a few times. The bartender was also our server and he
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review and for choosing our location for your stay!  Next time you come please let us know what we can do to make your stay even better.  Happy New Year!

Summary: But -- I was there for a Convention and the lobby was FRIGID as were all the meeting rooms! In Room Dining (& Special Services)  "Martha" and the bellmen (especially Ray, Scott, Cameron and Marc) were just perfect! My own room (a disabled access one) was large (I am also- and in a wheelchair)  warm, comfortable, the beds especially, and Cable TV selection of channels- was adequate. I'd stay here again.
Manager Response: We're so glad that you enjoyed our service, thank you for staying with us and taking the time to tell others about your experience!  We'll let everyone you named know how much you enjoyed their service as well.  We hope to see you again soon!  Happy New Year!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for couple's Disney vacation
Summary: The Anaheim Marriott was a great choice for our romantic 9 day California theme park vacation. It's located across the street from the Disney parks with excellent $5/person/day shuttle service, close to Knotts Berry Farm and 2 very good outlet malls, walking distance to restaurants, convenience stores, and Anaheim Garden Walk. Hotel itself had excellent service and housekeeping, and a tasty menu in the lobby restaurant. I would recommend this hotel for couples, and families as well.
Manager Response: We're so happy that we could be part of your romantic getaway!  It sounds like a wonderful time.  Thanks for the extra tips for future guests, they'll definitely appreciate it.  We can't wait to see you again, Happy New Year!

Summary: This hotel is expensive and classified as a 4 star hotel. Given the amenities and quality of the rooms, it is a 3 star hotel. It is nice but not upscale in any way imaginable. The room decor was very plain and the toiletries were very basic and actually smell disgusting. Whoever designed the disgusting orange ginger toiletries for Marriott has bad taste. They smell so bad and I do not want to use them. In general, Marriott hotels tend to be dated and have cheap toiletries. This hotel is slightly better than the average Marriott. On a positive note, the staff was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed our friendly staff, we definitely pride ourselves on providing excellent service. We appreciate your feedback on the toiletries and will pass it along to the right people.  When you're in the area next, we hope you'll let us know so that we may make your next stay a delightful time.  Happy New Year!

Summary: We have tried our hand at most of the major hotels in the Anaheim area, visiting 5-6 times per year (combination of Disneyland trips, occasional business, and frequent basketball tournament for our boys). This time around, stayed at the Marriott hotel convention center. The room was tight and dated, pool aged, and self-parking was quite a trek from the lobby. Whether traveling for business or pleasure, there are far better choices for the price. If you prefer staying at Marriott properties, I’d definitely recommend heading down the road a bit and staying at Marriott Suites which is a much better value.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review DKM, we take feedback from our guests very seriously and appreciate the time you took to write about us.  We pride ourselves on our service and great proximity to the Convention Center and theme parks among other things.  We hope you'll let us know next time you are in town so that we can have another chance to make your stay great!

Summary: Stayed here in December of 2012. Was a little dissatisfied with two areas. The pillows are old, small, and I had to request more. Secondly the room just did not seem up to a typical Marriott standard. The carpet seems dated, the acoustic ceiling is dated, and the furniture feels piece mealed.   Positives for this property would be the happy and helpful staff. They are all engaging and everyone I have had the pleasure to meet has gone the extra mile. I feel very safe and secure here. The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland and several great places to eat and shop.   Listen don't just relay on other people's experiences. Stay here for yourself and make your own informed decision.   Thanks!
Manager Response: We really appreciate your comments and advice to others to stay with us and make their own decisions.  We take your feedback very seriously about our beds & pillows and will make sure the right people also hear it.  Thanks again for staying with us and we hope to see you again!

Summary: We stayed at the Marriott on our recent DL visit.  The staff is probably one of the best highlights of this hotel.  Everyone went out of their way to be friendly, courteous and accommodating.  Even the bellman was very jovial...thanks for asking about my brother, Santa!  The hotel lobby was beautiful with its holiday decor.  For an older property it was a standout.   Love that there's a Starbucks on property, with a small gas fireplace to sit beside.   The only reasons it didn't get a 5 rating were the beds...comfy, with plush comforters...just not outstanding.  Also, parking was a RIDICULOUS $24.00 a day!
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review and for staying with us!  We appreciate that you enjoyed our decor, friendly staff, and amenities.  We hope you'll stay with us again!

Summary: Family trip to Disneyland and California Adventure. We were pleased with checking in earlier than expected and the staff was welcoming. I got a fair price for the area and would stay again. I read a few reviews with regards to the self parking being far, I thought it was fine. Although I do agree $24 is a tad steep? As for getting to the parks, we bought the ART passes at the front desk $5 adults and $2 for kids. It is kinda walk able, but factoring all the walking at the parks $2.50 per way was a deal. It is just over a mile to walk it, but the walk back at night would no doubt feel longer especially if you have to carry a 5 year old :) It had a Starbucks for my wife and though we didn't get a pizza they do have  a pizza hut as well. The rooms were clean large flat screen TV,
Manager Response: Thank you for spending your family vacation with us!  We appreciate that you would stay with us again and hope that we see you on your next vacation!

Summary: I stayed here for a three-day conference in early December. I booked a double room, non-smoking, requested a balcony facing Dinseyland land at check-in was giving a nice room on the 14th floor. The staff in the whole establishment is extremely friendly and greeting you throughout the stay. The property is nice inside. The room was comfortable, but a smaller room from other Marriott properties. Bed and pillows were comforable, flat screen TV with nice balcony with chairs. The only negative was the bathroom was small and internet was a fee. I would definately stay here again. It is a good 20 minute walk to downtown disney from hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a very nice review!  We're glad you enjoyed our friendly staff and comfortable beds.  We hope that you'll stay with us again!

Summary: We stayed here last week on a two day Disneyland trip.  We've stayed at the Hilton across the street many times but chose Marriott this time due to a much better deal and I have no complaints.  The lobby was nicely decorated for Christmas with some nice eating and drinking places (Pizza Hut, Starbucks).  Checkin was very easy and the service was very good.  The room was decent sized and clean.  I would recommend this place for any DLand visitors as it is certainly a much, much better deal than some of the other hotels in DLand area.  And the shuttles to and from DLand are very easy and convenient.
Manager Response: Thank you for breaking your normal routine and staying with us, we really appreciate it!  We're so happy that you enjoyed the decor and our service.  We hope to see you again for your next Disney trip!

Summary Heading: No Double Queens, $24/day parking, but a Marriott is still a Marriott
Summary: I am not used to the lavishness of a Marriott, but I could get used to it.  Why do 4 star hotels not have double queens? The double beds were too small for me and my wife, but the room was wonderful overall.  I loved the hotel for the 1 night stay.  I was treated very well.  However, I cannot recommend this hotel for Disneyland families on a budget, who are looking for convenience.  I have now stayed at 5 hotels in the last 2 months around Disneyland (check my other reviews to know which ones).  This one is the nicest by far, but suits my family's needs the least.  I drive from Vegas to go to Disneyland.  Parking is $24/day here.  It is also $15/day at Disney lots, with your alternative being the ART bus for $5/day/person ($2/kids).  A family of 5 is in for $40/day to park and
Manager Response: Thanks for coming in from Vegas to stay with us.  Hopefully your experience with your transportation didn't affect your view of our location.  We'd love to have you again, please don't hesitate to reach out to us if there is anything we can do to make your next stay even more enjoyable.  Again, thanks for staying with us and for your feedback.  We really appreciate that your rated our service, rooms, and cleanliness so high!

Summary: This is usual hotel when we go to Disney Land.   Quiet, clean, typical Marriott .  Walking distance is a major stretch with regard to Disney Land, but easy shuttle away (for a fee).  You'll be glad you didn't pay the enormous Disney hotel rates, and you'll be happy NOT to have 2 million screaming kids at the pool.  Not that there aren't kids here. . .there are, just not as many.  Great pool area, both indoor and outdoor.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind feedback!  We're delighted that you enjoyed our pool area and are your usual hotel for Disney visits.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We were VERY impressed with our stay here. The bell staff were absolutely wonderful & sent our 2 daughters a beautiful Welcome gift (as it was our 1st time to Disneyland!) This was completely unexpected & a really nice touch. We stayed on the Conceirge Level (such great value & I would highly recommend). We also had a view of the fireworks which was lovely. I was reluctant to stay here as I thought it would be inconvenient to get to/from Disneyland but it is completely the opposite. The shuttle is so easy & only takes about 3mins. The rooms are nice & clean....bathroom is tiny & needs updating but really no big deal. I highly recommend this property : )
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your glowing recommendation!  We're so glad that we could help make your first trip to Disneyland so impressive!  We appreciate that you stayed with us and hope you come back to see us again!

Summary Heading: Love the location next to convention center and Disney
Summary: I like Marriotts, the service is always great.   I like the location of Anaheim Marriott.  It is easy to walk from the Hotel to the Anaheim Convention Center or to Downtown Disney.  It easier to take the shuttle to the front gates though.   The nearest convenience store is about a mile walk so you are stuck with whatever the have in the gift shop if you need something.  The room has the old yellow Marriott decor with some nice upgrades.  My room had a media center so it was easy to hook up my computer or iPad up to the large screen TV.   That is always nice.     I like their new bedside lamps.  They have a nightlight option, and regular light.   The lamps also have electrical outlets so I was able to recharge my device on the night stand.   I found the closet small and the
Manager Response: A room with a view of the fireworks - that's great!  We're so glad we could make that happen for you!    Thank you for noticing our service, we hold ourselves to a very high standard!  We really appreciate your feedback and hope you'll stay with us again!

Summary: First off, we have been staying every year, sometimes several times a year, at the Anaheim Marriott since 1987 and here are the reasons: Of course, for Disneyland and the other small reason is for business. This Marriott has several things going for it: Front Desk is superb. This means you will get a professional, courteous person. No matter if you have booked the cheapest room on the net or are paying full rate, you are treated with the same type of respect. Just the opposite is true for their competitor across the street whose name starts with an H as happened to me when I tried them. Rooms: All the rooms have recently been renovated and there are no dated or worn out rooms. I will admit we only stay in the main tower so please ask if booking the tower or garden rooms.
Manager Response: Wow!  Thank you for being such a loyal guest!  We really, really appreciate that you stay with us every year!  You've got great tips that others will surely benefit from.  Look forward to seeing you again!  Happy holidays!

Summary: While I stayed here for business, this hotel is well suited to both the business traveler and families visiting Disneyland.  Located next to the convention center, this place is good for the business traveler.  About 20 minutes by car from John Wayne Airport, it easy to get to.  For families, it's a 10 minute walk to Disneyland/California Adventure/Downtown Disney.  Shuttle service to the parks, an in-house Starbucks and a swimming pool make this an excellent place for families too. Clean, well run... A good solid value.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to tell us that you found us to be a good, solid value.  Your review will certainly be helpful to others.  We appreciate that you stayed with us and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Stayed here for a night during a recent trip. Check I process was flawless. Had a king executive suite. Well maintained room, pillows & mattress reasonably comfortable. Bathroom larger than most. Numerous On-site venues for eating. Large facility.  The club was large & the food was delicious. The staff was very gracious.   Self parking was a bit of a headache, as it feels like you are driving out of your way, but once in garage it was not a problem.   One side note, there is extensive construction in the entrance area. It can feel a bit hectic when driving through, but there are people stationed out at the entrance to help guide you around the construction.
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay in an Executive Suite with us and our delicious food!  Thank you for staying with us and we hope you'll come back again!

Summary: Professional and friendly check-in was followed by great service during our stay here.  Concierge lounge staff was top notch.  We really enjoyed the breakfast.  Its a nice walk to Disneyland in the morning.  At the end of the day we caught to Disney overflow parking shuttle to the convention center next to the hotel.  Worked out great for us. Thanks again!
Manager Response: Thank YOU for taking the time to give us your feedback and for staying with us.  We're so glad that getting to Disneyland was an easy undertaking for you and the family.  We hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and will stay again
Summary: We recently stayed here with our kids while visiting sowm local theme parks.   As soon as we pulled up we had staff helping us out of the car and asking if we needed any assistance to our room. The kids especially loved the attention of one of the staff members who had them giggling.    Our room was nice, clean, and beds were comfortable. I like how they purposely placed us on a high floor on the side where we can watch the fireworks that Disneyland has every night! We did notice a medium sized dent/hole in the wall below the window and my husband called the front office just to make them aware that it was there before we checked in. They were quick to ask if we would like a different room and were concerned we weren't satisfied but we were not bothered by it, we simply didn't
Manager Response: We love that our staff could get the kids giggling and that your experience with us was great!  Customer service is very important to us and we're delighted that you noticed all of the details (and the fireworks!)  We look forward to seeing you again, thank you for staying with us and for writing about your time with us!

Summary: My family and I took a Disneyland trip and have had the best experience staying at this Marriott.  We were always greeted with a smile and treated with positive and upbeat energy.  Since we stayed at Disney for most of the day and night, we were so tired of walking, it was a treat to have the vallet service option.  The vallet service was awesome and the vallet management sent our kids a very nice treat of Cars favors and chocolate bars as a token of their appreciation (There were some truffles also for the hubby n I).  The beds were really comfy and the room was nice and felt refreshing. The bathroom was a little outdated and needed a towel rack outside of the bathtub because the kids couldn't reach the towels after they washed hands, but no biggie.  I used the gym and loved
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review your stay with us!  We really appreciate your kind words and love that you gave some helpful tips for your fellow travelers about when to hit the Starbucks.  We're so happy that your family enjoyed your stay with us and hope to see you again!  Happy Holidays!

Summary: we visited Marriott Anaheim at the start of November. after a long flight we where pleasantly greeted by the receptionist. Our room was in the palm tower very large room and very clean. unfortunately there was construction work going on outside which was a very early wake up call for us, we asked reception if there was a possibility if we could change rooms and the girl behind the desk was very pleasant and assisted us and there was no problem with a room change, the bar staff and waitress' where extremely friendly chatted away when we where being served or even if we where sitting outside they would have came over and acknowledged that we where there! although the older ladies who work in the restaurant in serving breakfast could maby learn a few things from the younger staff
Manager Response: Thank you for such wonderful complements!  We're so glad that you were able to enjoy our customer service that we pride ourselves on.  From the front desk, to the restaurant staff, to everyone that you come across - we want you to have friendly service.  We really appreciate that you stayed with us and hope to see you again!

Summary: Recently attended a conference at this hotel.  The hotel was clean, updated (except the bathrooms need a little more updating) and service was great.  The food provided by the hotel conference facility was some of the best I have ever had.  Healthy fresh options, full of flavor and welcoming.
Manager Response: We're so happy that you really enjoyed the food and enjoyed your stay with us.  We definitely pride ourselves on assuring that we serve delicious and healthy food for our guests.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: Standard hotel, used to be better
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was an ok experience. I've stayed here before for a conference we hosted a couple years ago and the hotel was great, not sure now. However, excellent meeting rooms and very nice staff, which I'm sure is still the case.   When we checked in the girl at the desk was very friendly and thanked me for my Marriott Rewards status. She told us she was giving us a "fantastic room" because of it. When we got to the room we realized it was a handicap access room directly across from the elevators. I understand these rooms have to be given out but two things about it annoyed me: 1. She insinuated we were getting a better than average room, 2. As a Rewards member I don't expect upgrades or free stuff, but I do expect NOT to get the worst room on the floor.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to provide a review on our hotel.  We are glad that you enjoyed our beds and the view from your room.  We're sorry that you did not get a better room upgrade.  Next time you are coming to the area, please let us know and we will do our best to get you a better upgrade.  As a Rewards member,  it is very important to us that you feel appropriately recognized for your loyalty to Marriott.  Also, thanks for the great comments about our staff service and the feedback on Starbucks.  We will be sure to pass that along to the team.  We appreciate you choosing our hotel and hope you give us another opportunity to take good care of you when you return to Anaheim.

Summary: Here for a convention and wasn't looking forward to it. But the room was much nicer than I expected. Large, clean, nice little balcony. Cafe is annoying with blasting oldies at breakfast. Too much for that time of day. Restaurant in the Hilton across the street. Hotel referred me to a car service which was very reliable. The Garden Walk Mall is about a 15 minute walk, quiet, lots of chain restaurants. But then it seems like there are only chain restaurants in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent stay and writing a review.  We are glad that you enjoyed the size and cleanliness of your room.  Also, thanks for the feedback on the music in our restaurant.  We will be sure to pass your comments on to the team.  The next time you visit Anaheim, we hope you come back to stay with us so our concierge team can provide you with a list of all the great independent restaurants in Anaheim.  There are a lot of chain restaurants in the area, but also some fantastic local finds that we are sure you would enjoy.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: All work & No play but great local.
Summary: Hotel is very well located, only a few blocks from some good food places, 5-7 minute walk.  About 10 minutes to Disney but unfortunanentl since I was there for work to include evening meetings I didn't get to play.  Lobby and business areas of the hotel are outstanding.  Rooms are a a little better than average.  My only concern, when we got in room(ground floor) we unpacked and got ready to leave and just because we are cautious we checked the sliding glass door, apparently the staff had never checked it when they cleaned before we checked in, it was unlocked and the security bar was not in place either...good thing we checked and didn't assume.  Staff were excellent though whenever thet saw us thet always had a smile for us.
Manager Response: We really appreciate that you brought to our attention the issue with the sliding door.  We've passed that information along to our housekeeping and security teams.  Thank you for your feedback and thank you for staying with us.  We hope to see you again when you can work less and play more!

Summary: Currently staying here.  We checked in early with no problem getting a room. Our room number was 294, which had a balcony and faced the parking lot.  Rooms are small but had plenty of space. Was surprised to have two double beds. Doubles leave not much room for two adults and two children.  Room was nice and clean.  We decided to drop off our stuff and head to the parks. Used the key lock safe for passports etc but kids were playing with iPod and my iPhone so I placed them in top drawer of dresser and we left.  Came back to hotel around 5pm and we changed rooms to a higher floor.  Husband moved all of our stuff up and as he was leaving the room on the second trip, housekeeping was going into the room. It was  about an hour later when our kids asked for the iPod we realized it
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to work with us on this issue.  We take the security of our guests and their belongings very seriously.  This is of the utmost important to us.  We hope this incident gets a positive resolution and look forward to serving you and your family in the future.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Staff is professional and very friendly. Very good bar in lobby with tasty snacks and excellent service. Rooms are spacy and clean, self parking is very easy accessible. Thanks to large business part (meetings room) of the hotel little bit complicated orientation first day but Starbucks is good milestone :-)) and meeting point.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying with us at the Anaheim Marriott.  We try very diligently to assure that we give our guests a map layout of the property on arrival and to have adequate signage to let you know where you are.  We appreciate your feedback and hope you'll come back to stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Great service and a great base for your anaheim adventures.
Summary: Was put up here for a convention and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel as i have stayed in a number of Marriott hotels in England and have been disappointed.  We where receiving some merchandise to sell at our stand in the convention centre and felt that the convention centre where charging way too much for us but the Marriott only charged $20 per item which was great.  Room service was very fairly priced and there is a Pizza hut in the lobby if you fancy the trek down the stairs. All in all very pleased with my stay.
Manager Response: We're so glad we could impress you!  Thank you for staying with us and for taking time out to write us a review.  Hopefully we will see you again!

Summary: The staff at this property were great - very professional and friendly, I didn't pass a single person in the hallways or lobby without receiving a greeting.   It is very easy to locate (even with the construction right out front).  Parking is a bit pricey, but the valet service is great.  It was very nice to be able to text the valet and have the car waiting.  The rooms were quite nice and beds comfortable.  I was not at the property long enough to fully take advantage of all of the amenities.  I did eat breakfast in the concierge lounge and was very impressed.  The room was quite spacious and the offering was complete . . . fresh fruit, bakery items, yogurt, and hot items.   I will definitely stay at this property when returning to the area.  I stayed about a block away at the
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your feedback, we're so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We appreciate that you chose us and hope you will be back soon!

Summary: had a great stay other than hot tub not working very nice grounds and close to disneyland would stay again called to front desk about hot tub but could not fix on our stay so was given comp breakfast .thanks stephanie an asset to the hotel
Manager Response: We're so glad that you enjoyed your stay and our service, thank you for your feedback!  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again.

Summary: We chose Anaheim Marriot for our recent trip to Disneland and had a nice experience there. The rooms were comfortable and priced well. I appreciated being able to buy tickets to Disneyland from an agent in the hotel. There was a convenient shuttle that we used ($5/person) which runs every 20 minutes and had plenty of space, dropping us off right at the entrance to the parks. Room service offered a nice variey and arrived quickly. The bathroom was small, but the bedding was good quality. There is a Starbucks and pizza hut on site. Parking in the garage was convenient at $24/day.
Manager Response: We're delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate your feedback!  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay even better please let us know.  Thank you for staying with us at Anaheim Marriott.

Summary: Decent location near Disneyland but next to the convention center. Hotel was clean and the staff was great. Very friendly and helpful.  Our room was clean, large and quite.  We had a large balcony overlooking Anaheim and the clean smoggy air :)  Self parking was 24.00 per night.  I guess we are all getting use to those exorbitant parking fees and the endless taxes imposed by the cities.  They have a shuttle bus to Disneyland operated by the City of Anaheim for 5.00pp all day.  Here is a little secret. If you don’t want to walk 15 minutes to DL walk to the DL overflow parking lot two blocks from the hotel and hop on a shuttle for free.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying with us and giving us your feedback, we really appreciate it.  We hope you'll come stay with us next time you're in the area.

Summary Heading: a measure of reference; strong recommendation
Summary: This is one of the nicer Marriott's I've been in.  Check in process was perfect, and quick.    The hotel is located in the convention center's loop.  perfect location for business or disney.  rooms are nice, well appointed.  Internet in the room is $13 per day and parking is $24 per day.  service was excellent everywhere.  Strong recommendation.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your strong recommendation!  We really appreciate that you stayed with us at the Anaheim Marriott and that you took the time to write us a review.  We hope that you stay with us again and that you feel your next stay is 100% perfect.  Again, thank you!

Summary Heading: Good value and a great location
Summary: This is really a conference hotel and that was the reason for the trip.  The rooms are a decent size, the bathrooms are tiny and so is the closet space.  The conference space is great, but they do charge you an arm and a leg for Wifi everywhere in the hotel except for the lobby.  That's a real drag when you are staying for business and need to have Wifi.  The service was ok.
Manager Response: We're so glad that you found us to be a good value and good location.  Thank you for taking the time to write a review and for staying with us.  We hope that you'll come again and let us make your stay even more enjoyable!

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights while my husband attended a conference. I spent most of my time by the pool, which was pleasant. Yes, there are kids at this hotel- it's right by DisneyLand! What is a pool without kids splashing around in it? The max depth of the pool was 4 feet, but it seemed just right for the kids that were playing in it. It was nice that there was both an open area for sunning, and a covered area for when it got too hot. The Patio Cafe didn't have great food, but it was nice having somewhere right by the pool to grab a drink or sandwich. The pool chairs were a bit dirty but I always lay on a towel anyway (towels and chairs were both plentiful by the pool.) We opted for a concierge level room and it was a good choice~ the breakfast was nice and appetizers at night
Manager Response: We really appreciate that you stayed with us at the Anaheim Marriott and that you took time to write us a review.  Thank you!  It's nice to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  We hope that you'll visit us again and give us a chance to make your stay even better.

Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel for five nights. Before going to Disney I was really worried about staying outside the park, at the same time staying in the park is very expensive. However, when we got the the Marriott Anaheim I liked the lobby and staff. The staff were very polite and very prompt and the service was great. The market place and Starbucks were excellent. The room was small and the bathroom tiny,The air conditioning didn't work very well but the room was clean and that what really matters at the end. Transportation was easy by using the shuttle service to Disney. I would definitely go back to this hotel if we return to Disney.
Manager Response: We're delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate that you took the time to give us feedback.  Please don't hesitate to reach out to us if there is anything we can do to make you next stay even more enjoyable.  Thanks so much for choosing to stay at the Anaheim Marriott!

Summary: The hotel is within walking distance to the park entrances of Disneyland and California Adventure.  One can opt to take the shuttle service, but we found the 10-15 minute walk a good way to get the energy flowing for the day.  Rooms are spacious with typical Marriott beds.  Bathrooms are functional and have tub/shower combo with good water pressure.  Our room had a balcony so that was a nice feature to enjoy the fresh air at the end of the day.  There is a large Starbucks in the lobby which we frequented as well as a Pizza Hut and a hotel restaurant that we did not.  The Executive Lounge was good for a quick breakfast before heading out and was rarely crowded to my surprise.  One note about the lounge:  $8 for a glass of wine a bit high.... I appreciate the properties in Asia
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your recent stay with us, we definitely appreciate your feedback!  It sounds like you took full advantage of our location and amenities.  If there is anything we can do next time to make your stay with us an even better experience please let us know.  Thank you again for staying with us at the Anaheim Marriott!

Summary Heading: Check out this hotel while at Disneyland!
Summary: I've stayed at Embassy Suites (North & South), Hilton, Candy Cane Inn and others...this Marriott certainly ranks up there if not exceeds expectations while in Anaheim for Disneyland. Although the entrance was under major construction, the hotel was unaffected for the most part. I stayed there with my 6 year old son for Halloween at Disneyland. The best part I found about the hotel is the friendliness of the hotel staff from the valet, front desk clerk, house cleaners and food servers. They were outstanding!  Secondly, the in house restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced food, not too much tourist gouging. It's called Cafe Del Sol. Deal for breakfast...kids under 12 was free with adult meal. For $17.00 I got 3 hot cakes, side of bacon, unlimited orange juice and coffee for
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us and for your feedback, we really appreciate it!  We strive to make every guest feel at home and provide a good value.  We hope you'll come back and stay with us again!

Summary: 500 feet to the convention center. Walkable to Disneyland, Garden Walk, and Downtown Disney - or take the shuttle that stops at the front door. If you plan to stay there Oct 2012 through the end of this year, be aware of a major streetscape project underway on the north side of the building - get a room NOT facing that direction.  Rooms feel dated, very small bathroom, but clean and quiet. Balconies on the rooms overlooking the pool. Excellent, friendly staff. Onsite restaurant, Starbucks, Pizza Hut, and a market. Great business location if you're headed to the convention center, probably better / less expensive locations for families with kids headed for Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review.  We appreciate your feedback very much!  We're thrilled that you gave us the highest ranking in cleanliness and service.  We hope that you stay with us again!

Summary: We stayed at the Marriott Anaheim 10/16 - 10/21/2012 and had a great experience. Things could have started off bad, but the staff at the Marriott really stepped up and made everything at check in right. The staff was friendly and attentative the entire week. Close to the convention center and Disneyland. Their in house restaraunt had a fabulous breakfast and dinners were equally enjoyable. Nice facility, clean, bright rooms. I would stay away from the 4 story tower rooms with double beds as you can't move in them, but you do get a nice balcony. I would stay here again without a doubt when I am in Anaheim.
Manager Response: We're so glad that we were able to impress you!  Reviews like yours always make our day.  Thank you so much for taking the time to write about us and thank you for staying at the Anaheim Marriott.  We look forward to having you as a guest again!

Summary: I was not overly wow'ed or impressed by this location.  Once you leave the lobby floor it's a bit of a downgrade.  I stayed in the Oasis Tower and maybe it's an older section, but it could use an update.  The bed was really uncomfortable, the room was dated, furnishings were older and the wallpaper was too.  In general, it needs updating.  I will say that the lounge and restaurant are top notch for food.  Naturally one kitchen serves both and the menu's are about the same but the food was terrific, it was up to Marriott standards.  The chicken tortilla soup was terrific.  You're really staying for the location either to the convention centre or Disney, the convention centre is steps away and Disney about a mile.  There is some great restaurants nearby, Morton's and Ruth's to
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful complements about our food - we strive to assure that this and everything about your stay is top notch!  We definitely appreciate the time you took to write about us and hope you'll come back and stay with us at the Anaheim Marriott again.  When you come back, let us know what we can do to make your stay a 100% positive experience.

Summary: Great location, but more importantly the staff was courteous and friendly and a pleasure to deal with!  The rooms are decent, but fell short of the look of the hotel.  I would have expected the room to be a little upgraded.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review, we definitely appreciate it.  We’re glad you found out staff so helpful. We pride ourselves in our service and making sure every guest feels right at home and has a great experience.  We strive to make sure every guest feels comfortable and right at home.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay better, please feel free to reach out and let us know.  Again, thanks so much for the review!

Summary: We stayed here for the second time for 4 nights, as part of a Disneyland trip. Everyone from bellmen, front desk and housekeeping were nothing but helpful, and very pleasant to deal with. Loved having a Starbucks in the hotel. There was construction in front of the hotel, and as such they reduced the cost of valet to $4 per night. (Normally $28) Self parking was at no charge, however as it wasn't close but is in a garage, valet was in an open parking lot. They room was comfortable, bath amenities were bath & body, not best but ok. The beds were doubles, not queen and the room was spacious even with a rollaway in it.  Hotel bar in lobby had a great bartender and really good food. No free wifi, knew that going in though.  20-25 minutes to Newport Beach, bellman offered directions
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us at the Anaheim Marriott a second time!  We really appreciate your repeat business.  We're so delighted that you found our staff to be helpful and pleasant.  That's something we definitely want to assure all of our guests experience.  We're disappointed that we couldn't be 100% in your eyes and appreciate your feedback as we take guest opinions very seriously.  We hope that you'll come back to see us a third time!

Summary: Just a few minute walk to the convention center and a short drive to Disneyland.  Nice enough property with dated rooms.  Living area in room is large and bath is tiny.  Beds are comfortable.  Nothing to complain about - just over- priced for what you get.  There are less expensive options throughout this area.  Staff is great.  Very helpful and polite.  Cafe has pretty good food at a reasonable price.  I would consider staying here again, if one of the small properties on Harbor or Katella were not available.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and the nice comments about our staff service, comfortable beds, and food quality.  There are definitely lots of choices in Anaheim and less expensive options at 2 and 3 star properties.  We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your recent stay.  On your next visit to Anaheim, if you choose  stay at a full service property, we hope you find our overall value competitive to other comparable hotels.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the Anaheim Marriott in the future.

Summary: This is our second stay at this hotel.   It is a nice full-service Marriott.  Easy walking distance to convention center and restaurants.  Disneyland is about a 10-minute walk.  At the end of the day, you can take a city shuttle from D.land directly to the hotel. We had a bedroom with an attached hospitality suite.  I was surprised that the ceiling above the door in the hospitality room had water damage and it looked like there was also some mold -- not what I normally see in a Marriott....
Manager Response: We really appreciate the time you took to give feedback, thank you.  We're very happy that you're overall quite happy and disappointed we weren't at 100% of your expectations.  We take very seriously our guest feedback.  Thank you for staying with us at the Anaheim Marriott and we hope that you stay with us again.

Summary: Hotel was very convenient, shuttle to Disneyland was very easy to use. They had enough shuttles that there was not a long wait. Hotel is huge, room was very nice, updated, kept up and clean. Food we ate in the hotel was good. Concierge lounge was wonderful. A bit out of the way if you are staying in the other tower but just a small concern.   We did use the pool at one point and it is a smaller area and (not the hotels fault) very rowdy little kids all over the pool. The parents were not watching them how ever it would have been nice to see a hotel staff member walk by to at least see the environment by the pool. My husband and I both had to tell this group of kids to stop splashing water all over. We were sitting in the seats away from the pool and they kept getting us wet over
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your valuable feedback, we really appreciate it and are so glad you enjoyed your stay.  We are always looking for ways to improve the experience here.  We hope that you'll come stay with us again!

Summary: In case you're wondering, this hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland, but it's a long 15-20 minute walk.  You're better off buy a day pass to the ART(Anaheim hotel bus transit system), which is $5 a day for adults.  The most you have to wait is about 20 minutes for a bus, but beware!  At the end of the day, when you're exhausted, there might be a long line for the ART bus (take the 4, 5, or 6 line to get to the hotel). We ended up walking back to the hotel.  Now, the hotel itself is especially nice because of the staff, who couldn't be kinder and more accommodating.  The things I really liked about the hotel were the gym (excellent!), the Starbucks and deli and pizza available at the lobby level.  The swimming pool is very shallow, so great for kids and I especially
Manager Response: We really appreciate your detailed review and all of the compliments you so graciously paid us.  Your tips will certainly be very helpful to other guests.  Thank you and we really hope you stay with us again soon!

Summary: Stayed in the Oasis tower which is far off the main lobby near the meeting rooms. Convenient for conventioneers for not great for Disney guests or families. The other tower is also closer and more convenient to the pool. This tower seemed dated and the bathroom fixtures were surprisingly very old, the towels were the same. The irony is that there was a sale brochure which highlighted the plush towels which could be purchased, maybe these towels are reserved for the other tower guests as our were grey and rough from age. Next time will opt for the Hilton next door which has nicer rooms for better price.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review of our location.  We regret that you didn't find things up to your standards and appreciate your feedback.  We'd love to get another chance with you visiting us.

Summary Heading: Great Location for Business or Pleasure
Summary: Recently stayed at the Marriott Anaheim next to Disney World and the Convention Center.  Room was very clean but a little dated.    Great people who seemed to care about their guests.  Had a bellman named Mark Richardson that was outstanding.  Called me by my name when he saw me.  Would stay there again.
Manager Response: We want to thank you very much for your review!  We really appreciate when a guest takes the time to talk about a good experience.  We hope to see you again!

Summary: Decent hotel - Clean, Neat but overall ambience felt a somewhat dated.  Travelled for conference at the convention center which is just 2 min away by walk.   Disney land is also just 10 to 15 min away by walk. Lots of decent restaurants within walking distance.  There was lots of construction going on in front of the hotel which was an inconvenience.  Inhouse Starbucks was great.   Supershuttles to and from the Santa Ana Airport works very well. Just book before hand.  Staff were friendly and helpful.   Would return.
Manager Response: We really appreciate that you took the time to give us your feedback and glad you had a nice stay.  We hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: Convention Hotel with Extremely Pleasant Staff
Summary: Stayed here for convention.  Clean rooms that are standard sized for business travelers although bathroom smaller than typically normal.  Beds comfortable and fresh. Hotel best for convenience to convention center facilities. No children's hotel. Staff very pleasant and courteous, catering to business professionals.  Room service excellent.  Not much in area (exception to Disneyland) for down time-no shops, etc.  Pool shallow-almost a kiddie pool and limited for size, and chairs. Has a few restaurants in addition to Starbucks and PizzaHut on site.  Take van service to airport-convenient drop off and pick up service-allow for traffic time for flight though.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the excellent review!  We appreciate the time you took to write it very much.  Hopefully you will stay with us again!

Summary: This hotel is very average.  We stayed on the club level so I would have thought the rooms would be the best in the hotel; they were well below my expectation!  The room was small - we are a family of 4 and I ordered a room with two beds.  The beds were tiny (double), the bathroom was tiny, and everything was very dated.  I had a dreadful sleep each night we were there as he air conditioning made a terrible whining noise and the walls are paper thin and even though we were a few rooms away from the elevator you could still hear these. The pool was very small and over crowded.  The club level breakfast was ok but nothing outstanding and the services they offered were minimal so probably wouldn't bother booking the club level.  There were two good things about this hotel - we had
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, we're sorry that you feel we were below expectations.  We've noted your concerns and hope you'll come back and give us another shot in the future.

Summary: This is the first time we have stayed off of the Disneyland property.  The cost was much less than one of the Disneyland properties, but we were concerned about travel back and forth to the park.  My son stayed at the Marriot and suggested a taxi.  This was a wonderful option.  We could save by staying off-property and the taxi was only $10 each way.  Picked up at the door of the hotel and dropped off right outside Disneyland.  Taxis were always available at the hotel and at the Park at closing.  The room was clean and very nice and we had a nice view of the city.  The pool is not great--only 3.5 feet maximum depth--but that is not why we were there.  If you're not interested in paying $300+ for a Disneyland hotel, check out this option.
Manager Response: We're grateful for the time you took to review us, thank you!  We're glad you consider us a "wonderful option" and hope to see you again!

Summary: I thought that  this hotel..being  within Disney travel hotels and all would be friendly and prompt service! We show up at about 10 pm my sister and i with 2 kids 2 and 6.. The bellboys are apparently inside so you have to drag your luggage from the shuttle area into the lobby. She checks in while im trying to find a bellboy as we need a cart..being late and all we are trying to get the kids to bed. After standing there 10 minutes...finally find the bellboy. We get to the room and find out neither the crib or microwave are not there wich we requested 2 weeks prior as well as hours before we arrived. We call them and let them know..meanwhile 2 yr old is having a meltdown wanting to sleep. They show up over 30 minutes later..at this point baby is passed out so we tell them forget
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here with family during a quick Disneyland trip.  Location is pretty decent, but it's definitely not what one would expect given the cost.  They nickel and dime you to death for amenities lower tier hotels provide for free.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location can’t be beat.  It is walking distance to Disneyland, Downtown Disney and Anaheim Garden Walk.  The Convention Center is just outside the hotel entrance.  Shopping and dozens of restaurants are within walking distance as well as a couple of dining options on site.     Nice sized rooms.  Good linens.  Comfortable beds and pillows.   Hotel and rooms are nicely decorated.  The ocean pictures in the rooms were a nice touch.  Everything was really clean.    The staff is all super friendly and helpful.  Hotels grounds are pretty and well maintained.    There was construction outside hotel entrance but we could not hear it in the room.    The $24 parking is a little steep but that seems to be the norm in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Upon arrival there were a number of employees in the lobby chit chatting. Check in was indifferent, no info provided about hotel or available amenities. I booked the club room floor, if you enjoy drab surroundings and old cookies you'll be fine. I thought it a waste of money. Staff not overly warm, enthusiastic or engaging. They did seem to enjoy talking amongst themselves in the lobby, just not to guests.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here during a convention. Food at catered events was very good.  Room service also good.  Lots of construction outside and I did hear jack hammers every morning, including Saturday, at 7 am.  No alarm clocks necessary.  Pretty comfortable king bed, bathrooms very small and the shower heads squeaks continuously.  Sounds like a mouse is trapped inside, and I  needed to keep bathroom door closed all the time to block it out.  Desk area small and cramped, and insufficient plugs near the desk.  Charge for internet.  Got an email from Elite Services asking for my requests before check in and never received any of my requests.  Staff friendly.  Short taxi to the parks, pool small so no laps, just dunking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location is close to the Convention Center, which is undergoing extensive construction, making hotel access difficult. I had a nice corner room. I didn't like the $12.95 plus tax daily charge for room Internet. This was a large conference. The wait for elevators was very long. When I called to complain, things improved (but not until after I had been trapped for 10 minutes between floors in a very overcrowded elevator).  Check in and out was smooth. Staff was very friendly.  Tea, usually overlooked, was provided in the room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful customer service , but rooms are deceivingly below average rooms. Mattresses in two double bed rooms are very firm and old. Bathrooms need recaulking and window seals are all blown causing a completely obstructed view. For $200 a night , this was not a value. It wasn't completely uncomfortable, there were many comforts inside the hotel including a Starbucks. It's a big beautiful hotel , but rooms are run down. Would not stay here again for the money.

Summary: We stayed here recently for our wedding anniversary (no kids) and went to disney.  Close to the parks, $4 shuttle round trip beats a $15/ each way cab(15-20 minute walk).  Hotel is nice, appears meant for the business traveler, however, suited our needs just fine. Rooms were clean and spacious, and the beds were comfy.  Bathroom was a bit on the small side, but didn't expect much.  Only minor gripe was I was told parking was included because of whom I booked through, however, was charged $12.  Its not a lot considering EVERY place charges for parking ($10-$15 has been my experiences).  We stay in Anaheim about every other month and this was definitely one of our favorite places to stay.  Didn't dine or hit up the pool, but they looked nice.  Oh yea, there is a starbucks
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was here for a conference.  The staff were very helpful and attentive.  The property was well maintained and nicely decorated.  Except for the box lunches (just average), provided on some days, the food was very good.   There was a lot of construction going on in front of the hotel, but I did not hear it inside the hotel.  The convention center is a short walk across the street.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stopover for a Disney weekend
Summary: As a regional neighbor we rarely spend an evening in Anaheim but on this weekend I decided we'd spend the night and not face an hour drive home.  I was a little nervous about some of the recent reviews but none of the recent negative comments were realized in our stay.    The rooms weren't enormous but more than adequate for or family of 3.  The twin double beds made for a cozy sleep but the linens were shiny clean and the pillows were large and ample - and the beds were very comfortable.   Like the room the bathroom was smallish but had all the right amenities and a good strong shower.   Barely room for two at the sink but it didn't affect our stay.   Out 11th floor room looked south over the pool area and the included balcony was a very nice bonus for relaxing.  And the recent

Summary: One night here, standard issue Marriott.  I arrived too late for dinner, and left before breakfast.  Location was great for my meetings.  Room was standard Marriott.  Nothing outrageously good, but there were no faults.  It’s a VG against the US scale, a Good against a global scale.  Service was friendly, rooms were clean.  I would return if I needed to be in the neighbourhood.

Summary: Everyone here has been so pleasant.  There's not one staff member I havent walked by that hasn't spoke.  Everyone says hello, good morning, good day or how is your stay.  It's very clean here and their toiletries aren't cheap!, they're from bath and body works!  The only little, very minor downfall which is not under their control is the construction right outside. Also their pool area is really nice.  One other minor dislike I may say is that there is no refrigerator or microwave in the room. So no hearing leftovers for you! I would definitely come back and stay here.

Summary: Attended a conference last week at the Marriott hotel, 10 years after my last one. The hotel has undergone major upgrading. I have enjoyed the room and service , which proved again the grandeur of the Marriott chain. Great location too !
