Summary Heading: The place for convention goers, okay for Disney
Summary: Ideal location for Anaheim Convention Center. There are closer hotels for Disneyland.  Only one restaurant with high priced meals. Pool nice but small considering number of guests. Decent health club. Wi-Fi extra. Staff was helpful and friendly.

Summary: We stayed two nights here, excellent customer service and clean and tidy rooms.  We spent a night in the bar with some friends, the bar staff were exceptional, the bar food great!  We are planning another trip and will definitely stay there again.  Also is a short ride to Disneyland and the buses come every 20 minutes.

Summary: We were here at a convention for 5 days. I must say the service was great and the rooms were great! I slept amazingly.  Only negative feedback: Terrible wireless at the rooms- I was never able to use it to call through Skype so I ended up calling through the phone hotel. Little did I know rate was $15/minute. I am aware that international phone calls from hotels are expensive... but that much?  Very close to disneyland too!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is very close to Disney resort, however this is an expensive hotel and almost every service that is complimentry in other hotels will cost you: the hoter charge for parking 24$ (!) a day. when you get a package to the hotel they will charge you 10$ per night per item if you don't take it. breakfast is not included so you will need to pay by your own. regarding the rooms - don't take room next to the elevator - you won't be able to sleep. i had to move a room...

Summary: Hotel clean.  Currently road under construction in front of hotel but traffic still moves fine overall. Very close to convention centre and short shuttle to Disneyland and shopping.   If you are getting the Super Shuttle from LAX book both ways as it is the only shuttle to this airport and is very busy.

Summary: My company held a conference at the hotel (not the convention center).  The rooms were adequate, not great.  Food was overpriced and bland.  Most of the folks working there seemed nice enough...except when they were telling you they knew a problem existed and they had no plan to fix it.  Examples-  the wireless in your room is worse than dial up... when you call they put you thru to tech support who tell you "the network isn't working very well"  not a 1 day issue was there 4 days.  AND they want $12.95 for it  A colleague had bedbugs (at least I was spared that)  for a huge convention hotel..  4 folks at front desk maximum... gives you lots of time to admire the lobby... and the elevators are overmatched for large crowds... gives you lots more time to admire the lobby  Nice

Summary Heading: Well ok if you are at a convention it is close
Summary: Drab. Bad beds. Mediocre food. Steak house closed with a convention of 6,0000 people, so down the street we go. Not completely terrible for the price but about as average as a Marriott gets. The staff in the restaurant are pleasant.  If you are doing Disney on a low budget this would be a good choice. Understaffed all around.

Summary Heading: Great Base for a Holiday in California with Excellent Staff
Summary: I travelled here from the UK with my husband and two children aged 20 and 17. After much searching on the internet and contacting other tripadvisor reviewers I settled on booking the Marriott due to its location for the itinerary we wished to do on our holiday of nearly three weeks. Unusual yes it seems to stay in one hotel for the duration we did, but one factor was that we didnt want to hire a car (the roads to us in and around LA look so scary and no matter what time we travelled on them they were very very busy) however we did want to do as much as possible.  So firstly the hotel, which is in a fantastic position for Disney. We have stayed in many marriotts and although this one is a little tired in places this is made up by the quality of staff service which is excellent,

Summary Heading: Not very impressed but friendly staff
Summary: I was here at this hotel because I had to attend a conference at the Convention Centre. Walking distance to the convention Center and if you want even to the Disneyland. The washroom didn't have an exhaust fan and with more than one person on the room was not so good. i had the room with two doubles - was the conference deal - $160/ night but with taxes I paid $1,200 for six nights - a little on the expensive side and the room was not so great - and no breakfast included. The staff seemed exceptionally friendly - everybody was saluting you - I didn't need any help from the staff anyway. The pool was excelent because it had a shaded area where you can sit or swim even during the hot day time. Do I come back to this hotel?

Summary: Stayed 4 nights for a conference at the convention center.  The staff was very friendly throughout our stay.  It was a quick walk to the convention center.  We took the bus to Disneyland one evening, but ended up walking back and it wasn't a bad walk.  The room was clean, but not very big.  WI-FI was not free.  Self parking was also very convenient and I believe it was free.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay right near Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for a few nights while going to Disneyland. We have stayed at several Marriots in different cities and are never disappointed. The beds are always super comfy which is what we like the most about them. This hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Disneyland and if you get a room facing the park you can see some of the fireworks at night. There is a Starbucks in the hotel and lots of places to eat nearby. We had breakfast at one of the restaurants in the hotel one morning and it was good but as expected very expensive. Also stopped by the bar for drinks and snacks one night, again good but expensive.   There is a hot tub which is nice to relax after a long day of walking.  My only complaint is the lack of wifi, well they have it but you have to pay which seems silly

Summary: Would have given this hotel a 3 if it wasn't for the great customer service. Lobby area was nicely appointed. The restrauant was nice, great Buffett breakfast, $23.00. Food was just OK, but again the staff made up fot it with great customer service! Room was small and in need of a make over, bathroom was even smaller.  Close access to Disney and the convention center. Overall, OK hotel with Great Staff.

Summary: Excellent service from all employees. Attractive lobby and grounds. Balloons for the kids. Room size was smaller than preferred but well appointed. Neighborhood construction made it somewhat difficult for pedestrians. Not far from Disney. Right next to Anaheim Convention Center.

Summary: I got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel. It was really nice, but the rooms were small and the bathroom smaller. It's not a reason we wouldn't stay there but it was a little "snug". William, one of the concierges, was so nice and accommodating. It did suck to pay $24 for self parking! Really, $24???? and there was a charge for Wi-Fi too! Pool area was nice, the kids had a good time & the Wii in the lobby is really nice touch. Overall great stay!

Summary: I have been bringing my family to Disney for the past 9 summers and we have always stayed at the hilton anaheim towers as diamond members, but this year we had a great deal from priceline for this hotel. The hotel room is smaller, but considering the price we got- it was worth it! we will definately stay there again!

Summary Heading: Can't get closer to the convention center...
Summary: Typical full service Marriott complete with a Starbucks in the lobby. Only suggestion... Starbucks ground beans in the room rather than the tasteless no name coffee they offer. Otherwise, no complaints.

They have a great breakfast buffet and the pools are very nice too! They also have a Starbucks in the hotel. The hotel was also just a few minute walk to Disneyland. The rooms are very clean and the service was great!! I will be sure to stay here on my next visit to Anaheim!

Summary: This was an okay hotel and was what I expected for the rate that I paid.  Everything was clean and the beds were comfortable.  The walk to and from Disneyland did seem a bit long especially after a day at the park.  We only stayed one night and didn't use the pool, but it looked very nice and relaxing.

Summary: We had to stay here for three days in late June for business in the Convention Center.  I had to go back and forth to the room a lot--many treks down a long hallway!  Luckily we were in the Oasis Tower, which is closer.  I also liked the Tower because it was convenient to the Oasis Pool (no dripping through the main lobby in a wet swimsuit).  We enjoyed eating lunch by the central pool, and also having an evening cocktail there.  The food from Cafe de Sol was always good.  One problem we did experience was we had a business package delivered to the hotel which was not located for three days. Also, the concierge desk was not very helpful when we needed to find a certain restaurant.   Our 10th floor room was very quiet, we slept like logs. If you will be in a hurry in the morning

Summary: My attendance at a 5 day seminar required a stay in Anaheim California. My Marriott experience at this hotel was refreshing compared to other hotels I have HAD to stay for meetings. My standard room,though pricey, was definitely  exceptional with tasteful decor and duvet cover on the VERY comfortable firm bed. There were always plenty of fresh clean towels and great maid service. The absence of an outdated mini-bar was replaced  with a very convenient refrigerator under the in-room coffee-maker. I recommend staying above the 9th floor to escape street noise. The well tended gardens and landscaping were so tasteful and appealing, which gave the entrance a grand, welcoming and elegant feel.  The two pools were well placed and inviting with excellnt lunch service

Summary Heading: Excellent business hotel -- walking distance to Convention Center
Summary: Great for business, so-so for families.  Best bet is to pay a bit more per night and stay on the concierge floor with free continental breakfast and a cocktail hour w/honor bar.  Worth the savings.  Caveat: be sure you don't stay in a room which shares a wall with the elevators -- we did and even in the dead of the night were awakened.

Summary Heading: Lives up to Marriott standards, for the convention crowd
Summary: My room was very large and comfortable, though the view over back roof and parking lot was not inspiring.  I was glad to have a refrigerator in the room, and I was able to buy milk, wine, and snacks at shops in the lobby, which were open late.  Very nice pool, I enjoyed spending Saturday  afternoon there and had a delicious late afternoon lunch at poolside.  However, on Sunday, all the conventioners came to the Marriott to eat because there was no food in the convention center next door-- huge lines, impossible to eat at the pool or restaurant, I ended up with takeout from the Starbucks.

Summary: We arrived at the hotel during what appeared to be a major group checking in.  We were checked in by James at reception who provided us with personal service and took the time to discuss the hotel and local area with us.  This was the theme for the rest of our stay - friendly staff willing to assist.  The facilities of the hotel were great - Starbucks and Pizza Hut!  Location to Disneyland was good - a few blocks to walk - we didn't even bother with the shuttle.  A great stay!

I think the Marriott is nicer and more charming than the huge Hilton across the street.  The Marriott is a large, convention hotel but still manages to seem warm and intimate, with two separate pool areas surrounded by lush gardens.  The rooms have a pleasant, updated decor and the beds are VERY comfortable with down-filled blankets and pillows.  The in-room refrigerator was a huge plus for me.  The bell staff and the room service staff are very nice (one guy brought me a free pop from the kitchen because the vending machine was empty.) Summary Heading: A Smart Alternative From Disneyland Hotels
Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Mariott for one night before departing for home. The benefits of staying here is the trolley takes you directly to Disneyland (8 mins away) very clean and comfortable rooms and security stationed at night. Starbucks located in the lobby was a big welcome.  The parking charge of $13 was shocking but I'd stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice, but more for business travel than family fun
Summary: The Anaheim Marriott has clean, comfortable rooms. It features a nice pool and large hot tub. And the service is like any other Marriott--top notch.But if you are going to stay there with your family thinking it will fill you with Disney magic, it won't. For that you will need to stay at a Disneyland Resort property. The Anaheim Marriott is a business class hotel.Nice, but oriented to a business crowd.BOTTOM LINE: The Anaheim Marriott provides great accomodations that tailors to the business traveler. Personally, there are other hotels that are just as nice and closer to the Disneyland Resort (saving you long shuttle rides) that may be more suited for family travel if that is your gig.

Summary Heading: You might want to rethink this one...
Summary: We have stayed at the Marriott a number of times.  It's great if your on a buisness trip, however you may want to re-think it if you are on a family trip to visit the parks.  It is very busy, being next to the convention center, as well as holding large conferences itself.  The parking is expensive $12.00 a day for self, and $16. or $18. valet, and the self parking lot is a haul.  The last time we stayed we requested a non-smoking room, but were told at arrival they were overbooked, so we were stuck in a smoking room.
